Review_Date: Nigel P wrote a review Yesterday
Review_Title: Nice place shame about the service
Review_Text: Hotel is immaculately clean and stylish. The food is excellent with a wide choice. The staff are polite & friendly but sadly the service is sluggish and unreliable.  Expect a long wait to be served and an even longer wait for your food or drink to arrive which it invariably does not. Over the 5 days I spent at the hotel I made 13 orders. 10 of the 13 missed items and all 13 had a lengthy wait (up to 20 minutes) to be served despite the staff outnumbering the guests.  The staff are a generally of a young demographic and I witnessed many of them arguing with each other and congregating in groups chatting when customers are waiting to be served. For this reason (ie the service) alone I wouldn‚Äôt return as the percentage of my break I spent waiting and chasing staff was not one I wish to repeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: mcgringo wrote a review Mar 16
Review_Title: Over rated and lots of staff not doing much. Overpriced for what I received
Review_Text: I choose this hotel hoping that the movenpick quality would stand up in Marrakech however this was not the case. The check in was a joke 5 staff standing around not wanting to work and it continued. The room had not been cleaned properly especially the bathroom and cigarette butt's all piled up on the balcony in this non smoking hotel. Thankfully the hotel was quiet so finding quiet space by the pool was OK but I reckon in season it wouldn't be pleasant. The outside pics imply that the hotel has lots of space which is not the case 2 pools and that's it. ALSO be warned that taxes and fees were added to my bill that they could not be justified and said they were local when I asked for clarification they couldn't answer me. Fraudulent. My booking never mentioned extra fees and all fees had been included at the time of booking and payment.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: World_explorer579 wrote a review Mar 8
Review_Title: Located in center of town, but incompetent staff
Review_Text: From the check-in process the staff seemed very disorganized although they were courteous. The whole hotel looked old/aged and needs a general refurbishment from the spa facilities to the room I was staying in. I called room service several times over my 3 nights stay for different requests (refilling of shower gel request for iron to the room etc.) which either took a very long time to arrive or never arrived.    What I am most unhappy and disappointed about is that fact that the front desk firstly decided to take a MAD 21000 security deposit from my credit card on arrival without informing me of the amount prior to attempting to debit me. I had assumed they would pass a charge for the room balance for my non-refundable booking and it was only after entering my pin and when additional authentication was required that I realized and challenged this. It was only at this point that I was offered the choice of paying for any amenities on demand or keeping a hold on my card.  Following this on departure and after settling all my bills I was told that the hold on my credit card had been released but this does not appear to be the case as the hold is still reflecting on my card after over 2weeks. I have called several times requesting to speak to the reservations and reception teams but people either don't pick up the phone drop the phone after it rings for some time tell me they are busy or that they will investigate without obtaining adequate information from me to look in to the issue and contact me back. One lady asked that I call the following day and ask for Mr. Abdoulate but I have not able to get in touch with him or anyone else competent enough to help. It feels like no one wants to take responsibility for resolving it.    The only reason why Movenpick is getting 2 stars is because they provided early check-in as requested. And also because the staff at the poolside restaurant were attentive and the food specifically by the poolside was decent. I tried the free breakfast buffet only once but the quality and spread was really poor so I decided not to go back and chose to eat early lunches by the poolside which came at an additional cost.

Review_Date: LovetravelZurich wrote a review Mar 8
Review_Text: We came for a business conference here and have been very pleased with the hotel. The grounds pools lobbies and restaurants are lovely and beautifully maintained. All the staff are friendly and extremely helpful and professional. If there is a problem the crew arrives to fix it in minutes (thank you Jasine and Abdellah). The spa is super - ask for a massage from Bouchra - amazing. The only problem is that the electricity supply is a bit weak and the Wi-Fi can be annoyingly intermittent.

Review_Date: Usha M wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Such an awesome experience ! We had booked two suites which were tastefully decorated with all modern amenities. I absolutely recommend it for families with kids. We were with 2 kids one of which is a toddler. Nice restaurants.  What a breakfast layout!  Staff is extremely friendly  helpful and attentive.  Here I would give a big shout out to some staff... Bahia and Fatima are wonderfully kind. And our chauffeur Wakeel for a day trip of Berber's life experience was outstanding. A huge thank you! Review_Date: karoleigh wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: This is a truly beautiful facility. The lobby is very large with two reception areas elegant sitting areas and a very attractive fountain.    Our first-floor guest room was comfortable with two twin beds and a fluffy comforter and pillows. The TV had 74 channels including those for various nationalities with four in English. The toilet was on its own room separate from the shower room with sink. The lighting was appealing with it being not too bright or too dim. After staying in some hotels with poor soap bars we were pleased that they had generously sized soap bars. Since we were staying for three nights they brought extra bars of soap on request.    The location was great. It was within walking distance of numerous restaurants a mall and ATM machine. It was recommended by a reliable source that we not use the ATM machine at this hotel since it‚Äôs controlled by a third party and if you have a problem with the machine you may have to wait until you can resolve it with that third party. Go to the Banque Populaire instead which is close to the hotel. This is what we used with no issues.    Breakfast consisted of many different foods as you would expect from such a hotel with many choices of breads pastries eggs cooked upon request plain and sweetened yogurt a self-service coffee machine fruit etc. There were many places to sit down so there was never a feeling of being crowded or having difficulty getting a table.    There was a very large outdoor pool with tables on the patio for outdoor eating and drinking.    The hotel definitely had a five-star appeal with its service amenities and decor. I would definitely stay here again if I were in the area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karley J wrote a review Jan 2023

Review_Date: John K wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Najia was amazing! The Hammam and 1 hour oriental massage was excellent after a long week of business travel. The full body massage engaged in all of my limbs and reset my body to being relaxed. I highly recommend this experience but you have to ask for Najia!

Review_Date: Elena wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful and overall the stay was positive. The staff were very helpful and kind Noelle and Sana were lovely. The food by the pool at breakfast and in the Marcelona restaurant was tasty. The only negative about the stay was the music by the pool. When sitting by the pool the music was loud and did not suit the otherwise peaceful atmosphere. The pool music was also often played loudly at night even when no guests were at the pool. On one occasion we had to request at reception at 1am for the pool music to be turned down because it was very loud. Otherwise the stay was enjoyable and the chocolate hour was delicious. Special shout-out to the donuts at breakfast!

Review_Date: Adebola A wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: My stay at this hotel was brilliant . The only let down of my stay are the reception team both the day shift and the night ones. On arrival I met with Kausarat I think thats her name she was totally unfriendly for a receptionist . I checked in around 21:30 and base on how she was talking you could tell she couldn‚Äôt wait to leave for the day. I was checked into room Zidane 4129 . The room was lovely and the bed was super comfy.  Breakfast the following morning was a bit unorganised as all the breakfast team were just standing around no one communicated on how things work however if you go to them they would support with information which I feel shouldn‚Äôt be the case. The following days after that was brilliant I suspect this is due to the presence of one of the management team on duty. The gentleman in a blue suit on Sunday 22nd and Monday 23rd ensure everyone was doing what they should‚Ä¶ Breakfast was lovely with different selection of continental and Moroccan breakfast‚Ä¶. Super yum.  The superstars of the hotel are the housekeeping team for me. They were happy and full of smiles.  When I changed room to 2209 because I wanted to be close to reception as my husband couldn‚Äôt make the trip Khadeja supported with packing my bags which I appreciate greatly. She went above and beyond by calling concierge to pick up my bags and put them in the new room. Thank you khadeja! You‚Äôre a star. Every other house keeping team I met are almost the same as khadeja because they are all always happy doing their job.  I‚Äôll definitely recommend using the spa. I had a session with Najia and Indi and they were both very nice and welcoming.  Overall I think the hotel deserves a 5star the 1 star minus is because all my encounter with the reception team falls short of expectation of a 5star hotel. As someone with over 7 years management experience in hospitality I believe the reception team needs to understand warmth of welcome as they are the first point of contact. For example I‚Äôve met with Hind on 3 occasions during my stay and the only time I got a smile from her was when there were management team present at reception which was on the 25th after spending 5days.  One lady did standout though I think her name is Nezha I‚Äôm not 100percent sure of her name she ask one of the bellmen to take me to a nearby shop.  The ambience of the hotel is fantastic I love all the on art display and the location to the airport is less than 20mins
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Susan B wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: An oasis palace with authentically friendly & professional staff
Review_Text: Such a beautiful oasis -- gorgeous colors in the large pool beautiful tropical gardens real actual art by artists not by hotel suppliers interesting nooks Moroccan designs gorgeous gift shops all a delight to the artistic eye. Best international breakfast with everything imaginable energizing fitness classes you can join randomly for joy and Ahmed serving mint tea by a blue tiled pool among antiques tropical leaves bird cages to set a bit before launching into the city. The staff seemed authentic and we enjoyed seeing them have the freedom to celebrate the advances of Morocco in the World Cup and felt like we were in a palace.

Review_Date: Eva Franco wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: I love this hotel! It s the 2nd time in 2022 we stay with our group at this Hotel (Daycoval grp from Brasil) and I can tell you: our group is a big one! In April 2022 with more than 200 guests now in November around 90 guests. The staff is amazing beginning at front desk with all of them and specially Mr Souhail also the cleaning ladies Sana and Noura - femme de chambres incredible nice and gentle. Everybody at the restaurant the Chef at breakfast Miss Fatima so so sweet always keeping a table for me and when I had no time for breakfast as we are always running she arranged for me a little something to eat a croissant an yogurt anything. So for sure next time in Marrakech I ll stay there even privaste with my family. Rooms and beds and showers are great too. The gardens so well kept the birds singing well what a joy it is to stay at the Mowenpick Mansour Eddahbi Marrakech! Thanks to ALL of you there. have a great 2023!! Eva G Franco Lisbon Portugal

Review_Date: Matt S wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Managers are Rude! Room pictures are deceiving!
Review_Text: The hotel managers are rude and will not accommodate you. The pictures of the rooms are not what the rooms are. They won‚Äôt provide good bedding and the hotel felt dirty. I do not recommend staying here. Calling it a 5 star hotel is a lie. They should be ashamed to call themselves luxurious

Review_Date: Tour822254 wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Large French hotel with all the facilities you expect from a 5 star but no real soul. Sadly whilst the grounds and facilities are all you would expect the service leaves alot to be desired. Restuarant/ Bar staff appear miserable and unfriendly and slow to meet the needs of guests. Generally you are waiting around for someone to serve you and you are made to feel it's a hassle. Disorganised approach in restaurants and bar. On arrival we were given no information of facilities and restaurants etc and even getting a menu was impossible unless you have a smart phone. Selection of food in buffet poor given the apparent 5* standard of the hotel and not a great reflection on Moroccan hospitality. Housekeeping was good and standards v clean. Entertainment was very overpriced and a reflection on this was poor attendance by guests who could eat drink and party elsewhere for less money. Sadly we would not recommend and you would be better off spending your money in a traditional riad or hotel where the star rating may not be as high but the hospitality atmosphere and price are ten times better.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Had a great day at this amazing Hotel too bad i didn t stay in for long but i am sure that it will be my stay whenever i come back to that beautiful citythe place is amazing for good pictures and they have very cool and supportive team  and special thanks to Mustapha the barman he was so kind and very helpful special thanks to him  he was the best thanks to him and all the team

Review_Date: Jaskeerat B wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: We had excellent service at Movenpick hotel especially Ropia and Khadija were extremely helpful and went above and beyond their duty. Thank you Ropia and Khadija for making my stay more comfortable.

Review_Date: Moonstar2015 wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: The Movenpick hotel made our family vacation in Morocco one to remember. It all started with Nehza the receptionist who greeted us warmly was eager to check us in and gave us recommendations on what to do in Marrakesh.  The hotel grounds and the rooms are beautiful and well maintained. The ladies Salma NajatMina and the young man Yassine kept our room clean and replenished every single day of our 7 nights stay.  The breakfast buffet is one of the best I have seen in a hotel. What makes breakfast even better is the staff Mustapha and his son Mohamed Youness Hdija Sami Nizar and Mariam are all people we became familiar with within the 8 days we stayed at the hotel. Every single day they were happy to see us and hurriedly assisted us. Thank you all for your service.  The kids club at the hotel is great as well. We are thankful that we were able to leave the littles ones in the loving care of Nehza and Touria while we went out to explore the souks in Marrakesh.  We will definitely book the Movenpick hotel on our next trip to Marrakech.

Review_Date: Eindelik wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: The hotel is a standard five star hotel. The public rooms are lofty and attractive but the area in which reception is situated is not well designed and is inclined to be stuffy.    Our room was comfortable and well appointed although the balcony was too small to take full advantage of. There was always hot water in the shower. A big plus.    The restaurant did not offer us an authentic Moroccan menu which disappointed me as a first-time visitor to the country. Room service was prompt well-presented and tasty however.    The best thing about our stay were the breakfasts offering a wide variety of foods to suit all tastes including Moroccan options like jben (a cheese) and m‚Äôsemen (a bread). We were exceptionally well looked after by Bahija and we commend her to management
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Imaa B wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: First time in Morocco went as a family with my mother and children. We absolutely had a good experience and a great time at this hotel. Nehza the receptionist was so welcoming and set our stay in Marrakech in motion. She gave us a beautiful family suite and made recommendations for what to do in Marrakech. She is amazing and we cannot thank her enough. Our beautiful was kept clean every by the dedicated housekeepers Salma Najat and Mina we had everything we needed. These ladies were so nice that the children would recognize and greet Salma when they saw her.  The breakfast buffet selection is very large and had a great selection of food. The staff was very helpful even with the great number of customers they had to deal with. They all always replied politely to request. One waiter Mustapha was eager to see us every single of the 8 days of our stay. We are thankful for all these people that made our stay pleasant and our vacation in Marrakech a memorable one.  The hotel grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The hotel has 3 pools areas and a jacuzzi. All are nice however we would have liked an indoor pool as well.  Overall Movenpick Marrakech is a great place to stay. Home away from home feel.

Review_Date: Tourist07630869126 wrote a review Dec 2022

Review_Text: Great hotel in a great location. Great service and very clean. Many thanks to Imane Fatima and Malika from house keeping for finding my lost ring and returning it. I was very happy to have it back.  Marrakech is an amazing place to visit and would totally recommend staying at the M√∂venpick
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: seconed time here excellent expeirnce clean and calm nice and friendly stuff cool facilitis such as pool gym and resturants. well done to the excellent housekeeping stuff MME Iman Roqia and Lamia for their great service.

Review_Date: kevin b wrote a review Dec 2022

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eve M wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: Beautiful grounds but lousy service. Traveler's stomach warning.
Review_Text: Beautiful grounds spa and pool room was acceptable and hotel had a nice selection for breakfast. Note there is no indoor pool as mentioned on TA page but the temperature in the heated outdoor pool was very pleasant in late November.  HOWEVER!  This is NOT a four-star hotel. Most of our interactions with staff left us inconvenienced and with the impression they are either very overworked unhelpful or untrained.    -Housekeeping was overworked and semi-responsive    -One staff member told me to go next door to heat up my baby food while said baby was crying; it would have been nice if they took the 30 seconds to do it themselves    -One staff member "showed us" where the spa and restaurant when asked by walking us all the way through the hotel before emphatically pointing and rudely saying "reception"    -The front desk fully charged us for our dinner in hotel restaurant Marcelona and tried to blame us after I mentioned we had traveler's diarrhea (we lost an entire day in the bathroom) from the tap water in the gazpacho that night (they could have at least apologized)    -After reassuring us of the cost of a taxi to town concierge told us to get one ourselves "just outside" where the cost doubled...    Too many negative experiences to list here. We are not high maintenance by any means but did expect a much higher level of service here. The riads in Marrakech were by far less expensive and more friendly.

Review_Date: Lucia wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: It was a wonderful holiday wiame in the Housekeeping was very friendly helpful everything was good  They upgreat our room ^^. They have a lovely swimingpool with good views.  It was very good stay  I am so satisfied thank you housekeeping team you're the best good work üòä

Review_Date: Pushpak B wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: It is a reasonable property inside and is well spread. However it lacks the 5 star touch and hospitality and attitude by far. Staff are too relaxed.    The room quality is average. A suite is not worth the money. Does not feel 5 star many things in the room were looking tired.    The food quality and choice is very disappointing. No choice at all. Breakfast was boring.    I wouldn‚Äôt recommend to stay here.    The only positive to this property was the location.    My recommendations:  1) increase the variety of international cuisine and for vegetarians add more food choice.    2) train staff to have a better attitude and care for guests.    3) make changes in the room layout and add bathroom doors for privacy.

Review_Date: Qasim S wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: This was our second stay here and defo 5* in every aspect - service, rooms, food, pool spa, especially hamza at the desk really
Review_Text: Having been a returning customer the hotel offered complimentary upgrade on arrival which was a bonus as we were planning on paying for the upgrade.    From the entrance to lobby to rooms this hotel really takes your breath away we were welcomed by hamza at the desk who has catered for our every need and want (and we are quite fussy)    This hotel has to be the best value for money as you get an amazing 5 star service wherever you go be it the breakfast area or pool or spa and valet parking every member of staff that we met was polite and hospitable.    Food from room service waa delicious and intercontinental breakfast is as good as any other 5 star we have been    We travelled with our 1 year old this time and movenpick certainly ticked the box or being child friendly too    Will definitely be back here again

Review_Date: marry wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: It was a wonderful experience  Thank you  I had an amazing stay at Movenpic and the Housekeeping was amazing especially wiame  she's so professional and she's very friendly and her team were always available .  See you soon üòä best team  clean room with nice view.

Review_Date: Pris wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: If you love photo spots this hotel is one of the best. The permaculture system in this hotel works well together with citrus trees that goes to the kitchen several pools for your relaxing enjoyment and landscaping where birds can fly free. The housekeeping staffs are excellent. In my experience Karima is very attentive. The breakfast buffet was marvelous. Even though it is always the same menu everyday we can choose healthy selections local delicacies with several different high quality honeys jams and preserves. The restaurant staffs are helpful particularly Bahija Fatima Meryem Youness Haoud Elrddy. The Morrocan tea station at the hotel entrance gives a true Moroccan experience with mint tea and delicacies and it was available until 6pm everyday by Ahmed "the Man." If need anything there is a 24 hours service. Osthman at front door also very helpful.

Review_Date: Emilia wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: This place is great and worth every penny. Lovely inside well maintained and the rooms up to a good standard. Food of great quality staff are super nice and helpful.    Ask for Naima during breakfast as she‚Äôs the nicest.  Highly recommend.    About 30 minutes walk from old town center.

Review_Date: Devina Adelia wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: It's one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at and definitely a great first impression as to what Marrakech has to offer. I stayed here for more than a week and it was wonderful from start to finish. The staff were very attentive and helpful. Despite the language barrier they always went above and beyond to make sure that I got everything I needed (and wanted).    The housekeeping staff was excellent especially under the supervision of Sana (thank you again for the birthday surprise). They always greeted me with a smile and made sure that we got some extra tea üòÜ    The breakfast buffet was marvelous. It's always the same menu everyday and indeed why change something that's already working well? The food is of high quality and I'm glad that they also offer some local delicacies it was quite overwhelming to decide what to eat every morning because I kept wanting to eat everything. There's also a tea station close to the hotel entrance a true Moroccan experience and it was available until 6pm everyday.    Another shout out particularly to the breakfast staff they were an excellent team. They always made sure that everyone at my table got everything they needed. They were always so quick in cleaning everything up right after we were done. Special thanks to Fatima Ezzahra and Said (my omelette guy)    The location of the hotel is quite strategic it's in an upscale area with many restaurants within walking distance. The train station is also nearby about 10 minutes walk. The medina and sites such as Koutoubia mosque and Saadien's Tomb are also easily reached. There are two malls in the area as well Menara Mall and Carre Eden. People can easily find souvenirs and such in both locations as well as a Carrefour Market.    I can definitely go on and on but this is already long enough. All in all it was definitely better than expected. The only minor issue I can think of is the fact that we had to basically update our key card everyday for it to work and the walk from our building to the lobby wasn't particularly short. Maybe the hotel can look into it and find a fix.

Review_Date: joseph Chai wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Good 5* Hotel with 2 star service Hotel is good location. Rooms are large and nice.  Bed comfortable.  TV not working.  Restaurant food - reasonable  Restaurant service - soso.    Front Office service is very very poor. Except for Ms Hanane & Nezha the other front staffs are very ‚Äúcold‚Äù and irresponsible.  1-Triple room with only 2 sets of linen. Despite repeated requests and reminders nothing done.    2-No morning calls for my group on Departure day despite prior arrangement.    The worst staff is Hassan (Reception) he has a very bad attitude. Does not believe in providing service to guests. I stay in this hotel with a contingent of 20 guest. I was responsible to provide information to my group. I asked Hassan many questions and directions he did not provide any. Has a ‚Äúdon‚Äôt bother me‚Äù attitude. Very COLD attitude with Arrogance does not bother to explain clearly and poor command of English.  Cannot understand how Movenpick management can employ such staff.

Review_Date: Ada E wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: I really enjoyed my stay at M√∂venpick! The lobby is gorgeous and the staff were very respectful and helpful! I found the service of the Concierge desk excellent and was my best experience at the hotel! Rafiq the senior Concierge was simply exceptional! He was polite patient and professional! He followed up on every request (and I had several - booking restaurants Hammam getting silver ring adjusted confirming shipping details for carpets purchased etc) to ensure that everything was done to my satisfaction! I did not have to worry about anything and cannot thank him enough! Lamia (concierge) was very helpful in giving me good recommendations for places to visit for shopping and Hammam. Imad porter was excellent in ensuring my baggage was properly handled and he also escorted me to a restaurant to book a group dinner. The breakfast buffet was very good and the food at the Marcelona restaurant at the hotel was delicious! Kolthoum (guest relations) and Hanane (reception) were also polite and helpful. I really enjoyed service at this hotel!

Delicious and varied food excellent welcome at the bar where we tasted excellent mojitos always served with the smile of the beautiful chaima.  See you soon.

Review_Date: Roxa N wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: The hotel lobby and public facilities are very nice and well maintained. The rooms (our family had two rooms) were satisfactory but certainly not 5-star quality. The furnishings were a bit worn and stained. We were also disappointed that there was no furniture on the balconies which basically made them useless.  We enjoyed the swimming pool and surrounding lounge areas and ate several nice lunches at the restaurant next to the large pool. The concierge was very helpful in providing dinner recommendations and arranging an excursion to the Atlas Mountains.  The biggest area for improvement is with service. Upon arrival at the hotel it took almost an hour for us to check into our room. This was at the end of a long day of travel with our young children. Once we finally got into our room we realized there was no crib for the baby even though one was previously requested. We called for a crib and it took another 60 minutes to receive it. This is absolutely not 5-star service. Another area if service that was disappointing was that I was told I couldn‚Äôt order a coffee by the pool until the bar opened at 11am. I‚Äôve never stayed at a hotel before where I was just flat out told I couldn‚Äôt order a coffee.  We enjoyed certain aspects of this hotel but there is a lot of room to improve to actual make it a 5-star experience.

Review_Date: Mariam m wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are big and spacious.  The customer service is impeccable. Concierge are always accommodating day or night and the staff in the restaurant (Bahija in particular) are very helpful.  I would definitely recommend staying here I personally will be back soon!

Review_Date: Mamagina1960 wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Active Older Adult Group Stay-Excellent food and Dining Room Staff!
Review_Text: Stayed 4 nights with a group of older adults from the US as part of a 10 day stay in Morocco. Exceptionally clean and very comfortable rooms with all amenities. Stunning public areas five beautiful pools with really comfortable lounge chairs and cabanas all available to use at no additional charge (exceptionally fluffy extra large pool towels). Perfect atmosphere great location. But the real shining stars of this hotel are the staff. Everyone really went out of their way to accommodate our folks who are not the easiest! Smiles all around very helpful and respectful. The dining room staff really went out of their way to assist and serve our group at the breakfast buffet. We also had a private evening dinner buffet one night and the staff could not have done more. The breakfast buffet was probably the most extensive I‚Äôve ever experienced. As was our buffet dinner. The food was hot fresh and really delicious. We have arranged trips for this ‚Äúsenior‚Äù group about 4 times per year for the last 10 years or so and I have to say that the hotel staff (especially the dining room manager and his crew) are one of the best we have ever experienced! Kudos to them!! Thank you for a great stay. We‚Äôll be back!

Review_Date: Sean G wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Stay here! But also read this review to avoid our mistake.
Review_Text: This hotel is truly amazing but make sure you book the right room!!    We stayed here for my 50th birthday and we could not have loved it more! The staff are awesome the pools a welcome oasis the grounds are magnificent and I could not recommend this hotel more!    I would point out that on Hotels.com and bookings.com you can‚Äôt tell that you do not want the non garden view deluxe rooms. We made that mistake but the hotel‚Äôs manager bailed out our mistake and really made our stay 10 stars. So to be clear you want the garden view deluxe room.    Allaf you are a rockstar!!

Review_Date: Southwest123 wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Unfortunately this was one of the worst hotel stays we have had.  - check in took one hour after travelling all day since 5am with 2 small children. Waited 4 hours for the room to be ready at 4pm  - room not what we requested (ground floor suite) it was higher up and awful with one tiny window  - cot and single bed not in room as requested took hours of chasing to get it  - promised the ground floor suite after breakfast next day. Queued 40m at front desk not ready. Told to come back at 3. At 3 told to come back at 5.  - wifi did not work in new suite impossible to stream a tv show or check in flights. Technicians came and went taking a up a whole afternoon no communication and no solution  - terrace door did not lock totally unsafe  - every interaction with front desk was dreadful taking one hour with queuing and nobody being trained to know how to deal with basic requests. Totally understaffed many people waiting and upset in line  - booked airport transfer to leave and it did not show up it was never booked we arrived late to the airport  - terrible service staff could not care less at the front desk about your experience and keeping you waiting  - hotel grounds are nice pool is good and breakfast we did a mountain tour that was very good but overall we could not wait to leave  Not 5*

Review_Date: Holly K wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Touria was everything and more for us on our family holiday. My daughter always wanted to stay in kids club when she was steroids away from a swimming pool... and that's saying a lot. It was so relaxing to know that our kids were in good hands. Touria also sent me many photos of the kids having a good time. Thank you for all the memories to Touria and the staff at kids club.

Review_Date: Sandy M wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Not 5 star hotel. 4 star. Really friendly staff.
Review_Text: A good hotel but not 5 star. The staff were all lovely but there we're so many little things that just meant the stay was not as good as what it could have been;    - The cleaners left our door unlocked and open one day after cleaning  - Tv had poor reception in the room  - I paid extra for a room with a view but it was just of a palm tree outside the patio door. I was pretty disappointed. It was not a 'view' at all. I complained about this to reception and there is a clause in the booking that defines the view as the pool or the garden but I felt pretty ripped off here to be honest.  - One night we were kept awake from 4am because of a loud banging noise in the building. I complained to reception and they told me it was a recuring mechanical issue. We'd booked the Majorelle gardens for 8am and we ended up being late cause we were exhausted. To be fair we did get upgraded to a better room but it does take a couple hours to repack all your stuff and then move to the new room. Its not something you want to do on holiday.  - There was no iron or ironing board in the room despite that being on the reservation  - The lights flickered annoyingly in the new rooms ensuit and there was a damp patch on the roof in the walk in wardrobe area.  - The chocolate hour was good but there were no plates or cutlery. how are you meant to dip food into the chocolate fountains without making a total mess? Just common sense - put down some napkins and forks!    Food & drink;    - the first night we arrived it was late and we ate in the main hotel restaurant. we sat down to get given 2 QR codes instead of menus. we didnt take our phones so we asked for physical menus but they didnt have any. Maybe this is something inherited from covid but what '5star' hotel doesnt have menus in the main restaurant?! We then had to go back to the room to get our phones so we could see the menu. When we did see the menu it was pretty pathetic. It is a tapas restaurant and some of the meals barely have any descriptions or pictures or both! We got 4 tapas which were average. One plate was a mixture of cheese and ham no dressing or garnish. It cost us like ¬£15 or something. I was disgusted. 4 tapas and 2 beer between us and it was ¬£50. absolute joke.    The menu situation is the same for all eateries in the hotel. There are no menus which I find bizarre. most of them lack a description of the meal and some of the pictures look dreadful. It doesnt sell the food at all. The room service one is the worse of all 2 of the meals it says 'Breast of Chicken' or 'Beef steak' or something like that and thats it! no photo! How can you order a meal not know what it is!! Not to mention its like 250 dirhams (¬£22).    We ate out of the hotel most nights as we just couldn't face the restaurants. The food wasn't great at all. On more then 1 occasion food arrived that wasnt ours etc. At the main pool bar we ordered chicken club sandwich but it arrived with ham in it instead...    Lots of annoying little things but again the pools were good there was ample beds and the staff were all really nice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Traveller M wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We stayed at Movenpick Marrakech for 7 days and were overall disappointed with our stay. Even though the hotel is rated as a 5 star the service we received was very poor and definitely not one of a 5 star.  We noted several issues during our stay none of which is the fault of the staff working there (the cleaning ladies were very nice and always happy to help) or but more a reflection of how poor the management of the hotel is:  - bathroom towels: There‚Äôs clearly a shortage of towels across the hotel which meant all towels and washed and redistributed in the evenings. Times where we would come back to the room and werent able to take a shower. We called reception on a daily basis to get towels and they would sometimes take up to an hour to bring the towels delaying our plans for the day - we even ended up using the bathrobes as towels on 2 of the days.  - toilet roll: again on several occasions we were left without toilet roll. We called housekeeping at least 4 days out of 7 to be given toilet roll as this had not been replenished. Once requested this again took hours to come.  - water bottles: in a 5 star hotel in a country where it is 30-35degrees water should be free & readily available. We were given two 33cl water bottles a day and could only get more on request.  - milk: even 1 star hotels have free cream available to be able to make tea or coffee in your room. In this hotel they didn't have any creamers available and we were informed a glass of milk to make tea would be an additional ¬£5 charge  - bathroom standard: the toilet lid in our room was half broken - it would close itself once sat on the toilet. This was very offputting and something pretty basic to get right for a 5 star hotel.  - hotel restaurant: we arrived around 8pm on the first day and decided to get food at the hotel. The only restaurant available was a tapas bar in which the food was not only poor but very expensive. We had to spend more than ¬£60 for 2 starters and 2 mains which we didn't enjoy. The hotel has at least 4 different pools but only restaurant of overpriced bad food for dinner.  - breakfast: coffee and tea should be served at the table in a 5 star hotel - in this hotel you have a coffee machine where you make the coffee yourself.  - reception: if you have any queries for reception expect to spend at least 20mins there.  - check-out process: not friendly the staff didn't ask us how our stay was we were just given our bill and asked to pay.  - the only upside to this hotel was the staff at breakfast the cleaning ladies and outside of the hotel (pool & hotel entrance): they were all very nice and were always happyto help and we're grateful to them  Overall having stayed at several 5 star hotels we can guarantee this is not a 5 star. Save your money and stay somewhere else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ladybelle wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: This is more like a 3 star hotel
Review_Text: This hotel should not be parading as a 5 star hotel. The hotel is run down the carpets in the rooms corridors and communal areas are worn some areas have grey tape to cover up things stains everywhere. The sofa in my room had stains on it. The service in the restaurants is awful - given a basket of bread that had a half eaten bread roll in it. The resort is quite expansive but unfortunately nothing is really sign posted so you could spend ages looking for the gym the main restaurant etc. I booked a twin room but was given a room with one bed. The breakfast buffet was awful - coffee and tea machines for hot drinks (very tacky and not what you'd expect for 5*) fruit and veg completely abysmal. Had they presented as a 3* hotel and adjusted the daily rate then I'd be hailing this place as great value for money. Only redeeming feature is the staff - very friendly. If you are expecting luxury and top notch service then give this one a miss save your money and stay in a riad or even a tent in the desert as that would be better value for money.

Review_Title: Top resort and customer care in Marrakech
Review_Text: One of the best resorts I have ever stayed in. The facilities the design the services but above all the lovely friendly staff all over the hotel. Laila and Hanane from the reception desk are great example of how customer service should be like. Kudos to the entire Movenpic family.

Review_Date: Jonathan C wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We checked in to our deluxe room and it was a horrible stay. First off the deluxe room building is the furthest building away from the hotel and by the time we get to our room the view from our balcony is of a construction site and parking lot.    Our room had a particularly strong vinegar smell to it and we asked to move rooms. We were told that every deluxe room was sold out and we would be able to move rooms the next day. Next day comes around and we didn‚Äôt hear from the hotel. Every call to guest services took at least 3-5 minutes until someone answered or called back. We also came back to our hotel room unlocked and it seemed housekeeping didn‚Äôt truly close our door when they cleaned it.    On our last night the A/C didn‚Äôt seem to work. We called guest services and the lady I spoke to told me that it was turned off for the whole hotel. When asked why or when will it be turned back on she abruptly interrupts me and says I‚Äôm transferring you to the front desk. I waited for at least 2 minutes on the phone before someone from the front desk to answer my call and he informs me that someone will come check our A/C.    We love staying at different hotels in different countries and had no issues with other hotels in Marrakech however our stay at Movenpick was very underwhelming and staff didn‚Äôt seem to care at all.    This has been a very awful experience and hope that the hotel management can make a much better experience and improvement for others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rob599 wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: I'm not really used to writing reviews but we had such a wonderful holiday that I wanted to share it now:  Wonderful hotel that meets all expectations! In particular the friendly staff who are always ready to give you best of service will make your stay a completely successful holiday.  The spa and hammam are also highly recommended especially Najia's massages are an experience to remember and a reason to visit the Movenpick hotel again!

Review_Date: Olga A wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Very nice spa treatments I had in this place. Now it is my favourite spa. I will definitely come back again. Especially I liked Narva the food massage she did was amazing. I would recommend this spa for everyone who want to enjoy and a proper rest.

Review_Date: Antonina J wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: It is very beautiful are of spa section.  Nice swimming pool  warm sun calm place.  People are kind warm-hearted pleasantly friendly. Very good service.  Visiting the spa for feet massage was a very good decision. Thank you Najia it was an awesome pleasure.

Review_Date: Anna K wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Very nice hotel with excelent massage service. Spa is a very clean and comfy. Foot massage is perfect.  Najia has a very good hands for massaz. Thank you Amal and Najia for your service. Will recomend it deffinetely to try!  Hope to see you soon again!

Review_Date: shelley orte wrote a review Sep 2022

I was amazed at the passage from the Palace to the restaurant where lunch was waiting for us.  A large buffet with very good food really bravo to the chef and pastry chef.

Review_Date: Mo B wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Wonderful Hotel and SPA. helpful staff nice location and wonderful conference room. Don‚Äôt miss a session of gym with Brandon. A life changing experience with his advice expertise and sympathie on the top. I would like to return in holidays.

Review_Date: Priti V wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We had a lovely couples black soap scrub and hammam on our first day. They were very professional and attentive. We also had an amazing poolside foot massage by Najia. I have to say Najia the reception manager Emal and their team are wonderful and I highly recommend their services.

Review_Date: Bob wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Had a lovely therapy at the spa in the hotel and also a foot massage at the pool side by Najia. The environment and facilities were great and the staff could not be more lovely & helpful. Special thank you to Najia & Madame Emal.

Review_Date: Djoumah wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: The massage was awesome to say the least with Massage therapist Najia she is simply the best in deep tissue. I highly recommend her any day she is definitely my reason to keep coming back to the Movenpick hotel. Will be back.

Review_Date: Rachel L wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: The spa was lovely and all the staff were very helpful especially Najia who was wonderful. The facilities are great and it‚Äôs a perfect place to relax. Najia made the trip a great success and helped me recharge my batteries - a welcome break

Review_Date: Freda E wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: I came to the hotel with my friends to have a fun week-end and I was amazed by the sincere welcoming of every person I crossed! I want to specially mention the Nice lady from HR (soukaina) Who have suggested several must-visits in the city! A big thank you goes to Souhail and Rafiq from the reception team...  I will certainly visit the hotel again mainly for the good service but also because it's close to the M avenue/downtown and the m√©dina.

Review_Date: Talha A wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Najia did a very nice message and I felt completely relaxed during the process. It was my first massage and it was fully worth it. Both my wife and I enjoyed it and I would highly recommend anyone to come. Thank you Najia

Review_Date: Andrew F wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Spent the first part of the week attending an international conference located at the Movenpick with non-stop meetings. Hotel was convenient plenty of space for breakout meetings and additional rooms available to reserve for private conference space. Meanwhile my spouse was able to utilize the hotel as her base for relaxing and exploring while I was at the conference. Second part of the trip is now a short vacation and hotel‚Äôs central location and ease of taxi access has been great for exploring greater Marrakech. In addition the pool and on site restaurants make for an easy base to simply stay put and relax!

Review_Date: Lukas b wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: The hotel design is amazing even when we always get lost in the lobby hahahaha  we came here for the event and literally everything was perfect from the beginning to the end  the staff at the front desk did an amazing job during the event  And I want to mention to Mr Hamza at the front desk because he was so helpful and he answered every question i ask also he did help me at the ATM when i couldn't be able to get some money I really would like to thank him and his colleagues for working so hard to make everything looks wonderful  if someone did ask me about a Luxury hotel in Morocco definitely the Movenpick will be my number one !!

Review_Date: Renee G wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Najia at the spa was lovely! She did an amazing job on my pedicure I felt very relaxed and very well take care of. The room was private and well maintained. I would recommend everyone to stop in to see her to get pampered!

Review_Date: Rabia R wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We spent 5 nights at the hotel and couldn‚Äôt have asked for anything more for our first time in Marrakesh.    Due to a conference the hotel couldn‚Äôt fulfil our final two nights and we we transferred to an alternative hotel. However the hotel more than compensated us for the inconvenience with an upgrade to a fabulous suite and a half-board stay.    The service and hospitality of the staff was exceptional with a particular thanks to head concierge Rafiq Ayoub from Jamra Hamza from the main restaurant and bar and Hassan at pool side. The hotel was beautiful and clean and we really enjoyed our meal at the Spanish restaurant as well as Jamra. The hotel is a short drive from the Medina and not far from key sites such as Koutoubia. We really enjoyed the excursion booked via the hotel to Oureka and spending time with Ismael.    If we had to be really critical the only think that would have improved our stay would be having more options for traditional Moroccan cuisine at the hotel but clearly this was aplenty a short walk away so really not a problem.    Thank you for the wonderful service - we look forward to returning.    Rabia and Nick (6302)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Freedom783319 wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: What an amazing feeling with her massage - absolutely professional not only only the basic massages Najia made but also relaxing or tonique and especially Massage of 5 monde!!! Strongly recommend when you come to Marrakech to book a massage with Najia - Spa M√∂venpick - you will not regret!!!

Review_Date: deecee wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: Wonderful mani pedi at the Spa!
Review_Text: Bouchra and Nadja took great care of me with a classic mani pedi. Great attention to detail my nails have never looked so good and cared for. And so relaxing with a lovely massage on my feet too. Merci!

Review_Text: Very pleasant meal with old friends in the Barcelona Resturant made all the more special with Khadija and Soukaima (possibly not the right spelling) attention warmth. These two made up for any short comings.

Review_Date: Rebecca Y wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: I Had a pedicure at the spa today at the hotel. Najia provided excellent service and was a relaxing treatment. Najia gave me the best pedicure And foot massage. I wIll recommend to others! I will be returning for a massage

Review_Date: Henna Thakur wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: I had an hour massage booked in with Najia at the spa she was super friendly and accommodating. One of the best massage‚Äôs I‚Äôve had. The price is reasonable however the massage was so good I‚Äôd go again!

Review_Date: Valeria D wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Nice hotel with great bar service by Mourad - such a nice person and great professional! Thank you Mourad for the amazing experience we really appreciated it! Looking forward to come back to you soon

Review_Date: Natalie R wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Najia I‚Äôm the spa gave me the most incredible massage today 10 out of 10 would highly recommend. All the spa staff are lovely and it is so much quieter in this pool and you can order food to your relaxing sun lounger

Review_Date: Nic wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Stayed in Room 4207 for 7 nights all the staff were friendly and welcoming. Ayoub looked after us when we were at the pool. Eat in the hotel restaurant twice the food was wonderful and sfter a miss understanding about the starters Soufiane explained what went wrong and we were happy with the out come and was so sorry it had happened. He is a good manager. Breakfast is amazingly. Hope we will be back soon. Thank everyone at the Mavenpick Marrakesh.

Review_Date: Insa wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: The staff is unreal absolutely amazing service especially from the baker Sami (patisserie) and his colleague skiriba cavalire tooop . Anytime it looked like we needed something we were brought more food and drinks without requesting. The service is top notch and our arrival was very relaxing. Pools spa gym and rooms are fantastic too. Definitely recommeding this hotel to anyone who is looking for a place and im looking forward to the remainder of my stay here. Review_Date: Hachem A wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: I came with two friends to discover the hotel amazed by all the details really beautiful place to be  The food was good excellent servicebig salut to the waiters Ayoub and Adil bar best cocktail loubna they was so nice with us with their large smile    ILL BACK FOR SURE .

Review_Date: Dastan wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: Excellent service but property needs some TLC
Review_Text: The hotel and location is very good but the property would not fall into 5 stars or anything luxury. The rooms need some TLC and touching up. The pool tiles/drain needs to be looked at. My toe got badly injured and on the first day as coming out of the pool which meant I couldn‚Äôt use the pool anymore with my kids with an open wound. I pent half a day at the local hospital to stop the toe from bleeding.    Breakfast was very good. Excellent eggs freshly squeezed orange juice and fresh pastries but they need to sort out the earl grey tea supply and stop people from taking 20 tea bags (yes some guests were literally filling their pockets with tea bags as if there is a tea crisis).    The hotel grounds are stunning with gardens and fruit trees like it is all over Marrakech.    What makes this hotel amazing and make up for the minuses is the service. The staff are super friendly and attentive. Right from the concierge (super amazing) to housekeeping. They will cater almost any requests you may have and I would like to send a super thanks to the lovely staff at Movenpick. I would definitely revisit for that reason alone.

Review_Date: Heather F wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: stayed here just me and my son and daughter. the hotel is very beautiful with cool interiors and bold colours. the pool area and the restaurants were all great although the pool was generally very busy with the usual towel reservation system going on!    worthy of mention as outstanding were the concierge team Leicester sorry about the spelling she was professional knowledgeable and very helpful to us and went out of her way to make our stay wonderful. She is certainly a five star employee.    also great we‚Äôre the ladies who cleaned our room 6206 Selma and Roqia who were excellent accommodating our late starts and keeping our room spotless. it‚Äôs theses and employees and some others that elevate this hotel from. 4 star to 5 Star.    we would love to come back this time with my husband who missed out on this trip due to work.    H

And they do have so many different activities such as painting. Board games. And other group activities. My son speaks English it was hard for him to make friends in the hotel but once he gets to their kids club he didn‚Äôt have this problem anymore because the staff they all speak English perfectly and they helped him to make new friends and learn new language to communicate with them. I strongly recommend this place.

Review_Date: Chelsea R wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: A great hotel to stay at
Review_Text: My friend and I visited this hotel to stay for our first time in Marrakesh. I‚Äôm so glad we chose to stay here. The staff is very kind and accommodating specifically Amoud and Mohammad . The head concierge Rafiq helped us book several tours and helped ensure we had the most pleasant stay. He went above and beyond to help teach us about Marrakech the culture and the best things to do and see. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone just coming to relax for holiday or someone who wants to go out and explore the city this hotel caters to everyone! The amenities are lovely including multiple pools and the breakfast each morning is stunning. We will certainly be back and bring our family and friends

Review_Date: Roberto A wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: From the moment we stepped onto the property we were immersed in all the finer things that Marrakech can offer. From the array of scents the decor the food and to the hospitality; it was nothing but the best.    The head concierge Rafik made sure we had everything we needed and all of our activities were planned to the very last detail! With our transportation the private tour of the gardens Mosque and souk. We did not have to worry about a thing!    The consistency of hospitality we experienced from the restaurants and bars; was one of a kind. The staff at this property do their job with such pride love and care. Every corner we were welcomed with a smile and ‚ÄúBonjour!‚Äù.    My first trip to Marrakech will forever be a trip of a lifetime! I can not wait until I get to enjoy this beautiful country again.    Five stars ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è    10/10!!!

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cen W wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Sensational setting and facilities, modest level of customer attention.
Review_Text: A really impressive and mature environment with excellent facilities. Service in the open air cafeterias wasn‚Äôt great to be honest. Staff a little disinterested and/or overwhelmed. But it didn‚Äôt spoil the experience as such.

Review_Date: Matty wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: The pedicure with Najia at the Hotel Movenpick spa was wonderful. Najia worked very meticulously and carefully and left my feet looking new (and beautiful) again after many days of walking in the Marrakech heat! Najia has expert skill set and I would recommend her to anyone who needs a pedicure!

Review_Date: Zakir P wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: If you after customer service and peace in your room this is not for you.
Review_Text: Check in was fine after an overnight flight rooms were ready when we arrived at the hotel hotel looked beautiful in the evening we could hear loud loud music in the room it was from the hotel opposite it felt like we were literally on the doorstep of a night club we had booked 3 rooms this is the last thing we needed with children we could not sleep till the music stopped at 12am took 3 phone calls and 2 hours later before the hotel finally agreed to swap rooms this is the last thing you need after you have unpacked and settled in your room had issues with air conditioning in the room engineer came at 11pm did something but make no difference we ended up trying to sleep sweating in a room with aircon not working it was horrible. Following morning I rang reception for bath towels 1 hour later still no towels ended going look for towels myself and had to help myself from the store room went to the reception in the morning to change the rooms was told someone would come and show us round the new rooms before we moved waiting 15-20 mins on reception no one came got fed up and went back to my room eventually a gentleman showed up outside my room and took us to our new rooms.    We are still on day 2 of our holiday.    To conclude  If you are after the 5 star Jumeriah experience this is definitely not for you as customers seem to be at the bottom of the pecking order also been told the music situation is a daily thing if you are an early person or have young kids who go to sleep early or before midnight you may need to think again if you expect quick service ie need towels in 10-15 mins again you need to think again personally am a service person the service I have received so far I would not be coming back to this hotel as am only here for 5 nights and had so many issues already.    I hope this review helps making you choice.

Review_Date: Gaston P wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: It was excellent especially thanks to Hanane who gave us a nicer room with a view and accommodate us for a late check out since our flight was at 8 pm.  As a frequent flyer with more than 4 MM miles flow all over the world I highly recommend the Movenpick Marrakesh!

Review_Date: Bronwyn T wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Amazing service from Lamiae and friendly staff
Review_Text: As this was my first visit to Marrakech I needed all the advice and local tips I could get. Lamiae the concierge was amazing! She gave me great recommendations of restaurants advice on what to pay the taxis and then the best service of all was when I needed to buy some gifts she phoned the shop in Menara Mall and had someone ready to help me! It was a pleasure to stay at the hotel. All the staff from the waiters in the restaurant to the omelette chefs at breakfast to the doormen and cleaning lady were friendly helpful and very professional. Thank you for treating me so well.

Review_Date: Monique M wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Amazing Treatment with Najia at Spa
Review_Text: Najia gave the best massage - didn't want to leave. Be sure to check out the hamam. It is truly an experience. The entire experience was peaceful. She is very nice and wants to make sure you're getting a great service.

Review_Date: Adarah wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: I liked the Movenpick Mansour hotel very much. It is centrally located in the Hivernage district; Other lovely hotels cafes and easy transport links. The roads are so clean there as well. The route from the airport is so close.  I was surprised at the modern architectural design as well as an unusual discreet entrance. It is a bird in the cage/ garden and fountain style entrance with a huge bronze/brown automatic curved door. The floors are so glossy and scent throughout the lobby is filled with the fragrance of fresh roses! I understand why they have a five star rating!    The check-in was swift attendance to take the luggage and proceed to the bedroom was also on point. I had a first floor superior room with small terrace front facing the garden/side pool area; Just as expected as requested with the booking. No complaints at all regarding this or with the standard of luxury. The king size bed was comfy; The setting for the air-conditioning was good. Only the Spanish dinner meals at Marcelona was limiting not Morrocan cuisine.    The Breakfast buffet wos high quality with amazing range of dishes and variety of drinks.  Staff friendly and service is fast.  Bahija was serving my table mostly according to my preferred seated area and she was friendly helpful and polite. All the staff generally are constantly moving about ensuring guests are catered for; Pool side bar area and lunch buffet is optional expensive but also high quality food and service.    The only thing disliked was that there was very little entertainment for guests; Only for people who booked their own private functions. I was expecting some live music playing during dinner at least in the weekends but there was none. They have a music hub with microphone but no player. Perhaps this is planned for busiest time of the year. The hotel was reasonably quiet but peaceful; Not bustling with guests; services a bit too expensive; going on tours is a must to get an authentic experience of Marrakech

Review_Date: YELINBOSTON wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel. Amazing breakfast. Accommodating staff. Main pool area could use updating as chairs were broken and/or cushions needed replacing. There‚Äôs an amazing spa like smell throughout the hotel this adds to the feeling of relaxation.

Review_Date: 69Pete wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Stayed there 3 years ago when it was a beautiful hotel ruined by incompetent management.  Mercifullyand rather unexpectedly the top management has been replaced the staff now feel and act a lot happier and this time we had a fantastic stay.    Rather oddly some of the in-house restaurants have not yet reopened so worth checking exactly what is open now. But the breakfast is to die for the pools are exceptional and the staff are now friendly and cooperative. The concierge is fantastic the Moroccan tea delicious the Spanish restaurant delightful    The position is a little incongruous. In one direction is a shopping mall ( air conditioned Carrefour supermarket) in the other the roads area bit derelict. But the neighbourhood is actually very safe and the people you pass are friendly and sociable. Moroccans are usually extremely well mannered like to try their English but respect your social space. So feel free to go.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rula wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: I had an issue upon checkin and the assistant manager Nuzha listened proposed changes and implemented. She is great in assisting and fixing issues. She was able to attend to my request to change the room in no flash. She is competent and problem solver. Great for the hotel to have someone like her.    Other staff Noufal and Othman were quick in attending to my room change helping me in sorting things out in no time. Bravo

Review_Date: Georges T wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: I had two treatment sessions with Najia massage and facials. Her hands are just magical to say the least. Najia is the queen of massage and facials. I travel around the world and have many spa treatments but Najia is without any doubt the best. Just go try and thank me later.

Review_Date: Maleehaa M wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Outstanding service and great experience with Najia. The massage was amazing. Very professional and amazing service. Got a facial and massage it was best the I have had ever. Got a hammam with Hind which was outstanding as well and definitely will be coming back to Najia and Hind.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anaya M wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: I have returned to the Movenpick for my sixth time and once again the service from the staff was impeccable as the staff could not do enough for us. Yet again I was incredibly impressed.    The breakfast staff were extremely attentive taking great pride and care in their job and were such hard workers. In particular My Youssef ( the breakfast manager) and the waiters; Mohamed skiriba Mohamed kabaj and Bahija who served us could not do enough for us and If we wanted anything they would immediately try to meet our needs as quickly as possible and treated us as if we were royalty. These workers take hard work and dedication to another level and put it into perspective onto how little we have it in the Uk. These staff put great pride into their job and it shows in every single thing they do for us and the quality of their work and I would appreciate it If the efforts of these fabulous staff was recognised. Such amazing service and hard workers I have never been to a hotel where the staff are as motivated and caring as this !  Thank you to all the breakfast staff for your incredible efforts :)    My breakfast experience at the Movenpick was a truly satisfying and out of this world experience every morning to the point it being therapeutic due to the relaxing atmosphere there. It was an unforgettable exceptional service and made my stay at the Movenpick once again one to never forget. Thank you to the amazing chefs and the superb breakfast waiter staff we appreciate your hard work and efforts !!!    From the Mistry family.

Review_Date: ChiColoTraveler wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: We stayed at the Movenpick for three nights and enjoyed our experience overall. The hotel is beautiful with modern Moroccan style especially the entrance and lobby areas. The pools and manicured grounds offer a lush oasis in the hot desert climate and the daily breakfast was plentiful in selection and quality (freshly made sfenj Moroccan donuts and fresh squeezed orange juice!). The female concierges were delightful and very helpful in answering questions about Marrakech assisting with dining reservations and transport.    Unfortunately this is not a 5-star hotel. The rooms are quite worn with stains/tears on the carpet and bathroom tile and fading and dirt on fixtures (lamp shades bathroom towel bars/mirrors). The front desk staff were highly unfriendly each time we sought assistance or wanted to exchange currency.    Would consider returning to Movenpick but are more likely to seek other accommodations for our next visit.

I really enjoy their breakfast at Restro Savoy & was very well organized by their manger Myyoussef & Balija. Their English skill was up to the good service standard and great with details.

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: N1992 wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: I created a TripAdvisor account specifically to warn you against visiting this hotel. I wrote this review after visiting the hotel but it had been sitting in my review drafts since ny visit! There are so many problems associated with this hotel that I just can not mention them all. We stayed here for 8 days. I have split the review into Accommodation/resort dining and service.    I will start with the accommodation/resort: The main pool was ridiculously overcrowded and freezing cold. I have no idea why they did not turn up the heating a bit more. It was really unpleasant to swim in. There was another pool near the Abou Faris buildings that was even colder than the main one! Absolutely freezing! It was also filled with lots of dead bees floating on the water. The suite was good spacious and the Moroccan theme adopted throughout (including the furniture colours) was very nice. This is where the positvies end. The bathroom door was broken and did not lock properly. The layout of the building was ridiculous; directly above us was the penthouse's wooden boarded balcony. This penthouse was filled with 20 Party-lovers. You could hear them running around junping in their plunge pool and shouting as well as playing music. After a few sleepless nights and multiple complaints we were moved to another suite. This was the same suite category but much much larger this left us wondering why they had not given us this earlier!? (As it was the same suite category not an upgrade). Build quality here was poor too which meant (broken bathroom door again) we frequently saw spiders and large numbers of other unknown insects from the building.    Dining: Absolutely terrible! First day ordered room service and we were charged the 5 star hotel price of ¬£20 for a burger with chips and ¬£4 for a coke. But the problem is the burger tasted horrible! The inside was red (having told them well done wanted) and uncooked smelled really bad. I would not be surprised if it was donkey meat! Then we tried the 'Dada's diner' cafe/restaurant. This was nothing special the food was 'okay' at best yet still 5 star hotel price. The breakfast was okay. Good choice and variety but actual quality was rubbish (don't go near the hashbrowns or sausages). The breads and Moroccan breakfast (pancakes?) were good. The Marcelona restaurant was okay nothing special we did not like the tagine at all though. Jamra was okay.    Service: By far the worst of the three categories. Horrendous. Poolside service = RUBBISH had to ask 4 times for a menu. Asked for ice cream and changed our mind for a different flavour the attendant rolled his eyes!    Just avoid this hotel if you're expecting a 5 star hotel. We went the nearby Four Seasons for dinner a couple times and it seemed much better though they were charging more than The Ritz London which seemed silly.

Review_Date: chetan t wrote a review May 2022
Review_Title: Visit this hotel, you will LOVE IT!
Review_Text: To help your decision of reading the rest of this review I will summarise. IT WAS AMAZING! Now on to the details.  When you arrive you will be greeted by a gorgeous lobby and the scent of jasmine flowers definitely Instagramable. Help yourself to some mint tea if you wish. The check in was quick and efficient and we were soon off to our room which was a garden view. Not the most amazing view but I wouldn't complain. The room is spacious and well equipped. The decor is classically modern with moroccan style oozing from every corner. It has all the essentials you would expect 24 hour room service conceirge etc.. it has 3 pools all of which have their own appeal. A lively pool next to a bar and cafe which serves hot stone-baked pizza on demand and then two smaller pools one for families and kids and another calm and quiet pool for adults only which is adjacent to the spa. We didn't visit the spa but I am sure it would be very nice judging by the rest of the hotel. The hotel grounds are very nice to walk around with tall structures surrounding you and palm trees. The hotel offers a great buffet breakfast with a lot of variety so everyone will be catered for and if you're feeling cultural then they also serve a traditional Moroccan breakfast. Would be nice if they switched up the hot food items but with all the variety in the other sections you definitely won't get bored. There are two other restaurants in the hotel one was closed which I'm sure will open up if the hotel got really busy but the other one is a nice dinner retreat from the hustle and bustle of the Medina.  We booked a few excursions from the hotel which a private car and guide. A little pricier than the other online or 'high-street' options but worth it because the private driver will stop where you like and will even haggle on your behalf if you ask nicely. The Medina was an intense cultural slap in the face that you must subject yourself to otherwise you can say that you've visited Marrkech. The Ourika Valley is okay I guess. Pick another mountain destination. The camel ride in the Agafay Desert with dinner under the stars is definitely worth it a deal Moroccan experience. Thank you to Rafiq and Mohamed for arranging this for us.  Overall it's a lovely hotel which caters for your every need while you are a guest. We had a lovely stay and would definitely come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Zana B wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: At the reception you will be welcomed by the most beautiful smile in Marrakech of Hanane and the greatest charme you will find of Othman. You want to exchange money for a good rate? Hanane is your bank. You need anything during your trip? Othman is your advisor. Both made our stay here in marrakech much easier!

Review_Date: Aneesa wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Reception: Mohssin has provided us with excellent customer service. He had good communication skills attentive to all our queries and went beyond our expectations.    Kids Club: a special thank you to Touria Nezha and the girls. They were fantastic caring and has experience with taking care of the kids. My daughter enjoyed her time at the kids club and wanted to go back everyday. They provide great program where My daughter made pizza played games was creative and made a bouquet of roses for me. They take very good care with the kids and ensure that the Kids wash their hands.    Breakfast: The breakfast was good and had a good selection of pastries and fruits. It was very busy and did not have enough English breakfast tea bag.    The hotel: it was modern very welcoming smelt nice and very clean. The attention to detail just makes it so special. Even when walking into the hotel during the day you have a man making mint tea and greet her all guest.    Car parking: excellent valet service and also underground secure parking with an attendant.    Good location 15mins to the medina away for the crowd.    The spa: we loved the jacuzzi and the steam room but unfortunately we did not manage to get a booking for a hammam as it was fully booked.
