The staff is good the decor is lovely. Thank you Movernpick and thank you Morocco. My experience here was unforgettable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ambar Yousuf wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: After an unfortunate start with the initial room we had been given the hospitality we received from the movenpick in particular Laila from the reception to reprimand the situation was unbelievable. It is my second visit here and I will undoubtedly return for a third.

Review_Date: soulefultraveler wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Huge hotel with large beautiful grounds and very nice pool area. Several dining options. Lovely large room. Great breakfast buffet. Good location down the street from a major mall and not too far from the old medina. This was our second 5* hotel stay in this area of Marrakesh and the Movenpick was definitely superior.

Review_Date: Charlie wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: The breakfast here is fantastic so many different options and great customer service.  A big thank you to Fatima for her beautiful smile pleasant manner excellent customer service and of course the fabulous mint tea.

Review_Date: Soheil AM wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: If you want to choose a hotel for your stay you can trust this hotel where you can experience a real five star hotel with a real five star Moroccan service.  I move to this hotel after a bad experience with another hotel in Marrakech.  A fancy lobby filled with the smell of flowers is ready to welcome you.  Check in was so fast and easy.  Breakfast was so tasty and covers all tastes.  Room was so big and comfortable and was well designed.

Review_Date: Auster L wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Title: Hotel is quite new and well facilitated
Review_Text: The Movenpick Hotel is located some 30 minutes walking distance from Jama El f‚Äôna Market & Souks to its west or 10 minutes' walk to the very modern Menara Mall to its south. The area feels quite safe even as we hiked back to hotel at night. The hotel itself is quite okay with all the facilities you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The breakfast is well stocked with varieties and choices. The staff members are generally friendly.

Review_Date: Michael O wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Title: Huge hotel attached to convention center--great!
Review_Text: Great hotel beautiful corridors and rooms lovely large outdoor pool. Breakfasts were terrific. Comfortable beds nice bathroom and hot shower with lots of water and the room was large.  Service was good but not excellent--service sort of on Morocco time....

Review_Date: Betty wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Great hotel  Rooms are nice and comfortable... breakfast is excellent.  The food at the restaurant was excellent too. The staff are very nice and professional.  Great pool facilities and friendly staff. Special thanks to Jihane Othman and Anas.  We will certainly stay again at the Movenpick during our next visit to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hoodo M wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Youssef‚Äôs customer service skills was amazing
Review_Text: He was very attentive and catered to all our needs he‚Äôs very easy to communicate with and helped with everything we needed and more! Thanks this makes our stay at the M√∂venpick so much easier and helps us start our day amazingly! Also the breakfast is exceptional.

Review_Date: MitchT666 wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: A very good hotel in a quiet residential area.
Review_Text: The hotel is located in a residential area 10min walk from Marrakesh railway station and ca 30min walk (10min in a taxi) from the old town. The hotel has 2 outdoor pools - one heated and plenty of sunbeds available around the pools - at least in November when the mornings were too cold to lie by the pool we did not have an issue finding sunbeds around midday.    We had breakfast included and there is plenty to choose from including fresh fruit various cooking stations etc.    Our room was quite spacious with decent size bathroom clean and with all the expected amenities.    The staff is friendly and helpful just watch out for the taxi drivers outside - their asking prices are always 2-3 times or more what it should be so negotiate before getting in!!

Review_Date: tassign0n wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Perfect balance between work and leisure if you are on business trip.  Perfectly relaxing if you want to forget business and only think leisure.  If you really want to discover Marrakech do it from M√∂venpick Hotel.

Review_Date: Meryem H wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: I advise you to chose this hotel if you ever wanna spend a good moment in marrakech.  Everything was perfect  Clean and organized  If you go there ask for nezha in the reception she is a golden woman  Thank you again

Review_Date: Yusefine wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Movenpick is an excellent hotel in every way possible.    The staff is the key to make your stay at the hotel enjoyable as it should be namely Nezha who went above and beyond the call of duty.    Nezha is patient professional and accommodating. Praise her she‚Äôs a wonderful asset to the Movenpick chain.

Review_Date: Halima Z wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: The best place to be for kids;)
Review_Text: I am simply in love with this hotel!! I particularly appreciate the kids club so spacious and colorful ! My kids can spend all the day playing dancing and painting. They can also enjoy a delicious meal specially cooked for them:)  Special thanks to kids club team you‚Äôre doing a great job guysüòò

Review_Date: Irina B wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: I have decided to celebrate my birthday in Marrakech and M√∂venpick hotel was an obvious choice. We had a warming welcome by Hanane who accompanied us all along our stay at the hotel. Hanane was professional friendly and very much client oriented.  The room was great and the breakfast delicious.  We highly recommend M√∂venpick.

Review_Date: Maria TravelPassion wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: A great experience above our expectations. The hotel has all the right installations to keep you inside. The team very warm and you feel all the time very welcome. Jamra Restaurant next to the pool offer a healthy menu w/o gluten and lactose next to the pool to allow you enjoy from the sun. Urban brasserie is the great choice for dinner or even the buffet menu at the pool terrace. The SPA open long hours with free access to Jacuzzi Hammam and Sauna reserve the hammam and massage on time! Thank you to FADOU Dauaa Jamila Kamir Mr. Bennani Chef Ahmed & Chef Tariq. We look forward to come back soon.

Review_Date: Mohammed wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: The spa at Movenpick Marrakech was a really good experience. I got the hands and feet treatment done by Najia at the Spa in Movenpick Marrakech. She took her time and did not rush. I would recommend asking for Najia as she will do it with care and pleasure. The 1 hour treatment was worth the money. I could tell the difference before and after the treatment and the service by Najia and the Spa overall was excellent.

Review_Date: Guide6869 wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: I had a spa package while on a business trip. The hotel was great and the overall service was wonderful. The spa package included a hammam a massage and beauty feet. It was my first experience with hammam and I was a little nervous but my skin never felt so exfoliated and refreshed. I‚Äôm very picky about massage and am always worried when there‚Äôs a language barrier. The massage with Najia was probably one of the best I‚Äôve had just the right pressure very intuitive and very patient with the communication. The following foot treatment was also wonderful. The overall spa experience at movenpick and with Najia was exceptional.

Review_Date: MoniqueRD wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Compliments to the staff of the M√∂venpick Marrakech!    Beautiful entourage super cool graffiti art √ñm Yoga studio fitness Spa 3 pools bars & restaurants!    Great possibilities for all kind of travellers!    Special shout-out üòÅü§© to the following people:    Sa√Ød & Mohammed at the reception.  Hassan at the pool bar.  Kaltoum at the Spa.  Skiriba at housekeeping.  And the rest of the team!    They all made our holiday a big succes!    Shukraan lak! Thank you very much!    Already looking forward to come back to beautiful Marrakeck!

Review_Date: Mohammed A wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Staff are excellent especially in Saray. Breakfast staff Mohammed and all waiters the ladies making msemen and sfinga bread are super and deserve my special appreciation. Special thanks to Mustapha and Fatima Alzahra. Great hospitality

Review_Date: Ed C wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Our tour started with 3 nights in this hotel. Considering how tired I was after first a long flight and second after a day of touring the only things that I was really interested in was sleep and recharging batteries for my electronics. As far as sleep goes the hotel was very good - I fell asleep quickly and slept soundly. Recharging however was another story. Like many of the hotels outside the US the room's electricity was disconnected when you took your key-card to leave the room and as a result all recharging stopped. I solved this problem by asking for a second card which more or less worked except when the maid removed the card while I was out during the day. Since it was part of my tour I have no idea of how much we paid so I can't assess its value.

Review_Date: Nare wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: We have been staying in Movenpick Hotel Mansour Eddahbi Marrakech for 5 days in February. Couldn't have been happier with the hotel that we choose. We had a wonderful experience. The rooms are spacious the heated pool makes our stay even more pleasant.  I want to write a huge thank you to the ladies who run the kids club. With 2 small children it was a perfect choice since the kids have been entertained busy with different types of games and fed for most of the time of the day and we had some spare time.

Review_Date: Kunle Awojobi wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: The hotel is fantastic very good service and clean rooms. A lot of facilities to use also. The staff are great especially one named Moshin! He really took care of me during my stay helped set up activities for me and even sorted out the refund for me when it got cancelled honestly made my trip very smooth. I‚Äôd definitely recommend here and can‚Äôt wait to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Viviana O. wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Incredible customer service especially from Hanane
Review_Text: Customer service here is exceptional but Hanane made our stay much more pleasant. She help us book our tours and assisted with anything else we needed. She is the best always helping out with a smile. Will definitely recommend the hotel and have them go directly to her.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: H Q wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Honestly apart from the room facilities and overall experience the staff at this hotel is exceptional. Laila from reception is a dream to work with as she made sure our stay was pleasurable and memorable.  Her knowledge about the city and recommendations were always valued and sought for. It honestly makes me so happy to experience such a service as it can make a huge difference.

Review_Date: karim m wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Superb first experience in Marrakech, was amazed by the hospitality and was way beyond any of my expectation!!!! :)
Review_Text: Went on holiday for my mums birthday was very hesitant at first as of what hotels in Marrakech would be accommodating to what she wanted.    Extremely satisfied to say the least staff offered excellent service (V.friendly gave us excellent recommendations)    Thank you Layla :)    Hope to see you soon

Review_Date: Rochelle T wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: 5*service from Poolside teamMonsefJihaneTarikMohammed and Bar Tender Hassan.  They made us feel very welcome.  However the reception staff Laila and Safa were rudelacked basic customer service skills and treated us with no courtesy.This is not what I expected from Movenpick as I have heard lots of fantastic things about this hoteland also had recommended friends and family to visitI have even thought about booking another visit there.Due to my experience I am not sure I will visit again.

Review_Date: Global223170 wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Extremely happy with the service provided to us by Layla she went above and beyond for us she was extremely helpful and sorted any problems with the accommodation. Layla was very patient with us which you don‚Äôt get from many other hotels. If you want to witness excellent customer service then Layla is definitely the standard to which it should be. I want to thank Layla once again for her support and her professionalism to make sure that we will have a pleasant stay. Incredible service.

Review_Date: Daniela wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Excellent first experience in Marrakech with M√∂venpick
Review_Text: We were there on a company business trip and have to admit that it was an excellent choice of Hotel. The outdoor pool is amazing they have clean and very nice rooms also one of the most comfortable bed ever!  The staff is amazing! I had an experience with one particular staff member called Hanane that made the best suggestions for the free time activity. She was very professional and kind making our stay easier and comfortable.  Definitely worth a visit! Enjoy!

Review_Date: Cristina B wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: After a few days of intensive visit of beautiful Marrakesh I treat myself with a well deserved pedicure ‚Äògriffe‚Äô by the beautiful Ghizlane in the O de Rose spa center. The staff is very welcoming friendly and customer oriented. Many thanks. I now have ‚Äúhappy feet‚Äù again and ready to enjoy the evening. Christina from Luxembourg

Review_Date: Ravi Kumar wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: I decided to go this place.i look on mobile this hotel. This is very good place. I am very interested in this. Very nice and beautiful place all services are available. Excellent customer service and best services provided by hotel.

Review_Date: Clarissa Follmann wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: I've decided to visit Marrakech for the first time to celebrate my birthday and couldn't have chosen a better hotel for the special occasion.  From the moment we checked in everyone was very attentive kind and accommodating. My husband had recently injured his coccyx and they managed to get us a room with a bathtub for his recovery. They also spontaneously gave me a cake to celebrate my birthday which was really yummy and covered with macaroons which I love!!  The hotel's facilities are also impressive and you can tell that each area is well maintained. They have 3-4 pools including one calmer and more private perfect for people with kids.  Overall my experience was very positive and I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone.  A special thank you to Safa and Leila for making our experience so special and unforgettable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alla T wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: This hotel will take you into a fairy tale world of Moroccan interior combined with class and tradition! Well-trained personnelgreat breakfast warmed up outdoor pool and a beautiful room is awaiting for u. Highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rachael S wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Nice experience if you can even get in
Review_Text: Me my boyfriend and his mother (on holiday in Marrakesh) tried to access this hotel on a day pass to use the pool and restaurant area. When we arrived we were told by reception when we enquired there was NO ROOM and we would not be able to get in the pool because it would be so full.    One member of staff rudely dismissed us and directed us to someone else.    We then just booked the pass online which we would have done before but we thought it would have been better to book face to face at the hotel and make sure everything was in order with the deal. Once presented with our booking She then eventually admired us entry but said we would not be able to get in the pool.    Once inside the pool area and loungers were basically empty expect for a few families and couples sun bathing. We were shown to a day bed area and enjoyed our time their a lot! The food was great fresh pizza by the pool. Sampled local Casablanca beer and the life guard was very friendly. Such a shame that such a great experience was ruined by prejudice fount of house staff. No large party arrived until 6pm which is when the day pass ends anyway. Either way they did not take up all the space in this massive hotel!!!

Review_Date: NKP30000 wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: We are a very lucky family we have stayed at some beautiful hotels. But the Movenpick in Marrakech is simply one of the best. The hotel is stunning there's incredible art work in the reception area and you are greeted with beautiful sofas in stunning colours and it's obvious that this is a classy hotel.  Our room was beautiful  it was incredibly clean and very modern and we had a lovely terrace which overlooked the well kept gardens. In the afternoon  I would sit on the terrace and I would spend hours enjoying the absolute peace. The bathroom was great and had the most fantastic shower. The WiFi was excellent there was a very strong signal. Breakfast was a wonderful treat. There were so many staff who would constantly make sure you had everything that you needed. The food was lovelywe really looked forward to Breakfast. All of the staff were so welcoming and always smiling. There was a wonderful lady who would prepare your eggs. Every single staff member was brilliant. We had lunch at the hotel and the food was very well prepared. My family used the spa every day and even had beauty treatments. They said the spa was one of the best that they've ever used. Well done to Fatima Fatin and Ghizlan  my wife said they were excellent. Mourad worked at the reception and he was happysmiling and always willing to help. He's very good. They've got a wonderful steam sauna and open air jacuzzi. The resort has a number of pools and they even have a heated swimming pool. Great facilities and very welcoming staff in the pool area. Well done Movenpick Marrakech we have all said that your hotel is one of the best that we've every stayed at. Brilliant hospitality and brilliant staff. Well done Khalid Mowloud and Said Semmah on the front desk you are great hosts. Med Aimad is one of the portershe is such a decent man and just wanted to make sure we were always happy. Mina Naima  Mariem looked after our room and they were brilliant. Hassan is in room service what a lovely man he always had time to chat. We will definitely come back to this wonderful hotel.

Review_Date: 3DMatrix wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Upon our arrival the reception was full of guests waiting to check-in and most appeared to be tired and somewhat frustrated. Our check-in process was overly long and it appeared the front desk staff were overwhelmed. The chap who checked us iin was a bit of a smart alec who was speaking down to us until he was taken down a peg by me. I am annoyed that I failed to note down his name.    We also didn't feel the usual Moroccan warm welcome there was no mint tea (or any beverage) offered upon arrival. In addition of the 4 rooms booked only 3 were ready and it took 2 hours for the fourth room to be ready. We eventually had to make a fuss and were given a complimentary dinner at the hotel's top restaurant the Urban Brasserie for later that evening.    The hotel's interiors are phenomenal interiors everywhere you look there's a picture begging to be taken. Sufficed to say the Instagram aficionados amongst us went on a picture taking spree for the duration of our stay. The rooms and bathrooms were generously sized but then again that's what we paid for. The first thing we did was to fill up the large bath tub and take a soak. with some wine. We both really enjoyed that.    Dinner at Urban Brasserie:  - Lovely service  - Attentive staff  - Delicious meal  - The only minus would be that the main hostess appeared to be a tad full of herself.    Daily breakfast at Saray Restaurant  - Extensive selection  - Delicious  - Looked forward to it everyday of our stay    Cocktails at 54¬∞ Steak & Bar:  - Pricey  - Not quite sure the barman knew what he was mixing    In terms of hotel staff the cleaning ladies deserve a mention as they where lovely warm and always full of smiles.    To summarize the hotel was great for what it was with mostly good staff other than the odd annoying git. We will definitely return.

Review_Date: rouba h wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Professional staff and pay attention to details they are welcoming and warm thank you abdellah and all the team tr√®s jolie h√¥tel avec une piscine amazing d√©coration as well tr√®s bien plac√© pr√®s de palais congr√®s

Review_Date: ilhame wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: I really enjoyed my hammam in √¥ de rose spa in movenpick h√¥tel fatimazahra chouabi was wonderful at exfoliating my body and washing my hair so gently she was amazing.  I definitely recommend it and recommend her for anyone wanting to relax and enjoy the moroccan hammam but with a luxurious touch.

Review_Date: Jim wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Great service, nice resort but with tiring amenities
Review_Text: We stayed a week in January 2020 here as a family of four.    The service at the hotel was near perfect. From the pool staff through to the restaurant staff and especially our room cleaner - Mina - they were excellent. For example the kids loved to come into our room and find how their toys had been set-up that day by her. All were very attentive and kind.    In terms of the rooms and amenities the resort is looking a bit tired. From mosaics coming away from the main pool floor to a number of faulty lifts it is in need of a little tlc. Equally we got adjoining rooms but they were connected by an antechamber that then had a separate door onto the hotel corridor which made us feel a little vulnerable with the two young kids in the next room. Our room had a balcony overlooking either the generator or incinerator that would lead to a low thud early in the morning as it kicked it alongside a smell of burning if the wind blow in a certain direction (though this wasn't all the time).    Location wise its in a nice but quiet neighbourhood. The downside is that their aren't too many eating options outside of the resort unless you walk for more than 10mins.    Overall we would stay at the Movenpick again because of the staff but would be more careful about the room we choose.

Review_Date: Zena R wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Taha was a fantastic host he was extremely kind with a great personality and provided excellent service at breakfast everyday. He was very welcoming which really made my family and I feel at home.  The hotel was beautiful and modern but still maintained the Moroccan ambience. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Marrakech.

Review_Date: PR_Bride wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Our company stayed here for our global sales meeting buying out the property. It is a beautiful resort with multiple buildings for rooms the spa yoga the gym restaurants etc. and it‚Äôs connected to a convention center where we had our meetings and event nights. There are also a couple of swimming pools.    The food was pretty good considering they had to feed about 550 people 3 meals a day plus coffee breaks. Mostly it was buffet so it did get repetitive after a couple of days but breakfast was always awesome and a few of the dinners were quite good.    My room was quiet clean and spacious. It had a mini fridge and water bottles were replenished with maid service. Huge bathroom with a large shower (no bathtub) robe slippers good towels etc. Just no wash cloths for some reason.    On our formal closing night the executives asked all the staff to come up on stage as a thank you and they got a standing ovation from all of us. It was quite the moment but showed just how much we appreciated their wonderful service and the lovely property.

Review_Date: Peter wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: The staff was very friendly and took care of us. At the front desk Mohssine helped us booking great and interesting tours. Lovely ambience with jasmine-scented lobby with Morrocan music and mint tea. Great amenities.

Review_Date: Eileen D wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: It was a great pleasure to take photographs in this gleaming hotel with its modern Moroccan colors and motifs fountains and small streams flowing beneath suspended huge golden filigreed lanterns and beautifully landscaped and lit pool area. Breakfast was very complete and the bar was a fun place to chat with fellow tour members. It is located within walking distance of the square and the souks and is also near the mall.

Review_Date: Hussa wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: A message for the hotel and Mrs Nadia guest service
Review_Text: Since my arrival Nadia was the best guest service I've ever met and she has to work hard to make me feel happy also she offered me a lot of help and she was so nice to me ... as a woman I was afraid but she helped me so much ... About the hotel I liked so much it make us feel comfy tbh I hope to see more guest services like Nadia / thank you so much Nadia Iwish you all the best I hope you receive this message
Reviewer_Location: Emirate of Dubai, United Arab Emirates

Review_Date: Mary H wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: It was marvellous the hotel was beautiful and the staff were so nice and welcoming. The breakfast was amazing with so much to choose from and we want to thank most of all Mohamed Skiriba who was so nice and helpful and made our stay so memorable my dad was very happy with his caf√© cr√®me every morningüëç A big thanks to our favourite Mohamed from your Irish guests Mary Alex & Sandyüíãüòò

Review_Date: Rover wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: A beautiful hotel with a few shortcomings!
Review_Text: On arrival the reception was totally packed with tired frustrated visitors and only two staff members were on duty.  We were given absolutely no tourist material or a map of Marrakesh.  I had to ask for one the next day.  We were upgraded to a very nice large room because our bedroom backed onto the neighbouring hotel's disco - we could not hear the TV in our room because the music was so loud.  There were not enough sun loungers at the pool. And somehow they were reserved every morning with hotel towels until the "special" guests arrived.  Otherwise all was ok..........

Review_Date: Mariska V wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: From January 7 till January 11 my daughter and I were guests in this wonderful hotel.  The staff was unbelievably nice!!  All of them were really friendly and helpful. I‚Äôve travelled all around the world but this is really hard to find!  Thank you for the great 4 days!  If you are looking for a luxurious hotel with good prices in the middle of Marrakech with a wonderful staff don‚Äôt look any further! This is your hotel. Even my Maroccan friends told me so!!

Review_Date: roycelyn R wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Asma was my masseuse.. she was absolutely excellent.. her technique was perfect and her pressure was right on point. If I wasn‚Äôt leaving I would book her again. The room was comfortable and warm. The reception area was clean and the clerks were very hospitable.. and the tray served after was great!!

Review_Date: O nan wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Lovely hotel with good facilities and good location.staff at hotel were very warm and helpful full. Nassima was very pleasant and allways smiling to all guests.In the busy morning breakfast restaurant.  The heated pool was not warm at allbut overall all the hotel was very good.and would recommend.

Review_Date: LJGMJLAJAI wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: We stayed in a variety of accommodations in Morocco and this place was the least welcoming. This might have to do with its size however as far as large hotels go we also stayed in an all-inclusive and in another luxury hotel and these two were VERY welcoming. You know have a seat with the mint tea upon arrival. I chose this hotel as I thought the photos made it look rather exotic. Quite the opposite. Again just too big. Lastly though the staff was very accommodating in keeping our two rooms within close vicinity of each other we ended up in a wheelchair accessible room and it was not very comfortable: ie. stationary shower chair is right underneath shower head difficult to shower. Fabric desk chair was in bad shape - quite filthy. For the price everything should be pristine rooms comfortable. We slept well and staying here was a reward after some of the limited riads we had been in but I would not check in here again.

Review_Date: HUSSA wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Nadia is the best guest service staff I have ever met since from my arrival and she has worked so hard to make us happy. very helpful and offered me the best services with hospotailty welcoming.  She can handle pressure so well and I really appeciate. In future I am sure the hotel would recieve more guests with the extreamily well behaved services of Nadia. Apprecaite her knowledge and know how skill in guest handlinging.  I wish Nadia a better future.  Hussa Alqubaisi

Review_Date: Nicole D wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: A very large hotel  well appointed and comfortable set in lovely gardens with two outdoor swimming pools (one always heated to 26degrees). It is a brilliant place for a yoga week as the Om Yoga centre there is fabulous and has classes running through the day. Excellent breakfast and only about 10 minute taxi ride to the M√©dina. Polite attentive staff . Excellent Spa ( ask for Fatima to have a traditional Hammam ... she was great) . I plan to go again with my daughter for a mother-daughter yoga weekend and a relax by the pool. Lovely and good value .

Review_Date: IRENE S wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: I and my husband joined Insight Vacations for Morocco tour. We arrived in Marakech on Dec 25 2019 and stayed there for 2 nights. Our Tour Director handed us the room key and confirmed that our room was twin bed as we strongly requested upon booking the tour. We were shocked the room given to us was not twin instead it was double bed. The staff then re-arranged twin bed for us. However when we opened the door someone was still occupying the room with her stuff all over the bed so we quickly closed the door and informed the staff. They did not seem to show any concern or apologetic at all. Thereafter the staff again re-arranged another twin bed for us which was away from the group.    On the same night at around midnight after washing my hair only then I realised the hair dryer was not working so I called the receptionist/front desk to get the replacement and told him that I need it urgent as my hair was wet after having waited for 15 min no one came so I called again the receptionist informed me only 1 staff was working that night however he promised to ask the staff to attend to my request first before attending to other calls. I waited for almost 1 hr still no one turned up so I came down with my messy hair to approach the front desk it was about 13-15 minutes walk from my room (2 ways). When I checked with him he didn't respond instead he quickly made a call using his cellular phone after waited for over 5 minutes I interrupted him to ask if he has got the replacement hair dryer he asked me to wait as he was checking with the staff on the phone only after almost 10 minutes he showed me the photo on his phone that the hair replacement dryer was already hanged on my room door handle. When I left my room it was not there. I felt very frustrated and furious with the staff attitude. I should say almost all the staff are not friendly and helpful. Someone from our group also complained that front desk didn't pick up her call another said she asked for iron board but didn't get it. No doubt that probably it was during holiday season where the hotel was crowded and the staff was busy but in the hospitality industry this kind of attitude is definitely a no no...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fabienne M wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: We travel almost every month to Marrakesh. I stay for the first time at the Movenpick together with my husband from December 8th till 12 2019 at Movenpick Hotel in Marrakesh and we have been very satisfied and surprised about the quality of the hotel and the excellent service by all the Staff.    Mr Mohssine from the reception and his colleagues where very professional and very helpful. Since my husband is an Accor Platinum (now Diamond) member the "Reception Staff" ( Mr Mohssine and also two very kind and helpful ladies) treated us accordingly including the room upgrade. Check-in and check-out were quick.    Since 2013 we stay always in another 5 star Accor hotel at Hivernage in Marrakesh.    We both had a wonderful time at the Movenpick despite our short stay because we were most of the time outside the hotel and couldn't unfortunately not enjoy of all the facilities the Movenpick offers.    The food at the restaurant was excellent and the staff at the restaurant are very professional .    Breakfast could in some way a little bit better regarding a larger choice of the buffet and bread such as the famous "parisienne or baguette"  smoked salmon fruits fresh smoothies etc where missing.    The room (building Aboufaris) was very nice and clean.    My husband had some problems with the Wi-Fi at the moment of our stay but the reception told us that next time the problem will be solved.    All the personal have been so helpful and friendly during our short stay.    My compliments to the Management and complete Staff.    We will certainly stay again at the Movenpick during one of our next visits to Marrakesh.

Review_Date: Silvana wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Wonderful Hotel in a beautiful city with amazing staff!
Review_Text: The Movenpick hotel is an amazing place to stay while visiting Marrakech! It really is a vacation in itself due to the kindness of staff. The rooms and grounds are immaculate. I actually extended my stay at this hotel because it is so good. Today I walked into my room and the staff had placed roses and rose petals. Thank you to Baali HanoneAit ouarker Najaf madamme hilali for the beautiful presentation of roses. Also the breakfast staff for providing a wonderful start to each day. Thank you also to Mr. Khalid Mawloud manager who took time to make me feel welcomed in this beautiful country.

Review_Date: Sufyan wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: The Spa and Hammam are a Must Visit.
Review_Text: I had a Hamam - The spa centre is fresh clean hygienic and tranquil. The therapist who did the Hamam is called Kalthoum - she was absolutely brilliant. She was very professional polite courteous and she made the utmost effort to ensure you are comfortable and to maintain and to maintain as much privacy as possible. I highly recommend Movenpick and Kalthoum.

Review_Date: MR & family wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Lovely week-long trip to Marrakech with our family! Lots of positives including an excellent kids club with great motivated and attentive staff.  Taha & Abdulkarim at breakfast were fantastic - they took great care of our large group. Thank you!!  Amina (housekeeping) was lovely too. Thanks to all who made our stay comfortable :)

Review_Date: Sunshine J wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: I normally stay at the Sofitel when I travel to Marrakech but due to the hotel being fully booked for part of my stay I decided to try Movenpick for the dates I couldn't stay at the Sofitel. Well It ended up being such a blessing! As Movenpick is now a new favourite place that I will stay when visiting Marrakech! I had a wonderful time! Everyone was so lovely especially beautiful Nezha at reservations she was extremely professional helpful and very sweet and she would always greet me with a big smile! I would also like to thank a few other special people like Taha my waiter he's truly an amazing guy he seemed to genuinely love his job! Also Kamal the chef ibtissam and Mahdi they both did the most amazing omelettes for me!! The lovely cleaners Noura and Fatima and finally the fantastic spa staff like Imane and especially the manager Amal Mimbane I stupidly hurt my toe very badly and blood went everywhere in the spa it was totally my fault but I was so shocked at how fast the staff acted... I couldn't believe it..... within a few minutes they got a doctor to look after me and help clean my toe. I didn't get the doctors name but I would like to thank him too!! I felt very embarrassed but they all made me feel better very kind caring spa staff!!    My only small criticism is that the breakfast should be more varied after 6 days there it got a little boring seeing the same things most days. If the chefs could mix it up a little more it would be amazing!!! Thanks again to all the wonderful staff at Movenpick!

Review_Date: Marc Lemmers wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: I stayed with my wife begin December 2019 at Movenpick Hotel in Marrakech and was very satisfied about the quality of the hotel and the excellent service.    Mr Mohamed (Reception) and colleagues where very professional and helpful. Has an Accor platinum member the Reception Staff treated me accordingly including the room upgrade. Check-in and check-out were quick.    The food at the restaurant was excellent and also the staff.    Breakfast could in some way a little bit better regarding the choice.    The room was very clean. The wifi in the room was not so good especially because I need very good Wi-Fi for my work. LAN was not available. The IT manager have done what was possible to help me and reception told me that next time the Wi-Fi will be ok.    I‚Äôm travelling almost every month to Morocco for my work and its was the first time that I choose to stay at the Movenpick in Marrakesh. I was really surprised about the quality of the hotel and the excellent service by the staff..    I will certainly stay again at the Movenpick during one of my next visits to Marrakesh.

Review_Date: No√©mie C wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: The experience was not 5 star we paid extra for a room garden view result of it we were next to a big outdoor condenser that we could hear while trying to sleep..  Service is so so... i would not recommend as you will have for a lower price much better alternative arounds...

Review_Date: Caroline M wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Spacious rooms well appointed beautiful pool with comfortable sun-loungers breakfast with healthy freshly squeezed orange juice and delicious omelettes But the most note-worthy factor to mention must be the helpful friendly staff .  On arrival after a long day travelling unfortunately our booking couldn't be traced despite being prepaid but NEZHA managed to sort the matter out and throughout the remainder of our stay was so helpful in supplying valuable local advice always charming with a beautiful smile Thank you Nezha -you made our family visit very special and we look forward to another Xmas in Marrakech

Review_Date: Richard Debenham wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: My wife and mother in law stayed here for one night and thoroughly enjoyed our time at Movenpick. Amazing massage from Najia worry every penny paid! Beautiful spa and jacuzzi with very attentive staff.

Review_Date: Epdoc wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Taha and AbdulKarim  were fantastic servers. They went above and beyond. Would highly recommend staying here. Very safe and clean and friendly staff.  December would be best time to visit you!  Don‚Äôt miss out

Review_Date: sadLsore1 wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We stayed at Movenpick Hotel for 4 nights over Christmas and came away very happy with most aspects of the experience. We arrived a couple of hours ahead of the check-in time of 3pm but our room was ready for us and the check-in process was handled quickly and efficiently.  The hotel is situated in the new part of the city and some distance from the Medina and main tourist sights so you do need to think about using taxi's or tour company's to get around as its a long walk otherwise and there is not much to see nearby.  Our room was one of the classic rooms but it was spacious clean and well-equipped and the only negative aspect was that our room in block 2 was overlooking a service area with the aircon units and this was periodically very noisy if you had the balcony door open.  Breakfast was excellent and offered just about everything you could possibly want - except English tea. As a large percentage of the guest were English it would be nice to have this option for those who don't like local tea (coffee drinkers had every option imaginable). We had evening meals in Dada's bistro and Manso Tapas bar which are in the hotel and the food in both was very good and reasonably priced although the service in Dada's was a bit sluggish. Also the pizza's from the pool bar were excellent.  We really liked the Movenpick and despite a few minor niggles it is an excellent hotel with wonderful multi-lingual staff and I would happily stay again if visiting Marrakesh.

Review_Date: GenevaJules wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: Excellent place to stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: One quick story first to tell the sort of place this is:  We were a group of 6. We booked 5 nights + half board. Upon our arrival we found out that our half board plan entitled us to one restaurant only (the brasserie) and that this restaurant was serving Italian food mainly. We like Italian cuisine but hadn't come to Morocco to have anything but Moroccan cuisine. We complained about this to the reception whilst we were checking in. We saw the Head of Reception Leila taking our disappointment in earnest and doing her best to address our problem. Minutes after this we received confirmation that the Chef Tarek would cook special menus for us. And so he did! We had 5 fantastic dinners cooked specially for us by Tarek and his team. One of the best couscous I ever had a great fish tajine a slow-cooked melting lamb shoulder ... all really good made from quality ingredients and very nicely presented. Frankly making a special menu every evening just for the 6 of us was the sort of thing you only rarely see and for sure a special attention which we won't forget. A big thanks to Leila + Tarek and his team again!    Pluses:  - Professional and friendly staff trying its very best to make your stay a memorable one. A few members really stood out: Leila at the Reception Tarek the Chef of the restaurant the team of waiters at the brasserie restaurant and many more whose first names we can't recall. Everyone will smile at you and try to help.  - Real 5-star experience nicely decorated and clean hotel. Nice and clean rooms very good beds.  - Great spa and fitness facilities  - Outstanding cuisine from Chef Tarek  - Good breakfast    Minuses:  - Location is convenient to reach from the airport but you'll have to ride a cab to get to the medina or other landmarks. Expect to pay 50 DAM every time you go to the medina and another 50 when you return.  - There's no free hotel shuttle from/to the airport  - Fruit salads at the breakfast could be better. Same applies to coffee.    We'd definitely consider staying there again.    Tip: a few good (official) taxi drivers often park in front of the Moevenpick. Try to hire Laarbi (see attached picture) and ask him for a day tour of Ourika + Plateau du Kik + Asni + Lalla Takerkoust dam. Laarbi speaks perfect French knows the history of Morocco like he were a book and was super friendly to us. Ask him to make a stop in Asni to Brahim's. Best kaftas of our week in Morocco.

Review_Date: Jamie H wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Mohamed Skiriba was very attentive during our daily breakfast at your lovely hotel. He came round to ask if we needed anything else tea coffee etc and was very polite. Breakfast variety was also very good in addition to the top customer service from Mohamed

Review_Date: indiedex2018 wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: Wonderful stay at this five star beautiful hotel!
Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful and underwent a major renovation and it shows. Very chic but comfortable. The staff is incredibly attentive and want to do everything to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. I was collected from the airport by the hotel transport that is outstanding. It went flawlessly as it was my first time visiting Marrakech and didn't feel comfortable taking a taxi right away. The cost was affordable for such service. We drove up to the property and I instantly knew this was going to be an experience. Once checked in I was greeted by Asma who invited to show me around the hotel at my convenience. I'm glad I took her offer and got to learn a lot about the brand and the hotel.    To my surprise I was upgraded to a suite which was truly magnificent for my ten day stay. So how do you beat that? Well the staff continued to be pleasant and helpful the entire stay especially the concierges Bader and Amine! These guys are true professionals and gave great recommendations and insight about the magical red city! For such a large hotel you don't feel lost in the crowd. Oh and the bar is super cool you have to have a visit even if you don't drink alcohol. It's just beautiful to see. I hope you do yourself a favor and visit the Movenpick Marrakech you will not regret one moment at this truly five star hotel!

Review_Date: Elizabeth wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: The hotel breakfast is located in a spacious restaurant with nice decor and has quite a few selections including local pastries which I recommend. They also have outstanding service. Our waiters Mohamed Skiriba Yousafe and Amine Ouzit were very helpful to serve our big family. Thank you!

Review_Date: K P wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Wonderful experience. Staff are helpful and friendly. Located in the new part of the city it's just within walking distance of the Koutubia mosque and Jemaa El Fnaa. The highlight though has to be it's design and amenities. It's spacious and has a lovely pool. Would certainly recommend it.

Review_Date: Daniel wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: Quality Breakfast at Movenpick Mansour Eddahbi Hotel
Review_Text: We stayed overnight at Movenpick Hotel Marrakech and we truly enjoyed our time. The hotel courtyard is beautiful surrounded with hotel building that exudes Morroco's cultural architecture. The people here is also very friendly as we got acquinted with Mohmaed Skiriba and Amine Ouzit who are serving us well for breakfast.

Review_Date: Ahaq wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Excellent spa & hamam treatment/experience provided by Kaltoum. Beutiful Hotel and the servicebreakfast buffetrestaurant is excellent. The food quality is very good. I loved my stay here and would recommend anyone coming to marrakech to stay at Movenpick.

Review_Date: Vahida wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We stayed here for 7 nights and no other words other than wow!! We were very satisfied with every aspect of the hotel. When we first checked in we had a very warm welcome staff at reception desk were very friendly especially Safae she went extra lengths to make sure our needs were met very knowledgeable and professional. Hotel room was beautiful lovely black marble bathroom very clean. Nasima welcomed us everyday at the breakfast hall with a warm smile always ready to help. Nasima is an absolute asset to the the hotel she is extremely professional and really stands out She is always on hand ready to help her guests in a very professional enthusiastic manner. I don‚Äôt have a bad word to say about this hotel all the staff are always smiling and helpful and the hotel itself is fantastic. My daughter used the kids club a few times on our visit. The staff were fab! especially Touria thank you for making may daughter feel welcomed. If we were to travel to Marrakech again we would definitely stay at this hotel and most definitely recommend for those that are traveling to marrakech first time! This hotel is excellent!!

Review_Date: Alberto D wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I can only recommend this place for those who are thinking about having some days of relax in Marrakech. This place is absolutely amazing and the customer service is outstanding (special mention to Mourad who kindly showed me everything around). I am pretty sure this place is one of the best in Marrakech in terms of quality-price.    Rooms: I booked a classic room with a king size bed. Very clean and well equipped.  Facilities: they have diverse pools gym spa area (they offer special treatments which are quite reasonable in terms of price) boutiques inside the hotel different restaurants yoga studio etc etc.  Customer service: As I mentioned above it is outstanding. The staff is extremely helpful and kind.

Review_Date: CBE wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Excellent Customer Services was provided by Imane from SPA. She was amazing üòâ... lively and extremely kind in providing services/ assisting. Definitely visit again SPA and ask for her Imane.    Thanks  B

Review_Date: Londoner9010 wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Spent 4 days here the rooms were sparkling clean and bed super comfortable. What deserves particular mention is the exceptional service during breakfast from Mohamed Skiriba who greeted us every morning and paid particular attention to each of our preferred hot drinks and had them ready for us at the table before we even sat down to eat. Great young man along with all the other staff at the hotel. Not a bad word can be said about our experience.

Review_Date: Susangermany wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: with arts every where. Very big lobby without any guests. The garden is green all over and beautiful! There are few pools and a lot of benches for many guests!  The staff is very friendly and helpful!  Breakfast is good the Coffee shop ok.  The distance from the airport is 4 km.  Only the room service needs a upgrade.  Our refrigerator has wine but no corkscrew. We asked few times for one at end we got one but took us few calls ! They prefer to send some waiter to open the small bottle of wine.  Second morning we wait until 3pm to clean our suite. Few calls and walk to the lobby helps finally ! Excuse was we have so many guests! But we are guest too! Our suite is costly for Marrakech.  We are still at the M√∂venpick and we want to enjoy our last night!  We lived many years in Z√ºrich and M√∂venpick was always our place to go!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mo Sadiku wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: Wonderful staff, beautiful facility and great location
Review_Text: I visited Marrakech for the first time with my family and I sincerely hope to be back soon and will definitely be staying at this hotel.    The staff were very friendly and were keen to ensure we had a good stay. The hotel has a few pools spa yoga restaurants bars etc.    On checking in Hanane was very welcoming and set the scene for a lovely stay. She was caring and made sure our room was spacious enough for our family of 4. She was also there on checking out to say her goodbyes.    The hotel has a lovely kid's club where we were able to leave the kids for hours while we had a relaxing holiday. The club is managed by Nehza who was absolutely caring and looked after the kids like they were hers. They were well fed and engaged in all sorts of activities (all free) The kids kept wanting to go back there all through thr holiday. I was very comfortable leaving my 3 and 5 years olds in the capable hands of Nehza and her lovely team.    Breakfast won't be the same without the lovely Nassima who welcomed us with a smile and lovely conversations. The fantastic Med Amine who was constantly checking that we had all we needed and for keeping the kids occupied while we grabbed breakfast and the lovely lady who made the best eggs every morning always rembering our usual orders (sorry I can't remember her name but you can't miss her lovely smile).    I can't help but mention Lahcen at the concierge who was always helpful and helped plan our visits and tours. He has recommendations to the best places and restaurants to visit be sure to have a chat with him.    A big thank you to everyone else at the hotel as I did not come across anyone who didn't say hello without a big smile.    Most importantly the hotel is central and close to most sites. I highly recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: Wander708526 wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel would highly recommend it! Some days we preferred to stay in the hotel. Food is great service is great and surroundings! Couldn‚Äôt ask for more.  Mohammed Amine provided us with the best service I‚Äôve ever had. Lovely man well mannered well presented always attentive. He is a great advocate for the hotel!

Review_Date: abdelkadertourguide wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I stayed in October 2019 in this hotel. I would like to share my experience that I enjoyed from the moment I arrived. The hotel is outstanding located by Hivernage where plenty of other hotels are. The rooms were very clean the staff were very helpful and especially Abdeltif one of the front desk memebers went out of his way to help for everything. "Thank you again for this memorable stay and if ever I come back to Marrakeck my stay stay will be in Movenpick Hotel."

Review_Date: Mussarrat K wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 nights and the stay was perfect! When we checked in we got a warm welcomeHind at the reception desk was very helpfull and we got an upgrade! The room service was very goodNoura and her team was very kind. Shower facility was excellent! The Breakfast was very good with a lot of different choices. Nassima welcomed us every day to the breakfast hall with a big smile and she answered all our questions about the city every morning! MeriamShihamMohammed and Abdel Karim was equaly helpful. A very big thanks to Naimashe is an asset to the organisation and very professional on her approach when dealing with hotel guests.She gave us personal attention for our breakfast and drink requirementsshe is sincere to her work. Also very kind was Med Aimad and Lahcen! My daughter in law booked this hotel to us and we loved our stay here and we will definetly come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: happygoluckydinz wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: "Brilliant 5 Star Experience " from a frequent traveller !
Review_Text: Excellent stay at this Hotel - An experience to remember - Warm welcome at the reception desk and service with a smile - Mohssin at Reception Desk was very helpful and accomodating for any requests .    Room size was big and very comfortable - shower facility was excellient .    Breakfast was very good with varied choice and Abdelikarim giving us personal attention for our drink requirements .Messaoud Mohammed served us well .    Special mention to Douaa from Human Resources - She is an asset to the organisation - very professional in her approach to dealing with hotel guests and her people skills are excellent - her interaction with the guests is on friendly terms and her local knowledge helps the guests to experience Marrakech and the hotel facilities in the most enjoyable way .    Big Big Thank You to all - we will return back to this Hotel for our extended family to experience the Movenpick Hospitality .

Review_Date: Mieke V wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We really enjoyed Movenpick hotel for several reasons : the hotel ( bar swimming pool  spa  ..) is just great. The room is big and comfortable! Breakfast is excellent : big thanks to the lady and gentleman who made us excellent eggs ! Also special mention for the relaxing massage of Imane at the Spa : Imane takes really good care of you ! Also Hind from the reception desk made sure we had a great welcome and good advice during our stay ! Just one last advise : the crepes marrocaines are delicious !!

Review_Date: Christoph T wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I stayed at the hotel for more than three weeks for business. The breakfast is a highlight though I wouldn't recommend the restaurants for dinner. I found the staff extremely helpful and friendly. Special thanks to the team of "service du soin": Nezhatari Touri Roqia Eloussoul Sedki Khadija Elhilali Khadija Elmachmachi Amina you made my home away from home!

Review_Date: Fahad N wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: This is a brilliant hotel with amazing service. The staff are all extremely helpful in particular Yusuf who is part of the breakfast team has been amazing. After the first day he already knew what hot drink we wanted and brought them over without us even having to ask for it. Highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Marrakech. Location is great too!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: walshemf e wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We stayed 7 nights for a golf holiday. No matter where you stay you will always find something to critisize but really I cannot think of anything at all we were unhappy about. It is a massive hotel arranged in blocks and as a result impersonal. After 7 days we did not really know any of the staff at all but that was fine. Remi on reception was very helpful indeed as was every single staff member we met. They could not have been more helpful respectful and kind. The breakfast is superb the best we have had anywhere and the impressive boss of that service runs it like clockwork and clearly commands huge respect from his staff. The rooms sheets cleaning pool etc etc were without fault. We relaxed poolside late afternoon and whilst it was crowded at times there was no problem finding a spot to relax and read. It was December though. The hotel is about 2 km ish from the Medina which is a perfect escape from the frentic city . We walked to the restaurants in Gueliz nearly every night- well the same restaurant as often as we could (plus 61-cool excellent etc ) . We had not been to Marrakech before and did a lot of research on taxis as we were taking them to different golf courses each day. We booked the hotel transport from the airport which was the right decision to avoid the hassle of the taxis late at night- but very expensive- we knew this in advance and it was the right decision but only for our first visit. There is a taxi rank outside and we found our fabulous man in Morocco on day 2 who looked after us the whole time. We negotiated the price before we set foot in any taxi- the legal meters were nowhere to be seen. I got ill whilst there with a rotton cold. I wish I could remember the name of the wonderful young man in the back bar who brought me a fabulous ginger and honey drink when he realised I was ill-thank you. We loved Marrakech and hope to return in 2020-we looked at some other hotels whilst there for future planning- we will be rebooking the Movenpick without hesitation. Thank you. Absolutely Excellent. We also had the addes glamour of the wonderful film festival when we were there. Well done to all.

Review_Date: Rasha S wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I stayed at the hotel for 4 weeks. The best thing about the hotel is the staff. Ghizlane was particularly amazing attentive gentle professional and thorough. She and the service staff keep the luxury standing of this hotel.

Review_Date: balbal a wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I‚Äôve been to several Movenpicks around the world but this one came on top good servicing great food and the rooms very clean. I knew that is was going to be a great experience in This hotel from the receptionist and all the efforts she did to make our waiting time a joy. Thank you Nezha for your time and dedication your recommendations were very helpful during our stay in Marrakech. Hope to comeback soon

Review_Date: Narcissyou wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights for a business trip. I was surprised by the new renovated hotel called now the Movenpick. They renovated the rooms which are very clean and well decorated. They have spacious bathroom with beautiful marble. the bed was also very comfortable. The service exceeded my expectations. all the staff was professional helpful et smiling which is very important. I had an amazing service at breakfast. Taha who is one of the staff who took good care of us. he was very nice and gave us great service. I highly recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: Anas El Baz wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Thank you Movenpick for this amazing week @ the International Film Festival. It was unforgettable. Thanks to the cleaning services people who were so kind to us during our stay. Thank you Khadija El Hilali Amina Mechmchi and Samira Zouhil üåπüåπüåπ

Review_Date: Milan wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I stayed in this hotel for one night and it exceeded my expectations. The property is well maintained and I loved the classic d√©cor. Room was spacious with a nice view on the garden and pool. The staff I interacted with was friendly and professional. I would especially like to thank Amine the Concierge for his helpful tips and for finding me a great tour guide. Lahcen from the Concierge Desk was also very friendly and attentive. I would stay again!

Review_Date: Adam G wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I was there for a business and I have not much time to explore the city and its restaurants that's why I wanted to eat in the hotel I slept in. Simply Great experience with a splendid service especially at the Level of food. Haven't regret it thank you

Review_Date: Nikita S wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I had an amazing Hamam experience with Keltoum who scrubbed away all of the dead skin making me feel brand new. I then had an amazing back massage with Bouchra - so good I actually fell asleep. Thank you so much for making me have a restful holiday!!

Review_Date: Picoarchoun wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We came late at the restaurant the Urban Brasserie and the manager took us in without rushing the food or service. We came back every single night during our stay as the drinks and the ambiance were too satisfaction. Thank you again for the all team and their management.

Review_Date: Lyne Morin wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We were staying in Movempick Marrakech and we had one of the best meals in the Urban Brasserie Restaurant. The service was excellent and the welcoming of their manager Jawad was just perfect and made us feel like we're home so thank you because it was a special occasion 20th anniversary. We ate there every day during our stay and service and food was consistently great. Thank you for make our stay memorable and we will definitely come back. And of course we will miss the food!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vlogs by Salma B wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: If your looking for 5 star service then this is not the place. We stayed there for 6 nights and had multiple issues during the night our shower went off by itself multiple times. I told the manager Amin who was very hard to get a hold of then finally when we did speak to him he was very dismissive of the issue and didn‚Äôt have any empathy of the fact that we both had a sleepless night and as a result told us we could change rooms with no upgrade offered this was on day 5 so we asked him to send a technician to fix the problem which was fixed finally. He then offered us a drink at the bar I was horrified by his response and refused that and said you should be offering us a lot more than a drink he then went onto say well you can have a meal. I‚Äôm sorry but if I can afford to stay in a 5 star I can for sure afford a drink and the meal the way it was presented to us was as if he was giving it as charity and did not properly invite us to have dinner at the restaurant so we didn‚Äôt go. He never followed up to see if the shower was fixed. Worst service I‚Äôve ever received. The only thing this hotel does have is great breakfast the chefs were amazing and the location is great too. I‚Äôd personally avoid it and stay in an all inclusive like the be live collection hotels. Never again.

Review_Date: Adnan H wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We stayed here for 5 nights as a family with half board for my daughters birthday. Location was great located centrally in Marrakech all the touristic sights were 5-10 mins away by taxi. Hotel room and layout was superb staff were all very kind and really attentive during our stay. Breakfast was excellent a wide variety of foods to choose from great selection for kids too. Pool and gym facilities were good and the small lounge restaurants nearby were convenient for grabbing a small snack during the day.    If your looking to relax and unwind from the madness of the medina then the Hotel Spa is where you want to be its fantastic and my wife loved her treatments there would highly recommend it.    The kids club was the best thing for my 4 year old daughter all the team looked after her really well and we will never forget their kindness and affection during our stay.    The hotel staff including the room cleaners and restaurant dinner team did a surprise room decoration and birthday dinner treat that my daughter really loved. We really appreciated this and would like to thank them all for making our stay very memorable.    Our only negative point of our stay was the half board menu! We literally had the same menu several times which was disappointing considering we paid a lot of money for it. The hotel should do more to look after guests that upgrade to this service.    Special thanks to the following    reception team including saied and hanane for sorting out our late checkout for free. Kalsoum at the SPA. The dinner team at urban Ahmed mahmood Nissim & Sara and the rest of the guys. Breakfast restaurant team including brahim and the lady chef by the name edissim amazing omelette flipper. And finally the ladies at the kids club Touria zahira and nena were all fantastic and we were made to feel at home. Hopefully we meet again in'sha'allah.    Ps. There is a taxi driver outside the hotel with a large ssangyong best avoided as he is a serial over charger! For the chocolate lovers Don't forget the lobby chocolate hour everyday at 5pm!

Review_Date: Armin N wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: One of the best spa treatments i‚Äòve Ever had. I had a 30 min Massage Done By BOUCHRA in the spa area. She has done a excellent job. The spa area is very pleseant and all of the treatments are top. I was Here for 1 week and all of my Treatments were Done By Bouchra! Just ask for her!!

Review_Date: Doyin wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I was surprised with a full body massage with Bouchra at Movenpick and she was very lovely professional and I feel very relaxed. We arrived late for our appointment however the manager allowed us to come through and still gave us a smile. I would return here.

Review_Date: LJY wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Stayed two nights whilst on tour.  Comfortable rooms with outside balcony.  Huge hotel to walk around delicious breakfast walking distance to shopping centre with food court and other restaurants near hotel too.  Money changers also plentiful.

Review_Date: Lucas A wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Stayed at the hotel with my family for a week and felt like at home.  Very clean rooms excellent breakfast variety and very friendly and detailed service.  Had lunch at the pool restaurant several times and got a great service and they even remembered all my family‚Äôs names!  Delicious cocktails and very friendly service at the hotel bar where we had drinks daily before dinner. Tried the Italian restaurant twice and my family and I loved it.  Overall very personalized service throughout the hotel  and will definitely come back next year.  Thank you Movenpick Marrakesh for making our stay a memorable one

Review_Date: pprasad2015 wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Provided room was quite good but being next to Lift that caused lot of noises every  2 -3 minutes. It was very disturbing mainly at night. Having raised issue to Laela Haily Supervisor who was very considerate and helpful changed room to Suit room. It was very commendable of her action.  Room cleaners Rogia Khadija Nezha who were very very listening and leaving room spotless and attentive to our requests. They are really very good to her assignment.  Morning breakfast along with waiters and waitress were great. Hence overall our stay for 7 days was fantastic.

Review_Date: Asif khan wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Luxury at its best . breakfast buffet was amazing and delicious. People at reception like ottoman helped us to book dinner at best dining places  Fatima zahra served us with great hospitality at breakfast . The facilities of spa  Hammam were outstanding.  Will visit again

Review_Date: Sali wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: The Movenpick is a beautiful hotel set in a great location in Marrakesh. Its a quick walk to the mall and to the bus station. The breakfast is amazing and the artwork is breathtaking. When you enter the lobby the smell is lovely and everything is just perfect. However the best part of the hotel was the staff on our second day we visited the Medina and I left my phone in the taxi. We attempted to chase down the taxi to no avail. I had lost hope but later that evening I went to the lobby and the three girls (Nezha Afaf and Hind) helped me track my phone via Find my phone in addition they used their personal phones to try and ring my international number. Story short two additional guys one named Faisal and the other guy who translated for my husband also helped. Ultimately with the help of the staff and tracking down my phone I was able to get my phone back!    The only thing I was a bit bummed about was the childcare center was limited to ages 4 and up and it was not listed on the website.

Review_Date: Aspetto Nancy B wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: A week with my friend in movenpick . From the frist moment de felt very welcome. Afaf and leila from the reception were very kind professional and helpful Otman too . We enjoyed every moment a place of 1001 nights.  The junior suit was fantastic. We will definitely come back. Thanks to amina Rokia and Khadija for the fantastic care. An absolute must...

Review_Date: Tosin O wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: Amazing stay and amazingly thoughtful staff!
Review_Text: My stay was absolutely fantastic. I would like to say a very special thank you to Hanane from reception Nora from Housekeeping and Imad (the best Bellboy) - they made my birthday super special by surprising me by singing happy birthday to when I entered my room - I‚Äôll honestly never forget it. They all deserve every kind of bonus available. The food was great the room was fantastic the staff were awesome - I‚Äôll definitely be back again insha Allah. Thank you so much again for making my birthday weekend so special.    Tosin

Review_Date: travelicious2018 wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: I was so glad I booked this hotel when I arrived. It was beautiful and it really felt like you were at a five star resort which was a great start to the holiday. It has several pools restaurants onsite shops funky modern art and a spa. It is also in a good central location within 10 minutes taxi ride to Jemma El Fina and the popular clubs and high end restaurants. It's also a 10 minute walk from Menara Mall which is a modern shopping mall with many shops and restaurants. The best thing about the hotel are the staff. They are very hospitable and friendly but I'd like to make a special mention for Nezha who was really welcoming and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble so it really made our stay enjoyable and memorable and I'm really looking forward to going back and booking the Movenpick again.

Review_Date: Karen A wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Great hotel. The facility is absolutely beautiful. The service was top notch. Really enjoyed my stay. I would like to give a special shout out to Med Admine a server in the restaurant. He went above and beyond to make sure me and my friends were well serviced. Thank you Med Admine!!!

Review_Date: David L wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: A very nice resort style hotel
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel as a part of a tour. This is a very nice hotel with multiple pools restaurants and a poolside bar. It is located in an area of large hotels. The Medina is walkable but a long walk. You would probably want to take a taxi to the Medina and back if you want to visit it It is a resort style of a hotel and there were a lot of families there. If that is what you are looking for this is a great choice for a hotel. If you are looking for a hotel that is convenient to get to the Medina there would be more convenient hotels.

Review_Date: Ak786123 wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: The walk up the hotel reception is just something else! This hotel impressed me for the price I paid! I was checked in by HANAN who upgraded us to a suite and was very helpful! SAID the concierge was friendly and gave great information! Thanks to you both - they gave insightful information that was good value for money.  Hotel breakfast was a good variety.  5-6pm was chocolate hour at reception - free chocolate and biscuits!  I‚Äôd pay double what I paid for this hotel easily!  See you all again soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Yasmina S wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: Best service ever...üòç with Mohammed amin
Review_Text: He make me feel very comfortable and I felt like home ... I will definitely came back here thanks to him... He‚Äôs service was super nice and kind. The hotel is very clean and nice. Hope to find him again here.

Review_Date: Najwa wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: This hotel made my stay very enjoyablew
Review_Text: From the second I checked in the staff at this hotel made my stay very enjoyable and smooth. The customer service was impeccable - from the staff ensuring you are comfortable and happy to recommending the best foods and places. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms are a good size with comfortable beds you struggle to get out of in the morning haha. Whilst staying here all the staff were helpful but mainly Brahim who would look after us in the morning by serving us moroccan tea and checking to see if we wanted anything else to a lady called Naima who was very kind and ensured our stay was of not only the best.

Review_Date: Nicole D wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Good morning  Just to say Brahim the waiter at the food hall was so amazing! Always welcoming and helpful. Always attended to our needs. The hotel as a whole was amazing. Housekeeper however don‚Äôt really speak English so it was abit hard but overall 5*!!

Review_Date: Bullet_DC wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Just left the spa and had to recommend khadija for massage. The hotel is great. The beds are like clouds. The pool is like a bath. Breakfast whilst a little frantic is good. The room behind the pool bar with the massive chairs was like a place to curl up and sleep. And when you‚Äôre relaxed there‚Äôs chocolate hour!! Great find and would certainly return.

Review_Date: Munaf wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: I just loved my stay at this lovely hotel my four day stay I just wished it was longer the staff here were the most friendly I‚Äôve ever come across right from day one I was greeted by a very friendly host Naseema who showed me everything around the breakfast hall Fatima zahra a sweet young waitress couldn‚Äôt do enough for us nothing was too much trouble and everything with a smile brahim was equally good and Dua who I believe was in charge of the HR was very professional and actually helped us to extend our stay as our flight was quite late in the evening a true gem in the midst of Marrakesh

Review_Date: Hamidkaabi wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: I want to thanks M√ñVENPICK for their welcoming  Also and especially i want to thanks MERIEM MAZL & OUMAIMA BEN LABSIN for their services and hospitality. #MyRoomSmellSoFresh&Clean  You guys have made my days better thanks a lot.

Review_Date: sofiaaaa wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: 5 days stay in October full hotel but the service was still impeccable! Clean and comfortable rooms! Helpful and kind staff! Full international breakfast but also full of Moroccan specialties! All great!  But I especially wanted to thank the gym staff who knew how to fulfill my daughter's needs perfectly competently and attentively.  we had a suite for 5 people and it was wonderful cared for in every little detail from rose petals to flowers and the ever-present macarone decorated with funny emojis that the children loved!

Review_Date: Kabil E wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: Salaheddine the worst employee on the Hotel
Review_Text: If you want to enjoy your stay.avoid any contact with this person.so rude doesnt know how to speak with the clients.infortunately there is a lot of good hotels at marrakech.never come back.No thanks..

Review_Date: Florbela R wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: Amazing Hotel, Staff very well trained
Review_Text: We stayed last week in hotel Movenpick  family holiday. The Staff are very well trained  profissional and helpeful. My mother and daugther were sick and we could saty 2.5 hours after check out in room  thanks to the reception and the wonderful cleaning women which were so careful with us. I speak about Jamila and Noura wonderful professional which made everything that we felt better. They were amazing  how effort made for us. I will be grateful forever . The SPA is great  massage there is full recommended. GYM is very well equipped  fabulous Trainer Abderahim prepare 1.5 hours training focus on lose stress  he is highly qualified and friendly. Hotel location close is close to shopping several restaurants. I was well impressed with this hotel and will come again Next Year.

Review_Date: Najat E wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: We had a family holiday and stayed at the movenpick which I had previously been before and again the service was excellent. The staff especially the waiting staff Layla and her colleagues made us feel so welcome the Chef even accommodated for us the manager sorted a problem out very quickly and efficiently! We all loved it including the children and definitely will be back again God willing.

Review_Date: BASEL221 wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: I stayed at the Movenpick hotel for 3 days between October 21st to October 23rd I checked out because I was planning to stay in different hotel for experience.
