The hotel I changed to didn't meet up my expectation so I decided to go back to Movenpick all the rooms were pretty much booked at the Movenpick How ever the reception girl Hannane who was super friendly and have helped us few times with our staying and places tips have put more effort to assist us of finding room. I do appreciate this great service this girl have offered us even they were super busy on that day all hotel team were super friendly and helpful and they always put the time to answer your questions but Hannane was absolutely a person that made things happened and made us appreciate how this hotel value their customers.  Hotel is supper clean suites are super nice and new SPA team are amazing and I liked it more than the other SPA (Moroccan Bath) I have been else where in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Dave wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Really like the hotel. The junior suite was spacious and very clean. What lets this hotel down is the service in the bars and restaurants. The pool bar service is particularly bad as the staff just want to huddle at the side of the bar talking rather than serving. You could die of thirst waiting for a drink. Very poor.

Review_Date: NadineMojo wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: International chain with a Moroccan twist
Review_Text: Positives about this place:  - Impressive entrance and interior design which gives an image of Moroccan grandeur  - Large selection of food at breakfast buffet which stays till 10:30. I sincerely appreciate the young gentlemen who prepares the eggs (he can make a very delicious omelette).  - Clean and spacious rooms  - AMAZING and highly resourceful concierge. Mr. Amine is truly a gem in this place. He truly presents a 5 star experience with his positive and warm attitude. He is very attentive to all guests and the Movenpick is truly lucky to have him on board.  - Great location. Safe in the Eglise area of Marrakech.    Negatives (potential to improve):  - Slow check-in and check-out (they really need to improve their reception service)  - Huge property. We were not aware of this! Our friend ended up staying in a different building which was not a big problem but it would have been nice to know prior to our arrival.  - We had some insects in our room (we noticed them on the curtains). This could be because we once left the bathroom window open. However it is something to look out for.    Overall it is a great place to stay in. Would return back.

Review_Date: Bright0nian wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: Nice Hotel with lots of potential but not five star
Review_Text: There is a lot to like about the Movenpick Marrakech - Superior rooms are of a good standard. Breakfast is excellent. The pool area is spacious. Pool and cleaning staff are extremely conscientious and friendly. We had nice meals at the various Resturants. Notable employees included Ghizlane from the cleaning staff Hind at reception and the lady who made the Omelettes.    However there are a number of things which lets this hotel down badly but notably Reception staff - genearlly have little attention to customers needs. On one day we asked for assistance about a tour to the Majorelle Gardens and was told to look at the internet or come back the next day when the concierge would be available. Even worst on checkout we were asked to stand in a separate queue and were left waiting for over 10 minutes to be allowed to check out - there were others behind us. When we finally caught the attention of a member of staff the young man was surly and appeared to be having an argument with his female supervisor and other members of staff. This continued throughout the whole check out process. I have never experienced such a poor check out process in any hotel. Several days we noticed people having difficulty at reception from surly staff (usually the same staff) and waited until more friendly staff were available to seek assistance eg Hind.    Overall this is a good standard four star hotel. Standards would jump significantly if the reception staff had a customer focused mindset.

Review_Date: Welsh_W0nderw0man wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Having never experienced a Hammam before I didn‚Äôt really know what to expect. The staff at √î De Rose on the M√∂venpick Hotel Marrakech are all very accommodating and welcoming. I was given water and tea before my treatment and made to feel at home. Then I was put in the very capable and reassuring hands of Kaltoum who very professionally provided a detoxifying relaxing and cleansing Hammam experience I will never forget and will definitely have again! For anyone wondering about Hammams I can certainly recommended having one especially at the wonderful venue √î De Rose and I hope you are lucky enough to meet and be treated by Kaltoum. ‚ò∫Ô∏èüßñüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüíÜüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüôè

Review_Date: Harry E wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: It has been three months in Morocco and have not found a better tech than Najia. To anyone visiting whether or pleasure be sure to request Ms. Najia for your services and the reasons why I would come back to M√∂venpick Marrakech.

Review_Date: Klaus L wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: What a great pleasant surprise for such a huge hotel.
Review_Text: Great surprise for an extended weekend in Marrakech.  Every year we celebrate our honeymoon.  Having stayed in Marrakech many times before like the Mamounia and different Riads in the Madina. we didn‚Äôt know what to expect and are pleasantly surprised. Despite the hotel being so huge it doesn‚Äôt feel that way the spacious rooms are spread of a number of Villas the walkways are surrounded by lush greens and great lighting. Plenty of pools from large to small. Breakfast is amazing difficult to restrain oneself from eating too much the fresh made orange juice and Moroccan pancakes where my favorite. We had dinner at the hotel for our first night too tired to go out it was exceptional especially the service. Special thanks to Hasna in reservations the front desk i wish i got his name he was so helpful and accommodating. Not to forget the head of housekeeping Samira who was very helpful as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Isabella wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Lovely hotel with lots of hidden treasures by way of art work and decor of the public areas. Just loved the ambiance of the hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. Stayed in the main block and the lift was a bit hard to find initially - all part of the fun!. My room didn't quite live up to the rest of the hotel. Despite being a non-smoking room it smelled of stale cigarette smoke and was rather small. Loved the rest of the hotel so much I didn't really mind. Truly awesome breakfast spread with a wide array of continental and Moroccan dishes. Nice pool area with a resort feel which could get a bit noisy during the day with the loud music played by a DJ. However there were several other pools including a quiet one near the spa. Several different eating options available within the hotel including a vegan restaurant. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay

Review_Date: angela w wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Definitely highly recommend this hotel. Very comfortable friendly attentive staff and excellent food. The rooms are spacious and the beds heavenly! Gorgeous black marble bathroom with separate loo. Also the hotel is very quiet. We had a massage which was lovely the spa and gym facilities are beautiful. As you walk through the hotel you are surrounded with gorgeous smells. It‚Äôs about a 10 min taxi ride to the M√©dina there were always taxis outside. There is a street next to the hotel that has modern restaurants and a supermarket. If I went back to Marrakech I‚Äôd stay here again.

Review_Date: Mounia T wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Just fabulousthe staff were very helpful and friendly specially MRS harbi saida she makes us feeling very welcoming and also she provides us everything we need for our kids in Mehdiwe really apreciate the quality of the service and how clean were the suitabsolutly i r√©cord it

Review_Date: Hajar D wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Special thanks to coach Abdou au centre de remise en forme Movenpick Marrakech  Kind helpful and so professional always here to help and show u the right steps  Thanks Abdou again for ur help and kindness

Review_Date: Salvador L wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: Beautiful Nice Hotel with Unfair Service Treatment
Review_Text: The hotel it's impressive from the arrival. The architecture and the forniture and decoration it's amazing in all corners. But to check in with a non smiling reception staff that takes 350‚Ç¨ from you credit card as deposit without warning firstly it's not a good start. Another collegues travelling with me were taken up to 900‚Ç¨ this while our accomodation was previously paid. So they charge as they feel with the excuse that this way you have money in the room account to pay any orders at the bars or restaurants.  This is another point to review. The prices of the food and beverage it's simply too expensive. 9‚Ç¨ for a glass of house wine or 7‚Ç¨ for a local beer it's too much in a slow and not smiling service.  About the service as low is the job position as more as they smile and polite are. The rooms keepers are lovely and always saying bon jour with a smile. The woman cooking the omelettes at the breakfast bufe is an artist and charmy. But concierge and receptionist are not that much.  The breakfas bufe is just enough (5 over 10). For a hotel with pices like the ones they charge they should have a look into Gran Melia Hotels breafast for example as this hotel is the range of prices as Gran Melia Palacio de Isora for example.  The room was amazing nice and the bed was one of the best I ever sleep on.  Good cleaning service and nice sowher and bathroom in general.

Review_Date: mizi wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: The Kids Club Staff is very nice and friendly and professionel. Program varies every day.    Rest of the hotel is pretty old. Pool area not maintained. Spa staff professional but premises neglected. Spa Manager is missing. Watch out mainly Conferences and reception staff is not very friendly.

Review_Date: Dana S wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: I came here with a Gate 1 tour and was very impressed by the grounds and public areas. It's beautiful to walk around and discover all the art work and decor. The room was nice mostly average with weak air conditioning. The bed was very comfy. I did the Royal Hammam treatment in the spa which was a unique experience. Not totally relaxing because it's a serious exfoliation but the spa set up was lovely and the attendant gave good service. My only gripe was the service at the pool bar as it was slow and not attentive. I had to finally get up and ask for the check at the bar because the server never came back. I did get a margherita pizza there and it was pretty tasty. I think you'll be pleased to stay at the hotel and only a couple minor adjustments would make it 5 star.

Review_Date: badrax wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: Rooms are fine ac is missing
Review_Text: The hotel is fine the rooms are nice the breakfast is fine the one criticism is the AC was practically off  Even after service by maintenance that got the air flow to work there was still no cooling effect from the noisy unit

Review_Date: LinandMike R wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Wow - modern large hotel with great Moorish touches.  Impressive pool very professional staff wonderful food and easy walk / taxi to many other restaurants and sights.  Wonderful public areas comfortable discrete seating - recommended!

Review_Date: Moonh wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Great hotel and staff the pool is amazing Abdelkarime et Mohammed Amine looked after us with big smile everytime they where warm friendly and helpful.  Thanks to both of you and thank movenpick....

Review_Date: Yusefine wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: I travel for work a lot and I stay at chain hotel most of the times. I have never been disappointed at all using Movenpick Marrakech. Thanks for the friendliness and helpfulness of the reception personnel namely Nezha she‚Äôs been incredibly helpful which I am great full for. She‚Äôs an asset to Movenpick Marrakech praise her.    The breakfast was also my top highlight. The buffet has almost everything you need. The coffee is sooooo good. The staff were helpful especially the smiley lady I don‚Äôt remember her name. She‚Äôs great.

Review_Date: daniel f wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Restaurant at breakfast... excellent service Mohammed Amin and Karim were superb
Review_Text: I come here regularly and breakfast is always a pleasure. Hotel a real maze but beautiful. Porters excellent too. No complaints. The pool and the pool bar really nice  very comfortable . You must try the pancake at breakfast it‚Äôs delicious.

Review_Date: Kevin C wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel in a great location. Only 15 mins from the airport. Staff are very attentive. Special shout out to Taha in the breakfast room he was superb. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. Be careful with the taxis outside the hotel (or anywhere in Marrakesh). The guys on the front door to the hotel can advise a ball park figure for what you should be paying which is handy. Make sure you agree the price before getting in the cab. Once you are in enjoy the ride because the way the traffic flows and driving is an experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eddie wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: 5 star hotel and service. Ideally located. The breakfast was truly marvelous and had everything that one could wish for in the morning. The servers were very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this hotel to all my family and friends visiting Marrakech.

Review_Date: travelclub wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Booked as a 60th birthday present the hotel went out of their way to make it a very memorable experience. We arrived late morning but recognising very quickly that we would have caught an early flight and would be hungry Mohammed (Manager) from the restaurant treated us like guests in his home. Despite the breakfast service being over with he served us everything he thought we would like.    On arrival our room was upgraded to a suite and during the stay the hotel had arranged for the room to be decorated and a cake to celebrate.    Waited on like royalty every morning by the waiters at breakfast and the staff at reception always offering exceptional service there was no single thing one could fault or complain about.    Thank you to all at the hotel whose path we crossed helped in every way possible and making this a joyous and happy stay / occasion.    Ps. The Moroccan doughnuts served at breakfast are a must.    + Marrakech has a history and with that plenty of places to visit (Ouzoud Falls/Atlas Mountains Jardin Majorelle Koutoubia Mosque and Bahia Palace)    + Opportunities to relax and enjoy the sun.    - The hustle and bustle of the M√©dina (snake / monkey charmers) and the taxi drivers full of empty promises (including those outside the hotel).    - Ben Youssef Mosque closed for 2 years for restoration.

Review_Date: Beatriz J wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Hi! this was my first time visiting Marrakesh Morroco and I had the pleasure to stay in this awesome M√∂venpick Hotel. I just want to share my unforgettable experience since day one of my arrival.....I was greeted by the Hotel staff with a very friendly smile. I want to point out specially every morning in the Restaurant when I was having my Breakfast a waiter a very young nice looking man approached to my table and a very polite way he introduced himself as Mohamed Skiriba. He asked me how are you Madan ? And if I want a coffee. For the three mornings that I have a breakfast there he with his kindness really made me feel like at home. This Hotel itself is amazing beautiful comfortable relaxing but with the upstanding service by the charming and friendly employees like Mohamed this Hotel is over the top. I extremely recommended . I wish to have here in the USA people like Mohamed who could work in our restaurants and with his smile and professional service make us to feel like we are not far away from home and enjoy our meals.  Mohamed keep up your unique personality. I wish you the best in your personal life and Professional  God Bless you and thanks Mohamed Skiriba

Review_Date: andreajxo wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: I visited the hotel in September with my mum and it was amazing from the beginning. The decor is stunning the staff were attentive and welcoming but one particularly stood out for us. His name was Mohammed Amine and he went to every length to ensure all our needs were met during breakfast. He‚Äôs a fantastic waiter and really made our stay all the more enjoyable. The hotel are lucky to have to him on board!    The rooms were really nice too well air conditioned and clean! The house keeping staff always fulfilled our requests too which was perfect!    Overall we‚Äôd rate our stay very good and we would definitely recommend staying here; we both really enjoyed ourselves. The only downside was everything you pay for within the hotel whether it‚Äôs food/massage etc is a lot more expensive when compared to doing/finding things for yourself outside.

Review_Date: Lightfoot wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: The Hannah bath was something to die for. The 90 minute massage was excellent. The therapist were sincere in assisting. My wife and I were happy with our treatments. We forgot we were in another country and we wanted to book another appointment immediately.

Review_Date: BTS wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Kids club at M√∂venpick Hotel Mansour Eddahbi
Review_Text: Words can not express our gratitude to the ladies from the kids club namely Nezha Zahira Touria and NouJoud. Not only did they look after our son with care and attention. They also organised a birthday party for our son at a very short notice which he celebrated with his international friends.The ladies did an amazing job which exceeded our expectations we are truly grateful. Thank you again ladies and keep up the great work. We look forward to seeing you again on our next visit.

Review_Date: YlvaFuruskog wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Very, very good! (And it is not too big!)
Review_Text: Very good hotel service and location. Beautifully decorated and nice garden and pool. Super friendly staff. It has a large number of rooms but it feels like a much smaller and cosier hotel. I can really recommend this place.

Review_Date: clairethetraveler872 wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Excellent service here! The front desk agents (Nezha & Souhail) and the restaurant staff at Urban Brasserie were friendly and helpful. The pools were never crowded so it was plenty relaxing. We had two adjoining rooms - with a lot of space and a back patio for each room. Bathrooms were extremely spacious I could do yoga in it. The only thing I would be wary of are the taxi cab drivers that linger outside of the hotel looking for someone to overcharge for a ride to the Medina. With careful bargaining you can avoid the switch and bait. However this should not deter Western travelers from enjoying this beautiful place (it's only a small nuance which you'll laugh about later).

Review_Date: Nikhil K wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Namaste! I stayed at your property during the PURE Travel event and I really liked the hotel for its central location large rooms and good service. I would especially like to thank Bouchra Front office for the help extended to me during my stay. I will certainly book myself here for next years event.

Review_Date: TravelerBAW wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Customer service, timeliness and 5 star standards
Review_Text: I am on my 6th out of 8 day stay at the M√∂venpick Marrakech. The hotel‚Äôs entrance is quite grand which gives a good first impression to guests. However the standard goes downhill from there pretty quickly.    1. 4 out of the 5 staff at the Jamra restaurant are rather abrupt. Service is very slow and inefficient regardless whether busy or not. That was my first stop to grab a light lunch after I had checked in. I returned the next day for a quick bite in between outings. Same experience: forgotten to set my table whilst I was waiting. Had to go and get salt and pepper from another table olive oil from the main counter..I have not gone back there since. Visit was @afternoon of Sunday 8th September around 3pm and again on Monday 10th September at the same time. Needless to say I have not been back there and will not go back during the rest of my stay.  The waiters and the duty manager could benefit from customer service training. Service standard is definitely not what can be expected from a 5 star establishment.    2. There have been very long queues at the front desk; 90% of the time. Just inefficient    3. BBC world news has not been available for 3 days. It is still not available. I have never stayed at any hotel claiming to have satellite TV where major news services are not available. I have travelled to other African countries; the Caribbean and Latin America. I have never experienced this before....One of these days there was no TV news service whatsoever; I don‚Äôt think any of the other channels worked either. I had made several calls to guest services with the promise someone would come over (starting the first day when there was no TV service); but no one came until the third call I had made. By then CNN was being transmitted; however I shouldn‚Äôt have to watch a news channel I don‚Äôt particularly like. The feedback from the person who came to look at the TV connection was that there is a transmission problem with the BBC news international service in all the rooms. Again how is this 5 star standard when the issue is left unresolved for 3 days I wonder....    3. Breakfast buffet lacks variety by 5 star standards. It‚Äôs more of a 4 star. Quantity doesn‚Äôt make up for quality or better standard.    4. Interesting experience I had not encountered anywhere else in the past (and I have travelled across the globe). This was my first time in Marrakech.  a. I am of mixed heritage and I was questioned by one restaurant staff ( he appeared to be the manager) when walking in to the breakfast buffet. Whether I was staying at the hotel etc.. he didn‚Äôt even take my room number. You either ask all guests whether they are staying at the hotel or when they go for breakfast or you don‚Äôt. Staff should not be questioning people based on what their heritage might be. This is quite offensive and disrespectful. I did not see him do that to anyone else.  b. Secondly one of the times I came back from a city tour; and made my way to the main entrance; one of the security guards chased me and questioned me. I had been in and out a couple of times before and this had not happened. Again either make everyone be stopped at the entrance or you don‚Äôt. There was nothing particular about my attire. Normal outfit over knees skirt and top with sleeves ( if I was inappropriately dressed I would have accepted it).    5. I would however like to thank all the staff at the Dada‚Äôs diner. All the ladies and gents there were most courteous pleasant welcoming and polite. The waiters from the Jamra restaurant might benefit from shadowing that team to learn what good customer service is.    6. The front desk staff are generally helpful with varying levels of approachability. Unfortunately some of them seem unhappy to be there. Perhaps because they are generally very busy - can‚Äôt say.    Having said that Mohssin has been very helpful in providing me with information on the various local activities to do. He is always welcoming with a smile has been most helpful patient and courteous when answering my various questions.

Review_Date: Jessica VM wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Not my kind of 5 star hotel
Review_Text: Not sure how this is considered a 5 star hotel but it doesnt fly by my standards. I met 2 friendly staff members and thats about it. The hotel room is small okay however the shower pressure or just the shower head was so poor that my head was basically against the wall in order to get water on my head. The hose that is next to the toilet was broken and broken on the wall as well. The toilet stopped working at one point and didnt flush and my biggest concern was the the sliding door (we were on the first floor) didnt even shut / lock. I couldnt sleep the entire night knowing that the door was just open. zero security around the premises (unlike the four seasons). Our suitcases were lost so we had to keep calling out to call our credit card company and airline and we had to call the reception everytime in order to do so. At one point they would just hang up the phone on me when I would ask and it happened multiple times. When I asked for an iron it never came. These are all scenarios that I would not expect to happen at a 5 star hotel. The breakfast was alright.. eggs were all under cooked and by that i mean raw. While the spread was huge the quality was not. Needless to say i cancelled my next night and stayed at the fours seasons. I will give it this much it is very close to the medina and the mall. so for location purposes its good.

Review_Date: Lautaro wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: I spent 6 days at the hotel and during working days we left our son in the Kids Club. All the ladies there were extremely friendly! Our kid loved to go there and when he arrived he hugged them. I would like to thank Touria Nezha that were very friendly and took special care of our son. And specially Zahira who was taking care of our son most days!  Thanks a lot and next time we are back we know we have an amazing place to leave our son!  Regarding the place is quite big it has different type of games for different ages. And everything seems to be very baby and toodler friendly!

Review_Date: Jessica G wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: We're staying here for a trade show in the attached convention centre - this is definitely not a place I would choose to stay at otherwise if it weren't for the convenience of it.  Most of the staff are friendly but don't ask for anything one minute past their "closing time" because you won't get it... I had to beg for just a glass of wine after a long day of work and literally one minute past their closing time of 6:45 pm.  We had dinner at their restaurant one night - it was buffet style and all the left overs that we had been served for lunch that same day.  Housekeeping is never consistent and comes at all different times half does your room and then comes back again. I never get the coffee / sugar / cream supplied in the same fashion every day. There's always something missing.  Worst of all we got 2 rooms in the very back of the hotel (paid for superior suites!) and as they overlook the road and a night club we are woken up every single morning before 5 am by the noise of people shouting and cars honking. It's ridiculous and not ideal when you're here for work (or holiday for that matter!).  Overall it's just OK - does the trick if you need to stay here for work - otherwise you'd be better off somewhere else.

Review_Date: Doris K Hemans wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: I booked an hour facial just to get relaxed after been jet lagged going for a few days. What a great decision as it was one of the best facials I've ever had (and trust me i've done facials at several luxury 5-star resorts throughout the world)! Khadija was my therapist. She did such a phenomenal job I immediately went to the reception and booked her for a full body massage. Khadija is amazing and very knowledgable. If you ever get the chance I highly recommend the spa services and please make sure you ask for Khadija as you won't regret it!

Review_Date: FlaviaMilano wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: I had the pleasure to have my hair done by a very professional stylist Ms Khadija at the hair salon at the Moevenpick. I highly recommend her she is amazing! I will surely come back and ask for her next time!

Review_Date: Carole C wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Housekeeping rather poor bathroom not very clean. A very noisy hotel more like a Spanish party hotel for teenagers.  Tiny balcony. Expensive drinks & wine with prices not consistent from one eating & drinking venue to another.  A very nice spa pool & terrace away from the rest of the noisy & crowded hotel leisure areas. Certainly not a 5star hotel experience.

Review_Date: Bansi S wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: After reading some of the reviews I was a bit skeptical about staying new in this hotel however from when we got there till the end of our stay the service was beyond amazing and everyone was so helpful and polite. We also had dinner in the hotel which was amazing and the breakfast was delicious every morning too. We also stayed in a superior room with a garden view and the view was beautiful! Would definitely recommend staying in this hotel and would love to come back again :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Excellent service she is very good at the job. She is every experienced and deserves to be rewarded. She is a good professional. She is friendly and kind and offered me water. I will recommend her to all my friends and family and I will definitely come back.Her name is Najia.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andra wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Good time and quality massage. You should try!!!everything was excellent good atmosphere and perfect techiques. Once in a lifetime experience. She is a great person and a great professional. You will wish the massage it will last forever:)) try it you will never forget!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sylvia P wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Movenpick Marrakesh is simply the best!
Review_Text: My family enjoyed our stay at this very beautiful Movenpick hotel. The decor grounds ambience and service is outstanding. The hotel is very well located near the airport as well as in close access to the city center and easy access to transportation. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The restaurants were also exceptionally nice. Shout out to the beautiful and very professional staff at the front desk - Laila Nadia and Hind. They helped to make our stay very pleasant indeed!

Review_Date: Sahar Khan A wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: About breakfast lady FATIMA EZZAHRA at MOROCCON TEA service at Movenpick  Very nice girl excellent service always smiling  Well done  Really impress with every person here  Very nice ppl  Really like the service

Review_Date: Amar Y wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Me and my friends stayed here for 4 nights in the junior suites.    The hotel is in a great location scores of restaurants and the mall close by. It is also close to the airport around 10-15mins via taxi which is great after travelling all day so you can get to your room and relax asap. NOT in our case we arrived at the hotel around 8pm and our rooms were not ready. I found this absurd as that room would have been empty when the previous guests checked out at the very latest 11am that day. Reception simply told us to wait in the lobby. I was not happy and after complaining was offered a drink. I said I'm hungry after a long day of travelling and to the hotels credit they gave us pizzas and drinks by the pool free of charge.    The junior suites were incredible inside spacious luxurious huge balcony with comfy sofas and tables stunning lounge area huge bathroom with 2 sinks and extra toilet and sink in a separate area incase the bathroom was occupied. The downside is the walls are paper thin so you will be disturbed constantly if the suite next to you is occupied. DO NOT use the mini bar as each drink is extortionate instead go to the shop across the road and stock up on drinks. You would have thought that at a five star hotel staying in a suite paying what we paid for the rooms that the drinks in the mini bar would be complimentary. My friends who were also in a suite aircon did not work very well. They asked reception to fix this and eventually complained but this was never sorted.    The hotel is huge and does not have enough pools or sun loungers to accommodate the volume of guests. Although you get towels from the pool staff they allow people to leave those towels on the loungers and go back to their rooms. People had to resort to putting towels on the grass next to the pool to sun bathe.    Overall I had a less than satisfactory stay. I really did love my suite when of the 4 days 2 days were quiet as there were no occupants next door. Breakfast was standard average. I would not recommend staying at this hotel as there is always a long wait at reception as there is clearly not enough staff and you will always struggle finding a sun lounger. Air con not working seems to be a common problem as We saw and spoke to a few other guests experiencing the same issue. The mini bar prices are a joke the amount added to our check out bill was insane ¬£6 for a can of Coke Zero as an example. This hotel has a long way to go. Me and my friends have fallen in love with Marrakech and are coming back in 2020 but will definitely not be staying here.

Review_Date: Zou wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Excellent experience at the SPA this afternoon. Special thanks to Khadija massage and Touriya Goumez.  A service worthy of the quality standards of a movenpick.  Very good location at the city center near to Menara Mall
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ninham wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: This hotel should never be a 5 star. Maybe maybe it should be a 4 star. All over booking places it says family hotel that‚Äôs ok because it‚Äôs lots of pools. So you think that‚Äôs no problem. But this hotel should be named to Movenpick KIDS hotel. Way to many kids. And the hotel is big. There is not enough sun beds at all! People wake up at 8 in the morning and ‚Äúreserves‚Äù the beds even the swim guards reserves for family‚Äôs and they get paid by them! This is very annoying and the hotel just accept it!  The breakfast is the same every day!  The rooms are old the aircoindition in the rooms sounds like a jet engine. It‚Äôs a a lot of loud music at night. I recommend this hotel ONLY for family‚Äôs with kids!  This hotel is just hyped up by the name.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lynda R wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: De Rose Hammam and Spa a must.
Review_Text: Having not had a hammam experience before I found Julia to be exceptional at guiding me through the elaborate process brilliantly. The 5 minute steam followed by a series of vigorous scrubbing and rinsing left years of dead skin on the cool marble slab I was lying on. Julia had firm hands and a ready smile which added to the whole relaxing experience. Now I just need to add hammam to my beauty routine regularly! Thank you Julia!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: I have stayed in this hotel many times during the past 3 years this year for several weeks.  After 43 years in aviation and close to 100 hotel nights per year this hotel is certainly on my top 10 list with regards to value for money.  The facilities and restaurants are hard to match but what impresses me most is the friendliness of the staff.  Aspecially the pool staff but also cleaners reception and waiters appears to be top motivated and always receive you with a smile. Whatever you need they will provide it always with a pleasant attitude and some kind words.  I can most certainly recommend this hotel to anyone especially frequent travellers.

Review_Date: traveler4k wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: No air conditioning and lots of noise
Review_Text: PROS:  The hotel and grounds are lovely. The staff of the restaurant and restaurant was extremely good. Unfortunately those positives end there.    CONS:  Where do I start? There were two major issues with this property.    NOISE:  Until about 12:30am there is extremely loud banging that goes on from the music they play downstairs. This music wasn‚Äôt that much of a bother to me because I stay up until late and it happens at other properties. If you are a light sleeper DO NOT stay here!    HOT ROOMS:  Marrakesh tends to be pretty warm in the summer. The first room I had 1303 was extremely hot. They sent in engineering which brought the temperature to 25C (about 78/79F). I stayed the night and while touring I asked my tour manager to call and ask them if the issue was solved. They said it was and it was not the case when coming back.    DO NOT DISTURB:  I placed the DND sign on the door as I usually do and care back from my all day tour to discover that the sign was removed my bed was made and they folded up my dirty underwear and left it on top of the sheets. I was a little upset they handled my dirty underwear I left. It was pretty bad.    At approximately 6pm on day 2 I asked if the AC would be fixed and it just couldn‚Äôt. I asked to speak with the GM who came and spoke with me apologized and then we decided it was best to move rooms. I packed my luggage and was hoping for a good room when I got back.    We arrived back at about 11:30PM. I went to my new room 1137 which was much smaller but totally OK by me. The air conditioning wouldn‚Äôt cool here either which I thought was a terrible coincidence. I called them a few times and they said they would send a fan which I was fine with. 30 minutes later no fan. I called downstairs again and they wouldn‚Äôt answer the phone.    I again asked to speak with the manager on duty who came to my room with an engineer at my request. The manager stated there was a problem and they would not be able to resolve it. It was 3am and I was hoping to sleep at least 3 hours before my wake up call. To his credit he apologized and said the GM should have checked the new room would not have an AC issue. We had to use Google translator as he only spoke French (possibly Arabic too).    If you don‚Äôt mind a room that cools down to 78F (25C) or really loud noise then this will not be an issue for you!    The staff was mixed up all over the place. The service ranged from excellent to poor. The staff at the dining room was great and did an excellent job but the rest of the staff fell short including the GM who dropped the ball with fixing this issue.    The other rooms in my group cooled fine and were able to work but there are many that will only cool to a certain point and blow air that is only slightly above room temperature.    After all the different Movenpicks I have stayed at including the recent Nile River Cruise on Movenpick‚Äôs Royal Lotus this is likely the last one I‚Äôll voluntarily stay at.    With all this said I truly try to avoid poor reviews (look at my history). I wanted this to actually work out and felt that after speaking to the GM it should have worked out. He should have checked to make sure the second room would cool down.    There was also a medium length black hair in the soap and shampoo area. That doesn‚Äôt gross me out as much as other people but since I‚Äôm criticizing them it‚Äôs something that others would be bothered by.    I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone unless you feel like suffering and not sleeping for a couple of days!    Despite their affordable rates and pretty atmosphere - DO NOT STAY here or you will not be looked after and terribly uncomfortable if you like air conditioning.

Review_Date: stormingnorman wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: I am staying here on business. the hotel on first sight looks nice enough with separate buildings and a pseudo Moroccan architectural design. The interior is a strange mixture of oversized furniture and bizarre decor. There is a large and smaller swimming pool with bars attached the problem is the larger pool is dominated by a sound system that plays continuous loud music throughout the day and night! It can be heard from 200 metres away and means one can't have the window open without the incessant noise ruining one's time off. It seems bizarre such a hotel that appeals to everyone has this policy more suited to a 20-30 something age group. I'm only glad I'm not paying to stay here.  Other than that things are okay the staff are nice but it took an inordinate amount of time to change rooms with numerous calls and finally a visit to reception along with two unsuitable alternatives being offered. A rather disappointing and frustrating experience as a whole I wouldn't stay at a Movenpick hotel again based on this experience.

Review_Date: Rabia M wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Very bad connection with the hotel by phone and when the receptioniste called from our hotel to the pool they said it is only for hotel guests. On the website it says that it is possible but on the phone it was not. Bad service

Review_Date: Mohamed wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: impressively splendid kidz club friendly and approachable staff.  Well led supervisor is apprachable and always smilling  Great hotel to choose if you have children  Suitable up to 12 years old  My daughter Suraya loved it full of fun and every day different activities  I would not hesitate to recommend to families with children  Well done team - Keep it up

Review_Date: Karim B wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Wonderful hotel. Very convenient I enjoyed everything in the hotel the room was great very clean and i am very happy with how well the housekeeping staff cleaned the room everyday the room service i got with the happy birthday cake was beyond amazing and the staff in the pool were just great. No negative comments in this stay everything was amazing. Good job to all the staff and looking forward for my next visit. Thank you

Review_Date: Aoife wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: I‚Äôm writing this review halfway through my current stay that itself speaks to something. Don‚Äôt get me wrong the setting is beautiful and our room is well kempt. But appearance does not make a hotel 5 stars. The place is teaming with staff you‚Äôll never see more employees in one space but the service is beyond slow and on several occasions already they have attempted to overcharge for drinks etc. The hotel also advertises several restaurants that do not in fact exist. As I‚Äôm writing this I‚Äôm sitting in my hotel bedroom nursing an all day bout of food poisoning which I am positive I got from here as it is the only place I‚Äôd eaten in the 40hrs before the illness started. Worst of all for me the brand prides itself on ‚Äúsustainability‚Äù. This is the most unsustainable establishment I‚Äôve ever stayed at worldwide. All drinks are served with two plastic straws for decoration all poolside cups are served in plastic cups with plastic lids all glass bottle beers are served with plastic cups alongside them all pizzas are served in single use boxes and not once have I seen a metal spoon all plastic. A sign in the bathrooms states ‚Äúin order to save water hang your towel on a rail if you want to reuse it and place on floor if you want fresh towels‚Äù. Our towels have been changed every single day despite hanging them neatly daily. Also this evening (rooms are cleaned in the am) a cleaner entered our room while myself and my partner were both nude post shower no knock proceeded to walk into the bathroom not appearing to do anything walked out and then repeated these actions a second time!! Bizarre. Also I‚Äôve never known a hotel to hold such a huge deposit upon check in 70% of our weeks stay. Not just card on file full amount taken. This better be returned promptly upon check out. Would not stay here again

Review_Date: Ghizlane T wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: This is our second time at the Movenpick. We love it because it's family friendly the design is beautiful the staff is super friendly and the breakfast buffet is just great! The kids club is what absolutely sold us on coming back. My girls have so much fun doing lots of activities swimming cooking and playing.. Touria was exceptionally helpful and knows how to deal with children. honestly the best option as far as family friendly hotels that doesn't skimp on the other things..

Review_Date: Caba Tora wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: I have stayed in the Movenpik Marrakeh in july it's one of the finest in the world. the rooms are fantastic the staff extremely attentive and what you would expect at a Movenpik.  The grounds are impecably maintened the pool is an ouasis amazing spa great kid's room restaurants are all wonderfull. a big thank you to the pool crew tarik abdulhaq and imad and to everyone who made our stay an unforgettable experiene.  We had a wonderfull week and are definitely coming bak.

Review_Date: Almondalmond1970 wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Wonderful memorable experience staying at the movenpick hotel. The hotel staff were all so accommodating especially Naima who helped with breakfast every day. She made it very easy by delivering breakfast to our tables. She was brilliant and nothing was too much effort for her    Adil was so accommodating with helping with delivering the luggage to our rooms even after changing rooms a few times.    Lubna was very accommodating with housekeeping making sure our rooms were fully equipped with all the necessities.

Review_Date: hans m wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay in a quite spacy and very clean superior room in this outstanding Hotel in July 2019.    We would like to thank the staff to make our stay memorable and comfortable at all times. Our special thanks to Nossima M.from the pool restaurant and Brahim from the breakfast area for their always lovely and helpful asisstance!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bushra Sailani wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived the staff were welcoming and friendly. a  Adil was so patient with us taking our group luggage between 4 separate rooms and dealing with a family of 8 adults and a baby. Lynn's the housekeeper excellent cleaning up after he young ones and Naima at the breakfast lounge was so attentive to all our individual needs/allergies. All the people and more made our stay very pleasurable. The hotel is beautiful and peaceful.

Review_Date: Farkhanda wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: I am currently here with my family and 1 year old grandson. Customer service is brilliant. All the staff are friendly and polite. The rooms are lovely and there are lots of communal lounges to sit in. Breakfast buffet is excellent with something for everyone. Naima looks after us every morning and brings us our endless cups of tea to the table. Thank you so much to everyone at the Movenpick for making our stay so enjoyable. We have a few more days left and are going to make the most of it. BRILLIANT!

Review_Date: RABIA wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Had a lovely trip to Marrakech and stayed at the Movenpic hotel. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. As I was travelling with my 1 year old I was very worried about coping but staff took care of everything. During the breakfast buffet one of the staff Naima was beyond helpful. She would bring things to the table even though it was a buffet to make things easier for feeding my baby. During breakfast she word help us with plans for the day and even suggest good things to do.

Review_Date: Malvina K wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Great fun, amazing food, super service
Review_Text: It was the best steak I ve ever had. Cooked perfectly to my order amazing taste. Food was beyond expectation as well as service. Really good fun and really awesome attitude DIEGO/ Mohammed. He made our experience absolutely unforgettable. Even a little detail like a ketchup or pictures... or simply anything we needed to have a great experience he did!!! 100% super service!!!! When I go to Marrakech again- MOVENPICK - will be first in my list!!! Thanks you guys for a lovely dinner! Special thanks to Diego ( bosa bosa)

Review_Date: Fernando M wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Great hotel but could be better, careful with the activities they sell you.
Review_Text: Outstanding resort that needs a facelift in the elevators lobbies of the rooms buildings and spa.Great location close to shops central station restaurants and airport. 7 minutes taxi ride to the Medina and the Fna Square at EUR 5 a ride or 50 DM nice rooms with great bathrooms.Outstanding pool area and amazing main lobby. Great breakfast buffet in a nice patio . On the negative side be very careful with the activities and excursions you buy from the front desk...They play with the prices as they wish.

Review_Date: AnneSeymour66 wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Absolutely love this hotel. We used the pool facilities nearly every day of our holiday. Everything is brilliant the beds are really comfortable the swimming pool was a perfect relief to a very hot day & towels are readily available. There is a newly added pizza oven which I took advantage of regularly. The team who attend to customers by the pool are so attentive - we were remembered again by Jihane & Anas. Their attention to detail is beyond excellent. Spotting when things need fixing. I am already planning my next trip for 2020 A***

Review_Date: Maria Elena S wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Me and my boyfriend we have been there one week in August 2019 and we can say that it was a great place to stay in Marrakech.  The breakfast was amazing our waiter Mohamed Skiriba was gentle.  The only thing that we didn‚Äôt appreciate was pool that was always overcrowded.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: L'hamiti Y wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: yassine hadhoumi @ restaurant saray give d me and my family an exellent service. Verry Nice and helpfull. Next year i Will comme back!  Also Naima and brahim where out standing People with a verry classy service thx for that moment off real vacation feeling. I Will recommend this service to my whole Family.

Review_Date: A.A wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Very good stay service was amazing and staff were very helpful especially Fatima Zahra she was a great help during the breakfast service making sure we had everything we needed and more. Would highly recommend.

Review_Date: Ema wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: We stayed in the h√¥tel last week and the service was nothing short of excellent. All the staff are very helpful.i was very impressed with laila restaurant. She gave us excellent servise in restaurant. Always looking dor ways to help and always smaling.  The h√¥tel room are very nice.clean and have their own class about room  The pool area is beautiful  Breakfast is really good  All in all reccomend this place

Review_Date: Tehilla D wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Overall beautiful hotel - pools are amazing - the restaurants are jot overpriced - all the staff is very polite - breakfast came with our room and the buffet was wonderful - Yassine waited on my table a couple days in a row and he was lovely.  Merci beaucoup!!

Review_Date: Mira55888 wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: We spent four days at this outstanding resort in Marrakech. Customer service was excellent with the help of Afaf and Nadia. They were both excellent and knowledgeable. Breakfast was also good with a big variety of options. I can only highly recommend this resort!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Osama wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Great hotel lovely clean space amazing service! Hind at reception desk and arrival was probably the most friendly and helpful. Overall good accommodation for a reasonable price. we would definately stay again

Review_Date: erinta lomi wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Hi     I would like to point out this amazing person me and my friend met at the hotel reception.    Hanane is the best employee of the hotel the most smiley person and the most helpful.  She helped us book restaurants and assisted with anything else we required. We laughed a lot and made our stay much much pleasant.

Review_Date: Kyriaki wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: We visited marrakech in July 7th for my birthday celebration. I could only say without Hanane (she is the receptionist at the Hotel) my trip would not had been so memorable. What Hannane did which made it so special? So I went back to our hotel room as you do I saw a cake with a beautiful flowers all over it took me by surprise and what a nice surprise! Not only did she went over and above her call of duties it was really the thoughts she put in which made it so special and unforgettable. Truly a kind young lady. I would think all company would want an employee like her. Thank you Hannane we will see you again really soon :)

Review_Date: Kim W wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: We wanted to spend a day at a hotel pool towards the end of our trip and saw a few (recent) articles which recommended the Movenpick Hotel. Unfortunately when we arrived they said that the pool was for use by guests only and they no longer allow visitors to use the pool. We went to Novotel Hotel instead which I can thoroughly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: robbeveridge wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: This is a lovely hotel in a great location. The staff were very polite and helpful. Unfortunately the food and minibar are way over priced.Brahim at breakfast was very helpful and couldn't do enough for you so I thank him.we had a junior suite which was lovely but again over priced.  We had a lovely time at the hotel but ¬£6.50 for a small can of coke and ¬£15.00 for a club sandwich ruined the experience.

Review_Date: LondonSussex wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: We stayed here in July . The hotel can arrange transportation from the airport to the hotel if pre booked .  Unfortunately Marrakech airport is very busy and it took ages to clear immigration .  We didn‚Äôt see our driver in the arrival hall and missed him so don‚Äôt go outside the airport otherwise they won‚Äôt let you back in in the end the driver found us .. excellent    Check in was good  we booked a junior suite OMG it was huge  large lounge and bedroom fantastic bathroom and terrace to sit out on the suites are located in the quiet part of the hotel -it‚Äôs worth up grading as far I can see the standard rooms balconies are very small .    Unfortunately the costs of the mini bar are crazy as well as room service  ¬£6 Euro for a can of coke  ¬£15 for a burger- I know it‚Äôs a 5 star hotel but please don‚Äôt over charge !    Swimming pool area is excellent plentiful of sun loungers - the guys in the red t shirts work very hard  didn‚Äôt see much action from the guys in the white t shirts ..  Breakfast is good  fair amount of Choice    only one tv English Channel/ bbc news    The hotel needs to improve its information to guest  what restaurant they have  what bars are within the hotel etc there is no guest information in your room ? Why ?    Housekeeping is of good standard and our suite was always cleaned to a high standard...    There is not much to do around the area of the hotel  handful of restaurants a basic shopping mall and a small shop across the road with high prices .    Overall the hotel is beautiful and relaxing the staff are lovely and friendly..    I think if you can secure a good price for your stay then go ahead  but i think it‚Äôs expensive if you can‚Äôt ...    planning your hotel and location is key to a fantastic holiday.

Review_Date: Mohammed K wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Stayed in this hotel for a week with my family and everything was great! There were multiple pools and the hotel itself is located near a number of attractions and restaurants.    The staff here are also super friendly in particular Hind at the front desk was very helpful and Youssef who works in the restaurant was always very attentive and ready to get us anything we might need.    Would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Review_Date: abanob n wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I had excellent experience at Movenpick Marrakech that is cause best service Offered by stuff at Movenpick . Let me correct my words it is become excellent experience with help of Hanene ( reciptionist) . Thank you for you smiling all the time  Thank you for your perfect english .

Review_Date: Omar wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Stayed in this hotel for a week! Everything was great! The pool is amazing and the food is outstanding. We spent most of our time in the hotel because it was too good! They have some of the best staff i have ever seen! Really friendly and always happy to help! Special mention to Hind Nezha Hanan and Sounail for making me feel at home.    Cant wait to be back again!

Review_Date: Leigh C wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: From the moment we walked in we loved the feel and look of the hotel.  Hind is the beautiful lady at the front desk. She is absolutely amazing and a superstar. She is always happy and always smiling and extremely helpful. She should manage her own hotel one day.üíïüíï    Mahmoed and Hamza at the pool bar are the perfect gentleman. They are always making sure that you are having a good time and that you do not lack anything. They make you feel good and welcome every minute.    Omar and Amien at breakfast is so friendly and very attentive to you. Always asking if you need anything and always happy to assist.    The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms are cosy and spacious.    I will definitely come stay here again.

Review_Date: MasudQ wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I don't enjoy writing negative reviews but our stay here was way below the standards of a 5* hotel.    On arrival the staff at the hotel looked utterly miserable and helping us with our luggage seemed as extra work to them. One of the bellboys dropped a few of our bags upto the room spilling some contents and didn't even bother to apologise let alone help pick the contents up.    The rooms were fairly well equipped however one of our rooms had a broken toilet seat broken locks & a crib bed rather than a proper bed. We promptly complained to the manager who arrogantly refused to do anything about this. He also refused to give us his name. We spoke to our booking agent and they reported that the manager had offered us a different room which was an obvious lie as we would have gladly accepted the offer. We found out that his name was NOUR from the staff.    Nothing improved during our stay and we did not want to waste our holiday arguing with the staff. On a plus note the breakfast was brilliant and on site pool & spa did not disappoint.    Overall not what we expected from a Movenpick 5* hotel and could have been better if the staff were more pleasant and helpful. Will not stay here again.

Review_Date: Amy C wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: No complaints about this hotel. Nice and clean. The hotel bars service wasn't great- often hard to find a server. But this could be due to how we arrived about a week before the start of peak season. By the end of the week there were more waiters. The inclusive breakfast was very good.

Review_Date: Lierbag Derdnik wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Currently visiting the beautiful country of Morocco with my girlfriend attempting to enjoy our first time in Africa and we have been repeatedly served with mediocre service from every staff member here. From the time we checked in we have been rushed from grabbing a drink at dinner to laying out ordering food at the pool. I was told today that I needed to hurry up and pay for a check in order for the attendant to ‚Äúwatch a match.‚Äù We obliged and attempted to pay with a debit card the card declined and we were told ‚Äúdo you have another card?‚Äù in a very accusatory tone. We asked whether or not it may have been the machine and when he ran the SAME card with a NEW machine TRANSACTION APPROVED.    After we paid we wanted to continue to enjoy our day by the pool (still here) and not once have we been checked on or asked whether or not we wanted to purchase something else.    . . . . . . still waiting
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mia S wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I am currently staying at this hotel my boyfriend and I have had both drinks at the bar and lunch at the pool. Both times the service has been below average. We are constantly being rushed and quickly asked to pay right after receiving our food. Today at the pool our server asked us if we could please quickly pay so he could go watch a soccer match. Then when trying to pay the card machine would not work and he insisted that there was a problem with my card. I asked him to run my card again and the machine worked. We are trying to have a relaxing holiday and this has made it somewhat unpleasant. We are trying to pay money to their hotel you would think they would at least be friendly.

Review_Date: Laurence wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Excellent hotel I‚Äôve stayed in Marrakech a couple of times now at different hotels and this is the Best one to date  The hotel is kept clean to a high standard the staff who greet you as you enter the hotel are polite and courteous this started the weeks stay off well.  The accommodation we had was a suite 5103 it was kept so clean and tidy by the maid who was so polite and helpful üëçto this young lady.  Kind regards Laurence.    PS. To management and staff please kept up the good work you do I will be coming back to stay.

Review_Date: Jane wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We had an amazing time in this hotel. The service was excellent. I'd like to say a special thanks to Hind at reception for being so much help. She knew what we needed when we needed it and most of the time she'd anticipate it before we did! The rooms were fantastic and thoroughly clean and breakfast was excellent!

Review_Date: Lucy wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We got a great deal on secret escapes - ¬£300 for 3 nights which we thought was good for a supposed 5 star. The hotel has an impressive reception and lobby area rooms are fairly standard but the bathrooms are nice. Our room was advertised as ‚Äògarden view‚Äô but overlooked a couple of trees and the bin area. Breakfast was good lots of choice and the lady serving the omelettes was lovely however every morning the omelettes were quite undercooked with a fair amount of raw egg in the middle. The location isn‚Äôt great for the M√©dina - about a 30 minute + walk. Pool area good plenty of sunloungers and the majority of the life guards were very attentive in getting towels and umbrellas when needed. The night prior to our departure we asked if there was anywhere we could store our bags and freshen up - check-out is quite early at 10am and our flight wasn‚Äôt until 6pm. The man on reception kindly offered us a complimentary late check out until 1:30pm which was a huge help.    On the first night a chilli con carne (185dh) was added to our bill instead of the Mac n cheese (50dh) we had actually had - hmm. This was quickly rectified when mentioned.    Our main issue came on check-out when as many other customers have mentioned we found that random items had been added to our bill. We had lunch at the pool on our second day - 2 cheeseburgers and 2 beers. A salad had also been added to our bill which was on a separate check and had been ordered half an hour prior to us ordering our lunch. An obvious mistake which we asked them to remove - after a little to-ing and fro-ing (having to ring the poolside cafe etc) the receptionist explained this was their mistake and removed it from the bill. We paid and went to sit on a nearby sofa to decide what to do for the next few hours until our flight. The receptionist then approached us again with the supposed check for the salad which bore our room number surname spelt incorrectly and a forgery of my signature. We were outraged and explained someone had clearly fraudulently attempted to copy our details - we suspect it may have been a member of staff who hadn‚Äôt obtained a signature from another guest who had actually had the salad but obviously this is just speculation. The receptionist shrugged in a very accusatory manner - I asked to speak to the manager and he disappeared for 40 minutes. I went to the desk to see where he had gotten to as we wanted to go and get some lunch (it was now 2:30pm) - the man behind the desk pointed behind me and I turned to see the receptionist jump behind a pillar and out of sight?!? Extremely bizarre behaviour. I confronted him and he just said ‚Äòwhat? What?‚Äô and disappeared again. Eventually the ‚Äòmanager‚Äô (coincidentally the same person who had served us at the pool the day prior) came and apologised and agreed it was a very concerning issue that they would look in to.    The levels of customer service at the hotel unfortunately don‚Äôt constitute a 5 star and the hotel in general needs a bit of a facelift to bring it up to standard - missing pool tiles stained and broken sun loungers broken toilet flushes etc. Unfortunately issues with the bill and dishonesty seem to be a recurring theme at the movenpick and until they sort this out we won‚Äôt be returning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tatiana G wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Everything in this hotel is way below expectations from declared 5*. Lifts and pool area have a lot of wear and tear mold broken tiles and carpet and look more up to 2* standard.  Morning buffet is also very basic minimal selection of food. The hotel is terrible value for money. For the price they charge you can be in real 5* somewhere in Dubai or in amazing All Inclusive in the best resorts in Egypt.  The only place which really lived up to my expectations was the Kids club. Very professional employees perfectly managing their little crew of (sometimes) misbehaving kids well diversified program 10-18. Great job and thanks for what you are doing!

Review_Date: PamK wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: This was a stop for our tour group in Morocco and was absolutely perfect! It is drop dead gorgeous filled with incredible art pieces shops bar restaurants and anything else you need. The rooms are comfortably furnished and tastefully decorated. Bedding was great air conditioning was great drinks even with ice that‚Äôs been made with distilled water were great. There‚Äôs a lovely pool and so many nice touches of fresh roses everywhere. The staff was so helpful especially since it really is a sort of maize that seems difficult but becomes easier to navigate with the help of the staff. Highly recommend this lovely gem!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Martin S wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is really great and would warrant 5 stars but several issues need to be addressed. The elevators are terrible. Broken buttons broken floor indicators frequent bumps and lurches make riding them quite uncomfortable. For a luxury hotel chain this is not acceptable. Also guest services staff is not attentive or responsive. We had to call and go to the desk 3 times for a simple request to be handled. Others in our group had similar issues. Pool restaurant/ Buffett and rooms were great.    The parent company of this great hotel chain needs to visit here and see the issues and get them fixed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ChiaLau wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We stayed for three nights and most of our experience at this hotel has been pleasant.    The landscape is beautiful and well maintained. Staff around the pool and breakfast area are fairly attentive and friendly. Plenty of choices are available for breakfast as well.    The room is well sized and comfortable with fair level of furnishing.    The room services needs to be improved as staffs are not attentive / trained to a 5 stars hotel standard. I need to ask for an item for three times before it was delivered.    Overall we did enjoy the stay. Could the experience be better yes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alena K wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We had very pleasant experience in this hotel reception people were accommodating.  The restaurant people not as much. Nice pool great breakfast. We stay for long weekend could stay little longer. Recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mohaned c wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: I had very nice experience at Movenpick Marrekech or just let me correct my words: it became nice experience with the help of the stuff at Movenpick. First day I arrived I had some minor problem with my room ( like wash room door does not close correctly) I reported that at the reception. So they transfer my report to the problem solver Hanane ( receptionist). She render my experience totally different: first she speak perfectly english ( no one else could understand me)she upgrade right away my room she took care of the transfer my language... She was smiling all the time even after 8 hours of work. If you would like to have nice experience go to Movenpick a‚Äô and go to see Hanane. She will offers you the best service

Review_Date: anthony c wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Marrakech would rate a probably the most interesting place in Morocco to visit. There are lots of high end hotels lots to do and the Movenpick is up there with them. Public areas are huge rooms OK for size. Meals were fine would certainly stay here again. Visiting the Medina especially at night is a must. Taxis are cheap and easy to find. We felt safe here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ann F wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: My husband Peter and I stayed at the Movenpick Mansour Eddahbi Marrakesh from the afternoon of the 9th June until the morning of the 11th June 2019 . We were travelling as members of an Insight Vacations Group Tour visiting Morocco. Our time at this hotel in Marrakesh and subsequent enjoyment of our tour was ruined by the incompetence irresponsibility and totally unprofessional attitude of the management and staff of this hotel . Not only did the porters fail to deliver my husband‚Äôs suitcase to our room after our arrival  the management there denied receiving it and blamed the company we were travelling with for its disappearance . Mr. Badr who was in charge of porterage  was most unhelpful  and hours after the suitcase went missing  having been given a full description of the case  it‚Äôs colour size and written labelling  was unable to recall what it looked like . The manageress a M. Layla  was impassive and equally reluctant to take any responsibility for retrieving the suitcase . She too denied all knowledge of its existence and blamed our tour director and driver for its disappearance . Our tour director gave us full support in trying to find my husband‚Äôs case by reminding the two members of staff mentioned above of their duty to guests in maintaining the reputation of a five star hotel . He was met with hostility and unwillingness to take the loss seriously . I asked them to search rooms to find the case as it was urgent to retrieve my husband‚Äôs medication  and they agreed to look in a few rooms that night  My husband and I accompanied Badr and Layla on a brief search of just three empty rooms late that night to no avail . My husband was in the clothes he had worn all day  he was not offered even a toothbrush that night .The following day he missed the excursions  spent six hours waiting in reception to hear the results of an examination of CCTV footage  and then he was given no direct evidence that the suitcase had been stolen  just hints that it had not been received or not shown by the cameras . He was not shown any of the CCTV footage . The hotel staff strenuously denied all responsibility or knowledge of my husband‚Äôs suitcase . It was presumed stolen . We were left  late afternoon  with no choice but to shop for a long list of replacement medication ( in school French ) .A kind Morocco representative of the INSIGHT tour company  a M. Najib  accompanied us to the pharmacy and then to the door of a local shopping mall . We were left to find replacement clothing  underwear  socks swimwear etc trying to communicate in a mixture of French Arabic and English to try to find the correct size ...my husband is not of average build ...We were exhausted  hungry and fairly stressed by this time . There was no offer of any sort of compensation or comfort by the hotel management . In addition earlier that day staff on reception had given me an additional key card with the wrong room number written on it  so I was unable to get into the room ! Our tour director Simon very wisely insisted on staff searching that room too but to no avail . We had to leave next day with our group for Casablanca  without my husband‚Äôs luggage  and with his newly purchased worldly possessions packed into a temporary carrier bag!  We received not one kind word from the staff who acted as if nothing had happened .Peter had to leave Movenpick  Marrakesh like a refugee  clutching a carrier bag . As you can imagine the trust we all felt as a group  in the ability of hotel staff in Morocco generally to safeguard our luggage  changed as a result of this unacceptable attitude to being almost non existent .We lost faith in porters and management .  We travelled on to Casablanca where my husband and I  in our late sixties were forced to race on foot across chaotic roads to the Medina where we bartered in sign language and Franglais for a replacement suitcase . There followed a search for a stall to purchase replacement chargers and cables for the phone and camera . Thank god we always pack money  passports  and phones in our hand luggage . We made it back to our coach in record time clutching our purchases .but no time to enjoy browsing for souvenirs or admiring the architecture . Our free time disappeared as we tried to replace Peter‚Äôs basic possessions . It was a nightmare .  We left North Africa for Spain mourning the loss of his favourite and unreplacable white linen jacket his favourite silver hip flask  and all his treasured possessions .  Five days after arriving at the dreaded Movenpick Marrakesh  we were in Tangier when word came indirectly that Peter‚Äôs suitcase had been found in an empty room on the same floor  by a new guest arriving that day . Not a word of apology and no offer by Movenpick to express -courier the suitcase to us before we left North Africa for Spain . A whole week after the suitcase was reported missing it finally joined us in Grenada . Although we were highly relieved  and somewhat amazed to receive it with contents intact  the unnecessary hassle  totally unnecessary expenditure on replacement equipment and clothing  and having to purchase additional baggage allowance for our return flight really adversely affected our holiday . ... but above all the anxiety and stress we felt was made so much worse by the totally rude indifference to our plight shown by this sadly mediocre hotel .    .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Zippywrx wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Stayed here the weekend of the 7-06-19 for 3 nights.  I‚Äôll list the things as I seen them.    Check in: Basically very poor levels of service the 2 x people on reception didn‚Äôt understand English yes I know I‚Äôm in a foreign country but I have never had an issue in any other country in 5 star hotels. We eventually got told at 10:00 am no room was available till at least 14:00 we had no problem with that but at 14:00 was told still no room what seemed to be a senior staff member who could actually understand English then got involved and got us our room. The first experience of a couldn‚Äôt care less attitude.  They then gave us a cheap photo copy piece of paper which was meant to be a map and drew 2 circles 1 which I believe was reception and the other was where our room was.  No explanation or offer to take our bags they have a little bell they use nothing happens when they jingle it quite funny really and they just leave you standing in reception we found our own room which is a fair distance from reception. 2nd couldn‚Äôt care less attitude.    The room: nice clean and tidybed was comfy bathroom was nice.    Pool area: nice beds and most of the pool guys where nice and helpful BUT they do not ask you if you want anything at all you have to find one and try and get his attention when they walk past.  The guys in the red shirts where very good to be fair sorting umbrellas and towels out and where very polite so thumbs up to them the rest of the staff could learn from them how to treat guests.    Restaurant: Tried calling from my room several times down to Reception and no answer again great service !! went to reception who then sent us to the concierge desk and he looked at us like why are you bothering me other reviewers have stated how wonderful these guys where but I‚Äôm sorry they where aloof and not very helpful at all.  3rd couldn‚Äôt care less attitude.  Eventually he told us that he couldn‚Äôt book us a seat in the restaurant as nobody was answering the internal phone ( this I knew about from my experience from my room)he then told us they don‚Äôt have a central booking system ( What ?) and they would leave a message and put a note in our room to let us know if the reservation was made guess what ? no message was sent and we walked into the virtually empty restaurant no more than 10 metres from reception and got a table at 7:30pm by ourselves with no input from reception or the concierge who had clearly lied to us at 10:00am as they had no booking request from our room number from the concierge.    We ordered 2 x Lamb tagines and my partners one had 3 x large bone chunks in it with no meat we called the waiter over who agreed that there wasn‚Äôt any meat in the dish and he would get another !! Why did the chef in a 5 star hotel release this as a meal when it was a bowl of bones ?  4th could care less attitude.    15 minutes later the replacement arrived but by that time dinner for 2 had become dinner for one at a time again poor service.    The waiter did apologise but the girls who show you to your table etc who seemed to be playing at being restaurant managers paid no attention. 5th couldn‚Äôt have cared less attitude.    Breakfast: Very good selection and choice however having a single person making omelettes in a 500 room hotel isn‚Äôt good planning the toasters are also a waste of time as they take far too long to warm not toast your bread.    Hotel Bar: Drank in here 2 x nights of our stay BUT they had NO Vodka Brandy or Coke Zero so a 5 star hotel over a weekend period didn‚Äôt have what I would deem to be basic requirements for any bar !! All I can say is wow.  They where also playing Christmas songs in June on the Saturday night ( very strange ) but once again a couldn‚Äôt care less attitude was evident from the staff.
