Check out: Not as easy as you would imagine they take ¬£168 from your account on arrival as a guarantee for extras etc on check out they presented us with a bill for ¬£186 I told them I would pay ¬£18 difference between the 2 x amounts they tried to tell me the original ¬£168 was only a guarantee when I could see it had left my account 3 days earlier!!! I shall have to wait till the banking system catches up and find out if the ¬£186 also came out of my account.    To summarise:    I have been as honest as I can be with my review of the hotel and I‚Äôm the first to compliment good service but I will also take the time to write an honest review of hotels we stay in.    Nice enough hotel in a reasonable area of Marrakesh but for me it‚Äôs not a 5 star hotel as too many things are not up to scratch.    It seems they have adopted an attitude or IT WILL DO which isn‚Äôt good enough in 2019. It could be so much better if the staff where trained correctly in customer service reading other reviews there is a pattern here all mentioning the poor service yet clearly it isn‚Äôt being addressed.    Managers walk around the hotel regularly but not one makes eye contact with you or makes any effort to say hello etc this maybe a cultural thing in Morocco but having stayed in many hotels around the world I have never experienced this anywhere else where most managers make an effort to say hello and introduce themselves.    We spoke to several guests who also said very similar things to us and ALL mentioned poor service and we where recommend the Mamounia hotel if we wanted proper 5 star treatment and service if we ever return to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: d0mta wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Would be 5 star review except for the Internet being on and off at times. Great breakfast and nice rooms. Lovely pool and big stand out was Hassan a super friendly and helpful lifeguard who guided us on the best places to go. I have nicknamed him  Hassan the Hassel Hoff dark hair and big muscles lol.

Review_Date: Love_Travels_2015 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: This hotel was nice and very modern. I stayed in the King suite with my hubby and baby and must say enjoyed it.    The bathroom was nice and big with his and hers sink. The balcony was lovely to sit out and chill.    There was an issue with the kettle not working. This was a nightmare as I couldn't make up my babies bottles. The staff were very reluctant to give a new kettle until right at the end when they realised after 6 attempts the one we had was broken!    Nevertheless. Despite this everything else was pleasant.    The suites are a bit out from the other rooms but it is quiet and no one disturbing you.    The strange thing about the suite is not having many plug sockets. They were either used for the kettles etc or on the skirting board which meant my UK adapter couldn't fit through...    The breakfast was good. But the outdoor pool I found overcrowded and not as good as the savoy.    The entrance is very dark gloomy but grand looking. However the smell of saffron or whatever it was.. was so OVERPOWERING! Made me and my baby nauseous. Its too strong especially if you are waiting in the long que to check in or out.    It isn't as convenient like the savoy with the mall right next door or being able to walk out to the restaurants but for relaxation this hotel is nice to end your holiday in morroco.

Review_Date: Calipso wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: The hotel is nice and is in a beaituful location. But the service is quite avarage. We had dinner with> 10 people . There was not enough number of waiters. They forgot and missed some orders. The requested iron to the room. I called the room service 4 times it took them 4 hours to brung. I ordered a hard pillow and called 2 times. No response still waiting for it. Quite expensive and not good value for the money...

Review_Date: Antuan wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: +Very Nice staff  +Clean and spacious lobby  + comfy beds  - bad smell in WC in room  - there were some small dirts for example on pic  - restaurant should have better food    Location: kinda far for those who wants to explore real Marrakech    From my point of view this hotel is kind of ‚Äúall inclusive‚Äù hotel which is bad for those who wants to really take a rest not in a crowded swimming pols

Review_Date: EKDEMET wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Excellent hotel in a nice neighbourhood
Review_Text: Stayed at this property for 2 nights with gate 1 travel .Beautiful hotel with different wings.Great decoration Very fresh and comfortable rooms.Great buffet breakfast and great onsight restaurants offering local and int'l deicasies.  Only complaint is all lobby restaurant and room furnƒ±ture are very low making it impossible for elderly and disabled people to get up once seated. It is impossible .  Normal height dinning room chairs and couches etc. should be provided. NOT EVERYONE IS 18 YEARS OLD......

Review_Date: Robert Knauer wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Plush is This Hotel's Middle Name
Review_Text: While visiting Marrakesh we stayed two nights at the Movenpick Hotel. We would have preferred to stay a month. This is a great hotel and the staff is incredibly cordial. What a treat! The rooms are very comfortable as are the beds. A refrigerator safe wifi and coffee (with a heater) are provided. Plush robes and slippers are also provided. The biggest criticism about this property is that it is very large and you can easily get lost. The friendly staff can quickly get you going in the right direction.    Food at the restaurant is excellent and sitting by the pool having breakfast makes the entire experience perfect. Dinner by the pool was an equally enjoyable experience. You will not go wrong staying at this hotel.

Review_Date: KA2215 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Our stay at the hotel was pleasant and this hotel was beautiful! The centre piece lighting and the various forms of art work were mesmerising.    Pro: The majority of the staff were friendly and approachable    Pro: the hotel itself was very clean and kept at a high standard    Pro: the range of facilities at the hotel were good such as the spa and swimming pool!    Pro: the hotel was also located in a convenient area! There was a mall just up the road the Medina was a ten minute drive away. The main attractions such as Jardin Majorelle Le Jardin Secret the Saadian Tombs and the Bahia Palace were approx a 10 minute drive away!    Pro: the restaurant provided a good range of food from starters to desserts! The deserts were notably the highlight of my dining experience at the hotel restaurant    Pro: the exchange of British pounds at local currency at a very good exchange rate.    Pro: there were many other hidden cafes restaurants that were of a good standard!    Con: the toilet seat was broken before arrival.  Con: the bathroom was not as clean as it could have been (but I‚Äôm being picky)  Con: the balcony door would not lock.  Con: house keeping would enter the room without knocking on some occasions and that took us by surprise as I have never encountered that in a hotel.    Overall a good stay at the M√∂venpick and I would recommend to friends!

Review_Date: Sheila G wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Hotel grounds nice, service is poor
Review_Text: The lobby and grounds of the hotel are nice. They are visually pleasing and have a nice smell. Staff is not helpful. I booked 2 day tours with the hotel and the actual experience was very different than what was promised. The waiters at the restaurant are slow to serve you. I got up during my meal to get something from the buffet and when I came back my drink is gone. When I asked them about it they said I had finished it and would have to purchase another one even though I know it was not finished. i had to call housekeeping 3 times to request a simple bed sheet. They repeatedly told me they would bring it but they never did. Poor service at this place. Save yourself the aggravation. Book your stay somewhere else.

Review_Date: Rajicray wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: I stayed 5 nights at the Movenpick Hotel and I couldn‚Äôt fault it. I booked a transfer via email got a swift reply and on the day they were waiting upon my arrival. My room was spacious and lovely maybe a little tired in places but you‚Äôd only notice if you were really looking. I used the gym and it was very well equipped. I also booked a few massages in advance via email with Bouchra in reception. She was very helpful and responded to my emails quickly. I met her each day and she was very warm and welcoming it was lovely to meet her in person. I had 3 different therapists each time Fatin Khadija and Bouchra - they were all very professional made me feel at ease and the massages were excellent. The spa was very calming and I‚Äôd recommend a visit. I had breakfast and dinner at the hotel and both were great - lots of choice. I was travelling alone the hotel staff were all very helpful. On my birthday I went on a tour upon my return their was a dessert in my room - it really made a very enjoyable day even better.

Review_Date: Marina K wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Beautiful lobby!! Beautiful rooms. Heated pool kids pool mini pool. Great breakfast! Great service at the restaurants (¬£¬£¬£¬£). Everything was great...we made my parents go the month after to the same hotel :)

Review_Date: Pamela M wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: As soon as we walked into this hotel with its gorgeous lobby we felt great about choosing to stay here! The hotel lobby is stunning and the rest of the property pool etc. are equally grand. We were also very satisfied with our room with its black marble bathroom and luxe linens. The staff was very helpful providing change for our larger denominated bills. The breakfast buffet is incredible - extensive and delicious. We ate dinner at 54 Steak. The ribeye was cooked to perfection. Service was superb. We also ate at Dada's Diner which was a nice option for quick casual meal. Thanks for a wonderful stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sidoine wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: My husband and I came chose this hotel for our mini vacation plus other things. The hotel is gorgeous and the views are breathtaking. The staff are respectful friendly welcome and are willing to go above and beyond to help. Breakfast is free and naima and Mohammed were always there to help us. Naima especially was always there to recommend things and chat with us. I surely fell like I was at home. I would recommend this hotel to.lots of people. I will definitely comme back again in the near future ü§óü§óü§ó.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: brodac wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Not a five stars hotel ! Poor service quality and food
Review_Text: No welcome drink  No recharge of toilet paper in the room  Bar of the swimming pool closes more than one hour before the sunset and even 15 minutes before they do not take anymore any order  Not enough umbrellas in the swimming pool and when we ask they just say ¬´ bad luck for you ¬ª  Terrible food at the night buffet and very expensive (but breakfast is OK)  Issue with the final bill (charged some beverages that we did not take)  Very poor quality of service at the swimming pool (take 45 minutes to bring a diet coke)    Clearly not a five stars hotel !! Maximum a two or three stars hotel... very disappointed by these vacation !!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: MrsandMrH wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Definitely not a five star hotel
Review_Text: We are on day 3 of a four night stay and would like to share our feedback to assist anyone else considering this hotel.    We arrived on Saturday after a long journey and were not given the rooms we had booked. My daughter and I are sharing a double bed and our friends are in tiny single beds next door. We were not provided with any refreshments on Check in (despite previous reviewers receiving this service)    After checking in we were guided to our basic room in a worn out building with no mini bar no iron no hairdryer and no WiFi !    The tea and coffee in the room is not replaced once you have used the two sachets provided and there is no turn down service in the evening.    Breakfast is very basic and on our second day we were not even offered any drinks from the lady serving in the indoor area. This service was replicated during lunch at the pool bar when we waited 20 minutes for our drinks and then had to poor our own wine.    There are plenty of staff around the pool during the day doing nothing. They told us we couldn't have an umberella moved down to the smaller pool as it was too difficult so we moved to the larger pool and were given an umberella which collapsed. When I advised a member of staff that it was dangerous he put it down and then walked off. It is nearly 100 degrees today and there are not enough umberellas the pool area is cramped and there is no drinks service offered.    We have stayed in five star accommodation in Marrakech before and all these services are a given.    The concierge at the entrance to the hotel and one guy in the breakfast room all deserve a thank you for raising the bar.

Review_Date: SolomonJL wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Just a short break. 3.5hr from Stanstead. Hotel is lovely. It‚Äôs quiet so don‚Äôt expect entertainment or shows. On the whole it‚Äôs top quality but is a little tired in places. Rooms are simple & comfortable but not opulent. Breakfast was basic but dinner is excellent. The venue is made that bit better by its excellent staff in particular Naima in the breakfast room ... nothing was too much trouble for her (she should get employee of the year!).

Review_Date: Zahra326 wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: I wanted to say I was very impressed with the birthday cake I requested for my partner. He was visiting Marrakesh solo for his birthday. The concierge team arranged a cake on his arrival as well as on his actual birthday a few days later!!    He loved it and will bring some back for me. Special thank you to Amine who handled my emails.    Zahra

Review_Date: Jeremy F wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: We stayed four night in the M√∂venpick and we really enjoyed our stay. Despite having more than 500 rooms the hotel is well designed and doesnt tell over crowded. The staff is really welcoming and professional and the bedroom are correct.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Asad Taqe wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: I was in town for work and stayed for 3 nights. I found the hotel to be clean to have good service and the interiors to be very colorful and hip. The gym had quite a lot of machinery and the food was great. i would stay again

Review_Date: buttunz1977 wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: My recent stay here was ok but not as great as I thought it would be. On arrival the lobby is grand with huge sliding doors and we received snacks while we were being checked in. Lovely! However after the walk past the stunning pool area on the way to my room my expectations took a hit. The elevator was rockery and frankly very tired with faded and patchy carpet. The room was just ok with no iron in the room (had to call the front desk for that) and a shaky toilet. When I turned on the air conditioning in the room it was so noisy.    On the positive side the breakfast is good with many choices and the restaurant by the pool has excellent food. The pizza and burgers were delicious and the bunnies hopping around were a fun eclectic touch. In addition the staff is very helpful.    The location is convenient but I am not sure I would stay here again unless they upgraded the rooms.

Review_Date: lauraccss wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: my friend and I stayed 7 nights at the Movenpick in a junior suite great size room very comfortable beds linens very clean large terrace with full sitting area and a table for 4. Housekeeping staff very attentive and accommodating to all our demands.  the only issue with the room is that windows in the bedroom does not open it can get a bit warm but living room area has a slide door you can get lovely brezze at night but it does not reach the bedroom.    spa is fabulous with great prices for treatments Hammam and massages were fabulous. Great buffet breakfast includes freshly made Moroccan pancakes and mint tea ceremony .  ample space in pool area it can get crowded.    The highlight was the concierge staff Amine and specially Safae went above and beyond with their recommendations transport and tour arrangements. my friend sprained her foot and Safae sent security with an emergency kit within 5 minutes. we were constantly requesting help to book everything and they never failed to give the best suggestions.  we cant wait to return!!!

Review_Date: Rudii H wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: We travelled for a short break from the UK for our dads 60th. No real effort was made for the fact it‚Äôs his birthday. Which is fine but we have stayed in lots of five star hotels that have made a big effort out of no real special birthdays.  The staff are lovely. Work so hard and really nice and caring especially the waiters in the evening. They recommended such nice food and wine for us which we appreciated over just telling us to get stuff for the sake of it.  We only got to spend one full day at the hotel as we did an amazing private tour on one of the days recommended by the hotel he was honestly such a good tour guide made our trip to be honest. On this one day we  obviously wanted to sit by the pool. The sun beds are limited  not the fault of the staff and they try to move reserved towels for people who have left them for ages and not returned but we waited for a long time for this to happen we were sat on the grass !! (I‚Äôm sorry but in a real five star hotel that isn‚Äôt a thing) and my sister suffers badly from hayfever. Which obviously was made worse by this. We eventually found our self a bed and they brought another over which was nice but we watched as those who just turned up tipped them to get beds which worked.. we all pay the same for the hotel and I just think that‚Äôs a bit unfair.  The rooms are good nothing special but the beds are very comfy and the bathrooms are nice and the over all cleanliness is 5 star.  Overall really nice hotel but not quite five star.

Review_Date: Globetrotter7707 wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Awesome place to stay with the most amazing staff and breakfast!!!
Review_Text: I accompanied my husband on a business trip as the company he represents also organizes a spouse program with visits and activities which allows to discover the place pretty well. When we first arrived at the hotel we were amazed to see the staff outside greeting us as we got off the bus. We were even more amazed once we entered the hotel which is not only beautiful but had the most sumptuous flower arrangements all over!! We were of course greeted with typical tea and sweets which you tend to have about 10 times a day in Morocco as it is DELICIOUS!!! FYI if you wish to purchase their tea do so in the Souq or at the mall don‚Äôt wait for the airport you won‚Äôt find the kind they serve in the city.  We were escorted to our rooms in one of the blocks closer to the pool so we got a nice walk and were able to see much of the hotel. Our room was on the top floor of our block and we had a very nice view and also appreciate the call to prayer sounds early in the morning the bathroom was clean and the bed were extremely comfortable. The next day we were greeted by the most amazing breakfast there was something for everyone! A lot of typical Moroccan things and also the typical continental breakfast choices. We attended the opening ceremony at the convention center which is connected to the hotel which is why the company chose Movenpick. In all we had an awesome stay the rooms were very good and the entire stay was very pleasant. We didn‚Äôt get to go to the pool but it was very tempting as during the day temperatures vary from 10 C to 25 C around the time of year we went. I strongly recommended!!!

Review_Date: SunriseSki wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: After travelling through Morocco mountains desert and all we chose this place for a few days of relaxation before heading back home. Very good choice it was. The hotel already stuns you with one of the nicest and impressive lobbies ever.You can immediately feel it is nicely run. It is a big establishment (seven buildings?). We got rooms in one of the farther ones which felt more like a serviced apartment so spacious it was. Everything seems quite new and very well taken care of (cleanliness landscaping etc.). The pool area is nice and on nice days the number of sunbeds seems limited. Might need to go early. The pool bar is great has some dishes for a quick lunch break. The gym and SPA are also well equipped and the staff very helpful. The breakfast area somehow feels like cafeteria style one place too big too crowded too loud. Selection is good may be there could be more diverse healthy options (fruit). We also tried the two restaurants (one is actually more like a bar) in the lobby-building for dinner. Mixed assessment. While they are very nicely decorated and cool the staff is fast and nice the selection is interesting on the other side the quality of the food is not up to par especially the meats. Also being where they are they tend to be overpriced but this is to be expected. Last point there is good WiFi and accessible from everywhere. In any case overall we enjoyed our stay and would certainly come back when in Marrakech.

Review_Date: waqar a wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: The Dj yassin is one the of best around full of energy and excitement and it was the best part of the experience for me. The overall hotel experience was pretty awesome. I would definitive reccomand it.

Review_Date: Gallusblether wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is lovely. My room is spacious clean and comfortable. Hotel amenities are great - good breakfast beautiful pool lovely staff. Why is there always a ‚Äúbut‚Äù? Yesterday after my room was cleaned I had no hand-towel or bottled water. Having only been here for one night so far I asked at reception if water was supposed to be replenished daily. Yes was the answer. Also my kettle didn‚Äôt work. I had to ask at reception 3 times before I received a working kettle a hand-towel and a bottle of water. Today my room has been serviced and at 3.50 pm I have absolutely no towels at all and my used coffee cups have not been cleaned. Maybe it is retribution for asking 3 times yesterday! I have already dried my hands on a bathrobe and have phoned guest services to request towels but so far no luck. I am here for another 4 nights. By then I may have used all of the pool towels!    For those who need to know this hotel is situated about a 20-30 min walk from the centre of town (main square). I like walking so that doesn‚Äôt bother me but if you can‚Äôt or don‚Äôt like to walk don‚Äôt stay here.

Review_Date: Sunny51 wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Very clean, comfortable hotel in good location
Review_Text: The hotel has a beautiful pool area and a large choice of restaurants. The room was large clean and the mattress was finally (after many hotels in Morocco) comfortable. The shower was also the best we experienced however ours was not pitched correctly and kept flooding the floor. The breakfast buffet was very good with flaky pastries. Service was attentive and the staff would walk with you to show you where to go. The location is on a main road which was pleasant to walk on and see the train station and royal theatre. We walked back from the souk very pleasant but not short.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jane S wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: My sister has reviewed already but I would like to echo her comments  Anas and Jihane who work at the lovely pool at the movenpick are a fantastic asset to the holiday experience nothing is too much trouble for them  We certainly will be back time and time again

Review_Date: AnneSeymour66 wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: This is our 3rd visit to the Movenpick and it won't be our last. The main amenities we used this trip was the pool area. The beds are so comfortable very easy to rest and enjoy the sunshine. The life guard Anas is an absolute treasure and as always looked after all the guests superbly. Anas remembered us by name after our last visit in July and the time before that in September 2017. We were also very pleased to see that Jihane the pool waiter was still working at the hotel. She is by fair the most attentive member of the team there. She is always watching and checking that the guests have everything they need and when delivering food she lays it all out neatly to ensure the guest has the best experience. The customer service demonstrated by Anas and Jihane is 2nd to none. Look forward to returning in 2020 if not before.

Review_Date: dtotiii wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Good place to stay for short vacation
Review_Text: The ambiance and decor of the common areas is worth a look. The roomsthough neat and clean are however a letdown. The service and housekeeping is poor. The property has a number of excellent swimming pools  which are the main attraction during summer months.

Review_Date: Lexigurl wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Clearly the toilet has not been scrubbed properly. I am so grossed out. The vanity had hair on it.  There are marks & stains on the walls.  There are stains on the carpet.  The lobby has a nauseating overpowering gardenia smell. I think this is common in Morocco. It‚Äôs like the old lady with too much perfume on to cover up bodily smells.

Review_Date: Dianne H wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We stayed in for the first few days of our tour. The staff was very helpful. The room was spacious and well equipped. The bar was well staffed. We ate at the restaurant and found the food tasty. The decor in the lobby was very eclectic. It was a 30 dirham ride to the souk. This hotel is located I. The new part of the city. I would stay here again.

Review_Date: Yosephyoseph wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Splendid and Grandeuse hotel . Enormous complex of hotel with convention center . Curated with amazing art and award winning restaurant . Room is spotless and swimming pool is heated . Surrounded by lush garden and fountain.

Review_Date: mon0 wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Wow this place is incredible from walking through the main doors this hotel definitely exceeded expectations. The room was good we got upgraded but downfall the rooms were so far from main entrance and back entrance near us had been closed off. Service was overall great the only one thing was we were after specific Teas and called room service about 5 times after waiting for 3 hours we headed to the bar ourselves to request this. We felt we were right on the edge so it was nice and quiet and had our privacy.    Breaksfast was great but super busy! Pool and amneties were fab the restaurant manager was brilliant too we really felt taken care of (3 girls) even thought the small tea issue. Lovely hotel would come back.

Review_Date: Madlin 2011 wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Friendly staff nice poolside.  The setting is very luxurious and it caters to the comfort of of the guests. My room was well appointed with all the usual amenities. Excellent buffet breakfast. We would highly recommend this hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: IsaacGBerkovsky wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: The only true way to review this gigantic resort style hotel is to put the food of it against the bad...    The Good:    -Architecturally beautiful  -Modern services and construction  -Nice sized rooms (but not enormous)  -Art exhibits around the lobby area  -Several restaurants to chose from  -Several pools one of them quite large.  -Nice plant and flower filled grounds.  -Centrally located  -Nice breakfast buffet  -Free wifi  -Kids club    The Bad:    -Room was infested with ants; housekeeping never did anything about it  -Our hair dryer caught fire after starting it the hotel change it after 24 hours and several requests at the front desk  -Although there are several restaurants they share many menu intend throughout  -Service at restaurants can be either efficient or extremely slow  -Housekeeping can vary in their service standard so much from one day to the next.  -WiFi signal is terrible  -Poolside drinks are terrible  -Front desk phone is never answered    I truly believe that although the front desk takes note of all request made there‚Äôs a lack of communication in the chain of command which results on terrible customer service.

Review_Date: rasmusb344 wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Worst ‚Äú5 star‚Äù hotel i have ever stayed at. Service and food quality is of the lowest possible.
Review_Text: I seldom do reviews - but after spending 5000 eur on this nightmare it deserved one.  lets start with the positive - IF you buy a 600 eur per night suite - rooms are relatively large / clean - and in generel all people are friendly and breakfast is decent.  But - Forget any pictures you see on their website - was probably taken in 1999.  after 2 hour wait in reception upon arrival as rooms were not finished on check in time - without any offer fro water or any other gesture - we recieved one room out of the 2- well after asking 5 times in reception whats going on as no one comes to you to assist.  In insane amount of groups and package tours are slamming check in so you can get an extreme wait in generel at reception area.  After 4 calls to reception and another 15 hour wait from the one room we got - our second room was ready on a different floor than our children despite having asked and advised.  They forgot to put the extra bed - and we tried to contact reception an unlimited times per phone - but NO ONE pick up the phone... so 5 min walk back to reception as hotel is huge and ask whats going on... they will send someone they say... no one comes ...  i go back and ask for a manager... they refuse and say not available... after preassure mr. ‚Äúmanager‚Äù comes out and we sit. i explain in details and he says no problem he will talk to all and fix all - and i say so how do i contact you if it doesnt happen - he says it will all improve so dont worry... 5 days trying to reach ‚Äúconcierge‚Äù to book a transport or an excursion and never once called me back...  ps. manager never once contacted me after our meeting to check on things...despite he knew it was an extremely bad sotuation... 5 STAR service ??? - you cant even order room service at times as again NO ONE pick up the phone..  i can keep on explaining in details - but let me put bullet points:  - ‚Äúconciergeservice‚Äù 2 people to 500 rooms - you do the math.. if you ask to help with reservation - they call the place and pass you the phone so you can make you own reservations :-)))  - childrens pool missing half the tiles  - food at pool is probably worst hotel food i have seen ever.. one home made printed menu in french so table can pass it around as they dont have more print out from the black and printer :-)... mcdonalds would be better option for food quality..  - same goes for the ‚Äúelegant spanish inspired‚Äù restaurant...ZERO taste... its extreme how its possible to cook that bad.. it almost takes talent to be able to have a pizza taste like air :-)  - view from SUITE was to the garbage area and junkyard  - sunbeds and some common areas are super run down and not maintained...  All in all - if you think you are going to a 5 star hotel with great service - think again... expect nice people - smiling - a decent breakfast and large groups of company guests and an abundance of screaming kids at the ‚Äúgrown up‚Äù pool ... and thats about it...  I have never spent 5000 eur on a more deceptional way.  An amazing private riad would be better option..  So many great hotels / riads in marrakech... this is not one of them.

Review_Date: dou wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Amazing hotel... best location in marrakech near to all activities (night clubs malls markets). staff super helpful. Big thanks to Bouchra from standard who was very helping with all my requests. To recommand !!!

Review_Date: Preeti T wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Has the most amazing stay at Movenpick Hotel as a mini hen break with my sisters. The grounds were stunning. We were upgraded to a suit which was also absolutely stunning. The staff were so helpful and very polite. A big thank you to Jaouad Ed-Dajjany who was the manager for the restaurant and his staff for the hospitality and making sure we were well looked after throughout the evening.  Would definitely make a return trip!

Review_Date: Enzo wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel amazing service and sites. Not the prime location in the city but far from being bad. Nice breakfast buffet in a nice setting. The hotel hosts an art gallery but is has great art prices throughout the property.

Review_Date: Brunobu wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Nicely located not too far from the Medina about 60 to 70 D depending on how you manage your negotiations. The taxis have nothing to do with the Hotel so the latter not to blame if you get caught out. Stayed with 2 adults 2 kids in a small suite perfect for our needs. Staff welcoming and super friendly big thanks to housekeeping team.    Breakfast a bit chaotic from 9 to 10 better before and after. Waiters under pressure to keep up supply of knives and forks and napkins. Good breakfast selection not the best we have seen in a 5 star but good all the same thumbs up to the omelette  and traditional Moroccan pancake teams.    Other on site food options a bit limited really. Pool side by day ‚Äì best to eat in the restaurant at the back of the pool sun bed service hit and miss around lunch time not staff fault think they are actually slightly understaffed at busy times. Super helpful and friendly pool team all the same also the outdoor pool is heated just the ticket for the April break.    Night time its best to go out. They have two restaurants one is ok and makes a good effort very welcoming team the other ‚Äì the main bar area - has an interesting menu but two or three times this space was out of bounds to hotel guests at night due to private events.    They are short a space for hotel guests to have a drink at the bar when this happens they do offer an outside terrace but not conducive to staying put there on a cooll evening. There is a self service spot as well but we think that was for specific groups. Also wine and spirits extremely expensive on the Marrakech scale.    These are only minor quibbles this is a super spot for kids and has the best kids club we have ever come across the unsung hero‚Äôs of this Hotel to be honest. We will definitely return to this spot next year. Thank you Movinpick team

Review_Date: Crazy Momma wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Crazy Mommas review.... of Movenpick Hotel...Excellent accommodation in nice location
Review_Text: The Movenpick Hotel is set in beautiful surroundings. Has amazing art & gallery. We were in a-garden room 4010 with small terrace having been up graded because of problems with our accommodation when we first arrived. Receptionists very helpful kind and patient Thank you Afaf & Hind on reception. All the staff were extremely nice nothing was to much trouble the waiters Mouchine & Brahim in the Saray restaurant especially so. And also Warrda our room maid such a lovely attitude It‚Äôs a top class hotel and a great place to escape the manic traffic  hussel and bussel that is Marrakesh . Things to be aware of taxi drivers over charge & drop you off to waiting guides. Be careful when taking photos or you will have to pay. There is constant pressure to give... The Medinas & Souks are exciting a great experience they may hassle you but they have a great sense of humour and mimic you.. Essaouira is beautiful... a must to visit. Argan oil products are good but shop around as prices vary. Seeing goats up trees is jaw dropping. The food is good... coffee excellent & Moroccan bread & honey M‚Äôsmen is yummy. The mixture of old & new the people & architecture make Marrakesh an Exciting Interesting & Vibrant place to visit..

Review_Date: JandKLondon wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Lovely large hotel on the outskirts of town
Review_Text: Loved our stay out of season. Plenty of space and good service. Evenings by the pool as the sun set while drinking cocktails before good food in the hotel choice of restaurants was a highlight. Would definitely consider staying there again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sally_Dude wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Unfortunately our stay at Movenpick wasn‚Äôt great! Started off with the staff at the front desk taking ages to even assist us (even though they were available).  The room was clean but we didn‚Äôt receive the Cot bed as requested. Service was very slow an any request had to be made two/three times before it was done.  Staff for breakfast were extremely rude an inattentive. No cutlery or napkins most mornings. Coffee wasn‚Äôt great! Disappointed with the service at this hotel. Won‚Äôt be staying here again.

Review_Date: Paul K wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Very Loud disco noise outside room
Review_Text: If you are looking for relaxation don't go here unless you check if they are having an event outside in the courtyard area with very loud music which they do and they know when time it is going to end which they don't when asked twice. They need to decide if they are an outdoor event space or a hotel.

Review_Date: Kholoud M wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: I'm the customer of hotel movenpick I had stayed for 1week I really like the hotel location there is a nice view on the garden also I like the pool but the should some DJ music in the pool for people to have fun to to pass there time and even o would like tell you there is really bad service in the spa I didn't like it at all there is no changes in the food it's very poor the rooms it really very simple but the mades who that they really have a good service I would like to thank ouaicha khadija she is really amazing women and ait warker najat mdme hilal they are excellent people they know how to talk to people the hotel it's not perfect thank you I hope you change this things other wise the other the hotel gonna be so bad

Review_Date: Muzammil_MM wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Stayed here for 3 nights and booked 2 classic rooms. One of the rooms got up graded to a junior suite. Anyhow we loved both the room and the suite. The only setback was these rooms are far apart as ours was in front of the main pool whilst our children were in the suite block at the end of the property.    Breakfast and dinner were both great. Good food with loads of choices. The location is also good as you can easily walk to Menara Mall in 15 minutes being maximum.    It is a huge property as there‚Äôs a convention centre next to this hotel. Staff are great too! Plenty of facilities to choose from - Hamam Spa more than 1 swimming pools etc.

Review_Date: MrsPTravels wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Great location great facilities and seamless customer service! Thank you for having us! The only one negative was the vegetarian options for food were very very limited during our half board dinner and we ended up eating pretty much the same thing every evening which was a real shame. I can't fault anything else though.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: kpenglaseptyltd wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Good Hotel, Good Location, Enjoyable Dining
Review_Text: Stayed here for three nights. Good location good sized rooms great pool facilities nice gardens had a pleasant feel about it. Dined in on two occasions which is unusual for my wife and I as we usually dine at venues outside our accommodation. The tapas at Marcelona was good though the big screen sport is a bit loud. Buffet breakfast in the Saray Restaurant was probably the best we experienced in Morocco. And Ayoub always got us good coffees to start the day. Location is great with the old medina supermarkets and other restaurant alternatives within walking distance.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Umut ≈ûaraplƒ± wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We have been staying in this hotel for two days    Firstly when we first entered the hotel room the electrical system of the room was not working we waited for half an hour to be fixed but they did not find it suitable to give another room    There was no water in the room we were calling for room service but they did not bring and the television did not work again    This morning the electricity was cut off again we called and they said they would come but they did not    Our room number is 7507 and there is still no going in    I have never seen such a bad service that I have traveled to many parts of the world.    I don‚Äôt recommend to anyone

Review_Date: N Houda A wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Super friendly and helpfull staff!  Breakfast is super great variety!  Really worth its five stars! Beautiful hotel!  Good location did everything by foot but taxis are all day available in front of hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michelle P wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We were so excited to stay at the Movenpick before we left Marrakech. I little bit of lux & relaxation from a the medina before flew back. What a disappointment we had. The 1st floor grounds lobby artwork & general design was beautiful but the service was atrocious. When you enter to check in the staff are not friendly or welcoming. They have a look on their face like you are bothering them. Minimal explanation of the grounds but you are given a half-ass map of the hotel which was barely helpful.  We attempted to go to the Marcelona restaurant which was supposed to have Spanish influenced food. Well don't count on it because they changed their menu & it was Moroccan than Spanish. The hostess did not crack a smile & she told us their was no table for 2 but pointed to the bar next door & said we could sit there & order the same food. A white man behind us asked for a table too she told him the same thing but with a smile & personally walked him to the bar next door. I started to notice this trend of inconsistent treatment throughout my stay here & I honestly think they are racist or prejudice against asians -and I'm only half!  Dinner at the restaurants could have been better. I had paella one night- looked & tasted like it came from a box. Other tapas were so mediocre I can't even recall what I ate.  To sum up the good things: breakfast buffet & only those servers the housekeeping toiletries & the aesthetics of the hotel are notable.    Don't consider this a 5 star hotel at all. They are in desperate need of hospitality service training. And I don't want the General Manager Thomas Gregory to send me a copy & paste apology & how they are going to take note of improving. He's clearly not doing his job in making improvements since they haven't improved.

Review_Date: Michael B wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: The Movenpick Hotel in Marrakech is a wonderful place. The cavernous and labyrinthine lobby is simply a delightful place in which to get lost and to explore. It really is a worthwhile maze with lots of art work and beautiful and stylistic furniture to experience; and there is always a helpful employee to set you on the correct path should you be in a hurry to find your room one of its restaurants or a convenient exit.  Our room was spacious clean comfortable and well-appointed. Complimentary wifi and a bottle of water were appreciated. Breakfast provided a great array of foodstuff from which to choose and with two efficient egg chefs there was little time wasted waiting for your individually prepared omelette or eggs.  With the super friendly and helpful staff this is a great place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen M wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Great place away from the hustle and bustle...but not to far
Review_Text: Don't usually stay in large hotels and this is large. However it didn't feel so due to the fabulous service we received whilst staying there from the exceptional staff  from the pool guys who found us sunbeds and towels to the maids who cleaned our room. Special shout out to Brahim in the restaurant who looked after us during breakfast.  If you are looking for somewhere to stay and relax after a busy day sightseeing it's perfect and only ¬£4 in a taxi to the main square so you can come and go as you please with ease. If you prefer to walk off those fabulous breakfasts it will take you 30mins.

Review_Date: Dominic wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We visited Marrakech for one week and stayed at Movenpick. We loved the artwork and graffiti in the hotel! Although the hotel wasn't excellent the service we received from the hotel staff was. We were particularly looked after by Ayoub during all our meals.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: malina1005 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Really nice place for a family .we are here the first time and we like the hotel very much .thanks too much all the stuff for being helpful.special thanks for laila marcelona very helpful mi family very happy of the servise layla ..thnk you

Review_Date: Tazzyyyyyyyxo wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: This place is truly a gem! I went with my sister and cousin staff food atmosphere and rooms are all amazing! Initially we were meant to stay at this hotel and one other as movenpick didn‚Äôt have the availability when we first book for us to stay with them the whole holiday: anyways we stayed here for half our holiday and made our way to the second hotel 3 days later... WHAT A MISTAKE. The other was soo bad we had to return to movenpick. They were actually fully booked because of a Chanel conference but thankfully Nadia managed to find us a room which we were so grateful for because this hotel MADE OUR HOLIDAY ! Special thanks to Hind for sorting all our activities for us and being so lovely to us! This place is a gem and we are looking to come back to Marrakech and stay at movenpick !!

Review_Date: yolanda fernandez wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: The hotel lobby is an art gallery full of paintings and sculptures. The room was very spacious bed was comfortable bathroom clean there‚Äôs a safe coffee maker and complementary bottle of water. Overall clean room no complaints.

Review_Date: dipux p wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Good hotel;however it does need a little updating. The bed mattress not comfortable and dipped causing back pain. Good size bathroom but the toilet area is compact in comparison with rest of the bathroom.  The staff are friendly and helpful.  Thank you to Wardayoung lady who did a fab job cleaning the rooms everyday with a smile.

Review_Date: Abdellah A wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Very good hotel with special thanks to Mr Mustapha in Sarai Restaurant for his good service and high sens of professionalism. His smile and his concern to satisfy the customer made of him the right person in the right place.

Review_Date: Jean-Yves wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: first of all i would like to thank a young waitress named laila she is very professional  a very nice hotel üòâ the restaurant (Marcelona ) is beautiful and the meal . Thanks for everything    Best regards  Jean-Yves family

Review_Date: Sylvain M wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We were a group of 13 friends for a bachelor party and spent 3 nights at the Movenpick. The facilities are great breakfast is delicious and the staff is amazing. In particular Jihanne who took great care of us at the pool. Thanks a lot to her!  Fully recommend to stay there.

Review_Date: JohnlSlater999 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Good hotel, helpful staff, very pleasant stay
Review_Text: Obviously mixed experiences here but we stayed for 4 nights in early March and had a good stay. - no complaints. The main (heated) pool and bar are busy but the lower (unheated) pool with its bar/restaurant was a calmer spot. Breakfasts are very good we dined twice in Marcelona restaurant and food was good and reasonably priced. Our standard room was clean comfortable and well serviced. I agree Reception could be understaffed at times they do themselves no favours by allowing you to quote any old room number when getting food and drinks without checks - thus we found a spurious dinner on our bill which took time to sort out. But concierge were swift every day in retrieving our golf bags from storage. We were there during a busy conference in the Palais de Congres next door and their gala night look extremely well done (possibly by outside event management company ). The hotel is well sited and 100 yards from a stop on the Hop on Hop off Tourist bus route which will take you round Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rockville7 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Avoid the satellite buildings: no A/C!
Review_Text: Don‚Äôt stay in the satellite buildings! Management refuses to turn on the air conditioning until May. It‚Äôs 86 degrees outside and my one bedroom suite is an oven. Even at night or with a breeze blowing through it‚Äôs still hot. I heard several other hotel guests complaining about the situation to management to no avail.

Review_Date: I love travelling wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Average 5 star hotel. Needs improvement in service level.
Review_Text: The hotel is huge with rooms spread in many buildings. Of course there is no covered pathway from reception or the restaurant to the buildings housing the rooms and this is a problem when it's raining.  Reception is very very small and very slow.  Very nice lobby and entrance.  Very nice pool area but probably small for the amount of people in the hotel.  Gym is not bad though a bit small for a holiday destination huge hotel.  The rooms are nicely sized. The bed is nice and comfy. Decor is nice as well. There is tea and coffee facilities but strangely enough only 1 mug.  Bathroom is nicely sized with a big shower. Some of the towels were soft and nice others looked older. Toiletries were refreshed every day.  I had a very tiny balcony but as i was ground floor there is no privacy at all. 1 of the chairs had pigeon poop on it throughout the stay.  The restaurant is nicely sized though very crowded for bfast on weekends. Breakfast is not bad. Selection of food at the pool bar is small and quality not wow. At dada's diner the selection is a bit better but again food not wow.  Overall this hotel is nothing wow but not a nightmare.

Review_Date: Belkina wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Such a shame i have to post this review as i was really looking forward to our stay at Movenpick in Marrakech. I loved the design of the hotel the ambience and trusting the great 5 star service and worldwide reputation i trusted this hotel to enjoy our time off. Booked the superior room for our short 3 day break.  We arrived very late at night to the 5* hotel to discover our bathroom and bathtub were full of ants dirty carpet full of stains and the phone completely not working (our building was very far from reception about good 5min walk through outdoor area). Don‚Äôt get me wrong the room was beautifully decorated i loved the design and it was exactly what we wanted however I expected it to be properly cleaned and prepared for the guests. We had to go a several times to explain that we are not happy with the room as this is not the condition to greet the guests. Obviously there was no one in charge who was able to help they just sent the cleaners to wash the ants with water that of course came back again.  Long story short in the morning we were waiting from 8am for our room to be changed. With a solution of downgrading to standard room which was very unfair as we specifically paid more for superior. Finally at 12 am we were asked to come to reception and check our new room. All this waiting going back and forth to find out that at 12.35 the room was still not prepared. To this point we were so frustrated and upset that we are wasting such precious time during our holiday that we left the hotel immediately and had to book somewhere else. Very unorganised management who doesn‚Äôt know how to please guests that are upset. Once again we were not there to get any sympathy or upgrade for free. We simply wanted to enjoy our holiday and have a pleasant stay. Unfortunately I won‚Äôt trust movenpick again and wouldn‚Äôt recommend anyone choosing this hotel because if the problem occurs it is unlikely they will find a solution for you. Don‚Äôt waste your time and ruin your holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Adam B wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Really nice place for a family stay in Marrakech. We are here second time and we like the hotel very much! Thanks to all of the stuff for being helpfull and kind. Thanks to Jihane working by the pool too!

Review_Date: stig l wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: During our visit recently to Marrakesh we stayed at two different hotels Four Seasons and Movenpick. Both has the same top rating at for example Booking.com. It is a total joke. Our room in Movenpick was small and smelly. Toilet in bathroom a joke as well it did not work properly. Pool area absolutely packed with people and difficult to find space.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dom wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: The Hotel is super nice and very clean - and the waitress her Name is Jihane is the best!!  We really appreciate her Service!  We are coming back to this Amazing Hotel - Looking forward!  See you soon Movenpick
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sidi Badr Khal wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: I had a good time during my work and especially I found your host parents at the reception and at the pool and especially the girl called JIHAN  I liked his kindness and his home she is very nice ......

Review_Date: klaabukas wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Would expect better from a M√∂venpick
Review_Text: The best part of the hotel was it's staff. Especially during the breakfast even though that it was too many people they could still find room for our family. The heated pool was great! The rooms had rather good size loved the spacy bathroom. Comfy bed.    On a negative side - the rooms are really outdated. The carpeted floor was very-very dirty the carpets should be changed immediately. It seemed that even after room service the floors were not really cleaned there was still dirt on floors. We had to wear shoes all the time as otherwise the feet/socks would get dirty. It was nice to have the balcony but there was almost no view unfortunately. The elevators were a disgrace. The button lights were not working you could not understand on which floor you were stopping as the tabloo was not showing the numbers. Old small and dirty elevators. Given the size of the hotel more check-in counters would be needed.

Review_Date: Nadae C wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: My parents and I spent the weekend in this fabulous hotel. The amenities are top notch. Rooms are so confortable with great quality toiletry. The breakfast is varied generous and delicious. The staff is fantastic.  In particular Mustafa (koukh?) in the restaurant who‚Äôs so friendly and attentive. For example we craved some meloui but the lady making them had left. We went inside the kitchen to order some fresh ones for us.  Thank you Mustafa and thank you the rest of the staff for a great stay

Review_Date: Jennifer O wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: We recently discovered this amazing property as a birthday gift for our son. He had always wanted to go to Marrakech and this hotel did not disappoint! From the great care Hanane and Hind took to make my sons birthday special to Dahjli at the spa who was amazing! Thank you for making our first trip to Marrakech truly special!

Review_Date: Lingan G wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Absolutely thrilled with the service we received! Came for a hen but arrived separately due to pregnancy. Greeted on arrival by lovely team - must point out Laila who was the receptionist who dealt with us extremely efficient and helpful even upgraded is. Thank you so much for a great stay!

Review_Date: Ani wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: To think I had almost missed this gem of a hotel. Upon searching for hotels Movenpick had not come up due to being sold out for part of my stay but I liked the look of the hotel thus had chosen to atleast for the four days here and elsewhere for the remainder of my holiday and I was not disappointed.    Arrival - check in was quick and efficient our room was ready and the receptionist was very polite.  Rooms - very clean modern comfy and not dingy looking like a lot of the rooms in other hotels in Marrakech.  Bathroom - beautiful showers were powerful and didnt leak too much like other hotels  Breakfast - a lot of choice fresh paratha and omelettes. Left satisfied everyday.  Pool - Amazing jacuzzi and sauna available too  Wifi - Good but sometimes cut off but nothing heartbreaking  Location - Everything was close Menara mall was like max 10 minutes away selection of cafes 5 minutes away and the stop for the hop on hop off bus was like a 3 minute walk away. Perfect part of Marrakech.    I could honestly go on forever but can you believe we went to our new hotel and hated it in comparison to movenpick so came back and requested if they had any room available. They had many large parties residing at the same time which is why it was sold out online initially. Nadia had very kindly gone out of her way to find a room for us and we ended up just leaving our other hotel and coming here again. No regrets honestly thank you soooo much you saved our holiday.    Thank you to Hind also for helping us with the excursions which we thoroughly enjoyed - Chez Ali day tour and quad biking is a must. All the staff (breakfast gym lugagge) are very polite and go the extra mile for you. THANK YOU SO MUCH. Without a doubt my favourite holiday ever.

Review_Date: DLkkkhee wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Simply bowled over by this hotel
Review_Text: What an incredible start to our tour of Morocco.  It was a spectacular hotel with a lobby floor that stretched into a labyrinth of decorated enclaves and art displays.  I think the Feng Shui is good as it has a grand water feature in front and a spacious lobby to let the good vibes in.  High backed sofa chairs greet our tired jetlagged bodies_ we had flown for 18 hours and coached from Casablanca International airport upom touchdown.  The rooms were so cosy and the beds luxurious. All the toiletries were arghan oil-based..  Although we went down late for dinner to an almost empty buffet we did not mind as we were more tired than hungry. The morning buffet was ample and the omelette chef took the trouble to decorate the plate.  The pastries were excellent_ loved the authentic croissants. Fruits galore. so much to eat.  Stayed here 2 nights with our group tour.  However I must say that the Movenpick in Casablanca is nowhere like this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anas wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: I would come to this hotel every single I come to Marrakech I don‚Äôt want to try anyone else!
Review_Text: Hands down staying at this hotel was one of the best experience of my life. We arrived in the morning and we was greeted by the most lovely people who helped us move our bags in and more. Leila at the reception (god bless her soul) was the most amazing person to grace this planet the way she made us feel welcome and greeted us and went the extra mile for everything puting us and our best interest first was just honestly so pleasing and wonderful. In addition I want to thank Leila for her amazing work at this hotel and she is defiantly someone who really does her job to her best ability and I wish there was more Leilas in the world. I wanted to surprise my partner I decided to upgrade to a suite room from a classic room and now thinking of it was one of the best decisions I have ever made honestly! The room was just beautiful the living space had a mix of Moroccan and European heritage in its design and I could just not stop taking pictures of the living spaces. The bedroom and bathroom were even better and staying here was so amazing. If anyone is coming marrakech this is your hotel I cannot see a way this hotel will disappoint you it will only exceed your expectations and you will have the best time of your life here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amina H. wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Me and my partner arrived by taxi at the hotel where we were received by a helpful young man who took our luggage and lead us to reception.  The service was fast and welcoming. We were quickly signed in to our rooms and further details explained.  My partner wanted to surprise me and upgrade our room where we were given a suite with no inconvenience!    The rooms are amazing and spacious. The lighting is outstanding and incredible. The views are to die for. And the pools are ever so beautiful.    Room service and maintenance is 24/7!! We forgot our adapter and they helped us out with no problem.    Overall I love my visit here and hate the thought to leave!! Highly recommend for a perfect gateway romantic or not the location is perfect as there‚Äôs a mall just by 15 minutes walk. Food is cheap and good quality
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Khaled Aly wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Hotel Lobby was wonderful as a piece of art didderent receptions distributed arround front office desk every reception reflects a specific stage of Marrakech culture old African soldiers boat with hot colors and live musician shows all the day with traditional dress and tea as hospitality for audiences  Staff are very polite helpful and descent  Restaurant was very clean providing variety of foods local and western Desserts very tasty and delicious fresh fruits every day  Room was very clean and comfortable. Daily drink water supply expresso coffee and tea also renewed every day  Heated Pool with different levels  Meeting room was huge and well equipped with audio and video instruments  Red flowers and very elegant smell everywhere  Really it was very good experience

Review_Date: Demi V wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Spend two days at the pool and we enjoyed it a lot. Khalid the poolboy is a very happy guy who made our days even more relaxing! I would really recommend buying a day pass which is including a 2-course lunch.

Review_Date: Dipesh Dhakal wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: The Hotel was beautifully designed in typical Moroccan style room was quite good. The staffs are helpful and generous. Food and the balcony view were amazing! I highly recommend this hotel to both business and traveling guests.

Review_Date: Khaled A wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: I would like thank Najia the massage specialist and therapist in movinpuck manssour el dahabe marrakesh spa as she is the best in the world  really i have made many massage seesion all around the world ( malasia hurgada turky  barcelona) but no one lika NAjia U fully recomnend her for any one who visit Morroco or Marrakesh even if you  not a movenpick guest she is the best ever seen regarding all types of madassagee

Review_Date: Simona D wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful.  The lobby is impressive. The rooms are big. The spa is not too impressive.  The service lack in some areas.  I was charged twice however I already paid and once I told them I paid they still charged me..  The kids club lacks of activity done outside the club. My girls 5 and 6 sears old found it too boring. However they offer free lunch for children.  The swimming pool area is very nice however even if heated the swimming pool in December was too cold.  The restaurant service is not the best. Extreme long wait even if only 2 tables were busy and the waitress were very moody.  We arrive to the hotel with a rented car and they couldn't find the car when we were leaving.    Overall it is a nice hotel but I was not impressed with the service.

Review_Date: Magali C wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Very nice hotel- very good staff/services
Review_Text: I spent a couples days there for work and I hope I will have the opportunity to go to this hotel again!!  Very nice well decorated quite huge outside (heated) pool lot of choises for breakfast and a pretty good fitness area.  Everyday there's a coach to help you with your work out session. Mohammed Amin gave a 30 min work-out and or felt like working out for 1 hour üòÖ . Very good coach advises and exercises!!

Review_Date: Ikram E wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Such a nice service actually it was expected because this is not the first time. I've been here in a lot of events and they are always surprising me with their prestigious service.  Food is nice.  Music and lights are fabulous.

Review_Date: elinamisato wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: Amazingly elegant and excellent staff, very comfy bedding
Review_Text: Spacious and beautifully well designed areas elegant reception and very helpful staff. Rooms are spacious finely decorated and clean. We had fresh flowers every day and the bedding was the best! This trip was planned for my birthday and the staff noted this event. When we came back to the hotel the nigh of my birthday they surprised us with our room decorated with rose petals everywhere and a delicious chocolate cake waiting for us in the stay room. Thanks for making me so happy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vian A wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: We stayed for a week in M√∂venpick hotel absoluloved every mintute of our stay very polite and helpful staff.  My daughter had a best time of her life. I can‚Äôt thanks enough Turin and Basma for looking after and playing with my daughter. They baked danced and played all day.  Would definitely recommend the hotel specially the kids club you can leave your child with them with a peace of mind that they are in a safe hands.

Review_Date: clarkUtvik wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: This is not a five star hotel as you know it. It's nice arrival but I get a feeling that they don't have control. The room is big but dirty. There is a large dark oil stain on the carpet floor and everything is worn. The mini bar is empty and there is a kettle for coffee but there is only dry milk left in the box. The internet is incredibly slow and I had to give up checking the news. On several occasions the reception does not respond when you call. I guess my expectations were bigger but this is just sad and not worth five flat ears.    The surroundings are nice and the breakfast was relatively good selection. But there were so many people but it was included which is always nice. If you are staying here I advise you to curb your expectations.    The pizza at the pool was ok but the waitresses gave my wife and daughter drinks which were juice - even though it was in the menu that they were alcoholic drinks. Must be Mamonia next time.

Review_Date: Ziad H wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Great Hotel and location in the heart of the city.Rooms were large and clean. The grounds of the hotel are stunning from the lobbies to the pools and the spa was beautiful with reasonably priced and good services. Food at the pool and room service both pretty good. Breakfast was very extensive and nice. The staff at the front desk is great especially Hind. A little bit high rate but still looking forward for my next stay.

Review_Date: Ilham A wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: I was pleased to finally being able to find a heaven spot in Marrakech to practice yoga. OM YOGA studio is definetly the place to be and it's located in Movenpick Marrakech. You are loaded with positive vibes as soon as you step in by meeting the gorgeous Morad!I had the greatest introduction to all the facilities and full explanation about their offer. This guy is a jewel in this studio and I am happy to meet such high standard service in Morocco.

Review_Date: Mahnaz F wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: We had a wonderful time in Marrakech our hotel was very convenient and clean. We were impressed with the guidance of your staff ( especially Hind and Afaf ) they helped us to choose the best tours and outings of the hotel. We now look forward to seeing Marrakech again and MOVENPICK hotel in the next coming opportunity thank you very much  Dariush and Mahnaz Mobasheri
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: podrozniczka60 wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: This is a pleasant hotel with beautiful exterior and nice interiors. We liked it for their restaurant. Very good Moroccan cooking. And in the afternoon a perfect dessert place with great European style pastries and cakes .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: JenniferAR131 wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: Pretty from the outside but not so great inside.
Review_Text: This hotel was chosen by our tour operators. The maze of hallways to get to the lifts was very confusing and then once in the lifts you realised that everything was only dressing. The lifts were antiquated and dodgy. Airconditioning in the room did not work well and we were there in July and they allegedly had someone "fix" it but they didn't have any success. The breakfasts however were magnificent and they had a waiter preparing freshly squeezed orange juice for all. The pool was also lovely for a nice dip to refresh. Certainly could have improved some of the help at desks as there were receiption concierge and other desks located in strange places throughout the maze like lobby.

Review_Date: Jon S wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: During my trip to the Movenpick I was eager to hit the gym during my stay. On entering the gym I was met by Mohammed Amin the in house gym instructor. I would highly recommend Mohammed Amin as a personal trainer having trained with him over a couple of days in January. He has a friendly nature coupled with a real focus on training and will certainly help you achieve your goals.

Review_Date: Edwin T wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Mohamed Amin is really 1 of the best coach here. Friendly approachable and definitely professional. He gave me advises based on my requirement and certainly did impress me with his knowledge. Give it a shot and you will understand

Review_Date: susieSaoPaulo wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: I was there with family in january 2019. Wonderful hotel huge and delicious breakfast comfy rooms. I would like to specially thank Mohammed Amine the fitness center coach who made his best at all times with our big group of 17 persons! He is a very experienced polite and helpful person who cared a lot about every guest in the fitness centre! And speaks perfectly english what is not common there! Thank you Mohammed!

Review_Date: Sajid P wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Used Movenpick for the first time  And the first day at the hotel was a real disappointment the TV wasn‚Äôt working and had issues with kettle aswell as the iron.  Every time I called room service no one would come and at one stage the electric tripped and I had no electrics and was sat In darkness and was getting ready to go out for a evening meal for my wife‚Äôs birthday. I made reception aware of this and eventually some body came up and fixed it. Hour later electric tripped again and I found my self fixing it myself as I knew where the electric box was not something you would find yourself having to do on holiday.    The rest of the staff and in the restaurant were lovely and that‚Äôs my main reason for scoring the hotel average score.    Yusuf/Jo was superb through out my stay the daily chocolate hour was special he was so welcoming and a lovely guy couldn‚Äôt do enough for us. Credit to him and the rest of the hotel staff team.    The lady who makes fresh patisseries outside at breakfast time made the most delicious churros/croissants.    I think the rooms and hotel needs a good revamp and abit more TLC  Apart from that pretty happy with the rest of my stay just the first day left a sour taste on my stay.

Review_Date: krewrov wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: The entrance is very impressive. Rooms are spacious and the balcony offered a great view over the swimming pool. Food is very good and varied. Staff is friendly & professional. The hotel could do with an update as wear & tear is clearly visible. Recommended!

Review_Date: Dejan wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Very pleasant atmosphere in Marcelona restaurant enjoyed good paella and desserts can recommend red Marrocan wine Eclipse very good staff and special thanks to Diego and Khadija who made our two dinners there very enjoyable!

Review_Date: Razvan B wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: When checking out we found on the bill almost 1000 euros added extra. One extra night was charged despite the fact that the full holidays were already paid bills from the restaurant that did not belong to us were charged without our signature the New Year dinner was charged twice and our credit card was biulled without our authorisation. The programme announced for the New Year dinner was a complete lie and almost nothing was respected starting with the duration of the party and ending with the programme itself. All above was consideredd by the hotel staff as an error!!!! Several errors amounting to 1000 euros. All attempts to have qualified responses failed. We intend to address the competent authorities in Maroc for serious fraud. There is no good choice for having a dinner in the restaurant; Only one option available with a meny that does not change at all.

Review_Date: Josef B wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: We stayed at the hotel in early January. We had a bigger one in the building opposite the spa. We have been very pleased with the treatment from the hotel.    We trained and used their spa daily.    I want to thank a person named Abdel Rahman who works at the gym. He was there and helped us with the training in the mornings and his genius commitment and his personality was super. We are glad we met him.    Hopefully we will come back in sha Allah.

Review_Date: Peter h wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: I stayed here for 10days over New Years with my family. The staff are fantastic and are the reason I give it 5 stars. They are friendly helpful and just really nice people (as all Moroccan‚Äôs we met were). They consistently went out of their way to make our holiday relaxing and enjoyable. In particular the staff around pool with special mention for Anas and Amine. The staff in the kids club were also very good and our 3 children enjoyed going there for a couple of hours each day giving us sometime to relax. The cleaners did a great job with the room beautifully made up and spotless every day. Only issue I had with the hotel was the lack of information on the hotel and Marrakech in the rooms. There is no guest directory or room service menu in the room (a menu was dropped to room on request).  To sum up the friendly staff lovely rooms kids club and heated swmmming pool make it a great choice for a relaxing family holiday.

Review_Date: Doris-Nonso wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: We moved to this hotel after a bit so good experience at Four Seasons Marrakech. I loved the whole ambience of the hotel it has everything you need for a good price. The staff where super friendly and professional at the same time. Ibitisam at breakfast enthusiastically designed our plates with beautiful Moroccan art. They bedspreads and restrooms were very clean. It was a bit chilly this January so glad the pool was heated.  They however need to upgrade the twin beds not so comfortable.

Review_Date: Zzzabou wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: A wonderful hotel with an efficient and friendly staff!
Review_Text: We spent 4 nights in this hotel during the Christmas holidays and enjoyed our stay for many reasons and in particular for the location the ambiance of the hotel and its amazing staff and facilities. We could swim in the large and warm swimming pool had relaxing massages in the beautiful spa and we had excellent lunches and dinners in the various restaurants. The staff advised us on many activities to do in Marrakech and areas to visit. I really recommend this hotel to discover this city and spend relaxing holidays.

Review_Date: Rich Burden wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Whilst on the whole this hotel has a great location good facilities the staff let it down.    I stayed there for 4 nights and it always felt like I was an inconvenience to the team there.    Food quality very good and outdoor pool stunning.    I placed a shirt in for dry cleaning one morning to where that evening but the shirt never made it back even by the next day no shirt.    The hotel couldn‚Äôt care less that they had lost a brand New shirt.

Review_Date: hotsyd22 wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: A really nice hotel... 20 years ago
Review_Text: The Movenpick Marrakech is a very large hotel with hundreds of rooms. When you arrive the lobby is quite impressive but depending on where your room is it is quite a walk to the room.    Our room itself was ok. The room had had some superficial renovation (new carpets wooden trims paint etc). The bathroom however was original. The (separate) toilet needed replacing. Indeed the porcelain had cracks and there was scale which had built up over the last 20 or so years which was not befitting the rest of the room.    The common areas of the hotel need more than some basic TLC. The lifts are slow damaged and unpredictable. They need to be replaced. The paint in the hallways was scuffed and needs re-painting. The breakfast restaurant too had seen better days. In the scheme of things these are not large investments to replace for a hotel of this size and standing.    Our room package included half-board. The dinner was really good and we enjoyed it. It included a 4-course al a carte Moroccan menu. The breakfast on the other hand was disappointing. Not only was the breakfast restaurant tired looking the food was mediocre and the scale of the resort (with just one buffet area) meant it was was like a school cafeteria. Long lines crowds and it was not an enjoyable experience.    The hotel gym was really good. It was busy (not the fault of the hotel) and had a good selection of equipment. The pool was large. We did not use the spa.    Had our room not included half board I would have been disappointed with the US$250/night we had paid especially considering the choices available in Marrakech. That said I would probably not choose to stay at the Movenpick again.
