Although the facilities are reasonable (if dated) the staff service was consistently poor and without the warmth unlike elsewhere we stayed in Morocco. Not only was the service cold it was inefficient. For a hotel of this size there was just one person processing guests checking out. We waited 15 minutes in a queue just to check out. Retrieving our luggage from the luggage room was also an ordeal. The concierge was never there when we were looking for him.    Indeed the service was so off that the staff didn't even wait around for tips when you would expect them too - tips must be so seldom that they don't even bother.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Remus Colombo wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: I Was in this hotel for the christmas holiday with my family and it was a very nice exeperience... hotel beautiful and very comfortable! ...We‚Äôd like to say many thanks to HIND the receptionist that organize us two incredible excursions! Hope to be in this hotel in a future! RACCOMENDED A LOT!!

Review_Date: Sascha Rogivue wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Mohammed Amin is the best personal trainer I‚Äôve met so far. Motivative energetic and humorous to work with. Also learnt several new techniques and how to focus on specific muscle groups. Real talented guy and he knows what he‚Äôs doing.    Hope to meet him again and gather some more experience to take home!    Definitely deserves 5/5.

Review_Date: Amaan wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: Poor service bar some great individuals
Review_Text: The hotels accommodation is top class. The facilities like spa and gym were excellent the decor is often beautiful rooms are basic but they‚Äôre neat and tidy - I can‚Äôt ask for more basically. Moreover the location is excellent: 5-10 mins drive to airport and a 5-10 mins walk to train station and shopping mall (which includes McDonalds and KFC for those who can‚Äôt hack the Moroccan cuisine)  My only problem is the service. Any complaints u have with the room don‚Äôt expect them to sort it out. I had a lizard crawl into my room. Called the staff 4 times after 2 hours nobody came and I had to sort it out myself.  If u get locked out from your room don‚Äôt expect them to help you. There is no urgency at that hotel and even more worrying there is no sense of responsibility. From experience my mother was locked out of her room due to a faulty key card provided to her by reception. When she called staff nobody came to help her and when she called the manager he eventually hung up on her because he can‚Äôt handle a complaint. This is embarrassing and a testament to the lack of care the staff have towards the guests.  That being said there were a few exceptions. There were some excellent individuals that were so brilliant they almost compensated for my experience. Namely Mohammed Amine who worked as an excellent and highly excuberant gym trainer. He was keen enthusiastic and urgent when it came to helping me in the spa/gym. He was a great lad to chat to and one of the silver linings of this hotel. Thank you to him for creating a great and fun experience for me and my family.

Review_Date: Diana wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: I have stayed at this hotel before and so while on my business trip with my business partner Jaouad I suggested we go to the hotel‚Äôs New Years Eve buffet dinner. The advertisement for the dinner buffet suggested we call to make a reservation which my partner did and was told that a reservation was not required. So of course we showed up for dinner...and guess what we are told we need a reservation. My partner called back the reservation number we had called earlier in the day while in the hotel restaurant entrance and requested to speak with management. Anyway nothing was done to rectify the situation. The sad part was that we are in the tourism business here in Morocco and was planning to book our future clients here. However if this is the level of customer server my clients would be subjected to I don‚Äôt think I will book this hotel. Well..now we are driving around trying to find someplace to eat at 11:00 in the evening New Year eve. Happy New Year!

Review_Date: Yasmin2141 wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Ok...on first impressions the hotel looks nice it was clean and looked impressive.    In the colder weather the main pool is cold!!..even tho is ‚Äúsupposedly‚Äù heated to 25-26 degrees...u are shivering this was one of the reasons I‚Äôd choosen this hotel as my son likes to swim in the pools but I greatly disappointed I think he managed 10 minutes on the entirety of our 4 day stay!    The bar located next to the pool was terrible at customer service you can sit there no-one comes over..the staff were always miserable and moody especially the older men working there...they were the same mood it seemed afternoon or evening!!  they could do with some lessons is hospitalility.    We had a superior room these rooms are located at the back of the building (a little walk tbh) the room however was nice clean spacious and comfortable. The room cleaning ladies were very nice.    I was on a bed and breakfast package however the breakfast did not impress me...the breakfast resturant is very busy with a shortage of inside seating and looked a little unorganised to me...there would be women and a few men dressed in smart clothes whom I can only assume were managers but did very little except moan at the waiters.  The waiters at breakfast were very busy u could see it in there behaviour...this impacted anything ud asked for took a long time to come ie a cup of tea. I‚Äôd go around 10am and that was my experience every time.    Kids club was great..my son enjoyed being there and the kids club staff were all very nice. Thank you.    The spa is nice I had a royal hamam with Iqbal it was a difference experience but the hot slab I laided on was too hot which Iqbal did notify the soa reception about but the temperature had not yet been fixed...apart from that it was enjoyable not relaxing tho as the extra hot slab ruined my experience alittle. Iqbal was very nice and accommodating.    I enclose pics of a superior room ‚Äúgarden view‚Äù

Review_Date: Adel Elhardouzi wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: I‚Äôm staying at this hotel next time I visit Marrakesh...
Review_Text: This is a gorgeous hotel I had a wonderful time. Nice and clean rooms and the staff who went out of there way to make my stay feel like home. The front desk agent Souhail was very accommodating helpful and excellent.  Next door to the Convention Center (Palais des Congr√®s) close to downtown Marrakesh train station and restaurants... place to be!!!

Review_Date: bilobrown wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: I'll never forget this place. Beautiful and all that but when i needed their simple service when i was ill they didnt help at all. I called for an urgent wheelchair 3 times when i was rushed to hospital no one acted.

Review_Date: Mian Mohsin wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Amazing stay at the Movenpick Hotel Mansour Eddahbi Marrakech. Weather was great - sunny warm enough to sun bathe and swim. Staff were amazing - especially anas at pool who were hugely attentive and helpful. restaurants and Bar and a Spa will satisfy all your needs. room our room located in masouda building was clean with amazing amenities  special thanks for the room made Soukaina for its turndown service and for its beautiful smile .Also a complete gym with ultra modern cardio machines. Highly recommended!

Review_Date: Pasc_L wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Great stay at Movenpick Marrekech. The staff were really really nice and welcoming. I particularly enjoyed the spa and fitness area. I did a series of deep tissue mssages - great :)... A special thank you to Mohammed Amin - sport coach at the fitness centre who is a great motivator.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: alifiyan wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel close to the old and new town
Review_Text: We are a group of 8 adults and 8 kids and stayed at this property during the X mas season this year. It‚Äôs a beautiful hotel with a great location and ambience.    We had asked for connecting rooms as we have small kids however we were given two separate rooms with a common lobby in the middle. This was acceptable but may not be the best with very small kids.    An important thing to note here is that the elevators are small and very scary and we would not recommend using them. The sensors on the doors do not work and the doors tend to bang they also open up sometimes thus we would suggest to avoid using the lifts in the main building.    The breakfast spread is very very nice. They have hot meals fresh juice and other juices a variety of teas and coffees and hot chocolate for the kids as well as a traditional corner serving Moroccan tea and pancakes. Fruits and curds are not to be missed. A variety of breads cornflakes dates cheese and a live counter for eggs. The staff are very hospitable and ensure you have a good fill.    Would also highly recommend the Morroccan hamam at the in house spa. They are clean and great but difficult to get in without a prior appointment. Amal at the spa counter is tremendously helpful. Please be aware that though entrances are separate for men and women - you will see men and women walking around inside freely in robes and using the steam room and common facilities which may be disconcerting for some.    Beware of the concierge who tries to book you in the Riad by lotus spa and our husbands had an awful experience there !    All in all a good hotel with some ups and downs.

Review_Date: Maggie K wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Lovely Staff, Comfortable Beds, Nice Pools, Best Massage
Review_Text: It's not a 5* hotel in the true sense: Things are slightly run-down; there isn't turn-down service; it can take a long time to get a response when you call for anything from housekeeping to concierge. Breakfast is fine not amazing. Terrible coffee! Food in general isn't the best.    BUT    The great stuff:    1. The staff from the restaurants to the spa to the kids club are wonderful. SO kind so helpful. Special shoutouts to:  Khadija from Marcelona restaurant who is so sweet and even gave my daughter a free couscous and veggies dish (off-menu special) one night.  Touria Nheza and Basma from the kids' club. They made my children feel so welcome. They both loved going there. One night I was late coming back from the Medina with my daughter (rush hour traffic) and Touria stayed with my son for nearly an hour past regular closing time for the club.  Khalid from the lunch restaurant. Always smiling and thoughtful. The entire staff from manager to waiters were wonderful at the lunch restaurant.  All the hostesses at Marcelona. They're lovely and sweet.    I got one of the best massages of my LIFE here. At first I was a little disappointed but as soon as I spoke up and asked for special attention to my problem areas my therapist took all the time necessary to get out all the kinks.    I will say that the front-desk staff was the least friendly and helpful compared to everyone else. I'm not sure why but they do not have the same open vibe as the rest of the hotel.    My children loved it here and want to come back immediately. It's definitely a family hotel. I don't think couples would enjoy it as much but it's perfect for a family.

Review_Date: J J M wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: A beautiful Hotel with first class service
Review_Text: I stayed for two nights at the Marrakesh Movenpick which is just a few minutes away from the Medina. The hotel is a place of calm from which you can venture forth to the total confusion of the Marrakesh Medina. The hotel has 5 restaurants but I only ate the breakfast at the hotel. Srrvice and food were very good.

Review_Date: Shez03 wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: I‚Äôm currently staying here & it‚Äôs a beautiful hotel. That‚Äôs where it ends.  The service is the worst I‚Äôve ever experienced. I‚Äôve been here for 3 days so far. The problems have been...    Electricity goes off in the room on Xmas day takes over 2 hours for someone to change the fuse. I‚Äôve called 3 times & even went to reception. The 4th time I start getting agitated with reception & within minutes it‚Äôs gitten repaired.    Key cards are awful- it stopped working the room was too far from reception so I called them to send someone to let me in. I desperately needed to get in & stated urgency but waited over 45 minutes. After many calls & then a huge rant they sent someone. - again I had to resort to being agitated before someone sorts things out. Oh & the best part- I asked to speak to a manger to complain & because I was angry at being kept waited & explained that to him he hung up the phone on me mid sentence! Never experienced such unprofessional an.    I asked for my kids to be out on the same floor as me- nope- On another floor. Even after numerous emails to request same floor.    Needed extra blanket called a few times but no one came!  Had a gekko in the room. Asked someone to remove it- no one came.  Asked for water cups - not had any still waiting.    1st night I put a sign for room to get cleaned- guess what ... no one came to clean.  Kids room had ants in the bathroom. That was sorted & they were moved.    I‚Äôm Here with family for 5 nights & ive never experiencd such difficulties it‚Äôs extremly upsetting & not relaxing at all.    The pool staff wouldn‚Äôt allow us to move the sun beds but 30 mins later someone else asked & they did for them?!  There not many sunloungers in this hotel- especially considering the size of hotel.    I‚Äôll try find positives the rooms are lovely- but beds actually are terrible- dip in the middle however  The best thing about the room is the shower. The best I‚Äôve ever experienced in a hotel.  Reception area is lovely but sorry to say this but the staff are not well trained & don‚Äôt know how to deal with any issues.  I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this hotel to anyone. Stay elsewhere. There are others on this stretch that look just as nice- I doubt service there could be any worse

Review_Date: Ziad El wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Great hotel great gym/martial art instructor (mohamed amine)  very professional helping everybodydon‚Äôt hesitate to ask him for advices helped me get my motivation back d√©cent breakfast too  The whole experience was pleasing

Review_Date: Sophia Sultan wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Spectacular service and gorgeous hotel. In particular restaurant manager Jawed went above and beyond to ensure we had a fantastic time. It was my little girls birthday and Jawed made sure she was made to feel like a princess. Absolutely splendid and can not recommend enough. Attentive staff such as Affaf at reception made our stay very enjoyable. If there were more stars I would. All very beautiful.

Review_Date: moud85 wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: I always enjoy staying at this hotel. The highlight for me this time was the excellent Fitness Center and Spa facilitates. Mohamed Amin was a fantastic instructor and highly recommended for anyone needing a holiday workout!

Review_Date: Gopal Chopra wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: a very nice hotel to stay  very scenic and the staff are polite...Good spacious rooms and very good service . the room service in particular is very efficient.  the front desk is cooperative and friendly .  the restaurants are good ..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: X Y wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Enjoyed my stay here comfortable rooms and excellent service by Amine Kenza and Shaimae at the Movenpick Cafe - delighting us each morning! Kasbah like architecture and intriguing banksy grafitti at each corner.

Review_Date: hajooj wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Mohamed was amazing at coaching and making me a program that I can go home with!  I came into the gym to do a lazy morning run and he turned it into two days of personalized training aimed and long term targets.

Review_Date: JonathanKingOfHits wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Fantastic hotel; 5 star quality; 3 star prices.
Review_Text: Amazing hotel; beautiful classy and with superb service. Lovely rooms great pools and restaurants - very much amongst the best in Marrakech and far less expensive than others. Huge but still with fine personalised attention.

Review_Date: peterele wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Had a 4 night stay in this hotel and it was great! Beautiful hotel fantastic rooms great location and staff. Visited the gym and met Mohammed Amin who gave me a personal training session in the gym friendly guy and great workout!    Only minus is that the WIFI could be better.

Review_Date: Elena S wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: I spent 3 weeks at the movenpick hotelrooms are spacious and clean breakfast is good and gym and spa also. In those days I‚Äôve been several time at the gym mostly cause there‚Äôs a very good instructor (Mohammed Amin) that really push you up to the limit  he‚Äôs very gently and professional. He choose for me a perfect workout and I saw my body changes! So best hotel!

Review_Date: Riccardo F wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: I did 3 weeks in this hotel and I am here to write a good review for the hotel in general but I want to say that the gym service is amazing Mohamad the trainer is very kind and professional he teachs very well the body exercises and he takes care off you all the time usually I don‚Äôt like the gym but here I went every day and Mohamad did a very great job. So... go to the gym and ask for mohamad trainer.

Review_Date: Robert C wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Perhaps the best hotel in Marrakech
Review_Text: We had reserved seven nights at the near-by Le Meridien a hotel not worthy of this famous and fine chain. So we checked out the first morning after a very unpleasant "welcome" by a snooty and unhelpful staff and went searching after breakfast for another hotel. We were very fortunate to find this jewel the Movenpick on the same avenue and the lovely Hivernage neighborhood as the Meridien. Although quite a bit more expensive it was worth every penny! The public areas are grand but in a truly elegant way the room most comfortable with a state-of-the-art bathroom a charming balcony and best of all perhpas a superb breakfast included in the room rate. Special mention must be made regarding a breakfast room employee NAIMA who excels in her attentiveness to detail courtesy solicitude for every need and desire of the guests and her good English. This lady richly deserves a promotion and every consideration the chain can give her; indeed Movenpick is very lucky to have her on staff. Thanks Naima for making our stay in Marrakech a truly joyous one. Hope to see you again

Review_Date: SophNA18 wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Beautiful decor in the hotel. The service was great. Very helpful hotel staff. The breakfast buffet was average really. Better food in the hotel restaurants. Enjoyed my stay here. Had a great massage at the spa. Nothing bad to say really. Rated 4 star because I thought the breakfast wasn‚Äôt that good. The room was super clean and bed was sooooo comfy. Would stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tarikdelyon wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: My family and I had a wonderful time in this hotel. The staff are really helpful especially when they see u with children. I want to thank basma and her team for taking care of my 2 boys in their kindergarten. I also had great time training with Mohamed Amine in the gym. He really cares about his customers and know how to motivate them to push the limits. Don‚Äôt not hesitate to ask him personal advise he is very kind and helpful and a great coach !! Hope to see u soon

Review_Date: Mariya wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: We came to Movenpick to celebrate my husbands birthday we was greeted at the front of the hotel by the wonderful staff very professional. We fell in love walking through the beautiful entrance leading to the reception. The staff at the reception was so nice and friendly especially Nadia who was always willing to help with anything!    Checking in was super fast and went straight into our room. I was a little upset that the hotel did not do anything for my partners birthday as i already sent a request via email and also contacted booking.com to call the hotel which they did and Movenpick did send a email back saying a cake would be put out with a lovely surprise but it was not done.    Also the window in the toilet was broke so on the same evening within being in the room for 15mins we had to call reception and was changed into another room straight away.    I emailed booking.com about the hotel not staying to its word and booking.com contacted myself and the hotel the following day. The hotel then left use a lovely fruit bowl and decorated the bed and also came in with a cake 2 days after the birthday.    The breakfast is amazing with variety of choices to choose from.    The cleaning young lady was just Amazing she cleaned the room everyday and the shower spotless she should get paid more!! Shes so good!    Overall this hotel is beautiful the facilities and service are great! Its great for all ages and for family‚Äôscouplesyoung&old it caters for all! I have had a wonderful and the most pleasant stay in this hotel and will be looking forward to coming back.    Thank you very much for your hospitality and kindness to all Movenpick staff‚ù§Ô∏è  From maria and rizwan
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: CoJoR wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Great hotel - very close to the city centre and the old city.  Staff were very cool - lots of helpful assistance and offers to advise and make things more comfortable  Bedroom was immaculate every day. The cleaning staff did a very cool and thorough clean - like seriously :) pulled out the beds and washed under them etc. Amazing  A special thanks to Houda Saltina who was always so helpful at breakfast and at the restaurant  Pool and facilities were great

Review_Date: noodlesverge wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Gate 1 Tour: Impressive but not Impressive
Review_Text: We stayed at the Movenpick Hotel Mansour for 2 nights as part of our Gate 1 Tour of Morocco. Overall the hotel looks very fancy and refined and it is for the most part but there were a few things that could be improved.    First off the property is huge many buildings many rooms a sprawling footprint. Even the main lobbies were a maze of hallways. We were placed in building 1 which is most likely their group building. Rooms were of adequate size maybe a bit small. We had a toilet that leaked water all night so we needed to keep the bathroom door closed. You will be happy to know the shower is Western! Best shower of the trip!    Movenpick offered free wifi but the wifi sucked--it was easy to connect to but slower than molasses. We did get good connections out in the courtyard and breakfast restaurant but it would have been so much better if it worked in the rooms.    Also there is not an ATM on the property. It was a about a 10 minute walk across the street to get cash. Make sure you have some with you or feel comfortable crossing the streets!    The included breakfast was the best on the trip with an omelette station and a full array of fresh breakfast foods. (Moroccan eggs taste just a little different from USA eggs!)    The highlight for us was the poolside bar. Lights were dimmed there was some background music and the external heaters were turned on. Service was a bit slower and prices were closer to $10 for a glass of wine and $13 for a cocktail.    Overall Movenpick was a pretty OK hotel a few changes and it would have been dynamite!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Delia M wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: I just wanted to thank the care takes at the Kids club at the Movenpick Hotel in Marrakesh specifically Basma who took such good care of my child. My daughter wanted to be there all day. They did arts and crafts treasure hunts face painting and the list goes on.... I was able to leave my daughter and leave the resort feeling relaxed and enjoy some adult time on my vacation. Thank you all so much for giving me some time and entertaining my daughter we will always remember the love warmth and kindness!

Review_Date: annakJ3917CR wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: We had an amazing holiday in M√∂venpick Marrakech. Hotel‚Äôs architecture and decoration is breathtaking and whole area is quiet and beautiful. Breakfast was delicious room was clean and hotel‚Äôs staff was so kind to us. Especially I want to thank waiter Mouchine and amazing personal trainer in the gym. Only bad thing was wifi connection -it didn‚Äôt work well in our room. Still I would like to recommend this hotel highly for everyone who adores beautiful design and good service. Thank you!

Review_Date: esmeeluiken wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Last week my husband and I arrived in Marrakech for the first time. We travelled to Marrakech to get married and were extremely excited. The moment that we arrived at the hotel we were absolutely impressed because the M√∂venpick is such a gorgeous hotel on the outside and inside. The moment we were checking in the staff told us that our suite had a technical issue and that we had to wait. So we waited. After an hour of still waiting I asked the reception if we could maybe get some tea or coffee. That wasn't an immediate yes she had to discuss that with the manager. Ultimately we got coffee while waiting. After two hours I started to get seriously irritated because no one offered us anything we just had to wait. No communication at all.    After those two hours we decided to talk to a manager since the reception didn't felt the urge to take care of us. From that moment on everything started to get better. The manager immediately apoligized and took us to one of the hotel restaurants. There we met assistent manager Hafsa who completely brightned up our evening. We were offered a dinner and Hafsa and her staff did a great job. She was very professional and informed us on all the things that we could do during our stay in Marrakech. The whole staff there was interested in us apoligized again and the food and service were extremely good.    The rest of our stay was as good. Breakfast is good the suite was extremely beautiful and comfortable the housekeeping ladies were sweethearts and the day we celebrated our wedding there the hotel decorated our room in honeymoon style. I would recommend this hotel for sure just ask for a manager fast if something happens because the reception doesn't communicate very well and is not trained enough to deliver exceptional customer care.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Daydream47522921219 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Excellent personal trainer in this gym. He approached me and was very keen to help plan my workout for the day. He was extremely motivating and very professional. If anyone is a gym goer please ask for Mohammed he is very willing to help and gave me the best workout I have had in a long time.

Review_Date: BrianGreenhalgh wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Stayed here for my birthday trip    The hotel is very nice indeed with great pools and gardens.  The rooms are very good with plenty of room and balconies. We had the junior suit which was Fantastic  All the staff at the hotel were excellent and could not be faulted.  The breakfast was very good with a great choice. We ate lunch 1 day and this also was fantastic in the buffet section  We ate at the Spanish restaurant which we felt could have been better and this is why it‚Äôs not a five marking.    Would come again for sure 100%
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: louardisamir wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Marcelona restaurant at Movenpick Hotel . This Restaurant is just amazing.One of our top restaurant experiences The food is delicious and their service is fantastic. Staff are so friendly and attentive.definitely exceed our expectations
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Navigate45632874021 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Great international standard hotel that reflect the arabic style.  Good services nice decoration good restaurants gym bar... !  The breakfast was on top and the personel was really helpful specially Kenza hostess at Saray restaurant .I will come back for sure. Thanks for everything

Review_Date: Philip H wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Money was removed from my room - very uncooperative management in dealing with my complaint - Got the impression that they felt my complaint was trivial. The issue is NOT about the amount 'misappropriated' [THEFT ] but about the Fact that this happened at this establishment AND the ATTITUDE of the management of the hotel in NOT being willing to deal with it~  Oh ...there is also no CCTV camera footage available on the floors !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Thakhie R wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Special Thanks to Touria and the friendly team at the kids club for taking care of our daughter ensuring that she was safe and entertained during our stay here. She absolutely loved her time there and couldn't wait to return each day.

Review_Date: Benmoussa Jaafar wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Thank you Movenpick Staff, specially Houda Saltani (restaurant staff)
Review_Text: I recently stayed at the Movenpick and I was very impressed with all the services and staff. Especially I want to compliment Houda Saltani who made sure we were very well looked after during breakfast and lunch by the poolside bar.  The hotel is amazing and deserves its five stars. Well done to the team.  I would highly recommend this hotel because it is close to the centre and old city - all a little walk or a short taxi ride.  Thanks guys!

Review_Date: jamescoucou wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: This hotel is a certified 5 star. The hotel arranged my transfer from the airport to the hotel. The service is excellent. It reflects the hospitality of the locals. It was always a warm welcome 24/7. I would like to commend Naima from the buffet restaurant she is so kind and looked after me during my breakfast what a way to start your day in Marrakech. Concierge could also arrange tours for you. I just hope that the hotel could organize free shuttle to the Medina if possible. In any case Medina is not far from the hotel and taxi is affordable. Menara Mall is just 10 minutes away from the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants along Avenue Mohammed VI. I went for dinner at the Marcelona restaurant in the hotel food and service are awesome. Shout out to the staff of this resto i could speak to them in English/French and Spanish.  Keep it up!

Review_Date: windvalley wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Quite good but could be excellent
Review_Text: Stayed 7 nights at the hotel. Location we found to be very good - Walking distance to the markets in the old part of town but far enough not to be in it all the time.    The lobby of the hotel was very nice but oir building Zinade definitrly in need of some repairs. The elevator carpets had partially come off. Our room was on the 5th floor but the view of the aircon units and piping didnt make us want to sit on the terrace. For such rooms probably shouldnt even have a terrace. We found the room nice enough with a large bathroom. Two things about the room were not good: it got extremely hot at night (despite temps of max 12C) and there was noise from the machinery on the rooftop. I am guessing this also caused the heat in the room. Opening a door was not an option unless we want to awaked before sunrise by the minaret nearby.  The pool area is lovely and thought the pool area service was also good. The bar by the pool was fine but often no one can to take drink orders for 10 minutes.  Breakfast was sufficient and the personnel there extremely friendly and service oriented. We also loved the resident cats on the property and the ladies taking care of them in the kids room wonderful.  What made me actually take the rating down to 3 from 4 was the restaurant. We ate dinner on our last evening and the food was pre cooked not really warm and tasteless. The service was ok but the prices were way too high for this quality. They need to work on this.  Decent stay but some improvements could take this to be a strong 4 star hotel on european standards.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nauman wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: I recently stayed in the Movenpick hotel with my family and had a great time there one of the highlights of our trip was the visit to the Kids Club within the hotel where one of the staff member Touria helped lookafter our children they absolutely loved spending time with Touria who performed different activities like  cooking face painting dancing treasure hunting gardening colouring and much more.    Touria has a great personality and her interaction with our children was amazing so I would highly recommend anyone visitng Marrakech to stay in this hotel and definitely take their kids to the Kids Club and have them make their trip memorable by spending time with the friendly staff there especially Touria.    Thank You Touria for all the good work you are doing pls keep it up... well done...

Review_Date: SmoothieBurton wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: A chandelier that Sia would be proud of!
Review_Text: I have visited Marrakech a few times and always tend to try different hotels whilst visiting Morocco. Having heard a mixture of reviews my friend had booked this hotel and therefore I decided to stay here. The hotel is located within the Hivernage area of Marrakech and is walking distance from the station and the Menara Mall.    Without doubt the entrance and the grounds of this hotel are amazing. The artwork (Banksy style) makes it even more intriguing and adds to the large display of artwork around the hotel. The chandelier in the main lounge is simply beautiful and the concierge explained the names of each of the difference sections of rooms located around the hotel which I found interesting.    Unfortunately as many have explained the rooms were a tad underwhelming. My friend originally had a room booked in the main section of the hotel however due to an issue the room had to be changed and we were then moved to the outside section of the hotel. Which was fine however the room was quite small for a twin bedded room. I found the cushions to be too soft (however this is down to personal preference) and more hangers for clothes would have been ideal. That said the room was clean (thank you housekeeping) and had the necessary amenities that was required.    I did not use the gym whilst I was there however my friend did and was very pleased with the array of equipment that was available.    The breakfast in the morning in the Sarai restaurant was perfect. The display of Moroccan plates on the walls were beautiful and there was a large selection of food to cater to all your requirements.    The service provided in the restaurant was super! Mohamed Bachiri (waiter) in particular was amazing. Whilst I was there for my stay he really looked after me and other guests. From making sure we had tea and coffee in the morning to even remembering my breakfast routine! He always served with a smile and nothing was too much trouble. His customer service was amazing and even explained the artwork on the walls he is an asset to the restaurant within the hotel.    I unfortunately did not have time to have dinner in the restaurant due to being out quite late exploring Marrakech however I did manage to have late night drinks at the Manso bar. The bar was wonderful with dark mood lighting and upbeat music it was a great space to sit and relax after a lot of walking! The barman Hamza (wears glasses) was super! He really took care to make sure me and my friend had drinks and always had a big smile on his face. Hamza took time to talk and explain more about the hotel and his customer service was better than what I have experienced in London bars. He provided me with suggestions on places to visit in Marrakech and from start to finish nothing was too much trouble. He really is an asset to the hotel.    To conclude I agree with previous reviews on the hotel rooms could be revamped however the grounds and the super service of the staff in the hotel make up for this and would visit again.

Review_Date: Angela H wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: this was our first time visiting Marrakech and this hotel certainly did contribute to a fabulous mini break!    Our suite was just perfect - a large walk in wardrobe huge bathroom and a comfy bed. The only downside that I can highlight was the noise from the nightclub opposite and the associated view from our balcony!    The extensive breakfast buffet ensured that there was something for everyone.    Service was a tad slower than I would have liked but it did not impact our break.    Point to note - the hairdryer supplied was not very effective take your own.

Review_Date: Michelle wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Front Desk employees should be more courteous when gusts are checking-in.... They should strive to provide the best "1st impression". The check in process was so so - they were all busy chatting between them instead of attending all of us who were in line....Then only one employee ended up helping the long waiting-line...Front desk should also be more tactful and nice with guests.

Review_Date: Ameera Al Araimi wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: It was my first time visiting Marrakech as a winner from Movenpick Hotel JBR Dubai & I‚Äôm blessed to this opportunity that I have had to visit this beautiful Marrakech.    Everything went smoothly & up to the standards starting from the arrival & ending to the departure.    All staff was very blessed & hospitalized from the doormen concierge reception housekeeping restaurant in room dining call centre & gym.    I felt that I‚Äôm in my second home & enjoyed a lot.    Restaurant has had the most delicious Moroccan authentic food that I will never forget the taste of it.    The experience with the tourist tours was absolutely great & I enjoyed every moment either in Marrakech or even during our stay at Movenpick Hotel Casablanca.    I‚Äôll definitely repeat my visit to beautiful Morocco.    Thank you Movenpick Hotel JBR Dubai for this opportunity.

Review_Date: Namarta T wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Fantastic hotel with the best kids club! Our 3 children didn‚Äôt want to leave! Special mention to Touria and Basma from the Kids club for their outstanding care and especially Touria who babysat on 2 nights. Highly recommended.

Review_Date: Hinna H wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: The Kids Club at the Movenpick was highly useful and entertaining for my children. The kids loved it here and it was a great place to drop them off and pick them up during the day. The staff were extremely friendly 3 ladies named Touria Nazha and Basma looked after the kids very well and were always there to entertain them. Lunch was provided by kitchen staff who always had a smile on their face and stayed positive. Their programme through the day was impeccable it included cooking face painting dancing treasure hunting gardening colouring and much more. Overall the visit was wonderful and Kids Club was a great aspect to the hotel.

Review_Date: UdoLandow wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: M√∂venpick Hotel Marrakech is a wonderful place to relax and enjoy your vacation. The rooms are very spacious and equipped with all your heart needs. With 503 rooms and suites it spreads out on a huge terrain you need a while to get to your room. The walk through most wonderful kept gardens and greenery is a dream.  The six restaurants and Bars and a Spa will satisfy all your needs.    Most wonderful the different 4 !! pool areas where you can enjoy the day in the sun or under the umbrella. On the pool-side as well restaurants and bars with great service.    Specially for families a great deal ‚Äì you will find a kids club as well as a pool for kids and many other amenities.    I enjoyed my time at M√∂venpick very much and can highly recommend the place.

Review_Date: Shawn G wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Love this hotel. Turia Basma Nezha really looked after our girls during our stay. The gardening added a nice twist to the ball park and arts and craft activities. Highly reccomended! Great family escape.

Review_Date: Lin S wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: We were a party of 12 chaps played golf and us ladies were there for a relaxing few days. We were in block 7 room 7407 lovely room not such a nice view of the car park. Balcony door didn‚Äôt lock.....The rooms in this block are noisy at night particularly early hours as the night club across the way closes early hours particularly bad on a Friday night/Saturday morning. Hotel accommodated 2 couples moving rooms but not all of us which was disappointing. We only eat in the hotel at lunchtime and breakfast unfortunately lunch was very slow although the food was good when it arrived. We also struggled to get an itemised bar bill early evening before we went out.    The breakfast area and food was lovely. You do need to do something about the coffee machine queues especially staff jumping in before guests?    You really do need to get cabs to get around always haggle with the taxis or they will rip you off!    Pool area was great.    The only other issue was getting a late check out. The lady dealing with us was rude and very unhelpful. I had to ask and then wait for the reservation manager for us to extend our room by 3 hrs you seemed to have to fight for anything other than the norm I did feel they could have been more helpful as we had spent 5 nights in a very noisy room!    Hotel grounds are lovely clean and kept well.

Review_Date: Sharon R wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Enjoyed a 5 night stay at the Movenpick. There is a lot to like about it. Rooms are spacious and quiet in building 7. Big balcony to enjoy and the bathrooms are quite large. Pools spa and main lobby areas are quite lovely. All staff are friendly and helpful. Two major setbacks stops me from rating it 5 stars. Room wifi was horrible. I asked for it to be checked but don‚Äôt think it was. The property is so large not sure they have enough routers. Perhaps an IT expert can check this for them. It was very annoying having to always go closer to the lobby area to get good wifi. The second issue was restaurants. For dinner only one good option for a large property. Would have been nice to have another option for guests who don‚Äôt want to leave the property. Other than that good hotel with potential to be great.

Review_Date: Picoarchoun wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: It s all about the Marcelona restaurant and its amazing authentic Spanish food and great service. I was invited to eat out with some business partner who were Spanish and really missed their food and it was very satisfying for them and me. The decor is so chic and the colors are so welcoming and as soon as we got in the staff and manager took great care of us we felt welcomed and comfortable which is rare these days. We ordered lots of food to share and taste and it was just delicious and had to order more just to try other dishes. The deserts were tasty and very well presented so I would say Kudos to the Chefs for a perfect meal and Big thanks to the staff and manager for really making me and my clients feel like home.

Review_Date: Bahia Alaoui wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: As i l visiting marrakech one of my friend from qatar advise me to visit Marcelona restaurant because she knows that i like Spanish food it was a great experience the food was so tasty especially the paella and the pil-pil the staff are very friendly the service was excellent the atmosphere is amazing unfortunately i will recommend this restaurant to all my friends.

Review_Date: Florian254 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: The good, the bad and the ugly
Review_Text: Location: In the middle of an area which is full of Hotels some 50-70 Dirhams away from the main attractions.    Room: The good a very nice room big and spacious a very nice bath and shower with nearly all in that you could expect. Serious problems with stocking/restocking the Minibar. The ugly: The room was in a building at the far end of the real estate and no umbrellas are available. Going from the reception to your room could get you soaked.    Food: The Spanish Restaurant had good food good drinks and good service. The breakfast is a mixed bag when it was full long lines for the coffee developed quickly. For a Hotel of that size nothing specacular. Room Service was fast and delivered good Quality    Public Areas: A large pool fo which 2/3rds are pretty flat otherwise a bit overdesigned but well kept.    Sevice: This is the main reason why only two stars. You want to have the minbar stocked up: Can take two hours to not get anything and two more to have only slightly more. You want to eat? Even the reception does not know that the buffetrestaurant is closed. Cleaning your table at breakfast? Randomly. You want to check out? Be Aware that there is only one person there to check you out and the other people at the reception don¬¥t do it. And do not expect the bill to be correct.    I had literally three employees at the pool area watching me while I was trying to get a sunumbrella up. And for two hours no person from the bar was able to walk around and get some orders.    All in all: I would not go there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: docxerxes wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Stayed here 8 days on business. Luxury hotel. Very stylish and lots of art abounds. Great outdoor swimming pools. Rooms very comfortable. Breakfast is pretty good. Staff generally food quality service. Not cheap but reasonable for the facilities. Location means need taxi to town but is taxi rank outside hotel. Takes 5 mins costs 50 to 100 Dirham.

Review_Date: Christouch291 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Excellent hotel. Perfect place for a vacation. Attentive service great food. Poolside facilities wonderful all the guys at the pool couldn‚Äôt do enough for you. Lovely suites. It would be hard to fault anything. Breakfasts were just a great start to the day. A amazing display of SO many food choices.

Review_Date: 187momentum wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Excellent hotel  the crew was fantastic .  Special thanks to Sana el Farassi for her hard work in housekeeping  she went the extra mile to make sure everything was perfect during our stay .  The food was excellent as well  plenty of restaurants to choose from.

Review_Date: GaylordRN wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Very large modern rooms came with two double veds with excellent air conditioning. Beautiful and functional shower. Also important in this day and age of technology is plenty of outletss that work! All the roooms provide safes. The hotel lobby and commib spaces are stunning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sammusa wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: I had a massage at their spa and it was the best. Fatine really did a wonderful job. I had a deep tissue massage and it was very good. Fatine was professional and very polite. Thank you so much for a wonderful massage
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrea P wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: The location is really greatsettled in the ‚Äòrich‚Äô area of Marakech.Fountains all around the structure are breathtaking and so the swimming pool.We had a bit of delay at check in since the room wasn‚Äôt ready but despite that everyone was nice.

Review_Date: David19711213 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: This was a lovely hotel.  Rooms restaurant bars and pool all very good.  The check out was very slow.  Location is good as it has a number of other places to spend time very close. Most attractions are with in 15 mins travel.

Review_Date: christof693 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: it was an amazing experience  hospitality  good service good moments  discovering new things  excited to do it again!! thanks to all employees they were kind and helpful specially tarik thanks to him !! it was such a confortable trip!

Review_Date: pips28 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: Not perfect but highly recommend for the price
Review_Text: The hotel has a great lobby pool area and rooms but certain areas let it down in terms of being a little tired for a 5 star hotel - the lounger cushions are very comfortable but a bit worn out the lifts to the hotel rooms are very shabby and the spa could do with a paint in the steam rooms and locker rooms. Having said that it is priced lower than other 5 star hotels in marrakech so you have to take that into consideration. We found the service to be excellent throughout especially the waiters at breakfast who always served us quickly and kept us topped up with coffees and freshly squeezed orange juice. The breakfast is excellent with lots of choice. Overall we had a great stay we'll return and we'd recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tarik B wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: I have been to the mansoo more then once with friends and family I gotta admit I am still going back because it's one of the best places in marrakech ! The service is top notch and the food is incredible ! Definitely going back !

Review_Date: Mraissam wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: hotel was soo beautiful clean rooms very classy front desk are very very professional and smiling all time waiting just to serve you and make sure your stay is very comfortable  i say thank you yo Said and Abdellatif for making my stay great  i recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brian H wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Good Hotel - Could be a great hotel
Review_Text: Great Pool - some of the deck side chairs need to be recovered  a number of the umbrella‚Äôs are broken or in disrepair. Pool staff are reasonably attentive but there is no place for a tip when you do a room charge so you need to take cash to the pool.    Restaurant food is acceptable breakfast buffett is outstanding. Bar service is adequate.    Hotel rooms are nice comfortable air conditioned.

Review_Date: nicknameIreland wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: This hotel has all the makings of a great hotel but falls down in a few areas.    The rooms are great spacious comfortable and very clean. Pool area is lovely and well maintained. Breakfast selection is very good with great omelet station.    However the hotel is like a maze with no signage to find your way around. After 4 days there I was still getting lost trying to find anything especially in lobby area which is enormous and very confusing.    As many others have said the service here is not good. There are lots of staff but they don‚Äôt know what they are doing. Six bar staff and it takes 20 mins for them to serve a gin and tonic. I was close to offering to do it myself.    The most frustrating thing was that many people in our group had minibar charges on their bill when checking out not having used the minibar at all. It looked like the hotel added these charges (100-250 dirhams) on to most bills and removed them straight away if challenged on checkout. Unfortunately not everyone spotted the overcharge so they are profiting here. Not good!

Review_Date: Alexander B wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Great hotel but service could be improved
Review_Text: The Movenpick is a wonderful oasis in busy Marrakech and the hotel is very modern and clean. The room we had was in beautiful shape and the grounds are kept very clean. The one fault would be the service particularly in the restaurants and with the concierge and front desk staff. It could be very slow at times and the concierge could not respond to some pretty basic requests for information. Overall you will enjoy this hotel for a relaxing break in Marrakech and the amenities property and rooms are all wonderful.

Review_Date: Daniel D wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Have 0 complaints about this hotel everything was perfect from top to bottom. Khalid Mawloud and his team were to hand to accomadate all queries from restaurant recommendations currency exchange sim activation to taxi advice.  The room was absolutely beautiful and I would have 0 qualms about staying here again.  It‚Äôs well located the breakfast is great and the pools are fantastic.  Highly recommended!

Review_Date: Lo D wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: 9.45pm 2 restaurants out of 3 are closed. Only one left open is Spanish: Marcelona  You walk into the restaurant no one to greet you. Finally they sit you at a table which is not clean. 15 minutes later take the order (ham and bread gambas al ajillo croquetas). 25 minutes later arrives the ham and bread. Still no drink. 35 minutes later arrives the gambas in some kind of tomato sauce with the drink. The croquetas never arrived. All the staff are running around the managers also. Some restaurants are better closed.

Review_Date: AD4891 wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Amazing hotel walking distance to everything.
Review_Text: I stayed hear for a week and I can not fault their excellent service especially Sana and another lady at the reception. Sanas customer service was the best when we checked in to our room it was filthy and we got upgraded to a presidential suit which was perfect with the pool near and it was such an amazing experience I would recommend this hotel to any one and everyone who visits Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nital P wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: This was our second stay at M√∂venpick (in Marrakech) and it never disappoints. We also stayed there December 2017. The service is great with all staff being helpful and ready to be of any assistance. Both times we had our 6 year old son with us and he thoroughly enjoyed the kids club. Even when he was in the pool the lifeguard and pool staff kept an eye on him even though we were sat right there.    We are going back in October (next month) and staying at M√∂venpick again! It‚Äôs a great location short walk away from local shops/ cafes/restaurants.    The buffet breakfast also has a lovely variety of hot and cold food.    I cannot fault the hotel or its staff! Definitely recommend!

Review_Date: samiya e wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: Outstanding hotel design confort and kids club
Review_Text: H√¥tel design is really awesome Rooms so comfortable and spacious the suite makes you feel like home.  Kids club is really my biggest super good surprise the staff is so lovely with the kids and really passionate kids didn‚Äôt want to leave them they made our stay memorable and relaxing. Thks to the lovely instructorsüëèüèº  Breakfast was excellent and varied but food for lunch or dinner a disaster a scam!! Service not worthy a 5star staff quite nice but you need to be behind to have service completed.

Review_Date: Danny S wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Stayed for one day before heading to the airport. It's a gorgeous hotel recently renovated with fabulous pools. Rooms are great too. But as with many places in Morocco it's the service that lets the place down.    From a disappearing concierge dismissive reception staff and impossible-to-find bar staff by the pool it became a bit of a running joke for us.    We foolishly forgot our sunscreen at the last hotel and with a 3 year old in tow needed some. Concierge says "there is none in the hotel". Ok where can we buy some? "At the pharmacy". Right where is that? "It's a public holiday so they're all closed". Any other suggestions for sunscreen? "No". Hmm not the service expected at a 5 star hotel. Thankfully we stumbled across the kids club and as expected they had some and let us use it.

Review_Date: MoTheExplorer wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Decor was brilliant extraordinary hotel lobby designs spectacular furniture fixture and fittings in lobby. Rooms were average designs our AC didn't work very well but staff did offer us an alternative room but that was too warm with the AC not working very well. We just stuck with our original room and the nights git very warm sometimes a bit difficult to sleep that was the only down fall from the hotel. Hotel was very busy but still had time for you. Afternoon tea and snack was complimentary and was a good touch. Childrens club was excellent and staff did everything to make your child feel special a great team. Swimming pool was good but again very busy and you hardly got any sunbeds during the daytime. Breakfast was good with a lot of variety and fresh omelettes prepared for you.  Pillow were very soft and woke up with a sore neck  Would visit again but maybe not in the peak season.

Review_Date: Ghulam wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Hi Guys picked the family up from our family home in Rabat and head over to Marrakech. Firstly we arrived early at the hotel so we assumed we will be at loose ends until check-in time. Reception could see we had kids so Kindly searched for an available room that will allow us to check-in immediately. They could have simply said "computer said no" but from the start you could see that staff want to be helpful and not resistant. Not only did we get an early check-in but also got an upgrade... what a lovely result.  We stayed in room 5002 which was a suite very clean and the bed was so comfortable you just sink into the pillows. I want to give a special mention to the kids club they were really friendly and really worked hard for the kids. I have a 6 year old boy and 7 year old girl and my daughter although at first reluctant was so happy there and let us chill out. There was 2 very small incidents that I hope the guys at the hotel will pick up on because the Movenpick Marrakech is a wonderful stay and it's the attention to detail which will make you stand out. The first negative point is the toaster in the breakfast area. I burnt my finger lowering the toast into the toaster using the button as the metal was exposed and the plastic protective cover on the slider missing. The second negative point was that my daughter cut her self in the small pool outside room 5002 on a broken tile in the pool on the steps coming in and out. One of the managers gave a very silly response when he said the pool was not for kids. Come on guys you can do better than that!!! Firstly it does not say that "no kids" secondly adults bleed and cut just like kids. Just own the problem and fix it. Please do not let these small points put you off what was a very nice and relaxing stay. I for one will 100% be booking again and I'm certain that there toaster will be fixed next time lol.

Review_Date: Labelga83 wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: If you want to rest this is a terrible place. Plenty of noise from surrounding discos and aquapark at night. Beds are comfortable pillows way too soft. After two nights you will feel broken. Most of the staff isn‚Äôt very motivated nor helpful. Lovely swimming pool but not enough sunbeds/umbrellas. People have to lay in the grass. Fitness was lovely before now moved to the spa. Way too small and packed. I can‚Äôt recommend this hotel

Review_Date: Samuel James wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: Spacious Rooms, delightful service, good food.
Review_Text: Although we only stayed for one night we could not fault the hotel. Check in was smooth our family room was spacious and modern and the food was tasty and of a good quality. Communal areas were clean and of a high standard whilst all the staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful.

Review_Date: martynwlondon wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: Excellent hotel and a memorable stay
Review_Text: At first I was a little hesitant to book this hotel after reading entirely different reviews. After long thought and seeing the beautiful interiors I went ahead and scheduled my visit. Please take into consideration that I visited during the low season (July) so the hotel was not as busy as it would usually be. Upon arrival the staff were very welcoming and directed me through to reception where I was able to check in quickly and efficiently. As I was guided through to my room the porter informed me of where the restaurants and facilities were on the grounds which came in use as the hotel does not have a directory or a map so there could be parts of the hotel that I never discovered.    I stayed in a classic room and was surprised by the size. It was very spacious and had an incredible shower room. I will note that as many of the reviews have already stated the carpets were awful and dirty. Mine was covered in nail polish and some very unsanitary brown stains. Other than the carpets the room was spotless and I love the little details that the housekeepers added every day.    There are quite a few restaurants on the grounds and every one that I visited was lovely. As it was the low season some of them were only open a couple of days of the week; I assume that this changes depending on the season. As you would expect from a five-star hotel the prices are on the higher side but when it comes to things like the Moroccan buffet you really can eat as much as you want.    I found the pool slightly disappointing. For adults there is only the one rectangular pool and I feel that the entire hotel centred around it. If you do not get a bed in the morning it is challenging to find one throughout the day. The staff are helpful and will manoeuvre umbrellas and beds for you but if you want food or drink you physically have to ask as they will not come to check.    The most significant let down of the hotel by far is the wifi connection. As I work remotely I have to check emails throughout the day and the wifi connection drops every ten minutes or so. I found that the signal in the atrium was the best but it also fails occasionally. I enquired every day and the staff swear that they know nothing about having a weak signal but it is a definite issue for the hotel.    Generally I enjoyed the hotel and would recommend it to visitors but if you are there for business be cautious about the internet connection.

Review_Date: Tayler W wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: Lovely hotel but could be run better
Review_Text: I think the Movenpick was having a bad week when we stayed. Check-in was quite chaotic and queues were long. We were assigned the wrong room at first (a twin room rather than a double). A few other guests were having similar issues from what I could gather; I heard someone complaining to reception because they were given a room with somebody already in it!    Our room key stopped working intermittently so we were back and forth to reception a lot. Then the lift broke so we had to walk up and down 3 flights of stairs multiple times a day for our whole stay. Not too much of an issue for us but it did make me wonder about the disabled guests.    The air con in our room was more of a lukewarm fan (I assume it was faulty?) so sleeping was uncomfortable some nights. We asked someone to have a look twice but it never got fixed. Water from the hotel was a rip off - 50 Dirham (around ¬£4) for a large bottle.    All that being said the hotel itself is beautiful and the staff are all so lovely and can't do enough for you. The food in the hotel restaurants is good quality (particularly the tapas restaurant) and the rooms are big and stylish. The pool area is fab with really comfy sun loungers.    Hardly anything is within walking distance though so be prepared to get taxis everywhere. It cost us around 100 Dirham to get into Marrakech centre and back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: cm19w5 wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: I can say this was probably the best hotel I've stayed at! The reception was absolutely breathtaking and always smelled amazing. Our room was very neat and tidy the bathroom was big and clean. Overall the decor of the room was very luxurious. The staff were really welcoming towards us from the moment we stopped into the hotel they were really attentive and took very good care of us. There was also a breakfast buffet included with our room and it was just simply amazing they had a wide variety of foods to choose from and the food was delicious. On the hotel compound they had about 5 restaurants to choose from we ate the main one ( I cannot recall the name) and the food was amazing. I definitely recommend staying at this hotel you will not be disappointed!.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: AnneSeymour66 wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Summer Holiday with Sister - 16th July 1 week
Review_Text: This was our 2nd visit to the Movenpick and what was really lovely to be remembered by some of the staff there who deserve a special mention. Omar in the restaurant at breakfast looked after us so well and even delivered fresh coffees to our sunbed. And then there was Anas our pool butler so helpful and friendly. A little child was falling asleep on the sunbed so he went out of his way to find an umbrella and cover the sun so the little one could sleep - how lovely is that.  We also met Jihane one of the waiters on this trip who joined the hotel in March. From the minute we arrived on Monday afternoon she could not do enough for us her English is really good and she couldn't do enough for us during our stay. It was so hot on this trip and we were given buckets of ice for our water throughout the day. My sister and I are hoping to return next year.  The room was fabulous but did have a few design flaws in the bathroom which had caused some water damage (did not impact our stay). There was also a fridge a coffee machine and a kettle. Hairdryer available and of good quality. The AC was an absolute god send after an amazing day by the gorgeous pool side.

Review_Date: Dan J wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Negative points.    Prior to arrival we booked a transfer via the hotel concierge to collect us from the airport. It never arrived! After 40 minutes of waiting we called the hotel to chase this & eventually a car was sent for us. Not what we‚Äôd expect when paying a premium for a transfer.    Shortly into our stay we heard from other guests that an event/ conference for 700 people was taking place at the hotel that day. This meant paying guests could not use the main pool or bar for the entire day.  In the evening as part of the event a party took place around the pool. Paying guests were not permitted to enter. The music was horrendously loud with heavy bass.    At 10:30pm I called reception to enquire  as to when this would end I was advised 11pm.    At 11:30pm the music continued I went to reception to ask again I was then told the music ‚Äòshould hopefully finish around midnight‚Äô. I asked to speak with a manager & was told a manager would call our room shortly. No manager called!    At 12:30am the music STILL continued my partner went to reception to complain. He asked to speak with a manager & was told there was no manager available. He was advised ‚Äòthe music should end soon this is not normal‚Äô. Shortly after the music finally stopped.    Not only did the hotel fail to inform us about the event but our room was situated very close to the pool where the party took place. This was appalling planning on behalf of the hotel.    The next morning my partner visited reception again as no manager had ever contacted us - as we had both been promised. Once again no manager was available. A member of staff called a manager & advised that my partner & I could each have a free massage as a good Will gesture for the disturbance the event had caused us.    Upon check out one of the massages appeared on the bill. We explained this should not be charged (as agreed) & We were told ‚Äò no this is not possible‚Äô after much back & fourth the staff eventually removed the massage from the bill my partner had to write a note explaining why this was & sign it. We felt this was terrible communication on the hotels part! Making our check out stressful & lengthy.    On one occasion we asked reception for water to be sent to our room - it never arrived!    On another occasion I ordered a beer by the pool 20 minutes later- still no beer yet staff were standing around doing nothing.    Positive points.    The hotel is beautiful the interiors & decor are stunning. It smells magnificent & is always very clean.    House keeping were great; polite ladies & room always well cleaned.    Breakfast is fab - lots of choice & fresh food. Special praise to the lady who makes the tasty omelettes & the pancake lady both were friendly & always smiling.    Chocolate hour 5-6pm everyday in the lobby is a lovely added extra. The men in charge of chocolate hour are always welcoming & friendly.    Tapas restaurant is very pleasant lovely setting great food & cheerful staff.    The Spa is wonderful. We had several massages all were to a high standard. The therapists are very good at what they do - better massages than any I‚Äôve experienced in the UK.    Summary.  Beautiful hotel.  Lovely Spa.  Service standards are not 5 star!  Sadly the high standards of some staff is pulled down by the inconsistencies of others.  Event hosting put a dampener on our stay;  1. Guests should be informed if an event is taking place.  2. Guests should not be prohibited to use facilities (which they have paid a lot of money for) during an event.  3. Guests should not be kept awake by an event!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anaya M wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Superb service from Khadija, Mehdi, Essef, Jessus and the Manager Jaouad
Review_Text: I arrived at the hotel on Monday and being a vegetarian didn‚Äôt find much on the menu to eat .  I was not very happy about that and conveyed my feelings to the waitor and waitress.  They then called Jaouad Eddajjani who was the manager who sorted all the problems out.  The chef called Jessus came out to talk to me and offered to make me whatever I wanted.  Jessus was very helpful and made many dishes for me and my family  which were all very tasty and wholesome and fresh.  He was very patient and sincere and made the food with much love and passion .  He took great joy in knowing that I was enjoying his food which conveys to me a very loyal and good worker.  The staff Khadija Mehdi and Essef were very accommodating  polite and kind.  .  They were doing their best to please and satisfy me which they accomplished to 100% and I can clearly say they are excellent staff as were very friendly genuine and hospitable and I have received this from them every day as I have been going back to the restaurant.    They have been showering me with such great hospitality and customer care which is genuine and sincere because it is coming from their heart and that is clearly evident.    I would recommend that these four members of staff be acknowledged for their hard work and genuine sincerity to please and accommodate the guest.    The manager Jaouad Eddajjani was very helpful and continued to do whatever he could to please me and my family.  He came and sat down and talked to me and my family with a genuine interest for what he could do for us to make our experience a good one.  Jaouad has customer service skills which are excellent and he was very professional and accommodating to our needs he is an excellent manager who has great skills in sorting out any problems and keeping the customer happy and satisfied.    I would recommend that these 5 members of staff be rewarded for their hard work and attention to detail in trying to please me and my family who were the guests at the hotel.    From the Guests of room 2307 and 2309.

Review_Date: Morson123 wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Having had our flight cancelled and turning up to this hotel we were expecting a very solid nights stay with top quality service and 3 meals that Easyjet had said we were going to have and the maddest few hours ensued.    We arrived at the hotel at approximately 10pm and a whole flight's worth of people got off and were told to go to reception to get allocated rooms. The people behind the reception desk were relatively good albeit quite rude but understandably so as having to check in nearly 200-300 people at 10pm was not expected at all until nigh on one hour before but still nothing much that could have been done so they could have been a bit less rude as no one wanted to be in that situation.    Once allocated the room and very quickly may I add I was pleasantly surprised with the room with a couple bottles of water a nice twin bed working air-con and a tv that's all that could be asked for after a cancelled flight. We went for our first meal that was complimentary and it was exceptionally good and sat outside to enjoy a few drinks before going to bed. This is where things started to go wrong.    Having been outside and wanting the bill the person serving us came back and gave us the total we asked for an itemised bill so that we could attempt to claim our expenses and this was a struggle in itself as this seemed not be the characteristic thing that happens but even so we would have wanted to see what was paid for. He came back shortly after and manually added up each of the orders and did not give us any itemised bill nor a receipt but did provide us with the ability to pay separately. Very bizarre especially after asking several times for an itemised bill. One of the people in our party then went inside to buy a couple more drinks and he saw approximately 10-15 people behind the bar standing around but the person who was sorting the bill out was pretty much forced to make the drinks even though other members of staff were available to do so which begs the question why are their so many members of staff in the hotel? The card machine signal was particularly poor not sure if that's common in Morocco as we had paid cash throughout the week but several failed transactions is not good and members of our party will continually check their banks to see if any money has gone out.    We were told that we had both breakfast and lunch provided for us so having decided to have a lie in we went to get lunch however after talking to reception lunch had not been provided to us which not sure if it was the hotel's or the airline's fault was pretty difficult and was even worse due to our moods after a cancelled flight.    We decided to buy lunch at one of the snack places. I had ordered first and my food came out pretty quickly along with my drink but other members of our party had a more difficult time ordering. One order was wrong completely giving us a club sandwich instead of a sandwich suitable for vegans one sandwich was completely stone cold along with the fries and the coffee order was wrong the service behind the cafe was an organised chaos with a couple members of our party standing around 10-15 minutes at the front of the queue trying to get served as 8 members of staff were running around like headless chickens trying to sort things out. Another member of our party was trying to get a refund after paying before the food came out and tried for a significant period of time to get a refund which is not acceptable at all. A simple remedy would be table numbers or to get the food from the cafe.    After checking out suitcases were left with the bellboy however there was seemingly no secure storage where we left them so they were just left behind a counter and some were left in the hallway or on trolleys it says something about a hotel that does this especially a 5* chain hotel that doesn't offer secure suitcase storage after checking out.    The room was nice however and the difficulty of a canceled flight might have made things worse but it doesn't take away from poor service.

Review_Date: Kate S wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Luckily we were only there for 24 hours after a flight was cancelled and we were put up here for the night. Staff were rude and completely incapable if communication producing itemised bills telling you how much sonething cost bringing food out and there was something dodgy going on with the card machines. Not expected at all from such a chain and when we first arrived looked so beautiful. Wouldn't return not even for one night

Review_Date: nazha j wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: I stayed at movenpick eddahbi during the months of June for 4 days and initially had a few issues with my room and not being attended to correctly by some staff on the first day which was slightly upsetting. However we eventually managed to speak to Mr amine Berre the guest relation manager who was very helpful and hospitable and immediately assisted me and my friends and rectified our issues. I would like to thank Mr Amine Berre for his excellent service and would like to express that he is a fantastic manager. Due to his help we enjoyed the rest of our stay at the hotel. The breakfast menu was nice but i feel  Could have provided an extended variety of food considering it is a 5* hotel.

Review_Date: Harrywine wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: I stayed in Movenpick Hotel Mansour Eddahbi from July 14 to 16 2018. I was travelling with my family. We had a very enjoyable time and stay the superior room given to me was amazing it was very spacious and comfortable. The hotel has very nice facilities aside from the the Pools and the restaurants overall ambiance was great. We had dinner in the restaurant the Food attendant was very friendly cant remember his exact name probably Mehmed he is a young good looking guy with a very good english diction. Also a very accommodating Manager who was there to look after us as well Mr. Jaouad Eddajjani. Their kids center is amazing my daughter had so much fun with their 2 staff who was very friendly Rouua? (she was wearing eyglasses) and Ikhbal. Front desk staff was very helpful I remember one FO staff helping me allot Mr. Badr. I would highly recommend this hotel and staff.

Review_Date: Kit Yee M wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Big nice hotel grand designed of the lobby. All The staffs are welcoming service good.  But the rooms are quite disappointing. We booked two rooms for a family holiday. But both of the rooms are not that good as show on the website. Room size are ok. But carpet dirty sockets failed broken curtainsbroken coffee machine toilet locks broke broken bathroom door some light bulbs broke birds poo on the fence of balcony balcony glass fence was full of dust and ashes balcony floor dirty leaves ours feet grey and dark. Ordered two extra pillows but wait for four hours delivered after chasing them. Overall the rooms are disappointing but hotel environment and staffs were good . It‚Äôs a over rated five stars hotel.

Review_Date: leochild wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: luxurious overall but room for improvement
Review_Text: I just stayed for 3 days. Check in was brutal. Argument over extra person which was my teenage daughter. They wanted to charge me extra since the reservation did not include her by booking error on the app. Then came the room assigned. Moldy and not a garden view.
