Then tears more complaining. 1 hour later finally in my room which was booked as a king but ended up a queen. The room was ok pretty pool view which I guess was their version of an upgrade?? Said the manager finally tried to make me happy after they pushed me to a meltdown.  So besides a terrible check in the actual room was small It had a dirty carpet the bathroom counter was not cleaned. and some stains on the setee. The location of the room was noisy so beware and don‚Äôt get a room near an elevator or above the entry to the building.  Besides that the pool was amazing and the gratis afternoon tea and chocolate bar are great touches. The breakfast was very good. Lots of options and good quality.    Upon Check out the bell desk took 30 minutes and 2 phone calls. So when asked how was my stay I was honest and they did take off the meal I had. So thank you for that.  Overall I would stay here again because the decor in the public areas are stunning and I wanted a nice pool.  Staff English could be improved and maybe a deep cleaning on the carpets? Prices for food are about high but to be expected in this type of trendy hotel.

Review_Date: h45an wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: On our second visit to Marrakech we stayed for 2 nights here. The hotel looks stunning from outside including the walk from the entrance to the reception. Our room was as you would expect from a 5 star hotel however only negative is no usb charging slots and reception did not have adapters for the UK plugs however to be fare we did find one 3 pin socket but it was away from the bed.    What I really liked about our stay was the service. All the staff including Mr Said at reception were the most welcoming we ever met!    We asked for a late check out no problem. Room service staff very polite and smiling.    The staff at breakfast were very polite and kept asking if we were ok and offered to serve us with drinks! Mint tea served as we pleased.    All in all they made us feel welcome which to us was to us better than some other hotels that had nicer rooms but poorer service.    We would like to stay here again for sure!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: krevelyn wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at the Movenpick in Marrakech for 9 days. We came primarily for work and brought our 15 month old daughter with us. I was a little nervous about finding a babysitter in Morocco since she is so young but the idea of leaving her behind for one week made me more uncomfortable. So I arranged for a babysitter through the hotel. First of all the Moroccan culture is extremely warm and welcoming to babies and children so it felt right that I brought my little one along. But most importantly we had a fabulous babysitter at the Movenpick. Her name is Raouia and she is on the staff of the kids club at the hotel. She was so kind responsible helpful calm and easy to communicate with. She speaks multiple languages and put me at ease upon meeting her. My daughter loved her and the kids club is a great addition to the hotel experience for children. If you plan on traveling with a baby or children to Morocco I do not hesitate to recommend hiring Raouia during your stay.

Review_Date: Batziolas Panagiotis wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Amazing hotel near to the city center. Rooms big and clean with city view. 2 main pools to enjoy and relax. Bar with Projector that you could see also Soccer match of World Cup. Interesting breakfast with local products. The cuisine is the only thing that needs a slight improvement (both quality & quantity).

Review_Date: safae1983 wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: The kids club is very nice within the hot. My daugther and niece loved it. They do everything to amuse the children. Nice games dancing painting good food and very gentle supervisors. If you have children I would definitely recommend this resort.

Review_Date: Viks J wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Duration of stay: 7 Nights (23rd to 30th July 2018)  Type of stay: Couples holiday  Board: Bed and breakfast  Room Type: Superior King Size    Written on last evening prior to AM departure.    I have been fortunate to visit Marrakech 6 times now and have stayed at various locations throughout. This was my first time attending this hotel with a view of experiencing a mixture of a relaxing and leisurely holiday.    Staff: Throughout the duration of our stay the staff at the hotel in all areas; from the bedroom maid to reception staff were very polite and attentive to our needs. Some spoke English fluently but others who did not were able to understand my broken French and actions. In our experience we felt this did not hinder our experience with the staff or any requests. Although for others this may not be the case.    Room: Superior King size room in the Messaouda pavilion. The room was beautiful. Positives: Clean contemporary large balcony with seating area large bathroom with various washroom products large closet area fully working and consistent air conditioning system huge and comfortable bed that was more like a super King flat screen TV hot drink station and super comfy lounger. Room service was prompt at all times with good communication via the room telephone to reception.    Negatives: Wi-Fi within the room is seriously poor. The connection is inconsistent and disconnects regularly. Where it was at its strongest (at the door) wasn't a really convenient place to relax within the room. The location for us was at the far end of the hotel. I'm not sure if there are other rooms similar in size that are closer but the walk became frustrating at times. Being a young active couple it was bearable but I can envisage a young family with a young child or older visitors finding this a tad frustrating. We had trouble getting into our room on three occasions. In our pavilion there is no staff or telecom system to communicate with the reception. So instead we had to treck back to the reception or attend the Spa and request for them to call and bring us a new card again and again. Thankfully the staff were responsive and prompt but we had our hands full on one occasion and another had hot food with us which caused an inconvenience. The room does not have an iron or ironing board. A request was made and these arrived within 30 minutes.    Hotel Overall: We used the gym pool area lunchtime cafe and experienced some Shisha in the evenings. All of which were good. The gym is a good size with towels and water to hand and a variety of free weights and resistance machines. The gym has no air conditioning which isn't great for a publicised 5 star hotel. The main pool is a decent size with lots of sun beds around. The other two pools a lot smaller can be used for kids and are a lot quieter. The pool closest to the bar looks out date and even on the busy days there is hardly anyone there. Shisha in the evenings was nice staff regularly change the coal and are attentive. Price for an apple shisha was 195 dirhams. About ¬£15. The hotel cafe is pretty decent and does great fresh food. Although is only open between 1030 to 1830. The breakfast food is fair and there is a variety to suit all. But it would be nice to try a new range of food in certain areas (i.e desserts section). We both feel that even though we were given a little map of the hotel and it's layout signage is poor and there is a lack of information provided by the staff. An example of this is the location of the gym. Even two members of staff directed us incorrectly. It took a third try stopping someone and walking in several directions before someone walked us to the door on the first day. There is also a huge lack of direction for the restaurants and cafe as we had to try and explore ourselves to find them. Apparently there are 6 restaurants even to this day we know of only 3.    Overall this was a good experience. The hotel has the look and physical beauty of a 5 star hotel but there are still minor adjustments to be made.    Thank you for the hospitality throughout our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: drhenya wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: I loved my stay at that beautiful hotel. However one person - Mrs. Naama that works at the morning restaurant made The difference! She paid attention to me from the moment I walked in until the very last minute when I got up to leave. Her sensitivity her kindness and exceptional professionalism made me feel pampered cared for. She took the 'extra step' even in sending me a card with dozens of roses when she found out that it was my birthday. Mrs. Naama is an asset to the hotel - a blessing to every guest who meets her. Dr. Henya Shanun-Klein

Review_Date: Valwh wrote a review Jun 2018

Review_Text: This place is simply awesome. It's a beautiful resort hotel. Stunning pools resort style environment with rooms that are 5 star quality. Very upscale and relaxing environment with great food quality and numerous selections for breakfast.    I highly recommend!

Review_Date: Manher H wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Had a lovely 7 nights in M√∂venpick hotellovely friendly atmosphere and the staff were so helpful.  I would like to mention a lady Nayna at breakfast timeshe was absulutely a lovely lady and looked after us so welland very professional with her job.    Thank you once again till we visit you again.    Harshika Hirani
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ferhat C wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Best staff ever at the hotel (Bahija) üåπ
Review_Text: We are from the UK and have stayed here for 6 days (12-17th June) and during our breakfast we had the most amazing waitress. Bahija looked after us above and beyond her duties she was so helpful and always had the biggest and heartwarming smile. I would deffinately recommend her to anyone that visits this hotel to see her. We stayed at room 2319 which had the swimming pool view from the third floor. Bahija gets 10 out of 10 from us

Review_Date: Sophie B wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Excellent !! Recommended stay everything you need
Review_Text: I have just returned from a weeks stay at the M√∂venpick resort.    Grounds; lovely surroundings the lobby area is first class beautiful touches with the velvet chairs and water fountains. The entrance is very impressive huge attention to detail has been well thought of here !    Rooms; nice size and equipped with everything you need. Staff were very happy to give us two sets of brand new hangers when we asked for some and more and tea and coffee on request this was never a problem. Rooms are cleaned to a good standard.    Gym and Spa; used this most days. Excellent equipment in the gym with everything you need. My only reservation would be that the air con needs to be on and windows closed as it did get very warm! It also could be cleaned more regularly as the bin was usually full of plastic bottles and the carpet did need a good hoover!    Breakfast; EXCELLENT ! freshly cooked omelettes ( young girl who cooked them most days was very professional and presented the plates with special touches !) Ask for less oil as they like to add a lot!!!  You could not have asked for more fresh fruit pastries pancakes yoghurts cold meats smoked tuna and hot options ! There is an option to sit inside or outside and the staff were very attentive. They would be happy to get your breakfast if you asked!    Chocolate hour is fantastic from 5pm - 6pm we really looked forward to heading in the lobby area to sample a huge variety of chocolate chocolate drinks and biscuits freshly prepared by the chef ! You can go back as many times as you like!    Food; we didn‚Äôt eat in the hotel as we wanted to see the ‚Äòreal‚Äô Morocco however the menus looked good in both restaurants that were open! We thought 360 for the buffet bbq was slightly steep!  I would recommend some alternative restaurants called Nomad Barametre and Le Cusine Moma all excellent !!!    Pool; lovely and big really good sun loungers and plenty of them! Pool staff very attentive. The coffee shop inside the lobby does similar food for half the price so we ordered in there and brought it out for example and panini and chips is around ¬£4.50. However during Ramadam this opens from 2:30pm.    Points for the hotel ; I think some of the gardens around the pool area could have been better kept i.e plants trimmed weeded. Gym and spa could be cleaner. The roof top terrace closed ... not sure why ? we are still paying guests regardless of Ramadam as the hotel was quiet.    We had a slight issue with cocktails which are not cheap at ¬£9 + so for that you would expect a ‚ÄòLondon standard‚Äô we are not one to complain but the Kahula was not added to the expresso martini the manger of the hotel was very apologetic and the next day without asking he came with the manager of the bar and brought us the ones we ordered to the pool area which was a very nice touch! So thank you again.    Location; we never got a taxi as you really see the ‚Äòreal city sites‚Äô walking however there are taxis right outside the hotel.  The hotel is slightly out of the way but well within walking distance 2.5k to the Souks and mall is just around the corner with a large supermarket.  We got the number 19 bus from the airport however they didn‚Äôt really know where the hotel was so we did go round in a large circle! I would get a taxi as it was only 100 door to door do not pay any more!    Overall this is an excellent hotel and we have already told our friends to visit!  This is a honest review. I agree some staff could be more helpful and accommodating especially speaking some English at the front desk..

Review_Date: Montrice W wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: My stay at M√∂venpick Hotel Mansour Eddahbi Marrakech has been wonderful. After a long plane ride it was a pleasure to be greeted with mint tea. The staff were warm and welcoming during my stay. I enjoyed my accommodations and will book this hotel again whenever I vacation in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Roberta M wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Amazing amazing Super with amazing service.
Review_Text: As u are aware Dubai is fake ( and human right  whattsssssss?..); South Africa is a place where people CAN t live toghether My Italy.. I prefer to keep silence about rude impolite manners . dirty expensive places ( sorry but is true) and London ( where I live is becoming a dangerous town.   Morocco is a place where u can find peace  respect kind people like YS Laurent said.  The Movenpick hotel reflects the spirit of Marrakech! It s an amazing Hotel with 4 amazing swimming pools ( 1 for kids)It s make me feel relaxed.  Beautiful  rich breakfast  amazing spacious rooms flowers and grass and plants are everywhere. . The Spa is fabulous and people are friendly  polite generous Professional.  Marrakech is a charming place! I haven t seen rubbish in the street( Europe is dirty ..); the Medina is the heart of art and culture.  I really appreciate this country. It s a place for nice people.let me say for the amazing sweet kind service!

Review_Date: smithgreg838 wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Just got back from the Movenpick hotel in Marrakesh after a 3 night stay.  had a nightmare with signing food and drink to the room.  3 hours wasted to and from the reception and on the phone to bank . Eventually was made to pre-pay money before hand . This is before we had even spent it . The icing on the cake was been told the money I don't spend can't be refunded as it's a "chore " for them . Basically robbing me .  Apart from the embarrassment of looking cheap the hotel is beautiful .  I would recommend staying there in a heart beat as you really have to see it to believe it .    Just a shame they fell at the last hurdle .

Review_Date: Henry C wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: clean but staff need some polishing.
Review_Text: OK not a bad hotel by any means but some significant irritations during our stay which a little bit of staff training could resolve. There is obviously a culture of extracting cash from tourists in Marrakech and I get that. However the guy that took our luggage to our rooms didn't take it to the rooms for 30 minutes so we couldn't change. To add insult to injury I tipped him for all 4 couples but he then took a further tip which my polite brother offered.  The dining experience left a lot to be desired. Although the dining room was nearly empty we had to share menus. One member of staff repeatedly took the wine list away (perhaps for religious reasons?) but then when we did order a bottle of wine the cheeky wine waiter told us one bottle was insufficient!!!! - A new experience.  Overall though clean comfortable rooms lovely pool and reasonably priced. Just hold a staff meeting and get them trained!!

Review_Date: Siobhan O wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: The standard of food at this hotel is terrible... I don‚Äôt need to say anything the picture says enough ü§¢  I can honestly say I have never had such bad quality Save your money and go to McDonald‚Äôs- thank me after !

Review_Date: jennykp wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: We jyst cane back from Marrakech today where we stayed at the Movenpick and had a great stay. We were in the 2 bedroom suite which was new clean and modern.    We had great house keeping service including a turndown service.    Will definitely stay again next time.

Review_Date: Aleksander B wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is located fairly closely to the airport and a short taxi ride (‚Ç¨5-8) from the old town.    We stayed at the hotel for five days and had a "family room" (i.e. two adjacent rooms) on the ground floor of the Zidane building. The hotel lobby area and the grounds are beautiful and the rooms are fine although they feel a bit dated considering that the hotel was renovated fairly recently. Also the kids club (free and starting at age 4) is good and proved to be pretty helpful during the rainy days we had. Similarly the buffet restaurant offers nice breakfasts and ok dinners (although dinners are fairly pricey given the quality).    The main thing that lets this place down is the service. On the day of arrival I asked about a pressing service for my shirts and suits and was told that someone would come to our room to collect them. Nobody did so I called again the following morning. Again I was told this would be attended to but I had to call again an hour later and still it was a no-show. We wanted to go explore the city (rather than waiting in our room for the shirts to be collected) so in the end I just took the items to reception myself. I later found out that a few other guests had the exact same experience. Further on one occasion we asked for some warm milk to give to our baby son at bedtime and it took the staff more than half an hour to get it to us which is not ideal when you have got an exhausted little who only wants to fall asleep. Finally the shower design in the rooms is fundamentally flawed as any shower turns the entire bathroom into a wet room with very slippery floors which is problematic when you have little ones prone to falling.

Review_Date: farouksouad wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: We ( 2 adult and 3 boys age 11 9 and 5) spend 1 week in this beautiful hotel. We had a really wonderful time. Every one of the staff was so friendly. the entrance /lobby of the hotel was amazing. The rooms Nice and clean.  A special Thank you to naima in the restaurant during breakfast. Every morning she was always so Nice and positieve such a Nice way to start the day! Lots of choice during breakfast.  Annas at the pool so friendly and and also keeping the kids safe.  And Sweet Ghislaine and the Spa gave me such a Nice moroccain hammam experiense  it was super!  All together we had a great time and hopefully we Will come back next year.    Souad el Aouaji -Farouk

Review_Date: anonymous4176 wrote a review May 2018

Review_Text: This isn‚Äôt my first visit here and I‚Äôve been meaning to leave a review. This hotel is amazing and highly recommended to everyone even family holidays. The hotel staff are so curteous and welcoming especially the bar staff. There was a gentleman in particular called Ayoub I believe that was his name... he was very pleasant and always made sure that me and my partner were well looked after. Review_Date: Safari771816 wrote a review May 2018

Review_Date: chin570909 wrote a review Apr 2018

Review_Date: Imad wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: A very nice place  I went there with a few friends and we had a great experience one of the waiters was very professional and attentive  We went to marcelona and we had a delicious dinner composed from a several tapas A good Moroccan wine (lumiere)  THANKS MEHDIIIII üíôüíôüíôüíô  coming back soon

Review_Date: Kevin_Atterbury wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: It is undoubtedly an attractive place but that‚Äôs where the allure ends. Food options are limited and the meals I had (Jambra room service) were bland and overpriced. It‚Äôs not hard to make a decent chicken panini...    I had to ask 3 separate people and wait over 24 hours just to get a kettle sent to the room despite tea bags and coffee being in there already. I had to ask a guy to show me how he would make a cup of tea before the penny dropped.    Check in and check out experience was too long badly organized and with staff more interested in talking among themselves and looking at their phones.    My company got me a basic room which had a wonderful view of an air conditioning unit. The air conditioning in my room did not work and just blew hot air around. I asked to have it fixed and was promised it would be done... by this point I had given up trying to get any customer service and just put up with it.    The express 1hr pressing service took 4 hours (still had to pay a 50% surcharge) there was a smell of cigarettes coming through the vent in the toilet from somewhere and there is no turn down service iron hairdryer no room service menu in the room terrible wine selections etc etc etc....    If I was on holiday and spending my own cash I would have demanded to move room and if not requested a refund and gone to the Four Seasons.    Movenpick need to send their staff to their hotels in Dubai to see how a truly 5 star hotel operates.

Review_Date: Maria F wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: I recently stayed at Movenpick after leaving a riad I had booked in the medina due to its poor condition and bad area. When I stepped foot in Movenpick I was delighted with the beauty and service. The room was very spacious and the bathroom high end. One also gets free access to the wonderful hammam if you are a guest which I took advantage of and loved. When I return to Marrakech I will definitely stay here again.

Review_Date: lucalbinski wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: House keeping is asleep and simply does not bother to respond to requests even repeated requests. I thought this was just my bad luck until I met another guest who had an identical experience. It's a pity as it's a beautiful hotel.

Review_Date: Tracy H wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Rooms lack basic items though hotel design is beautiful
Review_Text: Rooms do not have a hairdryer iron or conditioner (for hair). The water kettle and desk lamp do not work. I am here for a business conference and have no way of ironing my clothes to look presentable. We are 350+ conference delegates here and many of us are complaining about this same problem. As a top-end hotel the Movenpick should provide these basic amenities in all rooms.    However the design of the hotel is stunning and the decor beautiful. The staff have been warm and friendly.    I am still here and hope management can address this issue quickly.

Review_Date: Alex Block wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Absolutely loved my stay everything was amazing: great selection of food for breakfast; delicious dinner buffets in Moroccan style; well-equipped gym; several pools. Marcelona restaurant is serving Spanish cuisine in Catalan style - amazing tapas and main dishes felt myself like in Spain but loved it even more.  Chocolate hours are the great opportunity to try signature Movenpick chocolate and sweets. Highly recommend this hotel for vacation in Marrakech or short comfortable stays as it‚Äôs very central located and Medina with all the main attractions are in walking distance.

Review_Date: Vacation602056 wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is very modern and well fitted out. The reception staff were very helpful although at times there could be more at peak times. Both pools were clean and the pool staff friendly and the pool bar served good food. The half board menu is very tasty and has many very varied tagines and all fresh and plentiful. The only issue I have is the sound of car horns at 5am every morning from people leaving the night club next to the hotel. Would recommend it as a convenient location for exploring Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: rachel w wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: went with 11 year old son great luxury hotel for children they are really welcomed.  Junior Suite was fantastic  Service great  Atmosphere was perfect  Pool scene great large pool is heated all year this for some reason is hard to get confirmed but it is heated to a temperature you are able to enjoy it.  Special mention to whoever runs the team around the pool and pool restaurant - extremely organised staff excellent got beds and towels for you food and drinks served etc  Medi Terra restaurant was fantastic service please do go in here it may look exclusive but everyone is welcome and my son loved the tapas the cost is also very competitve - service and staff couldnt do enough for you  Dont understand the bad reviews okay there are some strange little things but these are not complaints just endearing little marrakech-isms - wine in the mini bar in room is corked but there is no cork screw in the room! we had to call room service every night to open a bottle! very funny but was nice to see the lovely staff!  Also the only other thing which was amusing was that for some reason the Reception staff were the least likely to understand you! it took us some dialogue to communicate with this team although they were lovely - its amusing cause the rest of the hotel staff seem to understand all languages and get completely what your asking for! but it made us laugh a little cause they were all so nice!    We will def go back to this hotel - without a doubt marrakech is a very special city

Review_Date: Khaled A wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: the hotel looked newly renovated (at least the rooms we were in) with a nice mix of modern and authentic style. we took suites and they were very spacious. service was super excellent and the staff were very friendly and helpful and that includes house keeping concierge and waiters at restaurants. the only downside though was the room service menu which was in french only and had only like 6-7 options to choose from. Nevertheless there are few restaurants in the hotel to dine in. i highly recommend this hotel for families and couples.
Reviewer_Location: Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

Review_Date: L4U wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: This is a beautiful hotel so it‚Äôs such a shame they don‚Äôt have the staff there to run it.  My room was lovely and spacious with a stand-alone tub and separate living space.  But the rooms are not sign posted at all. And nobody from reception takes you to your room in the vast complex so it‚Äôs a miracle I found my room at all.  Nobody on reception answers the phone. Nor room service. So I was unable to arrange breakfast before my 6am check out.  Not a 5* hotel in my book. Wouldn‚Äôt go back.

Review_Date: Annabella G wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: There are many 5 star things about this hotel  --beautiful grounds with water features and nice pool  --comfortable rooms including excellent linens (great pillows and towels). very comfortable bed  --rooms with nice terraces  --nice bathroom amenities  --big spread at breakfast buffet  --40 or so minute walk to main square and less than 10 minute walk to mall    But the understaffing easily knocks off a star  --huge line for eggs at breakfast. Another egg person is needed!  --no one at either reception to be found. We got caught in the pouring rain on our walk back from the center and wanted to ask for an extra hair dryer or see if we could pay to get our clothes dried. Not one person in sight in either reception area. Earlier in the day we waited for ages for a concierge so we could request a map. No one at either reception at 8:30 a.m. to ask a question to??  --there is plenty of staff at breakfast and they are friendly but a little overly eager to clear plates/glasses  --despite the lack of staffing as mentioned above they managed to find someone to knock on our door at 8 a.m. to check if we'd taken anything from the mini bar. We were accused of consuming a Red Bull (coincidentally the most expensive item on the menu). I've never had a Red Bull in my entire life. Since there was no one at reception anyway to try to charge us for it this didn't matter but it was extremely rude and insulting. Overall we'd really enjoyed our stay but this really left a terrible impression.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dr Rishi Shah wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Movenpick was a brilliant hotel! The room sizes were good and they had all the appliances you would need. There is also different languages in the entertainment so anyone can enjoy. We had a big balcony with a table for dining and the view was spectacular.  The food was delicious. There was a lot of variety for anyone. The crockery was very clean as was the food itself. The breakfast and dinner had lots of fab options and I thoroughly enjoyed.  The pools were of a massive size and the heated pool was just warm enough and not too hot. The cold pool wasn‚Äôt cold enough to freeze you but was still cold.  Movenpick‚Äòs location was just right with a mall next to it. It was an amazing hotel and I would recommend that you choose this one.

Review_Date: Mohamed E wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Very nice staff. Extremely friendly. Especially Mustapha et Hanaa at breakfast.  Will definitely be back.  The room is very comfortable. Bed extremely nice too. Large choices for buffets. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: NCtravellerUk wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Such an amazing hotel with such amazing staff.  Nadine .... was a staff member that made my holiday... multilingual.. smiley... service fabulous... I left my wallet and the same hour she returned it without a cent missing. She even refused the 100 euros I offered her. Where in the world do you find such trustworthy gems.    Certainly a hotel on your must visit list.  I never return anywhere but here... I will be back.

Review_Date: Poonam S wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: This hotel is so nice. It‚Äôs absolutely huge. So many buildings pools restaurants within the complex as well as a very large and professional spa. Check in and check out was very quick and all the staff are very well spoken. Rooms are very spacious as well as a walk in closet and large balcony equipped with table and chairs    The variety and quality of the food in the breakfast hall was one of the best I‚Äôve seen so far.    The location is perfect within the area of Hivernage which is known to have the best resorts/hotels restaurants and stores    Whilst there we visited the main square a few times it‚Äôs only a few minutes drive from the hotel. Here you will find the never ending semarina souk    In the evening we went to jad mahal and Buddha bar restaurant for dinner and entertainment from the belly dancers fire throwers etc    We did an excursion to the ourika mountains which was quite a trek. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this for anyone who is not fit or elderly. It‚Äôs a lot of fun but a lot of hard work reaching the top of the Rocky Mountain to see the waterfall.    We also did camel rides and quad biking.    All of this was organised by the concierge and went to plan    I‚Äôve also stayed in the Dubai JBR Movenpick and thoroughly enjoyed my experience and the level of customer service I received

Review_Date: Stephanie W wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Really enjoyed our stay at the Movenpick. The restaurants were great - particularly the breakfast buffet. All the pools were lovely and we had a very nice room. Special mention must go to the kids‚Äô camp and their fantastic friendly staff and amazing daily activities - our kids didn‚Äôt want to leave when they went there! Also very well located from airport and center.

Review_Date: AriesMK wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Very helpful staff and great service
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel very opulent and spacious rooms.  Have to mention the Kids Club was great the girls Raouia andTouria were excellent with both my boys who had lot‚Äôs of fun while my husband and I went to the souks and wanted some time by ourselves.  The breakfast spread is great although the coffee from the machines never seemed to be hot enough but that‚Äôs a small inconvenience .  Didn‚Äôt see any alcohol on any of their menus  so if you decide to buy your own make sure you also carry a bottle opener as they don‚Äôt have one at the hotel.  (We borrowed one of the Staffs personal Swiss army knife that he happened to have).  Other than these small glitches it was a wonderful stay is a fabulous hotel.

Review_Date: Lamiae O wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Great Hotel, excellent serviceb and kids club
Review_Text: We had a great time my daughter loved the kids club and their staff she would go everyday to play and feed the rabbits :) restaurants are very good one of the pools is warmed for the colder days and the staff at the pool are so nice. I highly recommend!

Review_Date: cielyng wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Checked in for 3 nights having spent most of our time in a Riad. Comfort level is exceptional. A couple of useless people in reception which makes life difficult but overall our stay was perfect - I wouldnt stay here for over ‚Ç¨150 per night
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pietro M wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Plush hotel near centre of Marrakech
Review_Text: Opulent hotel with huge suites ours looking over the gardens. Enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend... helpful staff and delicious breakfast with a vast range of food. Dinner was a little limited but that could have been to the time of year we visited (March 2018). Rooms a little walk from main hotel building but a choice of four pools. Go for the Hammam Scrub!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Francistyrone wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Worst hotel ever !!! Gave a bad impression of Marrakech for visitors.
Review_Text: First time ever in a Movenpick it will definitely be my very last.    I stay in hotels 80% of the time in a year and hotel by far is the worst of the worst.    Service is extremely poor and rude on the service center hotline I don‚Äôt care if you have 500 rooms as an excuse to find me a iron and ironing board and having 500 rooms you do not have enough for your guests? Or rather you think your guests would love to go out with wrinkled shirts and pants ? Totally unacceptable.    Food. Breakfast was ok but don‚Äôt except good service.    Rooms. Doesn‚Äôt deserve a 5 stars I was pretty excited to visit at first after looking at all the pictures online. When I got into my room wow I was shocked fourpoint Sheraton or doubletree could do a better job.    Don‚Äôt expect your Air condition to be cool even if you turn it to 5 degrees  you will get warm air around 30 degrees. If your someone who couldn‚Äôt stand the warmth and needs to sleep in around 18-20 degrees  you will not be happy. Unless you bring along your own fan.    Oh and don‚Äôt expect them to call you back if you asked for or to check something they will never call you back. And they will not make your room unless you hang your card at the door.    Don‚Äôt stay here if you do not want to spoil your holidays.

Review_Date: Amit C wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: AWESOME HOTEL AND NO.1 SERVICE.... MUST READ :)
Review_Text: I and my wife would like to thank everybody at the Movenpick Marrakech for a wonderful stay we had here. From the minute we checked in to the day we left everybody was so attentive to all our needs.    The suite was amazing and had everything required for a perfect stay with great comfort and services. Mr Khalid and the reception made every effort to ensure we where welcomed into our suite with VIP experience and Emmanuel ensured our dining experience in the restaurants were spot on throughout our 5 nights. The concierge where always on hand and ensured we had all the information required and assisted us not only during our stay but before arriving also. The Spa team (I forgot the names) where very helpful throughout are stay and always smiling and pleased for a pleasant chat if nothing else.    I would like to specially thank Jihane and Mr Gregory also for making this all happen. i was delighted and will sure to be returning to Marrakech to have a similar experience once again at Movenpick.    The personalised service at such a large hotel was one of a kind and masks over any small issues as one of my concerns was the hotel may be too large and commercial however it did not feel like this.    The location is awesome and close by to everything with the Medina just a 30 dirham taxi ride away and all the clubs and bars very local.    I would recommend this hotel to anybody coming to Marrakech as the staff are awesome and very helpful and the hotel is immaculate.    Hope to see you all soon. My home in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: fran h wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Wonderful visit for CAF Women's Football symposium in March 2018.    Everything was surreal and like jumping out of a genie lamp!!    Rooms and entire hotel so beautiful. Reception. Area mystical.  Wonderful food with so much variety on menu.  Bar with lovely music and chocolate snacks. Was like being in a dream!!! Thanks

Review_Date: Caroleset wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: So much better than I thought!
Review_Text: Was apprehensive booking this hotel due to few bad reviews but needn‚Äôt of  Worried  the staff couldn‚Äôt do enough for youmy husband was gluten free and  The found gluten free bread !  The standard room had a small problem so we were upgraded straight away  To a really lovely room and bathroomfelt so comfortable there.  I loved the pool once again pool staff were there for your every need  Breakfast great was in a very convenient position u can‚Äôt go wrong !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Monica H wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Initially we were super impressed with the hotel. The grounds were beautiful and dazzling at first glance but once you got pass the initial wow it goes down hill quick. The staff at the reception desk were moderately friendly but it was clear after residing there a few days that they were overworked. It appeared that one young lady was at the reception desk for a period of over 16 hours. Our first room was less than what was expected for a 5 Star Hotel especially since it took 4 years to renovate. On outside of the elevator doors the dry wall was cracking and falling apart. The fine details were totally missed in this hotel and the rooms were lack luster. We had to change rooms three times because of the room conditions. One evening it took over 30 minutes for someone to answer the phone to get a bottle of water. I called the front desk house keeping and even guest services. I eventually had to leave the room and walk to the fitness center to try and find water at 10pm to no avail. Finally after all of that they answered the phone needless to say I was livid. I would probably not stay there again because I‚Äôm sure for the price you can find better more well kept accommodations. On a positive note the breakfast was great and had a good selection of food the wait staff were nice but again overwhelmed. The owners need to spend more money adding additional staff at front desk and expanding that area less bellmen and more attention to detail in the room as far as the decor and structure of the property. The hallways are shameful and this doesn‚Äôt warrant a 5 Star rating. I expected so much better. I hope it improves it has such potential.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: nalbon wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: We liked this hotel it's a good 4*+ clean well kept and modern. Our room 7208 was large and very comfortable with a big terrace balcony. Monster bath and multiple showers with ample pressure and hot water. 3 restaurants and 2 bars. It could be better: house keeping tv channels and information about the hotel and services it offers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: L33smithy wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: I stayed here for 4 days last year as a relaxing end to 10 days spent climbing in the Atlas Mountains.    The hotel is absolutely amazing really clean and tidy with a very nice atmosphere and great facilities. The location is good also and within walking distance of both the new malls and food chains in one direction and the old town/ square in the other.    The breakfast options and service was also excellent.    However the hotel was let down by the staff. I was ignored/ left waiting to check-in likely due to coming straight from the mountains so being in scruffy clothes.. they then tried to make me pay upfront when I had already booked and paid via Amex. All in total it took around 30 mins to get checked in.    This was evening and the following morning I noticed that despite paying extra for a room with a Garden view I was overlooking a road and a car park with noise from a gate opening and closing all night as cars came in. I tried to discuss this at the front desk but their English was not great so gave up and stayed in the wrong room for my stay.    The other complaint is that due to being Easter holidays there were lots of kids left unattended by parents running and screaming around the pool between sun loungers and jumping in the pool. This is not what you would expect in a 5 star hotel and made the experience less than relaxing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: bpwarbler wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Unusable WiFi, poor service and security
Review_Text: We stayed 2 nights in this beautiful hotel but looks are deceiving. The WiFi in our room was unusable slow and unreliable- we told the front desk on our first day and while they said they would address it it was neither fixed nor did we hear back. Several rooms in our group experienced similar WiFi issues.    On the second day another group of friends checked in and they were given the room key to a stranger‚Äôs room. They found out when they saw a stranger‚Äôs luggage after brushing their teeth and using the bathroom. Needless to say lock up your valuables in case the wrong people gets access to your room.

Review_Date: alkesh a wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: We've just returned from a family trip and had a good time hotel was very nice and the coffee shop in particular was good with some very good service from the waiter named Mourad was very personable and made a very good cappuccino. Overall the stay was pleasant but we did have some issues with what we were told about 2 excursions we booked with the hotel seems the concierge and reception teams are not in sync and have their own people that they use for the trips and this caused confusion and some stress for us as we had to deal with the guides and drivers when what we had signed up to was different to what the tour people thought was agreed.

Review_Date: Karoly wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Clean rooms very kind staff good breakfast strong wi-fi.  The hotel is really OK.  But take care! If you go beyond the standard services of the hotel you have to prepared to be cheated - like everywhere in Morocco. Taxi was about 20 EUR from the airport but back to the airport it was only 15 EUR. Concierge was saying a totally different amount.  We ordered a private tour quide at the concierge and payed for it. At the end we got only a driver with a car but he was not a tour quide. Etc etc etc... Be prepared that you gonna be cheated each time wherever you go.

Review_Date: F N wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Title: Birthday trip made special thanks to Safae & Khalid
Review_Text: We got there and the welcoming part wasn‚Äôt as expected. However we were then introduced to Safae and Khalid who gave us an exceptional service and ensured to look after us the whole stay. Thanks to both my husbands birthday was a lot more memorable! Thanks for going the extra mile! I would recommend this hotel as a stay in Marrakech as it has a lot to offer the interior and exterior is beautiful and well maintained and it‚Äôs a great location!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: patrick b wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Had large corporate event at the Moevenpick and all was arranged very well. Food accommodations and presentation areas / ballroom were all up to high spec. It took participants a bit of time to get used to the confusing lay-out of the hotel but rooms were good and clean. Bar and pool area were also good. Only let-down was the slow service at the reception desk. They take way too much time to check-in and/or check-out guests. Nice place overall though.

Review_Date: Mamoon Zaheer wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Good hotel friendly staff lost my phone and cleaning hijabi lady and their supervisor helped find it! Clean rooms and facilities! Nice area with shopping mall McDonalds kfc and train station within walking distance.

Review_Date: Malveiradaserra wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: We stayed in this hotel because of attending a Congress next doors. It‚Äôs a big hotel where it takes some time to get to know the way. The rooms were nice with very comfortable beds and bathrooms. Our view was nothing and I believe a big part of the rooms doesn‚Äôt have a big view as it‚Äôs closed in by the other hotels.  Breakfast was wonderful very diverse and tasty. Nice was also that just 50 meters from the hotel are the Medina bikes that you can rent. There are several stations in Marrakech mostly at the main attractions. This brings you quickly in the centre nobody is bothering you and you don‚Äôt have the hassle with the taxi drivers.

Review_Date: Yasser K wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Me & my wife went to Marrakesh for 9 nights for my birthday. We stayed at this Movenpick Hotel thinking we will be getting excellent service but apart from the birthday cake which the hotel provided I got to say we were let down from the start. As soon as we got to the hotel there was a problem in finding our booking so it was a good job I had my hotel confirmation with me and I showed this to the receptionist. Now to my shock I was asked to pay ¬£160 deposit for the room even though I had already paid my hotel in full. I knew that I had to pay tourism tax for the hotel but this I wasn‚Äôt expecting and as I only brought cash with this had affected our holiday. When we got to the room I noticed stains on the toilet floor and also a water leak next to the toilet. I reported this but nothing was done. The food choice in the hotel was a let down so when me and my partner decided to order out we were told that we weren‚Äôt allowed to do this apart from this one time. So its either their food at the hotel or no food. When I returned to the UK I noticed I was charged extra when I checked out. I had 1 cola can from the mini bar n also when I ordered room service I paid for everything there and then apart from 2 cola bottles. But I got charged for 2 cola cans from the mini bar n 4 cola bottles. All I‚Äôm saying is when you pay good money for a hotel you expect good service n clean environment. But with my experience this wasn‚Äôt the case and I would go as far as saying that this is the worst experience me & my wife have ever had from a hotel. Rude staff members who are just wanting tips without providing good service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: BigMo2014 wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: I went with my wife in the first week of February for 5 days. Even though the weather wasnt as we expected (it was 8 degrees with some wind and rain) we made the most of it. It's in a good location away from the hustle and bustle but within good within of the main attractions with taxi.    The hotel decor was amazing and the rooms were clean. The buffet breakfast was spot on with plenty to choose from. The staff were very helpful whether it be the reception cleaning staff or the restaurant staff. During our stay there was a Chocolate Hour at 6pm and wow the varieties/taste of chocolate were amazing. We asked for a room upgrade (to a suite) on the 2nd day and our request was accepted.    The only thing that bugged me was when we first went to check-in one of the receptionist was more adamant in showing us a book of excursions. Yes this is helpful but would it not be best to show us a map of the area i.e. where the closest mall is how far the medina is how much we should be paying for taxis etc.    Now in terms of paying for taxis we would be quoted 50 dirhams everytime we wanted to go to the medina (jemma el efna). This is obviously marked up but with gentle haggling it should only be 20-30 dirhams. Be aware of people (especially in the markets) trying to latch onto you and try to be helpful/friendly - these are the hustlers! They will try taking you from one shop to another and then demand money from you. Majority of the people are friendly/helpful its just a small handful who are not. Just a piece of advice if you want to ask for directions then go to into a shop and ask a member of staff.    Also if you go to the market/souk then get lost of purpose - that's the beauty of it. The places to visit are Jemma El Efna (Markets) YSL Garden (Jardin Marjorelle) La Mamounia Hotel Gardens Koutoubia Mosque Bahia Palace Atlas Mountains (aprox. 1 hour from Marrakech)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shabz 23 wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: I recently went to Marakech for a girls trip I went in Feb the weather was nice it rained when we arrived but after this the weather picked up. I chose a hotel as I have stayed in a Riad before.    When you arrive at the Movenpick the entrance is grand and the smells are lovely the staff were friendly and easy to deal with. When we got to our rooms they were a good size we went for the king size bed.    As our stay progressed we noticed many inconsistencies our rooms were close to one another however a few of us had slippers in the room one so us had the extra pillows another had a card detailing who to call in emergencies etc etc... as time went on we found differences in the ways the rooms were cleaned and fresh towels were not provided a bath mat went missing toilettries were not replaced.    However the buffet does have a lot of variety and there are other places to eat if you fancy a change the lounge serves a good range of drinks and it's fairly quiet - but perhaps this was the time of the year we went.    The spa is always booked and I would have expected more the staff were also a little inconsistent with some being super friendly and the others being very 'matter of fact'... I would recommend they get more staff as space is not an issue - or so I was told.    It's based in the new town and very close to the airport there are some decent shopping centres near by and taxi there will cost you around 30MAD. The old town is further and I would suggest going to the souk and a few other tourist hotspots.    All in all i have given a average rating as there were some things which were great however some things could have been better and more consistent

Review_Date: Temi A wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: So so impressed with this hotel and level of service. Beautiful views and room service is delivered with minutes. Only thing I could mark them down for is lack of English speaking staff but other than that phenomenal and will be visiting again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rahul S wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: The last thing you would expect while traveling is getting robbed which is what exactly happened with me during my stay in the hotel. An amount of USD 1500 was stolen from my room(most likely by the House Keeping Staff) while i was out. To make matters worse another burglary took place the very next evening with my colleague whose wallet mobile and watch were stolen while he was sleeping inside the room. This clearly reflects the audacity of the people involved.    After all this the only expectation you have is for the Hotel staff to be supportive and get into investigating the events. However the response was extremely disappointing and questions were raised whether the burglary actually took place.    What is more shocking is that Movenpick does not even have a proper CCTV network to look into footage's as there are no camera's installed in corridors.    Clearly the worst experience of my lifetime and i do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Review_Date: takala2018 wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Title: Excellent service for a group reservation and event planning
Review_Text: Excellent service and event planning for a group visit. I would like to recommend Ms. Hafsa Ait Ouarham Meetings & Events senior Project Manager who was our contact person at the hotel. She was very attentive during the course of the planning and flexible regarding sudden changes in the tight schedules.

Review_Date: Omar S wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: I had to stay at this hotel for 3 nights to attend our sales kick off meeting. The hotel is good enough to provide the Movempick standards and to provide the comfort enough the hotel is located near walking distance to restaurants and clubs and provide full fledge for business case as it close to the conference Center.

Review_Date: Abir J wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: We stayed at the hotel for almost a week. For the sake of providing a fair and balanced review I am sharing the positives and negatives:    Positives:  1) the hotel looks stunning and has beautiful decoration.  2) an amazing house keeping lady whose name is Kareema. She was amazing as she was committed dedicated and friendly. Our rooms were clean and we had everything we needed.    Negatives:  1) Key chains: we had to request key cards every single day. This was the first time ever that I had to change keys so often. That was a major area of frustration.    2) Wi-fi/ TV problems: wi-fi was consistently poor/ bad and on some occasions you will not be able to join the Movenpick network. The last two days of our stays the TV would stop working for hours. You report the issue and nothing is done about it.    3) Lack of key information/ key details in the room:  One room out of the three rooms we booked had an important phone list. It is lots of trouble to call the service center to transfer us to reception. We felt bad as we did not want to bother them.    Is there a room service? All three rooms only had a small booklet which had signature dishes. This was rather useless. Due to the limited information available we ended up ordering food delivery as opposed to making use of the room service.    4) The English of some staff is below average and if you do not speak French or Arabic you are at a disadvantage. Communicating in Arabic was also a struggle due to regional variation. Resorting to English did not help as some staff apparently do not Know any English at all.    5) old lifts: the lift at the Zaidanne building was so old and the carpet looked disgusting. Having more modern lifts is a good idea.    Some suggestions:  The name of the buildings are not easy to spot / see at night. Perhaps place a sign with the name of the building next to the steps leading to a building.    With the buildings being spaced out and far from reception it would be helpful if there is a phone in each building in a designated common area to be used in case of emergency.

Review_Date: Prasanna D wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: I would give it 5 star for its location food and service. It's at walkable distance from Marrakech train station and well connected to Marrakech airport.    We were around 30 people from India Germany and US. It was a global team from Merck. The stay was arranged weeks back and we were well received.    I'd never been to a star hotel earlier so this was a new experience. I had a nice room with a king size bed and everything was just perfectly arranged.    The food was awesome. I loved the Moroccan cuisine. The staffs were very helpful and my 3 days of stay was filled with nice experience.Good job. keep it up.

Review_Date: marfschr81 wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Our stay would have been excellent if we had booked a garden view room. The staff around the hotel are excellent: pool restaurant gym and bar. The receptionist are not very helpful. We had a superior king and did not get any sleep. It was the last room in the resort next to a man powered gate that opens all night long. It sounds like a train is going by. Reception was not help telling us the rooms were all booked and we could not change rooms. Every night I would check and sure enough there were still superior rooms available--such a disappointment. We could not even use our terrace because security sits at the gate all day and all night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: lukeyboy95 wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: Very large and opulent, nice in winter
Review_Text: Some aspects of this hotel are completely amazing - like the entrance and like sitting curled up in a dressing gown on a cold winter's evening as the sun sets.    The place looks brilliant at night.    The room was extremely comfortable although at this price a bath would have been a justified extravagance. After the Holiday Inn where I'm writing this review from even has a tatty old bath.    Pool heated in winter. Highly wonderful.    Breakfast was actually very average with limited selection of foods and receptionists were incompetent for check-out.

Review_Date: andrew s wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: The poorest hotel in service ever seen by myself. The concierge is just a tourist package salesperson who refuses to answer any questions but only to market the corny tourist trap hotel packages. She refused to answer our simple direct to the point questions as if we were interrogating her. Room service is great if they ever pick up the phone. The staff at the reception do not mind yhier own business and ask odd questions. The breakfast area was infested with bees. The spa is always busy and the staff are rude. Too many children shouting in the corridors and doors squeeking like a horror movie. If you don't tip the waiters during breakfast you can forget about the service. Understaffed hotel with nice decor.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: 991apie wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Last Christmas holiday we stayed with the family in the M√∂venpick hotel. Because it fulfilled all our expectations that one may have of a 5-star hotel good accommodations friendly staff good food etc. we considered staying here this year again during the Christmas holidays. For me personally an absolute motive to revisit the M√∂venpick were the treatments in the Spa of the hotel and in particular that of Najia.    Without exaggeration she gave the best massage I had ever experienced. We decided to go again this year and again I have experienced some treatments in the spa √î de Rose. Again a wonderful experience one not to forget! Special thanks to Najia who with her professional and delicious treatments gives a sincere reason to return to Movenpick Marrakech!

Review_Date: NCDiamond wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: I really enjoyed this hotel. Rooms were quiet clean and comfortable. The grounds were absolutely beautiful with several quiet relaxing nooks tucked away -- you would never guess you were in the middle of a city. All the food I had was pretty darn good especially the breakfast buffet and the Moroccan restaurant in the back. The location was fairly convenient -- there are plenty of options within a 15 minute walk and the Medina was just a bit further. Even though some of the streets were quiet at night around the hotel we didn't feel unsafe. Conference facilities were also great and the Palais des Congres is one of the largest meeting rooms I've ever seen.    Staff was friendly enough but I did not find them particularly helpful when I asked questions. Not bad it's just that part didn't stand out. Never checked out the gym so I can't comment on that. The pool looked lovely but I never made it in for a swim. The internet was fairly reliable most of the time. It's hard to think of anything that stood out as bad. There were lots of bees on the patio during breakfast I guess.    Rooms in the back -- in buildings with higher numbers -- will be more removed and tranquil but can be a long walk especially with luggage. (I heard some elderly patrons complaining about it.) Rooms in the front -- with lower building numbers -- are more convenient to lobby breakfast and hotel amenities.    From a Western perspective I thought this hotel offered great value for the money.

Review_Date: Mariella G wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: Very nice hotel but disappointing service
Review_Text: We arrived at the Movenpick the evening of the 30th December we were fascinated by the design of the hotel the reception looks truly amazing. We had booked a room for three people (my husband our daughter and me) but once in the room we found out that the room was set up only for two people there was no bed for our daughter no towels for her and only one cup to make our tea or coffe. And the minibar was empty despite being a pricelist. We called reception to ask for those things to be delivered to the room but nobody came while we were undoing our suitcases. So we decided to stop by reception on our way out to dinner to ask for those things again as upon our return to the room we would need to have a shower and go to bed. On our return only the towels were there but no bed for our dauther and as of today there is still only one cup (little detail I know but we do like having a cup of coffee and tea first thing in the morning without having to call for room service). Yesterday we were left again with just two shower towels and one face towel we asked reception and nothing has been sent up to our room. There seems to be quite an issue with housekeeping as the room is not left that clean either. We will stop by reception today and ask once again‚Ä¶

Review_Date: Sofie S wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: Business an Pleasure with Uriage team Belgium!
Review_Text: The hotel was very nice in every aspect. The rooms were big enough clean and had a high comfort level with very good and soft beds. The staff was very professional helpful and very kind. The best thing about the hotel was the food we would definitely recommand the restaurant. The equipment and rooms we hired for our seminar were very professional and extended. They fulfilled all of our wishes. The Spa and heated swimmingpool heavenly to enjoy even in a colder month. Our next seminar in Morocco will be in this hotel again!  Special thanks to meeting and events manager Hafsa Ait Ouarham for the best service everything was taken care of meticulously and with the biggest smile!    Uriage Belgium  Sofie Zo√´ en Nicolas

Review_Date: jronald wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Lovely hotel half board option is good value nice rooms and services one of the best we have seen in Marrakech only things to improve is wait and speed of check-in and internal telephone services need to answer more promptly otherwise vers satisfied and thank you again! It's our favorite stop-over in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: kshim86 wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Service was poor like most places in Morocco. Though the room was spacious and nice.  Staffs are very unprofessional. For instance both my husband's and my access cards stopped working so we had to go to the lobby to get issued new ones.  The staff does not even check your ID and gives you the new access cards right away and no explanation when we asked why cards stopped working.  The next evening same thing happened (which I find bizarre). We went down to the reception the guy just reissued the card without checking our ID and no explanation.    Water temperature knob in shower was broken so every 15 seconds the temperature would change to super hot.. so I had to wash my hair and shower with one hand while the other hand is holding the temperature knob.    Next time we will definitely pay more and stay somewhere nicer...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: A2146MHtinar wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: Nice rooms but not a 5* hotel
Review_Text: Not sure we will come back.. The service level was very poor. Though the rooms and balcony was very nice. If we would come back to Marrakesh we would probably pay that little extra and stay at the Royal Mansour instead.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claudia D wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Very nice hotel in Marrakech with fantastic swimming pools and gardens. We had a spacious suite and the location is perfect to relax but also to attend the PURE Show. Service is fine and restaurant are quite good. Spa should improve as the atmosphere is not so cozy. Excellent concierge service

Review_Date: Eva S wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Very nice room frendly and helpfull staff great pool area and gym. The hotel garden was beuatifull and serene. Varied fresh and delicious breakfast.  Appreciated the choclate tasting every day and the aerobic class with Aziz.

Review_Date: Ayaz S wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: We are a family of 5 so had booked 2 superior rooms for a 4 night stay after reading excellent reviews. First impressions are great especially the reception areas and poolside. Had to walk to the end of the resort to find the rooms on 2nd floor of building no 7. No inter-connecting rooms available in this building so asked for rooms opposite each other - this was not possible as all sold out. Had to make do with two rooms on same floor facing a busy road with a night club. Stayed up most nights with noise of metal garage door opening and shutting every 15 to 20 minutes - sounded like sound of metal shutters being shut next to the windows. Some nights also noise from night club traffic. Nothing was done about the garage doors despite complaining numerous times and room change was only offered on same floor still road facing. Second main problem was that room keys stopped working every day and had to be renewed. Reception staff were not very friendly.    Best feature of the hotel was the breakfast with lovely fresh food and friendly staff. Concierge was also good (Abdul Haq) and helped arrange trips and transportation.

Review_Date: Bush 2 Sea wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: I spent half a day at the Cinq Mondes spa after a couple of days walking in the Atlas Mountains. It was phenomenal! The spa is beautiful and the staff enhance the experience. Mr Bennani one of the hotels managers personally checked on me which impressed me. Next time I‚Äôll be staying at the hotel too. World class!

Review_Date: Olga O wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Hotel is very nice the lobby swimming pool. We also like walk-in shower :)  Great breakfast with live cooking dozens of croissants and hazelnut cream :)  One disadvantage of that place is its location. For people without kids I think its not a problem but for us with a stroller it was a little bit too far away from all sights. All curbs are so high that walking with a stroller is almost like a gym :)  Our son got sick and they helped us a lot. Very nice man from the staff (unfortunately I dont know his name but I think he was a manager) organized a doctor within 20 minutes. In that kind of situation everything what is wrong becomes less important. We are so grateful to him for that.

Review_Date: MTT2903 wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: I spent one night at the Movenpick. The room was largeclean and recently renewed. The service was nice and the SPA ok. The hotel is so large that you get lost. Nice for business conventions. The location of the hotel is great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mohamed M wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Hope to come back again there At marakech And Specially at Movenpick With their fantastic swimming pool And near by rests The workers all very kind with good smile and helpful . Recomend it Highly Thanks

Review_Date: aliazizm wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Excellent place with very hospitable team in the restaurant amuse by the breakfast üç≥ with ibtessam we share its work on facebook and if available to attach screen shots from our posts i will make that ask about IBTESSAM when you reach to the restaurant at breakfast üç≥ also another female chef at the luanch also so hospital girl and so cute üçéüçé

Review_Date: PTFE wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel recently. All restaurants and bars are good and staff attentive and helpful. The ‚Äòturn down‚Äô staff were particularly friendly (my wife had a cold) and I enjoyed ‚Äòchocolate hour‚Äô. Oh also full marks for a great breakfast.  PS It‚Äôs a bit too far to walk to the old town from this hotel but only ¬£5 taxi fare (make sure seatbelts are there!).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: elenae315 wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: great place to stay and enjoy quiet time. swimming pool is perfect spa is very nice food is awesome and lying in bed feels as you were lying in a cloud. Wifi in some bedrooms is sometimes not very quick but network engineer Najib was always available and willing help us with each issue and request. he was perfect!

Review_Date: Jean-Francois B wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: An excellent place for business events
Review_Text: Very nicely decorated modern hotel with excellent facilities for congresses. Maybe having meeting rooms with daylight would be better. Being in a sunshine place and not seeing the sun is a little bit a shame... But everything was very good.

Review_Date: AasamAndMariam A wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Movenpick Marrakech was an absolute delightful and fantastic hotel.  All the staff are very happy and content in the work that they are doing which makes the guests also feel happy and content.  The restaurants in the hotel are fantastic and provide an excellent quality of food and service.  The breakfast area is immaculate and there was always someone to tend to your needs.  The qualityquantity and variety offered at breakfast is second to none.  It's not just the facilities and location that makes a great hotel its mainly the people.  There were a number of people that made us feel like we were at home and gave us a homely feel and I would like to call out these people.  Mr Amin for arranging the whole experience from our stay's start to finish.  Mr Khalid Mowlad who gave us the utmost respect and treated us like a member of his family - and we even shared a coffee with Mr Khalid.  The omelette/fried eggs chef-who clearly not only loves her job she made sure that her plate was immaculately presented as if we were dining in a 5-star michelin restaurant.  Lastly but not least Miss Safae who (in fact I struggle to find words to represent her kindness) has shown the true nature of a decent honest and kind human being and treated us with so much love that words just cannot describe it. Her official title is Guest Relations Manager - but please just call her Safae-there's no title that can describe her.    The only problem was that me and my wife "REALLY DID NOT WANT TO LEAVE"    Lots to do -  Menara Mall 20 minute walking distance  City tour Bus - outside hotel main road - 3 minute walking distance  Taxis freely available  Walking distance to restaurants  40 minute leisurely walking distrance to Jemm El Fnaa
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ddmmem wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: This was the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in. We stayed in building 4 which gives you an idea of its size. The buffet breakfast was included in the price. If I were to go back to Marrakech I would likely stay there again.

Review_Date: sajdorski wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Hotel is very nice the lobby swimming pools. We also like our walk-in shower :)  Great breakfast with live cooking dozens of croissants and hazelnut cream :)  One disadvantage of that place is its location. For people without kids I think it could not be a problem but for us with a stroller it was a little bit too far away from all sights. All curbs are so high that walking with a stroller is almost like a gym :)  Our son got sick and hotel staff helped us a lot. Very nice man from the staff (unfortunately I dont know his name but I think he was a manager) organized a doctor within 20 minutes. In that kind of situation everything what is wrong becomes less important. We are so grateful to him for that.

Review_Date: Miracle J wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Spent 5 days in this beautiful Palace with wonderful service and friendly staff. Im humbled and will return again also recommend this as a great stay while in Marrakech~location is accurately placed in the center of almost everything~

Review_Date: Nehal C wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: Fantastic, but my visit was ruined..
Review_Text: Mixed feelings about this hotel. The decor is amazing; it won‚Äôt let you down. Definitely luxurious. The ground staff (waiters concierge etc) are incredibly friendly. The rooftop bar and the pool areas are all amazing. This hotel spells luxury. Breakfast is amazing; the range is fantastic. A special shoutout goes to my friend Safae who helped me to find places to eat outside of the hotel and made my stay comfortable.    However there is also a lack of professionalism which exists within the management of this hotel. The rules and regulations are atrocious and totally illogical.  I had booked a Junior Suite and requested for my friend to come and visit me. We wanted to plan our days together and I thought we could sit in the living room and do this. However to my dismay and shock he was not allowed to come to my room. The staff outright refused. I‚Äôm assuming that there‚Äôd be no point in renting the penthouse which has a boardroom as I wouldn‚Äôt be allowed to bring external guests. Very disappointing.    Another day the same issue occurs when the gentlemen from Pizza Hut arrives. The hotel does not have many good food options for vegetarians and all of the food they have is extortionately expensive. I had ordered a pizza and I had to walk for about 7 minutes from my room which is on the other side of the resort to come and collect it. Appalling. I would have expected a member of staff to come with him had they been so scared. The hotel was quick to deny things but not quick enough to rectify it.    The last straw was pulled during checkout an experience which was absolutely infuriating. I had spoken to the gentlemen at reception in the morning and he had told me that it was okay for me to check out at 5pm which is when my car was coming as I had a night flight. After landing in London I knew that I‚Äôd have to drive for two hours to get home so I thought I‚Äôd get some sleep in the afternoon. However at 3pm I received a phonecall from the management telling me to evacuate the room. When I spoke of my prior arrangement with the receptionist she exclaimed in shock ‚Äú5pm?! No no sir you must clear the room now I need the suite‚Äù it was so unbelievably unprofessional. I told her to check with her colleagues and then received no phonecall back however I wasn‚Äôt able to sleep as a result of this and so I felt very sleepy whilst driving back home that night. More than that after the phonecall ended I went online and checked Expedia and to my shock it said that there were five Junior Suites available to be booked for that night. So I didn‚Äôt understand the urgency for me to evacuate my room.  I expected a higher standard of service and professionalism from such an establishment but as per the above it is evident that these standards were not met.    Would I return to this hotel? Probably not seeing as when i visited Sofitel during my stay the service was impeccable and I couldn‚Äôt fault them at all. I‚Äôll probably stay at Sofitel for my next visit to Marrakech.

Review_Date: tautog1 wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: I stayed at the Movenpick for 11 days in November while attending a meeting. The grounds were lovely and open the room was very nice with no troubles and the restaurants were good. Breakfast was very good also. The gym was well equipped. I did not use the spa. Although it is a few minutes from the old city which I had hoped to stay closer to before arriving it was easy to get there. I would stay at this hotel again as would my wife who accompanied me for part of the trip.

Review_Date: 31dal wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: One of the best hotels handsdown 5*****
Review_Text: This hotel was unbelievably beautiful has to be one of the best hotels I‚Äôve ever stayed at customer service was it 10 out of 10 and the room was a 15 out of 10 just unbelievable words cannot describe how good this hotel is. I‚Äôve been to a lot of hotels not just to brag but this has to be in my to top 5.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: hanna127 wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Very Good Hotel Good and big rooms and nice service! I enjoyed the stay in that great Hotel very much and really would like to come back. I had a good time and the service of the hotel was very good!

Review_Date: Fatemah M wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Wonderful hotel clean and very comfortable rooms... very nice breakfast.  The restaurants in the hotel are also very good.    The staff: most are very good few are average.    I would stay again in this hotel.

Review_Date: Cory O wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Traveled here for work. The hotel is excessively opulent. Everything gleamed and glowed and was illuminated.    Grounds were beautiful and the rooms were spacious clean modern and comfortable. This is a very high end hotel.    My only reservation is that the meals provided to us in the restaurant (I was attending a very large conference in the adjoining conference center) were reptitive and not very exciting.

Review_Date: Prof1000 wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Marrakech is a wonderful destination which has all kinds of options for accommodation.
