The Movenpick Hotel Mansour is a place to go to be pampered a bit out of the center but close enough to enjoy what the city has to offer. The main square and old quarter is a very short cab ride. The hotel could not be nicer and has choice of dining pool spa and what you would expect from a deluxe resort. The staff is friendly and helpful. It is priced so that even those on a budget might want to splurge a few nights.

Review_Date: BaBh001 wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: My first time in Marrakech and wanted to stay in a nicer hotel to help familarizing the city. Little did I expect such mediocore front desk service from a 5 star hotel. The staff barely speaks any English totally ignored people waiting online to check in they all have similar "do not ask me question" expression when I first checked in and subsequently when I approached the front desk asked questions about the city or hotel facilities. The worst part is the room they gave us was in horrible shape. First they gave us a room with horrible sewage smell as soon as we opened the door then there was strong cooking smell from the restaurant next building when we open the bacony window. When I explained the problem to the front desk they did not even bother to apologize just simply gave me a key to a different room without even offer to move our luggages as if we are the ones causing the problem. The room they gave us subsequently was freezing cold one of the lamps was not working and the toilette did not flush properly. I have stayed in many high end hotels in many countries for business or leisures and this is the worst hotel I ever stayed.

Review_Date: PalmieriMex wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Excellent place nice and clean. Just at two blocks from M√©nara Mall and near Marrakech Medina.  Modern rooms and nice Gym the restaurant with excellent international food and local food.  Security 100% you feel secure all time inside or outside nice people in Morocco

Review_Date: TallulahBan wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: I found the spa experience to be below par and overpriced. The room I was given was next to a noisy elevator. There were some good things about this hotel.... the staff were lovely and very welcoming and helpful and the setting is gorgeous .... but the whole spa experience was disappointing for what it was

Review_Date: Maeve W wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Lovely hotel but rooms are a bit basic
Review_Text: I stayed in this hotel for a conference this month. While the public areas are very luxurious the bedrooms are a bit basic! I had to change rooms after a day because the shower leaked so badly it was flooding the carpet in my bedroom! When I went to lock the security chain on my door in the second room it just came off the wall!! To be fair though reception fixed it immediately and there were no further issues with it. The pool is lovely and warm and the breakfast selection was great. As a vegetarian the other dining options were quite limited.    Service could be quite hit and miss. Reception didn't believe me when I said my phone wouldn't make outgoing calls the TV didn't always work but had no English language entertainment channels the TV would turn on every night around 1.40am for no apparent reason. However the housekeeper Najat was amazing and really looked after me! El Mehdi and My Ahmed in the bar (along with a young man with braces whose name I didn't catch) were all lovely and gave outstanding service as well!    Overall it's a nice hotel but depending on which staff member you deal with the service can either be fab or awful!

Review_Date: Liznewarkesque wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: The best experience i‚Äôve ever had in Morocco! Can‚Äôt wait to return
Review_Text: The hotel is amazingly decorated! The restaurant and staff are amazing! Mohammad made sure my preferred drink was always available! The cleaning staff was pleasant and Abdeslam Jeldi made sure that my room was comfortable and welcoming.

Review_Date: MelbourneRod wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: We stayed in this top rated hotel for two nights. Although the standard rooms are a bit small they are still very well presented. The room is very clean modern and one of the best hotels in town for the money. Breakfast was excellent with many options.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fabman13 wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Nice hotel, but not so great service
Review_Text: I stayed in this hotel in relation to a conference taking place there. It is a very nice hotel nice surroundings and nice setup. The quality of the service and of the front desk is below average. Food and bar are nice and good but again let down by poor service. Very mixed experience.

Review_Date: Ali B wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Good location excellent staff and service very clean good restaurants nice place to stay in recommend for couples and family's room was so clean and comfortable just the WiFi was fair and need more chanel for kids

Review_Date: Witek S wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Good but still some work has to be done
Review_Text: Room was dirty WiFi connection without coverage in my room fridge not working minibar empty. On the other hand - fantastic swimming pool very good breakfast great bar and very good staff. It's a good hotel but it needs some procedures to control the shape of rooms before checking guests.

Review_Date: Hans S wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Very nice hotel pool and spa ! but the staff overall is not worth the five stars!!! room maids knocking on door at 0700 walking in the room etc an absolut nogo! very disappointing (happened twice)  concierges: only one guy up to the job. (friday 17.11.1710.30 am) all others not up to the job! restaurants and bars seem to occupy people that dont know their job. A no-returner!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: sebastiancV3147OB wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: There is nothing bad to say about the hotel.rooms are quiet. There is excellent mattress bathroom and room was clean and cleaned up each day.. swimming pool was clean also.staff is friendly. breakfast was good.

Review_Date: Drghannam wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: It‚Äôs realy a great hotel clean friendly personnel beitiful landscape very nice pool well furnished I realy advice all who comes to marrakish to use this hotel and for me I am planning to have a family trip to Marraksh and will have M√∂venpick as my address there.

Review_Date: Steve G wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: It‚Äôs a big hotel. Entrance impressive. Public areas neat tidy and well presented.    Two main pools which look inviting but unfortunately are freezing cold so were quite unusable which is a pity.    Booked junior suite which was actually a one bedroom suite with separate lounge and bedroom. Well furnished with very nice bathroom and terrace. Turndown was hit and miss.    Breakfast standard affair. Nothing spectacular. As it‚Äôs a big hotel it‚Äôs busy at breakfast and has a cafeteria type feel.    Had buffet dinner one night. Ok nothing special.    Overall it‚Äôs what I would rate a good 4 Star. It‚Äôs not Deluxe. Service was hit and miss and surly at times in the restaurants and by the pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cristian P wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: good hotel high prices poor staff. A big hotel  very nic but services are poor and expensives.Marrakech is not either Europe neither Dubai.. ..  I asked a city map at lobby and they said ..We don t have. A  Probably I don t recommend this hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Crosenberg wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: A huge well decorated place with an exceptionally beautiful pool (especially at night). But the service didn't measure up to the standard expected of this kind of hotel. It started with a cumbersome check-in process slowed down by understaffing and inefficiency. Getting an ironing board to the room took several calls (first response: "I don't have someone to send"). And the staff at the pool and bar was inattentive. Also the wifi is very erratic and the breakfast ain't great. I think there are better options in town!

Review_Date: LaurentC92 wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: We went four days for a family trip in Marrakech. M√∂venpick hotel is very nice and convenient. The gardens are beautiful breakfast is very good as well as the moroccan restaurant. It would be perfect if the pool was heated :)

Review_Date: Olaf v wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Hotel is clean friendly staff good food great location beautifull hotel.  Down side high prices for alcohol and slow internet connection. WIFI not strong enough for e-mail Netflix and Facetime/Skype.

Review_Date: Akylai Idirisov... K wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: I don¬¥t have anything to add really after I filled out this survey. But it was a really beautiful stay and we enjoyed ourselves a lot. But the wifi should be better because it was really slow and poor which is annoying.

Review_Date: Pedro F wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Oversized Hotel but because it does spread out in area it does give an unusual warm feeling.  Perfect for travelers that do not want to have trip with very close encounters with the local flavors with all the pros and cons that this implies.  Excellent for families with small children.

Review_Date: Mimi G wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: What can we say this hotel has become our second home! Every time we have been to Marrakech this has been our go to place the hotel has made us feel comfortable catered to all our needs and have treated us like one of them. We will definitely be back next year!    Firstly we would like to say a massive thank you to some of the staff starting with:  Ayoub  What can we say Ayoub was so caring and attentive to our needs he made us feel like we are one of a kind! Always smiling and always happy and for that we thank him so much he is one of the reasons why we will come back to the hotel. He is very professional and always makes sure our drinks/food was there pronto!.    Hamza  He was always willing to please and will go out of his way to make sure the service was perfect for us even while extremely busy. He was very patient and attentive to our needs for that we would recommend friends and family.    Nadine  She was one of the best pool waitresses we have ever had she was so loving and caring and extremely quick! When she saw us at the pool she always went out of her way to say hello to us. She made us feel right at home!    Behija  She was like our second mum! Made us feel like we were at home with her sweet smile and her fantastic service.    ThNk you so much M√∂venpick for allowing us to have another amazing holiday!

Review_Date: K3320EEjonathanb wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: this hotel is a real 5 stars the quality of the employees and the decoration of the lobby is just amazing  The breakfast is very good and very complete.  The sunbeds are very good and comfortable  i will recommand it for sure to my friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: MrHCurrentReviews wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Great hotel and would recommend to all. Located centrally with access to the main square and local to shops and restaurants. Greater service food is excellent and facilities are very nice.    The main swimming pool is stunning but unfortunately not heated. There is also a spa unit which not busy and provides a relaxing experience.    Would also recommend the kids' club.    There are three restaurants on site.

Review_Date: shak_rathore wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Beautiful relaxing environment. The experience was great. We enjoyed the breakfast as family. Staff were helpful. Very clean.  Only one thing early morning (6:30am) breakfast buffet set up was delayed which was slightly disappointing.

Review_Date: Larbe wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: We decided on a quick half term break. The food was very good especially breakfast. The room we all had were deluxe the bed gave us all the best sleep we have had in a hotel. All the staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Sun loungers around the pool were the best we have had better than the Burj in Dubai !  Couldn't recommend this hotel enough.  Tried rebooking straight away and no availability !

Review_Date: ahsank846 wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Overall great vacation wonderful location and friendly staff. Good buffet breakfast nice spa/hammam. Room was clean private hotel not noisy. Shisha was good st night on rooftop lounge. Penthouse was very spacious and loved the private pool

Review_Date: Wessimchater wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Very good h√¥tel very welcoming ng staff helpful and smiling all the times . The food was excellent and luxurious rooms the issue is that some rooms are not far from noisy machines ( not sure what it was) the AC in the conference room was also so noisy that we should put it off  Very good in general

Review_Date: Jaime C wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: In gneeral terms it was a very good experience. The check-inn procedures should be improved; it took too long too many information was requested but in exchange for very little information or no information at all about the hotel the city etc.

Review_Date: V5382VWjosea wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: good hotelnice restaurants but no so good service specially on the Mediterranean Restaurant... Breakfast was good but there was little offer on fruits on the buffet....Not easy to find your roomsince is a very large hotel...

Review_Date: Tarek F wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: The Hotel location is perfect for business and leisure. The minute you enter you feel you are at a Moroccan palace. The architecture the decorations and even the smell are Moroccan. Hotel facilities are very nice. Staff is very friendly and food is great. The rooms are not as beautiful as the Hotel and they definitely need some maintenance and renovation. The furniture is modern but the colors are not attractive. Beds are comfortable.

Review_Date: V5375QHsimonm wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Staff are friendly and services are good Other than the just one of the two passenger lifts that seemed to have some minor mechanical issue (door closing too soon) everything else was excellent.  Air conditioning system in the rooms is very efficient.  Hotel location is serene  dinner and the dancers give me a unique experience.

Review_Date: Burak S wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Very good hotel in the city. It has local architecture with modern room decorations and all amenities. The bathroom is very nice the room is spacious. There are two outdoor swimming pools. The food is great too. The hotel is very big scattered in several buildings so you may get lost.

Review_Date: PaulF007 wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: Great setting beautiful **** Suggest Staff might need some training
Review_Text: Attending a conference next door I stayed for 4 nights at the hotel. My first room 3325 was disaster terrible smell coming from room reception and maid service unable to deal with it opening windows spraying something all to no avail. Moved rooms for the second night all is well. Very slow check-in and very slow if you needed any help from reception they seemed to spend a lot of time talking (and shouting) to each other to be avoided if possible. Maybe its a local way of communicating because the bar staff also spoke and shouted at each other something not often seen in European hotels. The food was excellent including breakfast great selection and fantastic setting. There is a small cafe type place near the front which sells very nice food one particular person I think her name was Naima was especially friendly made me feel very at home well done to her. Overall I thought the place had a great atmosphere everyone doing their best and but some more staff training could make itself more like its big competitor La mamounia Hotel.

Review_Date: Oaq W wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Stayed at Movenpick Mansour for 5nights and it wasn‚Äôt all that.    A very big hotel so be prepared for the walk from reception to your room in the most part out in the sun. For such a big hotel the rooms were actually not as big as indicated.  Appears more suited for conferences than family breaks.  Buffet meals had a good variety to choose from at breakfast and dinner and the service there was ok though the staff often times appeared overwhelmed.  Housekeeping was quite good and our chamber lady Najal was very prompt and made sure our room was always tidy.  Ordering coffee and cake at the cafe was good but be prepared to wait a while as they might have to go all the way to the restaurant to get the cake.  Taxis are in abundance right outside the hotel and you hardly have to wait to get one.

Review_Date: oas846 wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Staff kept chatting even though I walked up to the reception. This created a very bad first impression. The first room was very far from the reception and the pool view was non-existent because palm fronds blocked the view. Room had a bad smell so was moved to a room that had a blank wall as its view. Could not connect to hotel wifi and reaching the reception from the room was almost impossible.

Review_Date: ben642016 wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Located in the Hivernage district and neighboring the convention center of Marrakech this hotel has in theory a lot to offer for anyone on a business or leisure trip in Marrakech  The reality is totally different: the service is terrible and specifically inefficient extremely slow and light years away from the basics of customer service  The bathrooms in rooms (we tried several rooms after complaints all the same) are wrongly designed so that the water will flood your room rather than going the drain way.  Every single request takes hours to be dealt with probably because of incompetence more than bad will.  There is enough choice in Marrakech to go elsewhere  Not recommended

Review_Date: Sare L wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: Lovely staff made our visit special
Review_Text: We spent a relaxing week enjoying the pools and the food. The spa treatments were great. Our holiday was made enhanced by the excellent service provided by Nadine in the bar and Khalid who was always smiling and polite when delivering our room service.

Review_Date: Malak K wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: Worst hotel ever !! Don‚Äôt go there
Review_Text: Stayed at the Movenpick for a getaway weekend to chill and relax I am very dispointed in all possible ways. 1st the rooms are tiny the minibar is empty and when we called the reception for bottles of water no one was answering. We had to go down to get them. The service is very bad: no menu if you wanna have lunch by the pool. U need to go all the way to the chalk board to read what‚Äôs on the menu. We left the room at 9am by noon the room wasn‚Äôt made... never going back there !

Review_Date: Tomtomaz2 wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: While I did read the negative reviews after staying here most seemed service related and I must admit language a big issue for English and getting things done. Nice modern hotel mini bar empty hotel restaurants(3) are expensive...lunch buffet 32‚Ç¨ and no option for menu ordering...excellent buffet choices for all meals. 3 restaurants nearby by but not high quality..however you can get anywhere by taxi for less that 8‚Ç¨. Beautiful pool and outdoor restaurant but  18.5‚Ç¨ for a hamburger. Lobby and sitting areas beautiful and clean. Worthless screening system at door..alarm always goes off. But our visit was flawless with patience for language issues.

Review_Date: Cookie3108 wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed here to celebrate my 30th Birthday and I was surprised on arrival with an amazing chocolate cake in the room and every staff member we encountered were super friendly and wished me a happy birthday. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and super clean the room was big with lots of space and the bed was really comfortable. The coffee shop is really nice as well and the service there was great. The breakfast was lovely and contained a great selection the mint tea was delicious! Can't wait to go back!

Review_Date: LGRA wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Visited this hotel last month for a work conference & stayed for 2 nights. This is a beautiful hotel the rooms are very large as is the bathroom. Decorated beautifully. Lovely robe & slippers safe in room & a fridge. Lovely pools with super comfortable sunbeds. Can't complain about the food either buffet style breakfast & lunch. Never ate dinner in the hotel. The conference area in the hotel was very well thought out aswell. Staff all seemed very pleasant and helpful.

Review_Date: Phidi M wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Movenpick was located in a beautiful location in Marrakesh. Very clean and tourist friendly - (apart from the few stares here and there maybe cos of my skin color). Food was great ambiance was great. The only problem was that the bar wasn't well stocked and the barman took about an hour to make one cocktail making it frustrating. They also mostly only speak french or arabic and that made it hard to communicate to house keeping waiting staff etc. My mini bar was not stocked (even after request). The rooms are spacious and beautiful. However I would still recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: natalieclif4d wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Visited this hotel for my friends 30th and could not have been more pleased. The staff were so eager to help and everyone was so friendly . The hotel itself is stunning and impeccably clean the attention to detail is amazing from the red roses in reception to the petals being on the bed each day . I had contacted the general manager before our visit to inform him it was a special occasion we were visiting for and when we got to our room there was a birthday cake waiting for my friend was such a nice touch. We will be looking to go back asap!

Review_Date: Insearchofsplendour wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: This hotel is ideally located and is stunning. There are several restaurants to choose from including a morrocan mediterranean and a buffet. Staff are friendly. There is a business room with a computer and printer so that you can print off your boarding passes or other important needs. There is a large swimming pool in the heart of the complex. The breakfast is out of this world with fresh soups and fruit and the usual cooked variety. Beautifully cut fruit and fresh mint tea.

Review_Date: Dahoui wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Spent five nights at the Movenpick in Marrakech.  Our junior suite was very large and comfortable. It was clean; the bed was very comfortable; the bathroom was large and modern; the room had all the equipment we needed.  Breakfast was superb and service was excellent.  The hotel has several pools and is conveniently located between the airport and the medina.  In short it was a lovely stay. By the way the price was quite reasonable.  We shall definitely return.

Review_Date: Zahra_Matabdin wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: This hotel is great! I was excited to leave a review here because I was so impressed with the service provided. All the employees at Movenpick are the most friendly and helpful people they are so lovely. There was a day when I was ill and one of the managers of the hotel wanted to know if I and my family were fine we had told him how we were feeling and he immediately assisted us. He took care of us in the lobby and ordered tea and water bottles. We met two managers of the hotel unfortunately I was not able to take their names they were both so approachable and lovely and made sure we were happy with our stay. Everything about the hotel was exceptional and I don‚Äôt give praise lightly. It was clean stylish. The room itself was well equipped and comfortable. The bedroom was very spaciousa and very comfortable. I could go on but suffice to say I was very pleased with my stay and although short and sweet this time I hope to be back for a longer visit in the future. We would also like to say thank you to Amine he really was very caring and always greeted us with a smile. He would always stop and have a conversation with us and the guests. I wish I was able to make a note of all the names of the employees to say thank you. I have also recommended all my friends and family to stay here when they visit Marrakech.

Review_Date: Travel_Ang_1 wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: What an absolutely beautiful hotel the grounds are beautiful gardens pools facilities....there is not one thing I can fault about this hotel.  10mins drive to Marrakech centre 15mins drive to the airport.  The lead in classic rooms are absolutely gorgeous with lovely big bathrooms.  I visit Marrakech regularly and this for sure will be one I will be staying in again!

Review_Date: 86kristiend wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: we had to go to the Palais des Congr√©s for business and as this is next to the Movenpick ideal for this.  we reserved a suite and this was very good for the price we paid for. A lot of space to work also..

Review_Date: 876georgial wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Fabulous service at the restaurants and the hammam! I hope to go back. In particular the food at Medi Terra and Dahbi was fantastic. Friendly staff lovely pool area especially at the small quiet pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael V wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: A fair room for the price. Wifi and Keycards a big pain.
Review_Text: We stayed in room 3301 and 3309 for a business trip. The wifi didn't work in most places in the room (front door and tv only) and the keycards lost their magnetism too easily when in contact with your phone or wallet. With the room so far away from the front desk it was a pain to always have new keycards scanned for you.    Other than that the rooms were clean and well kept. The service especially at breakfast was awesome - I highly recommend getting a omelet from the lady there.

Review_Date: manur0sell wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: Movenpick Marrakech the disaster that Mr. Chavy knows
Review_Text: My comments are really clear. One of my worst hotel experiences ever. Many useless employees with any idea about the SOP of the hotel. Area manager treating their colleagues like slaves. Absurd guest experience strategy and horrible damage for the brand Movenpick.

Review_Date: terry y wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Just returned from 5 day stay which unfortunately coincided with a large (very large) event going on. No prior notice of any likely issues even on check in but having to queue through "security" at the buffet lunch by the pool made you feel like your business was not important I just want to get to my room. Talking of the pool the same large group took over the pool complex for four of the five days it was closed to the "outsiders". Albeit they did note placed under some room doors on the day it closed.  Lack of drawers in the rooms wifi hit and miss in the rooms (if only you could sit by the pool!) others in our party had poor A/C.    Finally got to sit by the pool on my final pm before my flight home and the sprinklers came on! Guess it just wasn't my week.    So you could end up with full price rooms for less amenities!

Review_Date: 907carolinek wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Amazing location for families and couples. many things to do and explore. I rather enjoyed going out in the evening or late nights in the market for a buzzing and fun experience. very friendly people. I would recommend the hotel.

Review_Date: ericsoni2017 wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: I had a wonderful stay with a group from Sweden. Rooms really nice service perfect breakfast wonderful. They only small problem was that the waiter did not understand well english at breakfast. If I asked for capuccino I got normal coffee with milk. But that is not a big problem

Review_Date: maisiemargaretm wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Really fantastic time. Would highly recommend this to anyone and everyone. They're very receptive to your needs and willing to do whatever you need to make the stay fantastic. We were there for a business event and all of that went very smoothly as well. Also there is a FANTASTIC exercise room.

Review_Date: Lorraine G wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Visited this hotel for a few days for work. This place is stunning. Had a massive bedroom wardrobe had a robe and slippers there was a safe aswell. Massive bathroom with lots of lovely toiletries. The hotel was all marble and beautiful chandeliers. The pool looked lovely although I didn't use it. There was pool towels provided and very luxurious sunbeds. Food was very good plenty of choice in the buffet. Staff were friendly. The conference area was really nice very comfortable seats. The air conditioning was very good which was important as the temperature was in the 40s.

Review_Date: ometsi_232207 wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Lovely stay fantastic staff slow internet at times and long waits for food or drinks orders to arrive however most staff went out of their way to make you feel welcome and give you a helping hand.  would definitely go back.

Review_Date: Zarina A wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: The services at hotel was excellent. I love the chocolate hour offered to hotel guests during my stay. I would also like to thank the hotel staff that was willing to provide us with an early breakfast on our the morning when we had to check-out by 6am in morning in order for us to be at the airport to catch a morning flight from Marrakech.

Review_Date: Khaoula A wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: excellent on the exception of the towels missing in the room after requiring them  we received only the bigger ones and not the small ones....but in general and honestly speaking great service. Good luck

Review_Date: mariegiseleb wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: Very good location but poor service
Review_Text: Still waiting for a copy of the invoice 3 weeks after my stay at the hotel. When I checked out the system was not working I was promised to receive it the day after. But nothing happended. Everytime I phone the hotel they say they will do it immediately but nothing happens. I am very disappointed.

Review_Date: Ajoke O wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: A few issues but overall very nice hotel in a great location walking distance to Gileaz  Good breakfast choices and included in the price was a pleasant surprise.  Kids loved the hotel.  A few issues:  Fridge not working iron not available despite asking a few times.

Review_Date: Caroline K wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: A nice setting in the new town away from the madness of the Medina was great for us as a family wanting a city break / time by the pool. Close to a mall for western style restaurants and a carrefour. Bear in mind you will need taxis to get to the medina etc - it wasn't far but in the heat you will want a taxi most times you go out.  Pros - smart clean hotel nice pools Moroccan restaurant v good  Cons - service slow to non existent housekeeping poor (had to keep asking for towels and even toilet rolls!) loud music by the large pool was overpowering. Spa overpriced and rubbish treatments

Review_Date: javaid_rameesha wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: The experience was wonderful. The hotel itself is so beautiful. The location is awesome 10 mins drive to the Medina and 3 mins drive to the train station. Walk to the train station and new city is 15 mins. Absolutely recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mag_Gourmet28 wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: Newly renewed hotel. Very clean friendly service great large rooms and excellent restaurants.    Nice pool area. One with music and the other to relax with kids.    Attached to the congress center.    Good location    Good price quality value!

Review_Date: Carlos V wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: The worst part: my room wasn't clean at all... A strong smell of smoking in the room from smoking smell in the room (very bad it felt I was in a club). Long black hairs in the bathroom and in the bad (I'm blonde).  The swimming pool was very dirty and they allow people and children to dive. So every 5 minutes you end up getting all wet... They allow people to drink and eat in the pool that's so rong for many reasons. The worst pool ever they let kids take their water toys and sorts of things into the pool and this is a 5 star hotel?! You should fired the pool manager. The breakfast is very poor on service higiene and selection of food. One of the employees made several times bad comments of me to another employee (Discrimination). Another employee gave me a dirty spoon without even blink. The omelet was raw when I ask to cook more the employee said it was good enough and didn't cooked again...  It was terrible in many ways...

Review_Date: Najat E wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: I travelled to Marrakesh with my two daughters for a seven nights holiday! We had a lovely relaxing break. The hotel decor is beautiful with friendly staff and lovely food. We would definitely visit again!

Review_Date: MIFACascais wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: Everyone has been very friendly with us in Marrakech M√∂venpick Mansour Eddahbi & Palais des Congr√®s .  The decoration was fantastic.  The best has been the staff which was very efficient.  The only nehative point has been the cards to enter the room which were not working most of the times.

Review_Date: Carlosveiga wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: Hi there! The lobby and the entrance of the hotel has a touch of grandeur and opulence but that's all that is to say. In another place of the world this hotel round be a 4*. Very poor service the breakfast is really bad (no tags to the identity the juices no coffee spoons very poor service very poor quality and the staff is very rude). It was included in my booking but I did went out to have breakfast far from that poor breakfast hotel. The worst part is the swimming pool... NO RULES they allow people to dive people eating in the swimming pool kids jumping all over showering everybody in their chairs... Cigarette bits all over the place food toys plastic bags you named everything was in the water... Only one guy from the staff was very kind and helpful the rest? OMG!!! The worst...  I can not compare to other 2 hotels I stayed in Marrakech it's sad... The rooms are nice and big but when I walked in the first time the smell of cigarettes it was disgusting... I never smoked in my life... In October I'm going to Dubai when I was wondering about their 5 * hotel over there... I'm guessing it's a no no...  My last call goes to the swimming pool supervisor : you need to be fired it's the worst 5* hotel swimming pool that I encountered in my life.

Review_Date: Simon G wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: Monsieur manager for the love of God turn the music down by the pool! Wife and I like to rave as much as the next couple but as we reported to you personally yesterday you've got sweary night club loud music all day long at the pool. Are you trying to replicate Ibiza? That's not what the clientele sat round here look like they want. Cheers

Review_Date: Khalid B wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: Nice hotel with great location good for relaxation they just need to work more on costumer services and improve the Staff skills when it come to dealing with issues and problems to meet the 5 starts hotels standards  I recommend this hotel for visitors üëç

Review_Date: katiah985 wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: Very lovely and comfortable hotel. Very reasonable food prices . Beautiful environment . Very helpful and friendly staff ....So clean .Good for families with swimming pools and kids play ground ....  Very safe with security check ...

Review_Date: Sitolakis wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: This is a nice hotel well situated with large and clean rooms nearly of luxury standards overall. The swimming pool looked great as well. Breakfast was fine although the young cooks need some more training in order to learn how to make fried eggs properly...    The service at the bar of the hotel was extremely slow.  The concierge assistance for getting a taxi can be very tricky! Pay attention! Make sure that what you are told by the concierge is the same amount you agree with the taxi driver! Otherwise the taxi driver will ask you for the double (of what the concierge told you that you are going to pay).  Anyway the situation with taxi fares in Marrakech is unacceptable/ one of the most negative issues hurting tourism. The authorities need to look at it seriously!

Review_Date: Yejul2015 wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Stay somewhere else where there's more value for your money.
Review_Text: if you're new in a place just book in a hotel for one day and then try to walk around and you'll get more value for your money. This is just one of those fancy hotels would very nice fa√ßade and lobby but you cannot expect the same when it comes to service. very poor. and breakfast is definitely better elsewhere

Review_Date: karim_rc wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: We had a great stay here at the Movenpick. To summarise...the location is perfect as you are 10 mins from all the places you want to be: Jemaa El Fna Square Jardin Marjorelle Ben Youssef Mosque the list goes on. The thing we liked most is you were able to be in by hustle and bustle very quickly but equally we in the relaxation of your hotel very quickly. Two people we want to mention in particular are Ayoub in the Jamra bar and grill: looked after us all week nothing was too much for him. Abdelhaq in concierge answered all our questions and organised a couple of trips with no problems. The reason I have rated this 4 not 5 is there a couple of improvements I think could be made and they are only small: show you round the hotel when you arrive and make sure everything was good with your stay when you leave.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: fardos y wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: This was a lovely beautiful hotel to stay at. All the ladies at the spa were amazing. So friendly professional and made me and my sister feel very comfortable with the treatments we chose. I would definitely come again for the spa. Our room was lovely and breakfast was very good too. Although the staff at breakfast were quite rude. I asked for some breakfast to be taken up to our room for my sister and niece and was told no one could take it up for me. I felt they were very rude every time. This is the reason I am giving 4 stars. Need better staff  but the ladies and the hairdresser at the spa are amazing.

Review_Date: DavidandMary82 wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Beautiful new hotel having re-opened 6 months ago. Our one-bedroom suite was large and lovely. The hotel is very big so the walk from our room to the main building was almost a quarter mile but that goes past 3 swimming pools. They do a very nice job with water features throughout the lobby and hotel grounds. It is still in a soft opening stage so staff were inconsistent in their knowledge. No one had a map of the hotel so you had to learn where everything was on your own. The restaurants near the freeform pool were the best nice paninis and salads for lunch. This is a great location for meetings at the adjacent Palais des Congress but it is away from the Medina (maybe a 15 minute walk).

Review_Date: vicki w wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: I'm cheap when it comes to raiting a hotel Movenpick Marrakesh gets 5 stars !  We were thinking of staying one night changed our minds and stayed for 4 more nights. Yes. We liked it that much.  We stayed in the Mini Suits building. This wonderful resort has so much to offer in all categories. I loved the fact that we had a "personal" swimming pool near the suit. There's 3 more. I loved the Spa and its (free) Saunas and Huge clean Jacuzzi. I would like to point out the wonderful service we received in all hotel departments but you know sometimes a personal touch means the world to you. So Ms. Nezha in the reception that took the extra mile helping us in a personal matter and dear Mrs. Fatmah who took such a good care of us in her motherly manner during all our breakfasts. The food was ok but she made it 'wow' for us.    This has got to be the best hotel I stayed in these past years. So we are so coming back to here !!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Zahid A wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Reda was a helpful guy who showed me around marakech and the hotel and made me feel welcome! Will be returning very soon and telling more people of the beautiful place. The service in bar Le mansou by Reda was very good/ 5*

Review_Date: 346tamerq wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: The best staff for my wife and I was Ms. Nezha Afiry head supervisor of reception in the hotel second was Ms. Samie Benkaddour Guest relations agent; along with Ms. Fatima Souhal in the breakfast and dining room area she should be the Manager not a waitress with all due respect

Review_Date: Michael Paul C wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: The hotel is gorgeous. The rooms are great. The concierges were very helpful.    I loved the breakfasts. I am not that fond of the standard American breakfast. The hotel's breakfasts had delightful variety.

Review_Date: LadyAshAsh wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Great new resort in Marrakech -- good location in Hivernage super clean and comfortable and just absolutely beautiful grounds/facilities. I would stay here again in a heartbeat wish I could've stayed longer!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: 259hateme wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: I bed room is very good and staff are excellent specially the service at breakfast. very good room house keeping the only comment is the weak wifi at room. the event businesses facility has problem in AC and small rooms doors sounds are very annoying. the round tables lunch box was not good

Review_Date: 122yingc wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Super good kids club. Very warm and friendly staff who really did great job. Children had a great time during I was working.    Nice hotel with friendly staff. They tried their best to help.    Delicious food.

Review_Date: JU1951 wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel but with crazy policy for bringing in food.
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel for a week while I attended a conference and my husband was a tourist. We stayed in a "junior suite" which was fantastic. It has a comfortable living room and a well-separated bedroom and a nice outdoor balcony. However we encountered one situation that we have never encountered before in a hotel. One afternoon we invited friends over for a happy hour in our suite. We went to a grocery store in advance and bought snacks like olives cheese and crackers. The hotel has a security check when you enter and they would not allow us to bring in the food! Other friends said they tried to bring in a box of cookies and were told they were not allowed. This seems like a really crazy policy for a hotel especially one that has such nice suites and rooms!

Review_Date: CT wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Loved everything about this hotel right location spa pool food lobby mint tea rooms were large and had a balcony. Don't miss staying here! There were able to get me a spa appt the same day as we arrived. So very accommodating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: wrongway_traveler wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: My wife and I vacationed in Marrakesh using this hotel as our base. Despite the 45+ oC temperatures the room was pleasant the service was excellent and the included breakfast one of the best I have seen. I would definitely stay here again should I return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: alexsW1258JJ wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: The room and facilities were great. Very roomy. The air conditioner could be improved as it wasn't cool enough- however it was manageable. Need more information on the restaurants map of the facilities and amenities. The choices available for breakfast was excellent and the service was great. In addition the caf√© in the lobby was excellent for lunch or a quick snack.

Review_Date: BrianW100FR wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: The hotel itself was beautiful and very clean. Our room was a good size and very comfortable. I loved the pool area it had really nice loungers and no trouble getting a bed no matter what time you arrive. It's in a good location close to the airport and the medina as well as some good restaurants.  The breakfast was great - lots of options and nice outside area to eat.  The other restaurants were very nice but no one eating there so very quiet! The bar is lovely with a terrace looking over the pool but again there was never anyone there.    The negatives of this hotel fall down to the staff. I did not find them very helpful or accommodating. Trying to order a drink by the pool or in the bar was just hard work and they couldn't understand what we wanted even when pointing to our choice on the menu.  The cafe staff inside were the worst - very very slow and quite rude. The lady overcharged us and when I pointed this out rather than apologizing she tutted.  We also had a problem when we bought water and crisps from the local shop and walked in with a shopping bag. We had 4 members of staff surround us and confiscate the shopping. I understand they want people to spend money on their drinks but I did not appreciate the treatment we had and it was only water!    Overall I thought this was a really beautiful hotel which sadly is being let down by the quite incompetent staff. If that improves I would 100% recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Yak206 wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Awesome hotel and staff. Excellent Moroccan restaurant and staff. I would like to make a special mention of Amine- Guest Relations who took great care of our needs and made our stay very comfortable. Definitely recommend for hotel comfort decor and especially staff.

Review_Date: mcblr wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: It may not carry the charm of the smaller riads but the hotel delivers Morocco as it should be. Every single detail of the hotel tells a story of Marrakech you just need to pay close attention.  The food at all restaurants was amazing. The best though was the massage at the spa!

Review_Date: Jhanyn A wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: The hotel has lovely modern and classy interior design. The rooms were the same as any other modern 5* star hotels. It did not have any touch of Moroccan art and culture. Breakfast buffet had nice options of hot and cold foods. Pool area always so crowded. Towels were provided in abundance. However the staff members in the reception desk and the main entrance (guards) were not very hospitable. Their expression constantly looked serious and stressed. They did not look approachable at all. On the other hand the other staff especially the one who did our hotel and room tour was very nice and friendly. He made us feel welcomed. We stayed in this hotel on the last part of our Marrakech trip as it is close to the airport. We will try another hotel in the same area on our next visit as the hospitality here is not so good.

Review_Date: C4894XYannef wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Have a nice trip to MARRAKECH while staying in Movenpick. I can recommand easily this hotel for comfort and quality of the attention.  You can also be in few minutes in the center for tourism and shopping  Best regards

Review_Date: Llmr wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: We stayed at Movenpick Mansour and had an excellent time! From the moment we arrived we received excellent service from Mohamed at the reception. Everything was perfect and we had a superb time. Everyday we spent time at the pool and received excellent service and attention from Imane Houd she checked on us brought us drinks and took excellent care of our every request. If you are looking for a beautiful hotel centrally located with all of the amenities you would want in a holiday look no further. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back.

Review_Date: Manan S wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: What a great hotel!  And excellent customer service. Great staff at every department- pool spa restaurant bar reception concierge etc.    Apart for the fact that this hotel is fairly new the experience was absolutely worth it. I give this hotel 5 stars for everything including the value for money and the friendliness of the staff.    Another brownie points for them is they don't typically allow outside food to be brought in. The staff was kind enough and said they would make the exception. Small things like that make a big difference to customers.    Great hotel and I definitely recommend!    Thank you!!

Review_Date: Manuel Sanchez wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: We have enjoyed M√∂venpick Hotel for 5 days. Marvellous decoration customer-oriented in all the staff beautiful places to explore inside the hotel very good meal in all the restaurants. The room was superb with no noise from outside. A strong recommendation to have a fantastic experience in Marrakech!!

Review_Date: imad I wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Nice modern hotel.    Rooms are new and recently renovated    The hotel has a nice big pool. our HK staff was amazing and big thanks to nouhad from reception    Great location.    I will come back despite some issue samia "guest relation " she tried to resolve on a good manner  this was due to luck cooperation by reservation manager.

Review_Date: HassanZarbal wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Nice hotel good services overall front desk needs to much the standard of this hotel nice and comfy rooms enjoyed by the family lovely breakfast amenities suitable for families would definitely be back again.

Review_Date: thesmdm wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Title: A little tired but still works well
Review_Text: The rooms are a little tired. Some of the rooms have great views some of the others look straight into an office building. The rooms are good size and everything works well. The lounge is good and the breakfast options are very good. The people are very friendly and helpful. Did struggle for anyone to pick up the room service phone. Reasonably central. Is a new Starbucks close by.

Review_Date: Mimi H wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: this hotel is beautiful and when you enter you can smell the scent of citrus orange and that was the only thing I liked about the movenpick .    the cons :  No one spoke English and they were stand offish not really as friendly as they should be .  Food was very average and expensive  They never left us coffee for our room  And I didn't like the location I would stay in the Gueliz area if I were to come back there's more to do and nicer  cute cheaper restaurants in that area .

Review_Date: zedk7 wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: This is a stunning hotel in both setting and facilities multiple pools spa gym on site restaurants etc. We had an issue with and overflowing shower which was partly fixed but on speaking to reception they immediately moved us to a different room which was bigger and better. The breakfast is excellent with great variety of continental and local Moroccan options including the delicious layered bread. The breakfast staff is wonderful too who are eager to help.    The only complaint was the pools were not heated. The hotel has all the things you could possibly need including restaurants and bar on site. The area is upmarket and very safe.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Milla B wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: I stayed at Movenpick Marrakech a long weekend and I felt like a princess!  Everything was perfect! The bed very comfy the room big and a spaceful bathroom.  It's a real relaxing place!  The spa is amazing!

Review_Date: William Y wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Nice option who travels to Marrakech.  It is located in the new part of Marrakech so the Hotel and the neighborhood are modern with restaurants and mall.  Rooms are clean. Wifi Free. The service is excellent from the Hotel recepction to the restaurant.  The swimming pool and the SPA are excelent to rest and enjoy the day.  It is near the downtown and the touristic attraction.  You can exchange EUR or USD into Dirhams in the reception. But don't forget to spend all Dirhams before you leave Morroco. It is hard to exchange back.

Review_Date: vfors wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Visited this hotel for a few days stay. The hotel is in a good condition snd several choices of restaurants. We whent for the one with Marrakech cousine twice since they served very good food. Service at the restaurant was exellent. Poolarea was good not to crowded and breakfast was very good with a big selection of choices the orange juice was really top notch.  I am a frequent gym user and very picky about this altough this hotel had a gym well over my expectations very good.    The only really downside of the hotelexperience itself was checkin and checkout procedure took forever and this makes me put only 4 points in this hotel.    I would recommend this hotel please look over your routines for check in and out.

Review_Date: hongjingd wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: A pleasant experience during staying at Movenpickcomfortable and quiet environment excellent service and food well-located and easy of access to airport train station shopping mall and scenic spot.

Review_Date: Paul C wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Lovely hotel let down by disorganised service during a business trip. Mini Bar not filled bar staff unaware of drinks orders and unable to cope with more than 20 people in the bar at any one time. Restaurant staff left others to pick up there work.

Review_Date: Skingen wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Movenpick is a massive estate spread over a large area. Went there for a large international conference. My opinion is that this is not a suitable venue for a large conference. However I am sure that Movenpick would serve well as a base on a leisure and holiday adventure. Food is good in all the restaurants - but still they all lack ambiance - just too sterile. People working there are very nice and friendly - but too much "manjana" - the efficiency and expediency of the service is absent for most of the part. People are running around in circles. The hotel is only about 15 minutes from the international airport and it is not far from the city centre where all the restaurants are. Taxis are readily available outside - but of course - one has to haggle over prices since there are no meters in the taxi - and this gets tiring after a very short while.

Review_Date: 37jafars wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Well kept and some rooms and suites are superb !
Review_Text: Diespite initial shortcomings and availability of hangars and iron (Conference so needed to iron shirts).. the staff eventually came through and made the stay comfortable. The facilities and location are very good. The concierge is also good and so are the hostesses ( excluding the over serious important looking and behaving manager of the Mediterranean restaurant ). The service at breakfast is excellent despite the large numbers of guests.. some tired people at the front desks. But a good job overall.

Review_Date: jennywC4496BW wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Rude staff and serivces are poor
Review_Text: I stayed there due to a conference. when I arrived in the hotel our meeting suites were not set up as what we required. the service to the meeting was also poor. we had times having 3 pots of hot water without coffee or milk or with 2 pots of milk without coffee and 2 pots of coffee without milk. the check out and departure procedure were disturbing. I was given a departure ticket after checking out and I gave the ticket when I was about to leave the hotel. suddenly the hotel securities stopped my leaving and asked me to go back to the check out counter without explanation. the staff were extremely rude and treated me as a criminal when I refused to go back. Eventually it turns out no issue with my payment but it delayed my departure from the hotel. I missed my flight on that day.

Review_Date: David W wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Stayed one week to attend a conference in the hotel (which is attached to a huge conference centre) accompanied by my wife. Selected a suite and had a wonderful stay. Room was spacious and comfortable and spotlessly clean. Service to the room was very good though they seem to have a very limited number of irons and ironing boards if like me you need one to try and look smart. Good provision of restaurants and bars though service is pretty slow. This was noticeable in the Medi Terra but food is very good - it is partly in a courtyard which is a nice feature. The Moroccan restaurant was very good as was the poolside restaurant. Staff were very helpful and courteous. There are two large swimming pools and we found a smaller private pool near the Spa which better suited us. Friendly and obliging staff and we left with a very good impression. Well worth staying here. One word of caution check-in/out can be slow. There is much form filling on arrival which really could be addressed online before arrival.

Review_Date: madenski wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: It's quite an impressive hotel it's grand - two massive pools a nice bar lots of different bits and pieces to this hotel. But I felt it was missing the class that goes with a world class hotel. Maybe it was a bit of an off week for Movenpick Marrakech. Might go back if the price is right. Most people seemed to enjoy it.

Review_Date: alaeddin2016 wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: need improvements especially in time of service providing  takes too long  food also need improvement especially at the Mediterranean restaurant  internet is so week and many interruption  some of the staff are excellent especially Mr Mustafa at breakfast restaurant

Review_Date: dbjwaenwen wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: This is a visually stunning hotel exceptionally comfortable and with with many plus points. The majority of the staff were very friendly and competent though some of the staff serving drinks and food around the pools could do with some more basic training (we waited for about an hour for something we ordered on one day and when we eventually inquired we were informed that the items were not available). The other pool staff (lifeguards etc.) were very attentive however.  Breakfast were superb with excellent fresh orange juice (and others) in great abundance. Touches like the "chocolate hour" (5-6 pm each day with a variety of hand made chocolate delicacies on offer) and delicious hors d'ouevres at the bar from 7 pm were much appreciated.

Review_Date: 548brigittea wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Excellent hotel beautiful interior and pool. Staff very attentive to your needs sometimes forgetful. Outstanding outdoor pool service. Service at the bar-restaurant is extremely slow and they don't have all the drinks that feature on their menu but food is all right.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jasx8 wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Stayed there for a week in May. It was an absolutely beautiful hotel from the moment you stepped in. The staff were extremely friendly even at the pool they would always ask if we were OK. The hotel itself is sophisticated with a modern take to Moroccan design. It had beautiful water features everywhere so beautiful that you wanted to take a pic of each room. It was a very calm atmosphere mostly couples or business people - but everyone minded their own business. There were no kids there at all when we went which made it more relaxing. The hotel itself is 5-10 minutes away from so many things including the airport. The only thing I will say however is that I probably wouldn't go back to the SPA because even though it was beautiful we chose a 30 minute treatment out of the 30 min or 1 hour but the treatment itself was only 15 minutes. We didn't want to make a big deal out of it but I would have expected a full 30 minutes (as you would). Otherwise I recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: GCH365 wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Newly renovated extensive paradise near the city
Review_Text: We stayed at the hotel on our way South over the High Atlas in December and on our way back in January. This is a beautifully renovated hotel with multiple buildings spread out over amazing grounds with pools and greenery and a most extraordinary foyer. Great breakfast and very enthusiastic food & beverage director/deputy hotel manager. Well equipped and appointed rooms. The hotel's Director of Engineering and his team made a huge effort to arrange charging for our Tesla EV at the hotel for free!    The hotel plans to install more permanent electric vehicle (EV) charging arrangements in the underground car park which would be a lot better. Easy to get a bit lost at first in the extensive grounds with multiple buildings and internal layouts also take a bit of getting used to. The lift failed at one point but to be fair the whole site is still on test. A minor design issue with the shower causes water to flow out onto the bathroom floor. A magnificent hotel and certainly our hotel of choice in Marrakech as we travel by EV.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: 945heikek wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: I was very happy with everything!  Marrakech is an impressiv city and the Movenpick hotel is a fantastic conference location. Also my client was more than impressed about accommodation and rooms in Palais des Congres.

Review_Date: Brent H wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Nice room but the 2 bedside lights could only be turned off by unplugging them. The shower/tub was nice but the water goes all over the bathroom. Poorly engineered.  Service at the pool and breakfast was great but in the evening restaurants was poor.

Review_Date: THS2010 wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Half through a multi week stay and wishing I could move. It's too bad really it's a nice building to walk into but like many of those the rooms and service don't match the look. After trying several of the restaurants found the food bland at best. The breakfast certainly isn't up to Movenpick standard. The promised 24 hour cafe seems to run out of food in the evening. All in F&B not great.    Service in general misses the mark in that promises just aren't met - I've given up asking to have my room made up early every morning it happens when it happens. The infrastructure is worn the tile floor of the elevator in my building is cracked and dips when you step on it and why do I have it ask for a new key all the time because it stops working (which is really annoying because rooms are in separate buildings away from the lobby). Finally do you have to have the extra-loud outdoor roof top band at night when all I really want to do is sleep?    All in all a miss.

Review_Date: 953takalanin wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Very good hotel in a good area in Marrakesh - wonderful staff and hospitality - the hotel is beautiful with decorations all over and water features that are very refreshing - very good smell of fresh flowers - the melas and breakfast buffet has a very wide selection of tasty food - enjoyed the traditional mint tea in silver kettle and glass as well as the Tajine meats and cousscous

Review_Date: Raphael wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: We stayed at the M√∂venpick for a week and it was a pleasant experience. The hotel is very well located in between the airport and the city center. The area (H√©ritage) is very clean and organised.    Positives  + we arrived very early and the reception desk showed us the bar took care of our luggage and made our waiting time as comfortable as possible  + the room is very clean well furnished has a huge restroom and a very comfortable bed  + the breakfast buffet offers a wide range of dishes  + we really enjoyed the restaurants the meals taste great. Especially the Medi Terra excellent cuisine!  + the bar/restaurant by the pool (Jamra) was very nice! Tasty snacks homemade ice teas (i highly recommend the rosemarin one) drinks and attentive personell  + the pool boys were very attentive and helpful as well great job!  + The concierge service was very helpful as well. We could easily book two dinners at normally fully booked places and the recommended quad tour was very entertaining (and didn't contain the usual sales pitches which I really appreciated!) I'd highly recommend to book a tour guide with them on your first day to explore the medina!!    Points to work on  - even if we were treated very well it's not comprehensible to me why we couldn't get a room early in the morning as the hotel wasn't fully booked  - some of the personell needs more training. The service has to be on a 5* scale which clearly means that you have to walk the extra mile! As i meantioned before most of the staff we met was very attentive very nice always open for a quick chat and very supportive which we really appreciated. But a few simply ignore you (or the work that involves) which is not acceptable.  - It was a pitty that the rooftop bar wasn't open - I'd really loved to watch the sunset from there. Btw: a humidor with some cigars would be nice. For all of those who love them: they sell cigars right across the street (Ave Muhammed) in the kiosk between the two restaurants)    Overall: great experience nice hotel very well located great restaurants. I already recommended it to my colleagues!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: lily100 wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Huge hotel good decor great pool + excellent breakfasts + lunches.    BUT - after loooong queue to check in I was allocated a poolside room that hadn't been serviced then relocated with minimal apology to an inferior room at the rear of the hotel which suffered loud singing late into the (mid-week) night from a nearby bar. There was no iron + only 1 small bottle of water.    Check out process equally painful - system was down + car that wasn't booked added to the bill.    Staff were friendly + reasonably helpful but these issues mean I can't recommend for business travelers + I imagine there are better options in the price range for tourists too.    Quick tip for those having trouble with de-magnetising room keys (as so many did) - keep it well away from your mobile phone!

Review_Date: KHjlmar wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Restaurant Medi Terra Mediterranean cuisine good and place wonderful. Outside is perfect inside is cool. Three or four courses at your taste. Good options and nice deserts. Atmosphere and staff combined. Cheers.

Review_Date: Santiagopereiro wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Had one massage when I arrived with Najia. She said will have best massage of my life and I did not believe but yes was    Thanks. Love it sure to recommend if you come to this hotel. Thanks for all hope I can repeat

Review_Date: mrlewis355 wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Clean and modern hotel but to many rules
Review_Text: I thought the hotel was modern and clean but the service needs improvements especially at the front desk. On check in they made me wait an extremely long time for assistance. I booked four rooms and came with six people three girls and three guys. The staff made me feel like a criminal because the girls are Moroccan.    On the Saturday I went to the supermarket and got some water and nuts to have in my room I was told this is prohibited but after a tip they allowed me though. In future I will rent an apartment as I do not want the hassle from hotel staff.

Review_Date: Michael D wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: This hotel was recently totally renovated it's brand spanking new it's gorgeous the staff were attentive and helpful the room is fantastic breakfast was great! I had not one complaint. The location is close to the medina a quick walk to the Menara Mall and very quiet.

Review_Date: harry047 wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Pros nice small room cleaned every day  pleasant communal areas  great service by the pool area good choice for breakfast  Cons; surly  unhelpful reception. No map available for the duration of the stay if you wanted any help they couldn't help ! No recommendation of restaurant places to go reception staff need lessons in customer service  this ruined our experience so would recommend you go elsewhere if you want a pleasant friendly stay!

Review_Date: Sanam B wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Really good hotel in a very good location  Hotel is near main menara mall  Also close to airport.staff was lovely pool area is beautifully designed and been kept very clean breakfast buffet has got huge selection and variety of different dishes overall we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: 383slimanea wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: The hotel also the suite i took were very good like rje service end cleanliness. The price i paid for the suite was top expencive.  The breakfast was good bot excellent. Also the swimming pool was more than good.

Review_Date: Harold M wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Just Keep Doing What You Are Doing. Put A Microwave In The Room.  I Do Have One Compliant.  I Came To The Convention By Myself And Did Not Choose To Eat Alone In Your Restaurants FOR EACH MEAL And Pay The Expensive Price For Doing That. I Chose One Night To Go Out And JUST Get A Pizza. I Was Stopped At The Entrance Saying I Could Not Bring Food Into The Hotel. Now I Can See That I Cannot Bring Food Into Your Hotel And Take It To Your In House Restaurants Sit Down There And Eat It. The Room I Rented There Was My Home Away From Home. You Were Telling Me I Could Not Take Food To My Home Unless I Bought It From Your Restaurant. Your Concierge Wanted To Argue The Point That No Hotel Allows That. Prior To Staying At Your Hotel I Stayed At The Atlantis Hotel On The Palm Island In Dubai. I Ate At One Of Their Restaurants Just For The Experience But After That I Ate From The Food Trucks That Were Positioned Nearby And Each Time I Took My Food To The Room Passing By Many Of The Hotel Staff And No One Checked My Bag To Tell Me I Could Not Bring Food In To The Hotel And Eat It In My Room I Have Stayed At Hotels All Over The World And Have Never Been Stopped And Told I Could Not Bring Food Into My Hotel Home (Room) Unless I Bought It From The Hotel. YOU SHOULD EXAMINE THAT POLICY.

Review_Date: MarieDele wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Not a 5* hotel - terrible service - I do not recommend this hotel
Review_Text: This hotel doesn't worth any visit!    The reasons why are listed below:  - poor service  - reception staff as no sense of customer services and are impolite with customers  - the lovely terrace for breakfast CANNOT be used because it is surrounded by enormous bees (everyone had a look for a table inside!) - SHAME  - food and drinks are ridiculously overpriced  - food portion and choices as below average  - air con doesn't work well in the room and make a strong noise (not possible to leave it on at night)  - the pool water is super cold although it says in the hotel description : "heated pool"!    All of this has been related to the hotel reception but no one gives a S***!    I came few times in Marrakesh and there are so many nice places to go but definitely not this one!!! Don't bother!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Didifox777 wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel close to the Medina
Review_Text: A luxury hotel located close to the Medina with friendly staff and beautifully appointed rooms and grounds. Although large it never feels overcrowded and the choice of 2 pools was lovely for afternoon sunbathing and swimming. The hotel has been recently refurbished to a very high level and the quality of food in the restaurants was good. Perfect for a longer trip or in our case with golf clubs - trekking through the Medina with gold=f clubs would have been a nightmare!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: jamila b wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: A very pleasant and comfortable experience. For a very big hotel recently re-opened I found the staff very competent and most important keeping the smile even under the pressure of the full house week-end of May 1st  The hotel its grand in the middle of vast well groomed gardens and a magnificent swimming pool .The buildings are spread so that its not overwhelming.  we were given a first room (4426) that had a unpleasant view of AC pipes.  Despite the limited choice due to the hotel being full the very helpful young ladies at the main reception Nouhad and Nezha did their outmost to accommodate us in a better room with a view.  The breakfast is at the level of this 5stars hotel  luscious and abundant.  from our arrival at the parking lot to our departure we've seen keen staff with a smile.  We highly recommande this hotel .

Review_Date: Dorte Gils√• H wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: You have to make sure at an early time point of the day that you get all the beds that you expect in the room.  The first night we could not have the extra bed although we had orderede the room for three adults.  Besides that the rest of the hotel is very nice clean and beatiful. The restaurants all serve delicious food in nice surroundings.

Review_Date: Ash_Carlton wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Almost, a few niggles need sorting
Review_Text: Movenpick is a lovely new hotel the decor and rooms are great.    A few niggles my room key stopped working on 5 separate occasions a long walk back in reception for a 5 star hotel is not ideal with a little one.    Breakfast good staff pleasant but overall need training always trying to pass the buck.    Maybe we will stay again if things improve !

Review_Date: zahavac2017 wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: I did not lake the service of this hotel the staff was very cold they make us wait 3 h before to give us the room I will never go back to this hotel is expensive for noting my experience was orible don't go to this hotel is you want to go to marakech they is so much better

Review_Date: banabellout wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Best 5‚òÜ hotel in marrakech !!  My check in and check out was quick I've had a suite with twin bed me and my sister food was fresh customer service was great staff very friendly and helpful very professional I have absolutely nothing to complain about I will definitely go back in summer.

Review_Date: 338jeanmarca wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Very good quality overall with a nice location where you feel relax and confortable. The atmosphere is quite and the and the set up is very nice. I will recommend it for events or for relaxing in family or with friends.

Review_Date: Imane B wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Great hotel great location but really poor quality service.  We felt no welcome at all we had several issues with the staff since day 1.  Rooms are great but a little noisy and not cleaned everyday i had to literally call when i came in (nighttime) to get it cleaned because it was still messy from 7 am when i left ...  Waiters won't come propose to you drinks when you sit by the pool.  Kids club smells bad it is dark i couldn't let my little sister stay there for a second.  Due to her strict diet i had to go shopping by the local supermarket to get her food to eat during the day but it was refused by security saying that the hotel doesn't accept food.. The manager was mean and unprofessional.  Unpleasant experience i don't recomand it.  I hope the direction will deal with this kind of problems to please new clients that come by their hotel.

Review_Date: kirstyb655 wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: I have stayed at other Movenpicks in the past and so I knew the quality of service which you would expect from this chain of hotels. Well my expectations could not have been more wrong.    Don't get me wrong the hotel is beautiful and the rooms are very comfortable and clean however the service is diabolical.    Our trouble started on arrival when we were told our room would be available at 3pm and it was not ready until 5pm. When we finally got to our room and started to unpack so that we could get showered and changed for dinner we received a call that we were in the wrong room and would have to move. We were informed that someone would be with us immediately to show us to the correct room but they did not arrive for 40 minutes! In that time we called reception and nobody answered.    The room we were moved to was equally nice but we were woken up three nights in a row by 45 minutes of taxis beeping their horns at people who had come out of the hotel's nightclub. Totally unacceptable especially considering we had paid extra to upgrade our room!    The staff around the pool were generally very nice but it took 45 minutes for an orange juice to arrive and over an hour and a half for our food. Sometimes our order was incorrect and on one occasion totally unpalatable despite having ordered the same dish the day before.    Breakfast is okay but the options are limited and the same every day. The omelettes are very greasy and so raw in the middle I couldn't bare eating it. My partner picked up a stomach bug and we are convinced it is from something he ate at the hotel.    The staff don't seem to understand what is going on. We asked 3 different members of staff what time a restaurant opened and received 3 different answers. On two separate occasions we were sent by the concierge to a restaurant that had closed its kitchen. On the second occasion we actually asked if they were serving food they assured us they were and allowed us to order drinks. When we asked for a food menu they told us the kitchen was closed!    Even when we tried to expain our grievances to reception it was clear the staff member did not truly understand what we were saying and didn't even have the decency to pretend to listen!    It is not in our nature to complain about bad service but this really was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. The only saving grace of this place is the lovely pool. However our holiday would have been far more relaxing if the service had not been a shambles.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: WadsZB wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Stayed at this hotel with my husband and two boys. The hotel is absolutely beautiful with amazing decor. The pool area is nice and relaxing and very clean. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. They do have a few service issues with regards to the housekeeping staff - many of whom do not speak english however the Duty Manager - Amin Karim in the restaurant and the General Manager went out of their way to make our stay comfortable.
